JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS Education: Bachelor’s degree desired; or equivalent education and/or related work experience Experience: Minimum of 10 years of experience with data analytics, project management, incident management Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Knowledge of vulnerability scanning tools Strong project management skills Management experience preferred Solid knowledge of information security principles, web applications and a level of familiarity with malicious code and common techniques used by hackers. Ability to maintain confidentiality of information Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with employees at all levels of the organization Excellent organizational skills Ability to adapt to a fast paced continually challenging business and work environment while managing multiple priorities Practical knowledge of application security standards and compliance (e.g., OWASP, Sarbanes-Oxley act, HIPAA) Ability to explain ideas and technical terms clearly and concisely Ability to work independently to resolve issues and in a team-office environment and in remote as needed; to communicate professionally across many organizational levels and functions driving business engagement and teamwork; to effectively build rapport with stakeholders Strong knowledge and understanding of both state and federal employment laws A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace Ability to adapt to a fast paced continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Capable of conducting research utilizing intellectual curiosity and critical thinking to determine best ways to prioritize and remediate vulnerabilities with no impact on production environment WORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.) Minimal travel required Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office setting The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity. TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact recruiting@trinet.com to request such an accommodation. #LI-VB1

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Plano Town Center (31064), United States of America, Plano, Texas Director Business Analyst Business Analysis at Capital One, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. You will work with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. And you'll do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: Strategic leadership: Develop business strategies that will drive growth, profitability, and competitive success for Capital One in the face of shifting consumer and regulatory demands Leadership: May manage and develop 1-2 analysts. Coaching and mentoring associates with a goal of developing and retaining talent at Capital One Product: Develop and implement new product and pricing strategies for various lending products; lead product level modeling/analytics Marketing: Lead direct-to-consumer marketing efforts for select products, and strategic intent for products distributed through the retail channel. Build targeted insights to inform the design and development of new customer experiences, as well as breakthrough technology and concepts designed to deliver on new go-to-market strategies Credit Risk: Drive step-change improvement in credit performance by connecting drivers of future consumer credit trends to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis Execution: Manage and sequence delivery of business intent, build business requirements and execute against the product strategy. Oversee multiple projects and programs concurrently Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Capital One including: IT, Sales, Operations, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability Strategic & analytic orientation: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation, given that a large part of the business is based on rigorous analytic marketing & credit risk management Strong business judgment, leadership and integrity: He/she should be a tenacious decision maker, able to bring a healthy, aggressive, yet responsible approach to business Strong executive communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills Clear results orientation: display an intense focus on achieving both short and long term goals. He/she should be able to drive and execute an agenda in an uncertain and fluid environment Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. Previous consulting experience is a plus Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, or Engineering At least 4 years of experience in business analysis role Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree or MBA 5 or more years of experience in business analysis in a corporate setting 3 or more years of experience in consulting 2 or more years of people management Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

title: Data Analyst
description: AT NORTHWESTERN MUTUAL, WE ARE STRONG, INNOVATIVE AND GROWING. WE INVEST IN OUR PEOPLE. WE CARE AND MAKE A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE. Provides decision-makers within the financial division quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends in order to drive business decisions and address business questions. Access, gather, and analyze data from internal and external sources to drive insights into business problems, decisions, and performance. Creates and produces forecasts, reports, dashboards, etc. to tell a story through financial data. Produce actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems. Creates recommendations based on financial data and market knowledge. Utilizes analytics and metrics to recommend improvements to processes and provide data-driven forecasts. Summarizes analysis into user-friendly deliverables by translating detailed data into business-appropriate communication and recommendations. Takes initiatives to design and develop deliverables based on interpretation of findings and business client needs. Collaborates with team for speed, agility and innovation in work. Embraces continuous learning, curiosity, and ambiguity. Bachelor's degree in computer science, MIS, math, statistics, business or related field. 3 years of experience in research and data analysis, application of statistical research techniques, report or application development that support business decisions/outcomes. Expertise in development and analytical tools such as SAS, SQL, VBA, Power Query, SSIS, SSAS, or other tool. Visualization tooling like Power BI, Business Objects or Cognos. Ability to deliver recommendations in written, verbal and presentation form. Proven skills in problem solving, research, quantitative analysis and analytical working techniques. Strong aptitude and desire for learning new platforms, development, analytic and presentation tools; modeling, analytic and quantitative techniques. Ability to gather information systematically; consider a broad range of issues or factors; grasp complexities and perceive relationships among problems or issues; use accurate logic in analysis. Team player. Ability to be responsive to changing business needs, manage and prioritize concurrent assignments, and handle ambiguity. Ability to use data mining tools and analytics in order to support the initiatives of assigned business areas. Ability to generate new ideas and go beyond the status quo; recognize the need for new or modified approaches. Strong customer / client orientation. Strong analytical capability with ability to meet deadlines. This job is not covered by the existing Collective Bargaining Agreement. Required Certifications: GROW YOUR CAREER WITH A BEST-IN-CLASS COMPANY THAT PUTS OUR CLIENT’S INTERESTS AT THE CENTER OF ALL WE DO. GET STARTED NOW! We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law. FIND YOUR FUTURE We’re excited about the potential people bring to Northwestern Mutual. You can grow your career here while enjoying first-class perks, benefits, and commitment to diversity and inclusion. Flexible work schedules Concierge service Comprehensive benefits Employee resource groups

title: Marketing Manager

Our client is a premier leader in the industry offering an easy-to-use technology platform that gives guests, therapists, and spas the freedom to design personalized spa experiences based on unique needs and preferences. B2B marketing support including recruitment advertising and job posting, CRM marketing, and collateral/sales tools creation. B2C marketing support including creative development oversight (video, display, print, blogs) and Marketing CRM/email marketing, Community/membership support including Facebook Group Moderation and email marketing Support of national and regional PR programming Facility lead generation research, prioritization, cold calls, and social outreach Marketing performance analytics and scorecarding Sales performance analytics and scorecarding Support Marketing research Trade show and event planning and coordination Qualifications / Skills: Social and Digital Marketing Marketing CRM/email marketing Agency creative development management B2B copywriting B2C copywriting as needed Strong communication skills Ability to collaborate across departments and functions Project management Analytics Understanding the customer Process improvement Initiative Planning Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s or master’s degree in marketing or a related field Proven working experience in marketing and/or sales with B2B marketing, particularly within the hospitality industry Demonstrable experience managing CRM/email marketing, social media and/or digital advertising campaigns Proven experience in working with and managing agencies Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments Solid knowledge of website and marketing analytics tools Working knowledge of ad serving tools Demonstrate ability to problem solve and collaborate with diverse teams Job Type: Full-time Pay: $47,000.00 - $66,000.00 per year Benefits: Health insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Digital Marketing/Content: 5 years (Required) Content marketing: 5 years (Required) Work Location: Fully Remote This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Company's website: https://headwayplatform.com/ Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process Virtual meetings

title: Data Analyst
description: WHO ARE WE? The way we pay for healthcare in America today is fundamentally broken, burdened by layers of avoidable inefficiencies that drive up costs while creating damaging delays in the process. Nomi Health was founded in 2019 as a direct healthcare company with a simple yet bold mission: retool how we pay for healthcare to create a more cost-effective and simply effective - experience for employers, patients and providers alike. The Nomi Health team, now 70 employees strong worldwide, collaborates under the leadership of game-changing executives hailing from the likes of Imagine Health, Optum, HireVue and Goldman Sachs. In the face of the pandemic, Nomi Health put its direct healthcare model to work, mobilizing to create and deliver effective, efficient and quality COVID-19 solutions to local governments, employers and organizations. We invite you to join us in this mission. WHAT IS A DAY IN THE LIFE? The data analyst will work to analyze data and turn it into useful information. This information will be leveraged to make recommendations for initiatives set to improve business operations and help achieve strategic business objectives. This requires proficiency in business intelligence tools, and a strong business sense. You’ll perform strategic business analyses for various departments and synthesize findings to business leaders. These analyses will provide the foundation for future business initiatives. The data that you model and analyze will be used to monitor and identify areas for improvement. What You'll Do Extract unstructured data from a variety of sources, manipulate data into a form suitable for analysis – and then explore data using statistical methods and a visualization tool like Tableau and Domo Shape, explore, and publish data for business analysis or stakeholder initiatives using core BI tools (Excel, Tableau, GSuite and Google Analytics) Collaborate with business teams on ad-hoc analyses Perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts Validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness Develop and implement data models to guide business decisions Work with Python and R to help automate data processing and analysis. Utilize business intelligence related tools and concepts such as Tableau, SQL (through MS SQL Server), relational database design, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Excel, Python, etc. to solve operational problems. Requirements A minimum of 2-3 years experience in a similar role. Must have coding experience (python, SQL, R) Knowledge of various modern data formats, tools, and methodologies. Excellent organizational and analytical abilities. Outstanding problem solver. Good written and verbal communication skills. Data visualization product like Tableau or Looker, Domo experience Ability to Identify and solve for underlying operational challenges and opportunities Flexibility and ability to work in a fast-changing environment. Work with Python and R to help automate data processing and analysis. Benefits Health, Dental, Vision, 401k with match, Commuter benefits with Great Pay, plus Equity. Nomi Health - Central USA Dallas, Texas 75001

title: Marketing Manager
description: As a successful hire, you will be responsible for assisting the VP of Sales and Marketing in the execution of marketing operations for the organization, promoting Comevo’s services to the Higher Education and K-12 markets, and increasing brand popularity on digital media platforms. Primary Responsibilities Manage and execute the current K-12 and HE campaigns. Engage with external vendor to assist in Discovery process, provide documentation and information they need to fulfill deliverables. Assist in develop marketing strategies for new products and features to prospective and existing customers Monitor and provide metrics to management team Provide new content and updates to company website Develop marketing materials for company conferences, trade shows, and major events Assist the VP of Sales and Marketing in building brand awareness and positioning. Execute lead generation and nurturing campaigns for leads and opportunities Work with Product Manager and customers to research demand for our products and services Write and edit of publications from the company blog, newsletter, white papers, case studies and marketing collateral. Maintain analytics reporting on ad, social media and email marketing campaigns Work with our video team to create company videos to be added to our website Create email marketing campaigns for on-going sales and customer care webinars Update Sales Deck Conduct competitive analyses of the market Write and post social media, public relations efforts, and content marketing Manage and market scholarship program Qualifications & Skills Bachelor’s degree in marketing, journalism, public relations, business administration or relevant work experience. At least 1 – 3 years marketing /sales experience Prefer experience creating marketing campaigns, events, and strategies. Prefer experience with website content, online marketing, including social media and content marketing. Must be detail oriented, with an eye for design Must have advanced communication skills both written and verbal Proficient using PowerPoint, Excel, Photoshop. WordPress and Zoho CRM a plus Self-starter and comfortable working independently Ability to quickly adapt to change. Benefits Medical/Dental/vision Insurance Monthly Wellness benefit Matching Retirement plan Paid Vacation/Sick Time Paid Holidays Details Salary: DOE Hours: 40 hours/week Qualified candidates will reside in CA, and will be a US citizen or alien authorized to work in the United States. Contact Comevo www.comevo.com, hr@comevo.com, (800) 748-0975 Comevo, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Software Engineer
description: Who we are: * Menusifu Inc. is a leading restaurant point-of-sale solution company based in New York that provides a comprehensive state-of-the-art restaurant management system for dine-in, take-out, delivery, and Cafes. As a SaaS provider, Menusifu covers all kinds of functional requirements from upper-stream supply chain to restaurant internal management operation and even customers. Nowadays, Menusifu has more than 100 employees and 8 offices (headquarter located in Manhattan) all around the world. We, at Menusifu, are keen on providing you an intelligent yet fine dining experience from our innovative ordering system. We’re born to build smart restaurants. Our team is young and energetic, enterprising and invincible. Menusifu has a broad-development platform to let you fully show your talents. Our mission stems from the passion of food, but beyond. If you crave it, then make it better! If you are a foodie with the same attitude, growth goals and entrepreneurial enthusiasm as Menusifu, please join now! Stay hungry, Stay foolish! What you bring to the table: Design and develop distributed software solutions to satisfy our business needs Practice disciplined software engineering through a beautiful, pragmatic code, code reviews, automated testing with proper documentation. Deliver high quality, scalable and heavily tested software that is modular, secure, reliable and usable. Take ownership of our product stacks and make continued improvements and provide necessary operational support whenever needed. Who will be a best fit: Minimum BS in Computer Science, with software development as a focus. 3+ years of industry experiences in internet related software development at scale or with an MS or above degree in CS Strong knowledge of best practices in Object-Oriented Programming, Code Refactoring, and Design Patterns. Strong expertise in building scalable and reliable distributed systems. Expert knowledge of high performance, highly available, fault-tolerant SOA architecture. Experiences in handling structured, semi-structured and unstructured data. Strong knowledge of data security, data consistency, system performance, and reliability issues in a networked environment Strong industry experiences with web development practices and tools, including SQL databases, caching strategies, backend APIs, Java, Node.js, SQL, MongoDB, and JSON. Experiences in cloud-based software development on AWS at scale Strong competencies in system design, data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving. Strong communication and documentation skills Motivated, self-starter that is able to work both independently and in cooperation with a larger team Even Better: Experiences working in a fast-paced startup environment Industry experiences in SaaS Industry experiences in online payment integration Experiences with message-based, loosely coupled architectures and event-driven programming Experiences in software development at scale Knowledge of Microservices, Docker, Kafka, Kubernetes, AWS Cognito AWS DevOps experiences Proficiency in multiple modern programming languages Experiences in the unit test and automatic integration test Knowledge of Cloud best practices Knowledge of Big Data analytics Experiences in CI/CD You are a motivated individual with a tracking record of solving hard problems and getting things done with minimum supervision. What we offer: Excellent Start-up culture with openness and inclusiveness Young and energetic team Great career growth opportunities Benefits including Health Insurance, FSA, PTO, etc. Mentor Program Competitive Salary package * Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $60,000.00 per year Benefits: Dental insurance Disability insurance Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Paid time off Referral program Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: SQL: 1 year (Preferred) AJAX: 1 year (Preferred) Back-end development: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location Visa Sponsorship Potentially Available: Yes: H-1B work authorization Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process

title: Senior Product Manager
description: Company Description Brightback helps consumer subscription and online SaaS businesses grow customer lifetime value and reduce churn by intelligently surfacing and retaining subscribers. We are pioneering the customer retention automation category, serving innovators and category leaders like Freshly, MeUndies, Pipedrive and Unbounce, spanning the food delivery, subscription e-commerce & boxes, streaming media, fintech and insurance, and SaaS verticals. Brightback is a Series A, remote-first enterprise SaaS startup backed by top Silicon Valley VCs and investors. With remote headquarters in SF, our team brings decades of subscription experience from companies like Zendesk, LinkedIn, Twitter, Salesforce, and Heap Analytics. Job Description Are you a product designer with an emphasis on interface and interaction design for web applications? Looking for a new challenge with the opportunity to directly impact the product roadmap for a Venture-backed startup? Brightback is looking for an experienced web app designer to join our growing team on a full-time basis and integrate into our software development lifecycle. A big component of this role will be user testing flows/components of our Admin Application to identify points of user friction and develop solutions to address these. This role will report directly to our Head of Product and will be integrated into the full Brightback Engineering team workflow. This includes attending daily standups and participating in ad hoc design reviews with various members of the team. We put a premium on having a fully integrated Product/Design/Eng org so you will be expected to work directly with engineers to ensure your designs are coming to life in our Application. Time zones are flexible, but we require the ability to be online during PST working hours. Responsibilities Plan, organize, and conduct interaction & interface design user testing across Brightback’s Admin Application Develop hi-fidelity prototypes and mockups (either in Invision or Figma preferred) that can be delivered to a developer to implement along with a product spec Comfortable taking an iterative approach to design including seeking user feedback on wireframes before moving into hi-fidelity prototypes Own the product design thought leadership at Brightback and ensure the product meets these design standards Attend standups and conduct ad-hoc design reviews with the team to review work and integrate it into our Development roadmap. Conduct User Tests with current Brightback customers and potential customer audiences to identify friction in our Admin Application and work with our Head of Product to prioritize roadmap objectives to remove friction Integrate into our product development process to help drive customer value for Brightback Qualifications 5-8 years of UX, UI, or product design experience. Experience conducting User Tests and delivering hi-fidelity prototypes Experience using Figma or Invision to deliver mockups that can be shared with customers and converted into hi-fidelity prototypes Customer empathy in the design and product development process Self-starter with the ability to thrive in a remote first environment Additional Information At Brightback, we embody inclusion and embrace diversity. We are an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. Brightback prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual identity, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, nationality, citizenship, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other unlawful consideration. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Coalmarch is looking for an entry-level Digital Marketing Analyst - with a focus in SEO - to join our small but mighty team in downtown Raleigh, NC. While our office is temporarily remote due to COVID-19, this position is based in Raleigh, NC so you must live in the Triangle area, or be willing to relocate upon hire. ### What We're Looking For Here at Coalmarch, you will work with a young, energetic, creative, supportive, hard-working team that’s always willing to go above and beyond to help each other succeed. You’ll think ahead of the curve to find better solutions for our clients and our company, furthering your own skills and abilities. Though we are a small company (~40 people), we are fierce in our work ethic, and by joining our company, you’ll be a part of something bigger. We’re looking for candidates that are passionate about the future of Search Engine Optimization, and are excited to learn. Our ideal entry level candidate is someone who: - Has a Bachelor’s Degree - Has previous internship experience in digital marketing and/or SEO - Has basic knowledge of core digital marketing principles, including how algorithms work and local SEO - Is easy to communicate with and can work with well with others - Is adaptable, open to change, and willing to be flexible when needed - Is honest, genuine, and conveys authenticity in their words and actions - Is excited about the opportunity to learn and always be improving - Enjoys juggling several projects at once and thrives in a fast-paced environment - Wants to participate in our company culture - it's what helps feed our success! ### What You'll be Responsible For At the highest level, you’ll be responsible for managing a variety of SEO strategies and performance for 15-25 home service clients. This includes but is not limited to: - Creating and maintaining SEO strategies for local businesses including keyword and market research, on-page and off-page optimization, local listing management, and more - Creating and maintaining content calendars and link building strategies that adhere to Google’s ever changing algorithm and best practices - Tracking and analyzing the performance and success of your SEO strategies through Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Data Studio, Moz, and more tools - Making annual traffic, conversion rate, and lead projections for clients based on historical data and industry averages - Working collaboratively with project managers to ensure that client performance goals are attainable and that actionable items to improve performance are being regularly identified and executed - Communicating with clients on SEO initiatives and performance when needed - Working in collaboration with other SEO strategists on department-wide initiatives ### Who is Coalmarch? Coalmarch is a digital marketing and software agency based in Raleigh, NC. We offer small business owners in the home services industries (lawn care, landscaping, pest control, etc.) solutions and tools to grow their company and take it to the next level. We aim to become partners in our client’s businesses through marketing/lead generation, business consulting, and sales efficiency software. We’re a small business with big ideas. Joining us now means getting in on the ground floor in a company that’s growing fast - but not too fast. We’re all about sustainable growth for our clients, our company, and ourselves. As a part of the team at Coalmarch, you’re encouraged to discover and hone your strengths and passions, and collaborate with your peers to create a role that’s truly suited to you. ### Our Awesome Benefits Discover the awesome benefits of belonging to the Coalmarch family. It’s why so many of our employees come for a job, but stay for a career. Coalmarch is a place where you can grow both personally and professionally, while maintaining a healthy work/life balance. Some of the benefits we are proud to offer full-time employees are: - 38-hour work weeks: We operate in a 38-hour work week every week to maintain work/life balance. This means you won't have to work past 3pm on a Friday again! - Work-from-home flexibility: During COVID, we are fully remote. But even in non-COVID times, we have a flexible WFH policy with the ability to WFH 1-2 times a week! - Year-round summer hours: We give employees the opportunity to work a little longer at the start of the week and cut out early for your weekend. - Paid vacation, sick, and volunteer days: The longer you work here, the more you’ll get. We offer competitive PTO days! - Health and dental insurance: We’re proud to offer a variety of insurance options to fit your health needs and budget. - Career advancement opportunities: Build your skillset and advance in a company that consistently employs a promote-from-within mentality. - Convenient location and paid parking: Enjoy working in our downtown Raleigh office that includes a 100% company-paid parking spot! - And many more benefits including fun events, volunteering opportunities, snacks in the office, happy hours, dog-friendly environment, and more. - 401(k) match: We offer retirement savings with matching. Invest in your future and we will too - Monthly fitness stipend: Love to stay active? Earn up to $50 per month to cover your fitness fees. If you’re ready to work hard, play hard, build lasting relationships, and advance your career, we want to talk to you! Apply today to join the Coalmarch family. Job Type: Full-time

title: Software Engineer
description: Position Summary... What you'll do... Working at Sam’s Club means a career without boundaries. There’s always room to grow, to take on another challenge, to roll up your sleeves and contribute, and to find professional rewards for your hard work. Yes, we are a division of the Fortune #1 company, Walmart, Inc. But you’ll quickly find that we’re a company that wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Sam’s Club is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our clubs. Join us and you'll discover why our company is a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement. From day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. We're driven by an intellectual curiosity that keeps us on the cutting-edge of user design and a seamless customer experience. Our Team Sam’s Mobile Solution team is a cross functional innovative team focusing on Sam’s Club member facing mobile applications. our engineering team built top rated android and iOS apps help millions of our members shop online and in club, our signature projects include Scan and Go, Sam’s Mobile Fuel, Sam’s Concierge Service, and Curbside pickup. As a Software Engineer III you will: Design and development features on Sam’s Club Mobile applications, build best member facing and associate facing mobile experiences. Cooperate with backend service team, QA and other teams, complete the end-to-end technical solution. Participate Agile scrum meetings, contribute to the continuous improvement for the agile team. Support biweekly app releases, troubleshoot issues reported by customers or associates. Keys to success in this role include: At least one year experience on Apple’s development platforms & frameworks (UIKit, Cocoa Touch, Cocoa, Core Foundation). Experience developing high quality applications for iOS on the App Store. Understanding of scalability, reliability, power and performance on iOS. Experience on client-side analytics tracking tagging. Fluency with essential tools (XCode, Instruments). Extensive knowledge of object-oriented programming, multi-threading, and MVC Experience working with RESTful APIs and full stack solution. Strong understanding of data structures & algorithms You will WOW us if you have: Strong data analytical skills Familiar with Splunk, Amplitude, or new relic. We would love to see any publish app in play store and GitHub work Benefits & Perks: Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more. Equal Opportunity Employer Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. Minimum Qualifications... Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and 2 years’ experience in software engineering or related field OR 4 years’ experience in software engineering or related field. Preferred Qualifications... Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. Masters: Computer Science

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Position: Business Intelligence Applications Analyst | Division: Business Intelligence Work Days: Monday - Friday | Work Hours: 8:00am - 5:00pm Purpose of the Position: This position serves to maintain, administer, and support various designated systems and tools utilized by the bank to meet its business information needs, to include developing, processing, and delivering data imports, extracts, and queries on a recurring or ad hoc basis as needed. This position also performs key tasks for completing periodic upgrades to these systems, working with I.T. resources and other internal or external partners. Key Accountabilities: As a system architect, support data needs for the bank’s dashboard/reporting platform (MicroStrategy), with duties that include: ‒ Developing and maintaining connections, schema, and application objects to other bank systems, databases, and applications (including CRM, the data warehouse, loan origination systems, etc.) as needed to aggregate information from those sources ‒ Developing, processing, maintaining, and delivering specified data imports or exports ‒ Developing, testing, and maintaining reports and dashboards to meet management information needs ‒ Providing training and support for other system users, as appropriate ‒ Perform user administration, including creation of users and groups, removing inactive users ‒ Performance tuning MicroStrategy Intelligence, Web, and Mobile Servers Administer and support the bank’s customer relationship management (CRM) system (Microsoft Dynamics/EnAct), with duties that include: ‒ Ensuring that data feeds (daily, weekly, monthly) from the bank’s data warehouse, core systems, profitability systems, and various other databases are successfully imported into system databases and appropriately validated ‒ Maintaining the integrity of existing workflows, processes, and integration for the system ‒ Identifying requests from business owners for platform customizations and designing, testing, conducting user acceptance testing, and documenting and applying changes following all appropriate change control procedures ‒ Applying predictive analytics data to CRM to aid “next best action” decisions for targeted campaigns As a primary data steward, utilize and support the bank’s data warehouse (Fiserv InformEnt) to facilitate the bank’s information needs, with duties that include: ‒ Maintaining ongoing proficiency with PowerShare, MicroStrategy, and other tools and applications for managing and accessing data in the data warehouse ‒ Developing and maintaining views using Oracle SQL to support customer, household, service, product, sales tracking, scorecards, and various other information needs ‒ Developing and maintaining organization and product hierarchies ‒ Developing and maintaining recurring and/or ad hoc queries and reports as needed ‒ Running and maintaining the Customer Data Quality (CDQ) application ‒ Developing, processing, maintaining, and delivering specified data imports or exports, utilizing ETL (extract, transform, load) processes ‒ Providing training and support for other system users, as appropriate Maintain expert knowledge of databases, database management, and most relevant bank data sources so user information needs can be fulfilled with data that is or will be sourced from appropriate systems Translate business owner requests and objectives into desired analytics, and using expert knowledge of available information (in CRM, the data warehouse, MicroStrategy, or other databases) to extract the desired analytics and make them available to users Ensure integrity of existing system reports and their timely delivery to business units Create new and customize existing forms and reports as required by business owners Work with I.T. personnel and third-party vendors to ensure successful system and application upgrades as needed Coordinate with I.T. personnel and third-party vendors to maintain integrity and up-time for designated systems and to resolve issues requiring higher level support or intervention Back up and support other BI team members with their duties, as needed Competencies and Skills: MicroStrategy Developer, Object Manager, Command Manager, Integrity Manager, System Manager, and Web Proficiency in working with business intelligence applications, SQL, databases, data files, and data import/ export processes Proficiency in writing and developing reports and dashboards, and data visualization Strong analytical, organizational, and time management skills Self-motivated and able to work autonomously while keeping management appropriately informed Strong verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills Proficiency in working with Microsoft Office Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Access Strong ability to collaborate positively with fellow employees and with senior management Strong work ethic and commitment to the accomplishment of individual and team objectives Work Experience Requirements: Required: 5+ years experience with MicroStrategy suite Proficiency developing dashboards or reports using MicroStrategy or a similar platform Expert knowledge working with data warehouse applications (including data extraction, transformation, loading and authoring reports using report writing solutions) and working with third party systems integration Proficiency working with Oracle and SQL databases Preferred: 5+ years experience in a finance or marketing position that included working with one or more CRM systems. 3+ years working with other business intelligence applications and database systems in a bank or other financial institution Extensive knowledge of bank products/services and customer relationship/profitability dynamics in financial services Proficiency working with Fiserv’s InformEnt data warehouse Education Requirements: Required: High school diploma Bachelor’s degree in finance or information technology Preferred: Master of Science in Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, or Computer Information Systems Master of Business Administration Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIP)

title: Senior Analyst - Data Science
description: Summary The Consumer Floral Brand’s Florist Operations Team is responsible for ensuring that consumer orders that are placed for delivery through the company’s network of florists are delivered on-time and with a degree of quality that meets or exceeds customer expectations. To this end, the Sr. Analyst will be responsible for the design, development and production of ad-hoc analyses and standing (daily, weekly, monthly) reports that are necessary to run the company’s florist channel operations. Additionally, through a partnership with the Florist Relations Management team, the Sr. Analyst will be responsible for devising strategies necessary to support fulfillment initiatives across the florist network while maintaining a keen focus on how these initiatives can impact Fulfillment Capacity, Order Distribution, Florist Performance, Product Performance, Hard good Penetration, Florist Payouts, Consumer Credits and much more. In order to accomplish these tasks, the candidate is required to be proficient in the development of SAS queries and the various database tables that store the elements to be queried and calculated. Query development (i.e. “coding”) is required daily. The Sr. Analyst is also responsible for identifying trends, issues or abnormalities in the data and escalating to the attention of leadership. Primary areas of focus include: florist fulfillment performance, customer satisfaction metrics (CSIs), codified product penetration, product sell-through, florist inventory levels, product issues, fulfillment workload/queue metrics, and much more. Education/Experience College degree in quantitative field required (mathematics/systems/business/engineering). SAS Programming Proficiency Snowflake Programming Proficiency Tableau Proficiency ANSI SQL Proficiency Skills Must have a very high degree of analytical, mathematical and empirical problem-solving skills. Must be skilled in data management, analytics and reporting. Proficiency with developing reports and analyses using SAS, Snowflake and Tableau is a must. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $33.00 - $37.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Disability insurance Employee assistance program Employee discount Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Referral program Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Tableau: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location Company's website: https://recruiting.adp.com/srccar/public/RTI.home?d=Career&icx=v02UJHr0uEU62JL9KI6IPzQXs4i7%2F3rTnORppbDCDTNe%2Fu1pD2jYhf0UOLHkQBG3r&c=1110541&dissimuloSSO=tLf7tEpmvyM: hC0YqiP5gzNwX_1gNYXJeWwsPlI#/ Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process Virtual meetings

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Job title: Senior Software Designer Division/function: Research & Development (DF0007) Business unit / department: Monitoring Wireless Protocol & NFV Infrastructure (BU0064) Country: United States State: Richardson/Dallas City(ies): Richardson EXFO develops smarter network test, monitoring and analytics solutions for the world’s leading telecommunications service providers, network equipment manufacturers and webscale companies—and we love what we do! With nearly 1,900 employees in more than 25 countries, EXFO is no. 1 worldwide in fiber optic test solutions and has the largest active assurance deployment. Our broad portfolio of intelligent hardware and software solutions enable our customer’s network transformations related to fiber, 5G, virtualization and big data analytics. We’re always looking for top talent to help us lead the way in a thriving industry with boundless opportunities. EXFO develops smarter network test, monitoring and analytics solutions for the world’s leading telecommunications service providers, network equipment manufacturers and webscale companies—and we love what we do! With nearly 1,900 employees in more than 25 countries, EXFO is no. 1 worldwide in fiber optic test solutions and has the largest active assurance deployment. Our broad portfolio of intelligent hardware and software solutions enable our customer’s network transformations related to fiber, 5G, virtualization and big data analytics. We’re always looking for top talent to help us lead the way in a thriving industry with boundless opportunities. We are the reference in the telecommunications industry in the field of network testing, analysis and monitoring, and we are passionate about our business! With approximately 2000 employees in more than 25 countries, we ensure that the largest telecommunications service providers, manufacturers of network equipment and web services, always operate optimally. We are constantly looking for the best talents to contribute to the advancement of a growing industry, do not hesitate to join us! Job summary As a part of the organization as a Software Developer in R&D/Wireless Monitoring entity, you are responsible for the development, the delivery and maintenance of the Passive Probe product. You integrate a SAFe Agile team, which brings together all the necessary skills for a software project (Product Owner, Scrum master, Team players) You will be part of Tier 1 customer group to develop specificities and customer care activities by leading complex troubleshooting issues. What you’ll do Participate in the Scrum Team ceremonies Estimate the stories for features and enablers during backlog refinement Contribute to the risk and dependencies analysis before launching Product Increment Contribute, with the help of the Technical Product Manager (TPO), to the scheduling of activities, choice of technology, development and test tools, and review of test plans Troubleshoot customer system’s Telecom issues and Probing issues in Wireless Monitoring & Troubleshooting context for both Control Plane and User Plane. Be involved with software development team for future development and improvements to be implemented from the collected customer cases from the support group Accountable for customer satisfaction on the resolution Ensure the transfer of technical knowledge to support and engineering teams Be part of the E2E system team (all components) for the customer Realize R&D projects: Take in charge development activities/ follow development guidelines / produce associated software documentation Actively participate to sprint planning Commit as a team player to the sprint content delivery Take in charge part of development tests & associated documentation Actively participate to continuous improvement via Agile best practices Participate to the success of the Tier 1 Project Make sure Customer improvements will be ported into product mainstream Be part of the team to deploy Cloud Probe based solution in customer environment Be responsible for the quality and schedule of deliverables: Be responsible of the quality of his deliverables by ensuring, right level of test and design review of his modules, ensuring the completion of the test coverage of his deliverables, achieving test execution by himself, as appropriate, until quality level is reached Be responsible for delivering his own deliverables in line with schedule agreed with team and project leader Respect SLA from customer Provide technical support: Bring technical expertise to the Support teams What we’re looking for Technical skills Core development: Strong experience in C/C++ development in industrial environment Experience with DPDK is a plus Devops / automation scripting languages (Python, Shell, Groovy) tools (Jenkins, Gitlab-ci, Robot Framework, Nexus/Artifactory) deployment frameworks: ansible, openstack Cloud technologies: docker, microservice-based architectures, Kubernetes Network and system knowledge (linux kernel, network stacks) is a plus Telecom Knowledge of all the main signaling procedures, protocols, algorithms on a specific part of the network (radio, access, core, applications) Have a good theoretical understanding of Data Networking and telecommunications Master the analogies between all current network technologies Bring a transversal view on the telecom aspects of the product and services. Required aptitudes You are capable of managing development tasks in complete autonomy, immersing yourself in existing codes and proposing corrections and evolutions Your experience will demonstrate your ability to review and challenge the software practices in place at Exfo You are also able to imagine how your product can be future proof and how it can integrate new technologies You combine analytical thinking with the ability to synthesize, you are rigorous in your analyses and developments Your relationship allows you to work naturally “as a team” in an international environment Autonomous, rigorous, and flexible and demonstrate a capacity for analysis and synthesis. Solid experience in strong interaction with international customers, and have shown, in this context, an excellent level of communication and leadership. Passionate, curious and eager to learn. Must have Pertinent experience: minimum of 5 years’ experience in C/C++ software development in industrial context Language requirements: French, English Education: Master's degree in computer science or equivalent Any other combination of experience/studies will be considered. What we are offering : Working on innovating projects with new technologies Multi-site & Multidisciplinary teams Dynamic and collaborative work environment AGILE work methodology Career development and mobility inside the Group EXFO is an equal opportunity employer. Thanks for your interest in EXFO. If you have questions, please write us at careers@EXFO.com We look forward to hearing from you soon.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Digital Marketing Coordinator Stanley Steemer is looking for a Digital Marketing Coordinator to join our Marketing team! This role will be responsible for supporting Stanley Steemer’s digital marketing team and will require a strong understanding of content writing, SEO, influencer marketing and social media copy writing. This role will also need knowledge of the digital marketing funnel and online to offline marketing relationships. The position contributes to internal and external communication, reporting, content writing and local social media copy writing to align with company and department objectives. Responsibilities: Communication Collaborate with the creative and digital department to help traffic creative needs submitted to designers by the digital team– submit, organize, and help manage deadlines and deliverables Draft and write content for Stanley Steemer’s blog, The Dirt on Clean, and local store pages Pitch social media influencer partnerships Facilitate communication between marketing and internal departments such as HR and Operations Data Analytics and Reporting Maintain operational and store data as it pertains to digital listings and internal needs Strategize location opt-ins and onboard new locations Draft and schedule social media content for local programs and campaigns Organize and send reporting for local social media campaigns Monitor and track social mentions and comments on social media to understand community engagement and opinion with the brand Research and study website user experience Outline needs and align creative campaigns to planned shoots and content needs for the website and social media Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business or equivalent 0.5-2+ years of digital marketing experience Project coordination, project management and multi-project organizational skills Strong written and oral communication, time management skills, and attention to detail Stanley Steemer hires the highest quality individuals to serve our customers. Therefore, candidates will be required to pass a drug screening and criminal background check. Must be able to move and/or lift 50lbs (avg).  Stanley Steemer is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Disability insurance Employee discount Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift COVID-19 considerations: We have trained our employees in maintaining the appropriate social distance throughout the workday and the critical importance of personal hygiene with a specific emphasis on hand washing before, during and after all jobs. Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: Digital Marketing: 1 year (Required) COVID-19 Precaution(s): Social distancing guidelines in place Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Business Analyst
description: EB Solutions Inc. is looking for Healthcare Business Analyst for a contract opportunity. We have been delivering the highest quality consultants to our clients since two decades. We've built a solid reputation for dealing with our clients and our consultants with honesty, integrity, and respect. We work hard every day to maintain that reputation, and we're very interested in candidates who can help us. If you're that candidate, this opportunity is made for you. Submit your Resume now! Job Summary Role The role of the business analyst is to actively participate in software development and implementation projects through initiation, analysis, execution and implementation phases. This role will engage with cross-functional business and technology team members through the project life-cycle, developing and documenting business requirements to be used by the software development/delivery teams as well as the basis for test cases utilized by the QA team to ensure that solutions meet the original business requirements. The Business Analyst provides leadership and drive collaboration across disciplines to help delivering solution that meet all the stakeholder needs. Responsibilities Working with internal and external stakeholders to proactively identify opportunities to leverage data and information to support business and client needs Translating moderately complex and varied business needs into reporting requirements and supporting documentation of technical specifications Collaborating with clients, internal analytics, IT development and data warehouse teams to inform and validate business and technical requirements Communicating effectively with internal development teams to ensure that the technical requirements and the business objectives are clear Working with other Technical, Business and Clinical Lead/ Analysts to address interface and domain overlap issues and conflicts and resolves disputes Skills High level of understanding of Professional Business Analysts standards Expertise in documenting Use Cases, User Stories, Workflows, Data Flows, Root Cause Analysis, Acceptance Criteria, and Business, Functional and Non-Functional Requirements and detailed work estimation Ability to navigate through a large, de-centralized organizational structure to identify SMEs and project stakeholders Strong knowledge of data analysis techniques to interpret results; strong critical thinking skill Strong understanding of waterfall and agile approaches Competent in SDLC phases, able to work at the highest technical level of all SDLC phases Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $30.00 - $42.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) matching Health insurance Relocation assistance Schedule: 8 hour shift Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Business Analysis: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Digital Marketing Coordinator Reports To: Performance Marketing Manager Hours Required: Full Time Department: Marketing Jenson USA is an omni-channel cycling business whose core purpose is to Inspire People to Ride, Experience, and Explore! Summary This position assists in the implementation of Marketing initiatives and is responsible for coordinating the activities required to bring a marketing campaign from ideation to successful launch. In addition, this role is responsible for helping gather data and leads market research efforts that expose strengths and weaknesses of our core marketing functions. The Digital Marketing Coordinator collaborates with many individuals within the Marketing Department and requires strong verbal and written communication skills with exceptional attention to detail. Essential Responsibilities Assists the Marketing Team in concepting and executing marketing campaign materials. Coordinates all marketing campaign events and activities onto Project Management Software. Liaison between Merchandising and Marketing Department to archive upcoming Brand Sales and Product Launches onto Project Management Software. Collaborates closely with all sub-departments of marketing to assist in executing recurring and one-off tasks as needed. In charge of recording Marketing Meeting Minutes, Notes, and Action Items. Assist in the recording and reporting of key Marketing KPIs. Support Social Media and Community Outreach/Events efforts. Marketing liaison to advocacy / community partner organizations. Development Digital Tactics - Case Studies and Audits (Monthly/Bi-Monthly) Case Studies will be conducted for the purpose of presenting insights to the Marketing Department relating to core functions of our business and how they compare to our direct competitors and businesses outside of our market. Relevant insights will be archived publicly, and Marketing Rocks will be determined by the Case Study archive. Sub-Department owners will work with the Marketing Coordinator to complete Rock action items/components. Loyalty Branding (Art, Visual) Email Paid Advertising Owned Content (Social, YouTube, Blog, Direct Communications, etc.) Customer Service (GAs) Box Opening Experiences Qualifications 1-2 years in similar Marketing role, Bachelors Degree in Marketing or related field a plus. Experience working with eCommerce platforms and CMS systems. Basic HTML/CSS knowledge is a plus. Strong web analytics skills with demonstrated proficiency in Google Analytics. Excellent project management skills. Excellent verbal, written and presentation abilities. Proficiency using Microsoft Office suite. Self-starter and motivated. Organized and sharp attention to detail. Ability to work independently and with a team. Has a passion for bicycles. Compensation - Undisclosed Skills/Abilities We Look For Adaptability - Demonstrates flexibility with change. Organization Effectively balances conflicting priorities to manage workflow, ensure completion of essential projects and meets critical deadlines. Proactive Anticipation of Needs Utilizes analytical skills and broad understanding of the business to effectively addresses problems and acts to prevent them. Communication Listens to understand the needs; speaks with confidence using clear and concise language, produces well thought-out professional correspondence that is free from grammatical and spelling errors. Service Oriented Interacts professionally with leaders, customers, vendors and team members. Promptly responds to requests with accuracy and a courteous demeanor. Team Player Works as a competent member of the team, willing to support others. Computer/Technical Savvy Is proficient in using standard office equipment. Demonstrates advanced proficiency by adapting to new technology and easily acquiring new technical skills. Judgement Exhibits sound judgement and the ability to make reasonable decisions in the absence of direction. Swiftly refers problems/issues to the appropriate person when necessary. Initiative Works effectively while asking for direction when needed. Benefits We offer a variety of benefits and perks for full-time employees, including: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Flexible Spending Account 401(k) Retirement Plan with Employer Matching Supplemental Life Insurance Employee Purchase Discount Program Professional Growth & Development Opportunities Jenson USA is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace. All new hires must complete a pre-employment drug screen. Jenson USA is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. title: Software Engineer
description: Company Name: ddms Job Title: Software Engineer Location: St. Paul, MN de maximis data management solutions, Inc. (ddms) is a growing and innovative environmental data management, analysis, & visualization services organization. We specialize in optimizing the flow of data from the field, converting that data to meaningful analytics, and distributing that information to clients. We are on the cutting-edge data management and application development services and we are in the process of hiring a Software Engineer to join our growing software development team! The software engineer is expected to design, develop, support and maintain ddms’ SaaS application, Project Portal, and custom data automation tools that comply with industry best practices. Software Engineer Responsibilities: Build, test and deploy new product offerings within ddms’ AWS cloud environment Develop innovative quality features on existing .NET / ASP.NET / MVC applications. Develop data visualization and reporting deliverables using R / Python Assist with design, building, and maintaining databases to support applications. Including providing support for SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS and writing of stored procedures and SQL Scripts. Develop scripting for Microsoft solutions (e.g. Flow) Work in an agile team methodology and dynamic environment Work with other company thought leaders on other tangential processes like Dev Ops Collaborate in gathering internal and external stakeholder needs and design systems based on strategic business initiatives Become an expert of ddms software and identify ways to expand overall application stability as well as new opportunities and solutions. Prioritize task-centric work from multiple projects under deadline. Software Engineer Experience: Minimum 2 years of relevant experience AWS, Azure, or other cloud-based architectures JavaScript Frameworks: AngularJS, Vue, others Experience developing custom JavaScript web-map applications utilizing GIS best practices and leveraging Esri technology. Experience with version control systems such as GIT Able to prioritize task-centric work from multiple projects under deadline. Wicked smart Not required but nice to have: AWS certification: Solutions Architect or DevOps Engineer/Developer Esri certification: Web Application Developer or ArcGIS API for JavaScript Specialty MRA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer XJ6

title: Financial Analyst
description: Description: Pain Specialists of America (“PSA”) is a portfolio company of private equity firm, CommonView Capital (“CVC”). Based in Austin, PSA is a physician practice of 15 physicians in 18 offices and 2 ambulatory surgical centers (“ASCs”) along the I-35 corridor from San Antonio to Fort Worth with approximately 200 employees. PSA was created through the merger of two of the largest interventional pain management practices in the state of Texas, Central Texas Pain Center and Pain Specialists of Austin. Reporting directly to the VP, Finance, the Financial Analyst will work closely with PSA’s Executive Team and talented staff to implement strategic processes to support the firm’s continued growth. The Financial Analyst is a junior position, however, a successful analyst will also be considered for future roles within CVC, the general partner, and at other portfolio companies. This position combines clinical healthcare finance/operational experience and deal execution. The Financial Analyst will facilitate the identification and execution of actionable items that are critical to PSA’s growth. Duties and Responsibilities Perform data analytics on business intelligence platforms like Power Bi. Must possess the ability to design and develop reports to analyze data in meaningful ways to disseminate among the Executive Team Analyze operational metrics, location financials, and operational metrics to drive margin and process improvements Deliver follow-up summaries, recommend action steps based on analysis and execute action steps relating to operational, clinical, and financial initiatives Lead the execution of key strategic initiatives and establish data-driven, fact-based presentations for critical issues Attend meetings with, and on the behalf of the Executive Team, as requested; develop action items and follow-up with stakeholders on key initiatives to ensure progress continues on all assigned workstreams. Participate in the identification, design, development, and implementation of assigned projects, including acquisition opportunities Analyze, synthesize, and manage data provided by project teams and functional areas to efficiently deliver information to Executive Team to streamline decision-making processes Deliver high-impact solutions to the Executive Team by identifying key issues, defining appropriate work structures, and executive steps to affect change Communicate with executive stakeholders, including extensive contact with general partners, lenders, intermediaries, and PSA staff, with a high level of sensitivity, diplomacy, and professionalism Over time, serve as a thoughtful partner and “utility hitter” to the Executive Team regarding PSA’s strategies, staffing, and all other key aspects of the business Ability to query databases using SQL Benefits Medical, Dental, Vision Short Term and Long Term Disability Life Insurance (Self, Spouse, Child) 2 weeks PTO + 9 Paid Holidays Annually 401(k) + Employer Match Employee Assistance Programs . Requirements: The ideal candidate would have extensive financial modeling experience, such as investment banking, and extensive exposure to physician practices within the healthcare sector. Other profiles under consideration would be 2-5 years of work experience including some combination of the following" Accounting Consulting Finance/Operations experience, preferable in a healthcare environment Investment banking A successful financial analyst will have a flexible skill set which includes advanced Excel technical abilities, a “whatever it takes” attitude, a hunger to learn, interest in digging deeper to a granular level to solve operational problems, and maturity to lead under stressful conditions. Due to the substantial pipeline of new acquisition opportunities, a successful analyst role would expand beyond internal operations and would include participating in deal due diligence and execution as managed by the private equity owner, CVC. A successful analyst will receive preferred consideration for future job openings within CVC. Healthcare and physician practice industry experience is preferred but not mandatory. Like the rest of the Executive Team, the analyst will be expected to be available when needed to meet critical deadlines. During the COVID crisis, this candidate will work from home and would likely continue to do so for the foreseeable future. Some travel may be required for the role once the COVID crisis has passed. A modeling test and case study will be part of the interview process. Education Requirement Bachelors in Finance or Accounting

title: Financial Analyst
description: The Financial Analyst position is a key role in fulfilling the expansive analytic needs of the Department of Internal Medicine. Working in a collaborative team environment this position will be responsible for supporting monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc reports. Representative data types include: provider productivity, patient access to care, operational efficiency, patient volume forecasting, and some financial metrics. Duties include driving operational improvements through communication and ownership of operational processes, improving reporting processes through rigorous data validation and standardization. Excellent communication, project management, and attention to detail are required. Responsibilities Prepares and interprets management information and other financial reports. Analyzes financial documents, statistical data, historical data and presents to and interprets for management. Analyzes trends and possible consequences. Recommends and implements improvements that affect the department, physicians, providers, and clinics. Support new product development. Participate within a multidisciplinary team across multiple locations. Develop and maintain effective and collaborative working relationships with a wide variety of internal colleagues and customers. Work with the analytics team to devise and implement strategies. Provide data and financial analysis to support department, as well as hospital and health sciences management. Perform program and operations analysis. Implement and potentially lead performance improvement initiatives. Assume ownership for working with appropriate groups to address challenges or resolve issues as needed. Problem Solving This position has the authority to independently determine the type and nature of analysis to be used to obtain the desired information or results, including data to be collected, analysis methods, presentation, format, and report structure. Representative challenges of this position include organizing and prioritizing multiple projects, determining the best course of action or appropriate resources needed to complete the project or address a problem, obtaining valid data and creating clear and understandable reports that reflect the data being sought. This job description is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job. Work Environment and Level of Frequency typically required Nearly Continuously: Office environment. Physical Requirements and Level of Frequency that may be required Nearly Continuously: Sitting, hearing, listening, talking. Often: Repetitive hand motion (such as typing), walking. Seldom: Bending, reaching overhead. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Healthcare Administration, or a related field or equivalency; plus two years of related experience. Also required are a thorough knowledge of established accounting principles and practices; spreadsheet and database skills; knowledge of statistics and demonstrated analytical,problem solving, human relation and effective communication skills required. An advanced degree, such as a Master’s of Business Administration, is preferred. Certain positions may require familiarity with hospital billing systems, Medicare and insurance reimbursement regulations, etc. Applicants must demonstrate the potential ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined in the position description. Preferences Candidate exhibits a thorough knowledge of database processes and functions including basic SQL knowledge, expertise with hospital and professional billing systems, detailed knowledge of spreadsheet skills, and common statistical analysis practices. Demonstrated experience in establishing working relationships with staff, vendors, and customers. Excellent communication skills, team relations, and time management skills. Knowledge of Epic systems, and business intelligence applications preferred. Distinguished candidates will exhibit awareness of data collection processes (the gathering of data), information analysis (transformation of data to understand its meaning), and vision (the capacity, governance, and process to do something with the information). This position is considered Category IIA: Not required on campus and has the ability to telework remotely for the duration of the University of Utah’s response to COVID-19. An employee hired into this role will be responsible for providing space, telephone, printing, networking and/or internet capabilities at the telecommute location and agree to the terms of the University of Utah campus and Health Academics COVID-19 Telecommuting Agreement. Type Benefited Staff Special Instructions Summary

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Overview People who work for themselves fuel our global economy. In the US, small businesses employ 60% of the workforce and create 80% of new jobs. Internationally the stats are even more skewed, but the odds are stacked against them. One of two small businesses fails in the first five years, two of three in the first ten years. Intuit’s Small Business and Self-Employed Group creates products and services that improve the chances of success for small businesses around the world. From time tracking to invoicing, from payroll to accounting, from crafting new ways to get the money you need to thrive and dream and the support you need to get your work done and make the right decisions. We are looking for a Director of Design,QuickBooksBrand & Marketing to lead a team of passionate product designers, visual designers, content designers and design managers who are chartered with defining world-class go to market experiences and brand systems. Bringing the value and benefit of our ecosystem to life for our customers from the very first glance of our brand all the way through first-time use and into a long-term relationship. This role is based in Mountain View and reports directly to the SVP of Design with dotted line reporting to the SVP, Global Marketing. The Director of Design will lead the team to create an aspirational and actionable vision for our customer experiences. Inspiring the team to drive and own the vision, and ultimately, partners to align on creative strategy and delivery of pixel-perfect curated design experiences of all marketing of products and services in the Small Business and Self-Employed Group including Quickbooks: payroll, capital, time-tracking, commerce, cash products and live bookkeeping services. The Director of Design will be a member of the Market Leadership Team. This team is responsible for defining both short and long-term business strategy, adding value with new design concepts and innovation. Let’s talk if you are: Customer-driven. Unrelenting about solving real customer problems - you are deeply familiar with the design thinking process and how to apply it. The customer is king, and you’re committed to deep understanding, creative solutioning and rigorous experimentation. Masterful craftsperson and storyteller. Able to work in multiple mediums and channels, leveraging your superpowers to bring possibility to life through prototypes and provocation. You sweat the details and push for benchmark quality in every touchpoint. Trend maven. You keep up on the latest trends in art, design, culture and beyond, and are comfortable having opinions that might differ from other thought leaders. Data-passionate designer. Intent on measuring quality, you are intensely curious about the power of data, analytics and machine learning to transform experience. You get business and understand the role design plays in driving outcomes. You look to the numbers as a primary indicator on areas for incremental improvement as well as those ripe for reinvention. Teacher coach. Enthusiastic about building capability in others, you are a highly desired mentor, well-known as someone who grows great people and teams. Your advice is sought out on everything from creative guidance to career. Lean into partnerships. You’re collaborative by nature and comfortable influencing across organizational and functional boundaries What you'll bring 9+ years designing and building beautiful experiences at scale Proven track record being an exceptional people manager and creative coach Natural bias to working with other functions and partners A dazzling portfolio, with core strength in creative strategy and execution Experience and comfort tackling challenges in complex spaces and competitive markets A Masters degree in Advertising, Product or Graphic Design, Consumer Research is preferred and/or equivalent experience Technical savvy and experience executing multi-channel lifecycle engagement strategies across web and mobile platforms Nice to haves: Agency leadership experience designing and driving creative campaigns with world-class brand partners Direct experience owning or managing a small business How you will lead Accountable for the visual and content expression of the QuickBooks brand - partnering with design and marketing leaders across Intuit (Mint, TurboTax, QuickBooks, Intuit) to push our brands to evolve together. Help define QuickBooks cross-channel, cross-segment GTM & engagement strategy - informed by our core value propositions and product innovations, a deep understanding of customer needs, business goals and the capabilities of our product platform Deliver phenomenal end-to-end customer experiences and experiments – evolving existing channels and developing net-new capabilities Inspire innovation – translating opportunity into action in ways that galvanize your partners to stretch, building capability and step-changing experience quality Establish and measure cross-segment, cross-device experience excellence - spearhead and drive complex programs that span across products, platforms and organizational divides, always with an eye for excellence and effectiveness Provide strategic and creative guidance - that helps grow craft and impact for your design teams and marketing partners

title: Data Analyst
description: The following describes the various aspects of the designated job. Some or all of these aspects may be changed over time, with or without notice, at the sole discretion of the ACGME. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States (US) on a full-time basis. The ACGME will not provide employment sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B Visa or other US employment authorization).
