Title: Data Analyst Department: Department of Information Services Reports To: Manager, Data Analytics, Quality, and Reporting Work Schedule: Full Time Job Summary The Data Analyst assists in maintaining data integration, data processing, and data analysis to meet the strategic and operational needs of the organization. Applications and Data Analysis Overview The Department of Information Services’ Applications and Data Analysis group is responsible for the development and ongoing maintenance of all data collection systems for residency program accreditation and outcomes. The group also provides project management, quality assurance testing, analytical reporting, and support for these data systems and data acquisition tools. Currently the group is taking a leadership role in the visual display of data and its use in accreditation. Primary Duties and Responsibilities Work with the operations data team to assist in the maintenance and quality of data used in the annual review of residency programs. Work with the operations data team in the data preparation, reconciliation, reporting, and analytic tasks required to meet business needs and requirements. Assist in the design of dashboard representation of various data, clearly showing data driven cut-offs and threshold criteria. Assist in the implementation of testing strategies to ensure consistency among data collection sources, data warehouse database, reports, and dashboards. Identify root cause of data integrity issues and implement corrective action through strong partnerships with development team and database administrators. Provide sophisticated analysis and output in the form of reports and data tables to meet operational needs. Work with multiple large datasets (primarily SQL and SAS) as needed to drive analytic, graphical, and dashboard solutions. Develop, code, and maintain SQL/SAS applications that are used for data analysis and reporting. Maintain analytic documentation. Other duties as assigned. Education, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, public health, or research-related field required; Master’s degree preferred. Must have two to three years of experience in data management and data analysis; data management experience related to medical education or health care preferred. Must have an understanding of database structure and design. Must have demonstrated proficiency using analytic software; specific experience using SQL is required, SAS preferred. Must be able to generate creative solutions to existing data analysis and data display problems; must have experience with a business intelligence software, Power BI preferred. Must be able to conceptualize and perform data analysis and have experience generating custom reports; knowledge of Excel required. Must possess excellent interpersonal skills and be able to work as a team player. Must be comfortable with ambiguity, variability, and change in business requirements. Must possess the skills to generate multiple effective solutions that address specific data and analytic needs. Must be comfortable generating multiple solutions to data analysis and data display challenges. Must be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously; must be able to shift priorities as organizational demands require. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Must be able to manage multiple projects independently and prioritize tasks. Must be detail oriented with the ability to pay close attention to accuracy of work. Must be able to communicate clearly, effectively, and appropriately for the intended purpose and audience. Equipment Position requires the significant use of standard office equipment, such as a computer, keyboard, mouse, photo copier, fax machine, telephone, etc. Working Conditions Most of the work of the Data Analyst is normally done in the ACGME office with the typical physical demands of an office environment. During the COVID-19 pandemic, ACGME employees are working remotely until further notice. The Data Analyst will need to be able to efficiently and effectively work remotely. Some travel may be required. Physical Requirements The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the Data Analyst: Will frequently be required to participate in meetings via Zoom or other video conferencing platforms. Note, this is particularly relevant while working remotely. Will frequently be required to sit and work for extended periods of time at computer terminal using various computer programs and other computer tools. Must be willing and able to travel if required. The ACGME is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Pro Disabled and Veteran Employer. The ACGME welcomes differences in the form of gender, race, ethnicity, disability, geography, socioeconomic status, age, politics, religion, philosophy, sexual orientation, gender identity, or expression status. All applicants who share this goal are encouraged to apply.

title: Product Manager
description: WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all. Not every company has the opportunity to impact the lives of millions. We do. At WW, we believe that healthy living is a human right and democratizing wellness is the heart of our brand purpose. We recognize that we cannot achieve our most ambitious goals alone. We are a human-centric technology company powered by the world's leading commercial weight management program. As a global wellness company, we inspire millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life and we need talented, motivated individuals and their unique perspectives and experiences. Through our comprehensive digital app and engaging experiences, members follow our proven, sustainable, science-based program focused on food, activity, mindset and sleep. With nearly six decades of experience in providing real human connection through engaging workshops led by expert Coaches, building inspired communities and leveraging our deep expertise in nutritional and behavioral change science, we encourage you to explore this career opportunity to help democratize and deliver holistic wellness for all. Overview of Roles: WW is hiring across all our Product teams from Mid-level Product Managers to Senior Product Managers. The product org is broadly focused on enhancing responsive and contextually relevant, personalized experiences that adapt as our members’ needs change and evolve along their own personal weight loss and wellness journey. We have a number of opportunities across multiple product teams, defining and executing on a holistic virtual and digital strategy to expand our efforts in supporting our members. The spectrum of product opportunities encompasses areas of opportunity within the growth of our member base and core businesses, engagement and retention of our members on the WW program and bringing together a cohesive wellness experience , as well as enhancing our physical and virtual workshop experiences . If you are passionate about building engaging and personalized experiences on game-changing platforms, using boundary-pushing technology, analytical data and member-facing techniques, this could be the Product team for you. Key Responsibilities: Own vision, goals, strategy, roadmaps, execution and impact of how our members engage with WW products, improving the experience across our wellness parameters Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support strategies rooted in motivating behavioral change, personalization, gamification, as well as encouraging a supportive environment Work within the Agile methodology to create user stories, product requirements, and communicate them effectively to your team, Design, Engineering and Marketing. Integrate qualitative and quantitative research, product data analysis and market insights into product requirements, roadmaps and strategies Manage bottlenecks, escalate as needed, anticipate and make trade-offs, balance the business needs versus technical constraints, and maximize business benefit while building great member experiences Requirements: 5+ years in a Product Management role in a consumer facing, software-as-a-service / mobile-first business with initiative-level scope of ownership Demonstrated deliverables, currently live and in production, showcasing iterative customer-facing experiences Excellent quantitative data analysis and experience with A/B testing Experience working with Data Science and/or Analytics teams to understand the impact of features and influence iterative development Excellent communication skills with a demonstrated ability to align stakeholders, multiple teams, and leadership to recommended strategy and solutions Strong technical understanding and experience working with engineering in Agile Product development A Bachelor's+ degree in Computer Science or an analytical-based field is preferred A passion for health, wellness or nutrition is a plus WW is an equal opportunity employer. WW does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Marketing Manager
description: We are looking for a competent Marketing Director for a Law Firm to be in charge of the organization’s marketing ventures. This primarily involves developing and implementing strategies to strengthen the company’s market presence and help it find a “voice” that will make a difference. The ideal candidate will be an experienced professional with a passion for the job, able to employ unique marketing techniques. He/She will be a skilled marketing strategist and able to drive creativity and enthusiasm in others. The goal is to increase the company’s market share and maximize revenues in order to thrive against competitors. Responsibilities Design and implement comprehensive marketing strategies to create awareness of the company’s business activities Supervise the department and provide guidance and feedback to other marketing professionals Produce ideas for promotional events or activities and organize them efficiently Plan and execute campaigns for corporate promotion, launching of new product lines etc. Monitor progress and submit performance reports Responsible for producing valuable content for the company’s online presence, editorial design and organizing the company’s publications Conduct general market research to keep abreast of trends and competitor’s marketing movements Control budgets and allocate resources amongst projects Become the organization’s agent towards external parties such as media, stakeholders and potential clients and build strategic partnerships Skills Proven experience as Marketing Director Excellent leadership and organizing skills Analytical and creative thinking Exquisite communication and interpersonal skills Up to speed with current and online marketing techniques and best practices Thorough knowledge of web analytics (e.g. Google Analytics, WebTrends etc.) and Google Adwords Customer-oriented approach with aptitude Professional chartered marketer (CIM) is a plus BSc/BA in business administration, marketing and communications or relevant field Job Type: Full-time Pay: $44,128.00 - $147,751.00 per year Schedule: 8 hour shift Holidays Monday to Friday Weekends Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Commission pay Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Digital Marketing: 5 years (Required) Marketing: 5 years (Required) Social media marketing: 5 years (Required) Work Remotely: No

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Company Description Are you an individual with a passion for cloud technologies and how you deliver services across the world? If you have built and led teams to execute on a complex, multi-disciplinary work in the development of a cloud platform, join us to have a direct impact on how we serve Twitter! Job Description Our company's purpose is to serve the public conversation. The Platform team helps serve that conversation by enabling us to deliver a reliable service to all our customers across the world at high quality and cost effectively. We operate our own data centers at Twitter and have recently partnered with AWS (Amazon Web Services) to deliver our real-time services through the cloud (https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/15/twitter-taps-aws-for-its-latest-foray-into-the-public-cloud/). This enables us to serve our customers from data centers closer to them. We deploy in our data centers proprietary and open source solutions for messaging, graph storage, database clusters, observability, etc. that partners organizations at Twitter build upon to deliver great new products and features. We run all services at Twitter with a strong focus on security and privacy. Uptime is critical, so is ease-of-use for our services. With our foray into the hybrid cloud, abstracting away the complexity of managing the data center and the cloud offerings serves to simplify how our customers in the consumer and revenue product organizations build products. It is critical that we enable a high velocity in product development. The Platform Product organization is a critical team that we’ve assembled recently to provide direction and a product lens on all the work the platform organization does at Twitter, from data to analytics, storage to data centers, graph technologies, to networking and data centers. With every product we ship to our internal customers, we provide an enabling environment to build exciting experiences for our customers. Areas of responsibility include: developing a vision for the cloud platform that supports the mission of Twitter of serving the public conversation advising on new feature development and product roadmaps providing a particular focus on delivering new capabilities to our product managers proactively identifying potential gaps/risk areas and opportunities for driving cross-functional collaboration in these areas, such as developing product offering; creating aspirational goals and partnering closely with Product and Engineering to create a roadmap that unlock capabilities for our partner organizations By working together, we create the most capable and cost-efficient platform in an innovative, experiment-rich, and fast-paced environment. What You’ll Do As director of Product for the Cloud Platform, you’ll actively develop a deep understanding of Twitter's products and lead the team to ensure the timely coverage of product initiatives across the company and develop a comprehensive, cohesive vision for a product portfolio that advances our cloud offering. You will be responsible for: defining and driving the company initiative for the hybrid cloud platform, identify the strategic direction, priorities, and work in support of the company goals; deepening the Platform’s working relationship with the Consumer and Revenue Product and Engineering leadership and to ensure product roadmaps enable innovation and critical data-centric thinking; cultivating partnerships with teams working across the whole stack from containers (Kubernetes) to infrastructure teams responsible for reliable logging, observability and alerting, while strengthening flows of communication and dialogue; collaborating cross-functionally with our Legal, Public Policy, and Communications teams on product launches; considering both organic and non-organic opportunities and being opinionated about cost/benefit tradeoffs building a growing team of direct reports (Product Managers) through diligent hiring, direct mentoring, and a comprehensive staff development plan and the next level of managers; being responsible for the team’s performance and eliminating blockers that may prevent Product Managers from executing on their roadmap and shipping product; marketing internally with the team the set of solutions, making sure that partner organizations are informed of the offered capabilities and consulted on future features; keeping engineering at a high level of efficiency by removing roadblocks, ruthlessly prioritizing feature set and product development and driving accountability on execution and delivery dates You will report directly to Richard Rabbat, Head of Product, Platform. Qualifications You obsess over building products people love. You can demonstrate a track record of collaborating with cross-functional teams to ship phenomenal enterprise products and have experience building an understanding of customers, and rapidly iterating to determine how to serve their needs and tackle their problems (via rapid prototyping, concept testing, experimentation, etc). You possess a creative and entrepreneurial spirit, are a self starter and a problem solver. You understand how to create delightful user experiences and partner well with design to test/iterate and deploy new user interfaces. You care! You believe Twitter should obsess about availability and deliver a fabulous experience. Your curiosity drives you to understand the impact that product changes may have on Twitter’s diverse customer base and makes you a natural advocate for their needs. As a strategic and valued collaborator, you are just as comfortable strategizing and leading as you are diving into the details of product work when circumstances require it. You facilitate critical conversations with ease and have no trouble working with and juggling the (at times) contending priorities of multiple teams operating in different timezones. You approach problems with multiple solutions in mind, and quickly pivot when needed to better account for newly-discovered data and insight. You have an entrepreneurial approach and are flexible, self-motivated, dedicated, and hard-working. You actively recognize needs, resolve problems, anticipate issues, and develop solutions. You build and cultivate healthy collaborations and keep teammates informed and engaged. You customize your communication style based on your audience and easily switch between verbal and written communication as needed. Basic requirements 10+ years of experience driving and implementing policy, process redesign, project/program management, or management consulting Leading teams, preferably in multi-site organizations. Bonus: Has held leadership roles that require extensive collaboration with third parties, partners, and teams whose short-term priorities may not be aligned with yours Exceptional interpersonal skills; excels at providing balanced feedback to influence decision-making without direct managerial authority Strong process modeling and problem-solving capabilities. Able to document and analyze the flow of information between systems, quickly grasps how product settings and features interact to impact customer experience, and promptly propose elegant, creative solutions to address product and customer needs Exceptional written and oral communication skills; able to express complex issues using clear, customer-focused language that is tailored to the intended audience Experience working with quantitative and qualitative data, including research findings, to support recommendations Sound business judgment and critical thinking skills Familiarity with building public or private cloud offerings Experience working on products that have a multi-regional or global impact A Masters in CS or EE degree is required. A Ph.D. or MBA is strongly preferred Additional Information We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.” San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Software Engineer
description: Who is Interactions? Interactions, LLC is the world’s largest independent AI company. We operate at the intersection of customer experience and AI – two of today’s most innovative and dynamic industries. Since 2004, we’ve helped leading companies like MetLife, Citi, Shutterfly, and LifeLock have millions of successful conversations, resulting in saving operational cost and increasing productivity. Interactions’ 5-year vision is to accelerate a transition from today’s frustrating and uninspired customer service experiences into amazing conversational engagements! Allowing customers to communicate in their own words and on their channel of choice, to accomplish tasks, all without having to go through an agent. In doing this via our conversational AI engine, our customers benefit from dramatically improved customer experience and increased customer engagement, while also saving significant and demonstrable operational expenses. Job Description As a member of one of our Technology teams, you will contribute to building solutions that use natural language processing, cognitive computing, and artificial intelligence applications or the frameworks and infrastructure that support them. As a member of one of our Engineering teams, you will contribute to building highly scalable/reliable components that leverage natural language understanding, search, and big data technologies to provide social media analytics and engagement. The Senior Software Engineer will be part of a team of engineers and scientists that are responsible for all aspects of developing, testing and supporting a social engagement platform that uses AI to help companies understand and engage with their customers over many different channels. Position Overview: The Software Engineer plays a key role in designing, implementing, and maintaining a full stack of software components that make up our data analytics and engagement platform. The Software Engineer works in close collaboration with Product Owners, Professional Services, and in some cases third party software vendors and Customers/Prospects. Essential Job Functions: Design and implement new product features for our customers Maintain entire software stack, providing exceptional experiences for our customers Diagnose, address, and get in front of potential issues through robust monitoring and logging Effectively communicate within and outside the team. Bring new technical ideas, in keeping with latest industry trends, to fruition by prototyping and then incorporating them into the Platform. Work on an agile team to deliver high quality software on time, providing progress updates and reporting any issues or technical difficulties. Preparation, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Required: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or similar field. 3+ years of experience building applications in Java and/or Node. Web development experience in Angular, React, Ember, or Vue Exceptional database skills including SQL and NoSQL architectures Experience designing and creating web APIs using REST, gRPC, and other API standards. Minimum of two years working on mission critical, 24x7, high performance and scalable systems. Experience working with all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle – ranging from architecture and design to implementation and testing. Experience in writing design documentation, coding, and writing unit and integration tests. Prior experience with architecture and design of components and features that are part of large enterprise architectures. Enjoys coding and solving challenging and complex technical problems. Must have strong testing, debugging and problem solving skills. Good written/verbal communication skills and excellent collaboration skills. Proactive, independent problem solver; addresses complex challenges with both focus and curiosity. Pluses: Master’s Degree in Computer Science or similar field. Prior experience with AI and machine learning technologies just as tensorflow, pytorch, and scikit-learn. Python experience Experience with ETL and BI Tools Experience with profiling and troubleshooting large scale systems with extremely large amounts of data Experience with asynchronous, event driven architectures Why Work at Interactions? We've created a culture of people who are dedicated to helping each other and the company succeed. We take time to celebrate wins and recognize accomplishments. Whether it’s a seasonal event or friendly competition, we’re always thinking of new ways to have fun. Our team's health and well-being is important to us. In addition to a full suite of benefits, we offer 5 weeks of time off with pay, 401k matching, paid parental leave and flexible work schedules. We are all committed to the company’s success by being valued shareowners and are incentivized through individual performance and company results. Come join us! Interactions is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, marital status, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Disability insurance Employee assistance program Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: Fully Remote Company's website: https://www.interactions.com/ COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process

title: Data Analyst
description: TITLE Data Analyst DESCRIPTION This is an entry to mid-level position perfect for someone looking for an opportunity to join an organization that is engaged in groundbreaking innovation in the field of Transportation Analytics within the federal marketplace. Our Tech Solutions Group is focused on delivering tangible and transformative data driven use cases to stakeholder groups across a diversity of federal clients. In broad strokes, this Data Analyst position would ideally be involved at varying levels of ownership of, and involvement with, a substantial subset of the spectrum of data analytics operations ranging from exploratory data analysis, enabling accessibility to data sources and servicing ad-hoc data, preliminary statistical modeling, model validation, and efficient communication and visualization of analytical results. Responsibilities Develop standard data extracts/reports/analyses for senior leadership. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets. Drive strategic decisions through reporting of strategic metrics. Establish definitions for, and track progress towards, KPIs and report of efficiency of initiatives. Liaise with client stakeholders and technology partners to build insightful analytical solutions and dashboards. Work closely with the Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence contingent of the T. White Parker Tech Solution's Group to implement data analysis best practices. Simplify and communicate complex concepts to partners across the enterprise to drive data-driven outcomes. Be an adopter and driver of data governance standards and practices. Contribute to an analytics and data driven mindset across client organizations and within the wider T. White Parker team. Improve and ensure data quality by reviewing performance indicators to locate data quality issues and execute on established remediation processes. Work with management & production to prioritize business and information needs. Establish regular validation processes to ensure data integrity and recommend new reports, feeds, and processes to support the client operational and business models. POSITION REQUIREMENTS MUST BE EITHER A U.S. CITIZEN OR PERMANENT RESIDENT WITH THE ABILITY TO OBTAIN A SECURITY CLEARANCE SHOULD NOT AT THE PRESENT MOMENT IN TIME, NOR AT ANY POINT OF TIME IN THE FUTURE REQUIRE, SPONSORSHIP IN ORDER TO OBTAIN AND MAINTAIN THE LEGAL RIGHT TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES (I.E. U.S. WORK AUTHORIZATION) Bachelor’s Degree (Master’s preferred) in relevant fields, e.g., Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Finance, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Analytics, Data Science, etc. 1-3 years professional experience in roles like Data Analyst, Business Intelligence, etc. Extensive experience performing preliminary analyses and generating reports via using programming languages (R, Python, etc.) and tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.) Experience using SQL to query and manipulate data systems within operational and business contexts. Business analysis, report design, and presentation skills – must be very strong in communication with non-technical audiences. Familiarity with fundamental principles of data warehouses and data lakes, along with a solid understanding of data modeling concepts and methodologies. (SQL & NoSQL) Expert knowledge of best practices in data visualization. (R Shiny, Plot.ly) Ability to think creatively and to support projects, initiatives teams, and stakeholder groups in a flexible manner. Ability to handle a fast paced, occasionally high-pressure environment. Strong organizational skills, consultative approach to client interactions, and attention to detail. Unscrupulous commitment to maintaining professionalism, especially with in the context of communications and interactions with client stakeholder groups, strategic partners, and vendor/supplier organizations. DESIRED EDUCATION AND SKILLS None Specified EOE STATEMENT We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. FULL-TIME/PART-TIME Contingent THIS POSITION IS CURRENTLY ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $58,525.00 - $74,000.00 per year Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location Company's website: WWW.IOTVA1.COM Work Remotely: No

title: Product Manager
description: You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. The Team: One Amex is a product development platform which breaks business unit, market, and device boundaries to create cohesion, simplicity, and ubiquity across digital at American Express. One Amex enables engineers to develop fast, scalable, and consistent websites. Since it follows an inner source model, everyone at American Express can view and contribute to any part of the platform. Being part of OneAmex is about being a platform champion to build reusable software that impacts our customers in a positive way though data and content. We are innovative and a global organization with activities in different customer experiences. The Role: Join our team to create exciting new products and services that help all American Express customers. You will collaborate with a set of experienced product managers and act as a leader for defining how we gather, store, discover, and utilize content, data and information to deliver contextual customer experiences. You'll work closely with our data, analytics, machine learning, personalization, account experiences, consumer, servicing, merchant, and commercial teams to ensure they have the data and content they need to build the best of the best customer experiences and attack customer problems. We are looking for a strong leader who can work at the intersection of business, engineering, and user experience, with deep domain knowledge of data or content management systems. Key Responsibilities: Lead the creation of our data and/or content strategy, vision, and framework Define how the organization will gather and use data and analytics to deliver great customer experiences Define how content will be created, searched/retrieved, delivered, and its processes Obsess over customer needs and push to achieve these needs Partner across American Express teams to align and seek buy-in for the vision Prioritize initiatives (features) and create product roadmaps Establish metrics and key performance indicators to manage the business Develop business requirements and user stories Work closely with engineering, data, analytics and product management teams to deliver results Strong people leadership skills Minimum Qualifications Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science, math, business, or related discipline; Deep knowledge of content management, data modeling, data infrastructure, and statistical and machine learning, SEO (one or more) Experience of 2-3 years as a product manager of complex technologies Track record of shaping business strategy and roadmaps for technical products Ability to work with software development teams, data engineers, and data scientists to launch and improve data lakes and software applications Strong written communication skills and the ability to influence other teams Experience defining data needs and frameworks for customer facing products Preferred Qualifications Strong understanding of the payments industry Track record of shipping enterprise grade global products Experience creating B2B service offerings that cater to a wide audience Prior data and engineering experience Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law. ReqID: 21001262 Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-time Date Posted: Jan 25, 2021, 8:37:34 PMAmerican Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

title: Data Engineer
description: Job Summary: We are a close-knit, collaborative team, guided by a mission to improve lives by making the impossible possible through innovation. We are searching for a Data Engineer III who will be responsible for maintaining scalable data pipelines, efficient management of large datasets, and working cross functionally with research teams in building cutting edge healthcare algorithms. This position is an integral part of our global medical technology company that develops innovative medical technology and world-class products. Duties & Responsibilities: · Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture · Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional and non-functional business requirements · Develop and implement procedures to maintain integrity and security of data deployed on the cloud · Maintain data processes to remain scalable and stable with containerization, load balancing, and redundant system architecture · Aggregate from diverse data sources (including electronic medical records) while being documentation minded · Work closely with Data Scientists and Algorithm Engineers to identify new patterns/trends in data and assist them in building the optimal product · Develop and implement processes and systems to monitor data quality and ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders · Use Source Code Management software and follow coding style guidelines accordingly to Open Source Community guidelines. · Follow Agile methodology process to get tasks done. · Must work with limited supervision and will be involved in and have input to project planning. · Role will involve time planning and coordinating activities with software team Qualifications and Experience: · Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related field with 5+ years of experience in data engineering, ETL, analytics or related field. · Masters degree desired. · Experience building end-to-end cloud based data pipeline for real-time, streaming data collection, ingestion. · Experience architecting scalable, distributed and fault-tolerant database systems with low latency. · Experience with advanced and highly-optimized queries across large data sets with SQL and NoSQL databases. · Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets · Production experience with Azure cloud services. · Experience designing and managing highly scalable systems to provide highly reliable and available services. · Knowledge of distributed systems, Hadoop, Kafka, and container orchestration · Proficient in programming languages such as Javascript, Python, Golang, C++ etc. · Prior experience building REST APIs and interfacing applications with other 3rd party APIs · Familiarity with Machine Learning algorithms and tools is a bonus · Proficient with code versioning tools such as Git · Experience working with Data Scientist and Software Engineer to productionize machie learning models · Good communication skills, both verbal and written, and the ability to interface effectively with engineering and manufacturing personnel. Physical requirements/Work Environment This position primarily works in an office environment. It requires frequent sitting, standing and walking. Daily use of a computer and other computing and digital devices is required. May stand for extended periods when facilitating meetings or walking in the facilities. Some local travel is necessary so the ability to operate a motor vehicle and maintain a valid driver’s license is required. The physical demands of the position described herein are essential functions of the job and employees must be able to successfully perform these tasks for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made for those individuals with real or perceived disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job described. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Dental Insurance Disability Insurance Flexible Spending Account Health Insurance Life Insurance Paid Time Off Vision Insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus Pay Work Location: One location Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No

title: Senior Product Manager
description: Sr. Product Manager – Splunk Infrastructure Monitoring, Splunk Observability Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Role We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to help bring our industry leading Infrastructure Monitoring SaaS solution to a whole new level with step-function usability enhancement. You will work closely with your peers in product, engineering, design, architect and GTM team, both within Splunk Infrastructure Monitoring and across Observability suite to: Drive significant revenue growth with new and renewal customers through usability and product capability improvement Own the user experience for visualizing and exploring not the inventory, health and performance of their cloud infrastructure and infrastructure services, but also how they are correlated with one another Own the user experience for visualizing, exploring, monitoring and troubleshooting cloud and data center infrastructure across the tech stack Research and understand user journey, build differentiated functionalities and monitoring features in the platform to support strategic infrastructure monitoring solutions and integrated user experience across Splunk observability product suite Help drive the strategic directions of Splunk Infrastructure Monitoring for long term success This position requires your understanding the users’ needs and workflow, instincts and creativity to ideate and implement new user journeys, and technical expertise. Knowledge of development will enable you to produce clear product requirements and navigate the technical complexity of monitoring products, including the metrics and streaming analytics platform. You will need to work with our distributed team across San Jose, RTP offices in the US and Krakow office in Poland. Key Responsibilities Understand customer and user needs in depth; communicate those needs crisply and succinctly within Splunk; and work with design and engineering teams to translate those needs into clear priorities, a compelling roadmap, high-impact, innovative features, and sharp product requirements Actively maintain a view of how the market, competition and technologies are evolving, and factor it, as well as feedback from internal groups and customers, into the product direction Collaborate with product marketing, support and the sales team to drive GTM efforts and solve for business limiters within your control and pursue key business accelerants Basic Qualifications Demonstrated ability to prioritize requirements across conflicting dimensions and to be clear on the minimum capabilities that matter Able to independently identify significant opportunities in an ambiguous area and build consensus around roadmaps A passion for customer journey, user experience, usability and a knack for simplicity; willing and able to dive deep into technical requirements Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to lead, collaborate and influence via persuasion, patience and energy Excellent analytical / problem-solving skills. Ability to identify patterns and synthesize disparate data into a coherent whole Experience with developing software, understanding engineering tradeoffs, and an intuition for the needs of the developers and operators who use our products Willing to do whatever it takes to get quality products and features to market on time Preferred Qualifications 3-5 years of experience in product management or technical product management role BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent MBA from a top-tier program Background in enterprise SaaS; bonus if those were monitoring or analytics related Participation in all stages of the software development lifecycle, experience with Agile software methodologies If you’d like to join one of the fastest growing and most exciting tech companies in the Silicon Valley, contact us! This position has the ability to make a huge impact. Your compensation will include a competitive salary, stock options, cool perks, and generous benefits. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Data Engineer
description: Data Engineer HighPoint Digital, Inc. is seeking to hire a Data Engineer with experience in designing, implementing and delivering data solutions. The candidate should be a Subject Matter Expert in JupyterHub and web administration and open source analytics. KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS: Significant experience with JupyterHub, Python and R languages Significant experience with the following languages and tools: Python, R, scikit-learn Anaconda, SQL Server, RStudio, Spyder experience preferred Experience with scripting tools such as Python, unix shell scripts Experience with big data platforms (Hadoop, Spark, etc) Experience with cloud service providers (AWS, Azure) General knowledge of machine learning techniques and methodologies Should be well organized, thorough, and able to handle competing priorities Ability to start, manage and conclude projects independently Ability to adjust to changes in requirements, scope and direction Positive attitude, attention to detail and great problem-solving skills Experience in financial industry a plus Ability to obtain position of Public Trust designation JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Implement, architect, and administer a JupyterHub server environment. Facilitate major machine learning projects from conception to conclusion. Collect requirements, plan implementations and integrate data sources in collaboration with stakeholders. Create understanding and build consensus with stakeholders to define project security, data architecture and operational requirements. Demonstrate strong oral and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate on technical and methodological matters with audiences of various expertise. Work onsite 100% EDUCATION AND YEARS OF EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, related field or equivalent experience ABOUT HIGHPOINT: HighPoint is a growth-oriented firm that provides a unique, differentiated employee culture relative to our Federal market peers. We leverage this growth-oriented and employee-focused culture to attract and retain a higher grade of talent than our peers to be an employer of choice. HighPoint helps government agencies elevate the citizen experience (CX) by improving the touchpoints through which citizens interact with government. We were founded in 2006 by Ben Lanius with the spirit of transforming how agencies connect with and empower citizens to deliver on mission-critical objectives. At HighPoint, our focus is on delivering results that matter. We support and modernize our federal customer’s mission critical systems and functions. Agility is at our core: it is the mantra that drives us to succeed. We work quickly, analytically and deliver on agency priorities. HighPoint is privately held with 300 passionate employees across offices and locations in Indianapolis, Indiana; Baltimore, Maryland; and Herndon, Virginia. HighPoint Digital, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national or ethnic origin, disability or veteran status. HighPoint Digital, Inc. will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with HighPoint’s legal duty to furnish information.

title: Senior Analyst - Data Science
description: Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies (JJMDC) Strategic Customer Group (SCG), is recruiting for a Senior Analyst, Contract Execution, to be located in one of the following areas: Somerville, NJ; Raynham, MA; Cincinnati, OH; West Chester, PA; Warsaw, In; or Irvine, CA. The Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies have been working to make surgery better for more than a century. With substantial breadth and depth in surgical technologies, orthopedic and interventional solutions, we aspire to improve and enhance medical care for people worldwide. Together, we are working to shape the future of health through differentiated products and services. Contracting is responsible for the development and execution of contract strategy and execution for customers within the JJMD Strategic Customer Group (SCG). Contracting includes the development and delivery of Contracting Strategies (contracting options, etc.), Deal Desk (single point of contact, rapid response hub for developing contracts), Customer Analytics (preparation of customer-ready analytics and materials for the field to support customer updates and negotiations), Contract Administration (Contract executing, loading and tracking compliance) and CPC governance (rules and processes for approving deal exceptions). The Contracting group works in close collaboration with the field to put together the most appropriate offering (products, pricing, solutions and T&Cs) for the customer as possible while still supporting the objectives and strategies of the business. The Senior Analyst, Contract Execution is responsible for driving precise execution of contracts in support of accounts aligned to SCG Regions for their dedicated business unit. You will be the expert on handling RFP/RFI submissions, contract authoring, contract implementation, and contract maintenance. Those responsibilities include coordinating the contract implementation workflow, identifying potential gaps, recommending solutions, and sharing best practices. The Senior Contract Execution Analyst is also responsible for review and redlines of contract terms and conditions in close coordination with Legal, Deal Desk & field. Key Responsibilities: [Lead RFP/RFI process to include gathering required pricing approvals & non-financial information as well as review terms and conditions in close coordination with Legal, Deal Desk & field for timely submission. Develop Contract Execution plans for all incoming approvals to include drafting contracts utilizing approved templates and clauses. Ensure development of error proof contract documents, maintaining high attention to details. Work closely with Deal Desk and Field on any discrepancy or gaps in pricing approvals. Responsible for contract price activation, including optimal contract set up, ensuring all contract data elements are accurately and consistently entered into appropriate contracting systems. Coordination of price loading where appropriate providing clear and complete price load direction to price load specialists where applicable. Direct work flow across Contract Administration team to ensure flawless execution. Implementation of price changes resulting from contract maintenance activity to include scheduled price increases stipulated in the contract and compliance price adjustments for noncompliant accounts. Generate contract price files, IDN roster maintenance on contracts, creation of member add letters, and draft amendments. Develop and maintain contract templates in contracting systems in support of approved JJMD contract pricing strategies. Maintain assigned SOPs and WIs. Qualifications A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required. A concentration in Business, Finance, Sales or Marketing is preferred. A minimum of 4 years of business experience is required. A minimum of 2 years of experience in Contracting, Quoting, Pricing or related experience is required. Strong organizational skills, time management skills and ability to self-manage in a complex / time sensitive environment is required. Ability to form strong, trust-based relationships with Account Management, Franchises, Deal Managers and Contract Strategy is required. Drive to understand business products and offerings, strategies and business objectives is required. Ability to influence and align complex groups of stakeholders towards overall business objectives is required. Strong level of ownership and drive for meeting / exceeding expectations is required. Ability to drive adherence to protocols and business rules is required. Strong organizational skills, time management skills and ability to self-manage in a complex / time sensitive environment are required. Ability to work well in a cross-functional environment and build support across a complex set of stakeholders is required. Ability to form strong, trust-based relationships with CPLG, Account Management, Franchises, Deal Managers and Contract Strategy is required. Drive to understand the JJMD products and offerings, strategies and business objectives is required. Experience with sales teams, contracting needs and leadership mindsets is required. Comfort working remotely with multiple lines of business is required. Experience with quoting systems and support tools is preferred. Advanced skills in MS Excel including pivot tables, v-lookups and standard functions is preferred. Proficiency in MS Word including track changes and doc compare is required. Proficiency in Model N Contract system is preferred. This position will be located in one of the following areas: Somerville, NJ; Raynham, MA; Cincinnati, OH; West Chester, PA; Warsaw, IN; or Irvine, CA; and will require up to 10% domestic travel. Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Primary Location United States-Massachusetts-Raynham-325 Paramount Drive Other Locations United States-New Jersey-Somerville, United States-Indiana-Warsaw, United States-Ohio-Cincinnati, United States-Pennsylvania-West Chester, United States-California-Irvine Organization Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. (6077) Job Function Sales Requisition ID 2105894553W

title: Financial Analyst
description: About Us One Medical is a primary care platform challenging the industry status quo by making quality care more affordable, accessible and enjoyable. But this isn't your average doctor's office. We're on a mission to radically transform healthcare, which means tackling the frustrations of everyone involved — from patients and providers to employers and health networks. Across the country, our members enjoy seamless access to comprehensive care at more than 90 locations across thirteen cities (and counting!) as well as 24/7 access to virtual care powered by intelligent uses of technology. In addition to a direct-to-consumer membership model, we work with more than 7,000 companies to provide One Medical health benefits to their employees. On January 31, 2020 we marked a milestone with our public listing on Nasdaq, but our work is far from over. As we continue to grow and broaden our impact, we're building a diverse, driven and empathetic team, while working hard to cultivate an environment where everyone can thrive. The Opportunity One Medical is seeking a Financial Analyst to join our Strategic Finance Team. This fast-paced role provides an outstanding opportunity to influence data-driven business decisions. The Strategic Finance team has exposure to all facets of the business and plays a critical role in shaping the future and strategy of the company through forecasting and analysis of key business drivers. In this role, you will be providing support to the business through deep analytics and financial modeling. We'd love to speak to you if you are passionate about data, are results oriented and like challenging the status quo to drive business insights. You are extremely proactive, motivated, well organized, and have the ability to multitask while working with different stakeholders within the organization. What you'll likely work on: Reporting Provide reports for business partners to enable them to manage their budgets and headcount effectively and in accordance with annual plan Prepare financial reporting packages with deep and relevant insights to various stakeholders: leadership, employees, board, and investors Perform core responsibilities around month-end financial close and forecasting Create and maintain dashboards and other summary outputs for CEO and leadership teams Develop constructive, collaborative relationships with business partners. Be the trusted business advisor for leaders Evolve and implement processes and tools necessary to help scale our FP&A practices Financial modeling and analytics Provide scenario analysis support to help business partners understand financial impact of investment decisions Work closely with Finance leadership to understand growth levers that impact the financial well-being of the business Conduct deep dives into business trends and drivers of variance Support strategic short and long-term business decisions through financial modeling and analysis for business and product teams Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and help inform and influence Company strategy What you'll need: 2+ years of strategic finance, consulting, private equity, investment banking, or corporate finance experience at a high-growth startup or well-established company Hands-on experience with SQL or R Self-starter mentality with a focus on deadline and excellent time management skills High output and great attention to detail Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-performance environment Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with proven success partnering and collaborating across a wide spectrum of stakeholders Working knowledge of Adaptive, NetSuite, and Tableau preferred Benefits designed to aid your health and wellness: Taking care of you today Paid sabbatical after 5 and 10 years Employee Assistance Program - Free confidential advice for team members who need help with stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision plans Free One Medical memberships for yourself, your friends and family Pre-Tax commuter benefits PTO cash outs - Option to cash out up to 40 accrued hours per year Protecting your future for you and your family 401K match Opportunity to participate in company equity programs Credit towards emergency childcare Company paid maternity and paternity leave Paid Life Insurance - One Medical pays 100% of the cost of Basic Life Insurance Disability insurance - One Medical pays 100% of the cost of Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance This is a full-time role based in San Francisco, CA or remotely in certain states (AZ, CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, HI, ID, IL, IA, MD, MA, MI, MN, NV, NY, NC, OR, PA, SC, TX, VA, WA). One Medical is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all applicants from every background and life experience. #LI-Remote One Medical is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all applicants from every background and life experience.

title: Marketing Manager
description: If you live and breathe marketing, we need to talk. We’re looking for a flexible and versatile marketer who will be responsible for the growth of our inbound sales channels. Marketing manager responsibilities include tracking and analyzing the performance of advertising campaigns, managing the marketing budget and ensuring that all marketing material is in line with our brand identity. To be successful in this role, you should have hands-on experience with web analytics tools and be able to turn creative ideas into effective advertising projects. Ultimately, you will help us build and maintain a strong and consistent brand through a wide range of online and offline marketing channels. Responsibilities Develop strategies and tactics to get the word out about our company and drive qualified traffic Deploy successful marketing campaigns and own their implementation from ideation to execution Experiment with a variety of organic and paid acquisition channels like content creation, content curation, pay per click campaigns, event management, publicity, social media, lead generation campaigns, copywriting, performance analysis Produce valuable and engaging content for our website and blog that attracts and converts our target groups Manage social media accounts Design marketing material, from website banners to hard copy brochures Measure and report on the performance of marketing campaigns, gain insight and assess against goals Analyze consumer behavior and adjust email and advertising campaigns accordingly Skills Branding Graphic design Demonstrable experience in marketing together with the potential and attitude required to learn Proven experience in identifying target audiences and in creatively devising and leading across channels marketing campaigns that engage, educate and motivate A sense of aesthetics and a love for great copy and witty communication Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement BSc/MSc degree in Marketing or related field Related keywords: marketing, marketing manager, social media Job Type: Full-time Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction Innovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity Company's website: www.perfectpaverco.com Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/perfectpaverofpalmbeach Work Remotely: No

title: Marketing Manager
description: There’s a lot to love about a career with Perfect Pet Resort. We believe that happy pets make happy people, and we’re committed to bringing out the best in every pet. Surround yourself with wagging tails and sloppy kisses. Watch our clients’ faces light up the lobby as their pets are brought to them after a long workday or vacation stay. Walk into work knowing that, as the leading marketing force of the organization, you’re directly responsible for growing the company in new and exciting ways. This Marketing Manager position is a unique position where sales and marketing combine in a role that will keep you on your toes! One day, you’ll create company flyers…and the next, you’ll hand them out to interested prospects on-site or at community pet events. We’re also in the process of evolving our established brand, so you’ll be responsible for bringing our message and image to life. Perhaps most importantly, you’ll nurture and deepen relationships with hundreds of current clients, encouraging them to return and advocate on our behalf. Marketing Responsibilities: Develop, implement, and execute strategic marketing plans, which may include: Implement and monitor digital marketing strategy Database management & utilization Creative development of company collateral and campaigns Social media management Identifying and negotiating marketing opportunities, including sponsorships Public relations Website updates Closely track marketing campaigns Review and use analytics to effectively grow revenue Sales & Outreach Responsibilities: Work with the management team to identify and nurture relationships with leads, clients, and industry/community partners to increase revenue, which may include: Hire, motivate, and develop top notch reservation specialists team Coordinate, set up, participate, and staff marketing events (on-site and off-site) Develop community outreach initiatives Visit veterinarians and other local pet care businesses Conduct resort tours Create customer surveys Oversee staff sales training programs Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: We’re seeking an attentive, approachable multi-tasker with a knack for relationship building and wearing many hats. An intrinsic love of animals is a must (of course!) along with 3+ years of sales and marketing experience. If asked to interview, please come prepared with proven success stories about your ability to generate revenue via direct selling and/or marketing initiatives. This position will require weekend and holiday hours.

title: Business Analyst
description: Bartlett Cocke General Contractors is currently seeking a Business Analyst/Data Analyst/ERP Manager to join our ERP & Analytics Team! The Business Analyst/Data Analyst/ERP Manager has a broad knowledge of business analysis, data analysis, and ERP experience. Mastery of these distinct areas may be rare, but subject mastery in one or two areas and a working knowledge in the remaining is sufficient. Depending on area mastery, this role’s specific responsibilities may vary, but this role will be an essential part of the ERP and Analytics team, which strives to develop capabilities and processes that incorporate a wide range of views and inputs and can tailor outcomes to fit the best interests of the organization. This dynamic position works directly with the ERP and analytics team as well as teams involved with IT, construction technology, operations, accounting, scheduling, estimating, preconstruction, marketing, business development, HR, training, safety, quality control, and equipment. With an ever-evolving industry, we strive to stay on the forefront of technologies and processes, and this position will need to keep tabs on industry advances to test, develop, and implement these to improve the relevant areas of our organization. Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities: Work directly with the ERP and analytics team, department heads, project teams, and other internal teams to understand business needs and develop processes and reports with actionable data and insights. Provide training and support as required on new processes, systems, tools, reports, etc. including the creation of training documentation to ensure an effective implementation. In collaboration with department leadership, define the key insights and metrics the business needs and help develop applicable datasets, dashboards and/or methods. Take a deep dive into data to understand data quality and completeness and recommend process changes and additions to ensure data consistency and integrity to create a cohesive data system. Manage, update, and test system(s) to ensure they provide company with proper business solutions and accurate results. Identify areas for enhancements and improvements to the system(s) and the departments they support. Conform to company guidelines when handling sensitive and confidential data. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher education from an accredited college or university (or ten [10+] years of relevant industry experience). Three (3+) years analyst or ERP experience required. Experience with data visualization/BI tools required – Power BI preferred. Experience with ERP systems required – CMiC preferred. Working knowledge of database systems and technology infrastructures. Understanding of how business decisions are evaluated across various departments (operations, accounting, risk, etc.) and ability to apply this understanding. Ability to translate technical applications and issues into non-technical, layman’s terms. Passion for the use of data and business intelligence to optimize business performance. Working knowledge of database systems and technology infrastructures. Excellent organizational, interpersonal, communication (written, verbal, and visual) and analytical skills are needed. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with programming or query languages such as Python, DAX, SQL or similar. Knowledge/experience in the construction industry preferred. Bartlett Cocke General Contractors provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
