title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: The Company: NWCREI owns and operates over 1,800 apartment units in the Puget Sound Area, along with retail, office, and mixed-use properties since 1973. With lasting market knowledge and experience in real estate, we have continued to acquire and manage well-appointed properties in highly desirable areas. Most of our apartments are in Capitol Hill, the city’s mecca of art, culture, entertainment, shopping, and fine dining. You can also find apartments in other exclusive neighborhoods such as Queen Anne, Fremont, West Seattle, and the University District. Position: The Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for planning, implementing, and managing the company's digital marketing strategy including social media, email marketing, website design updates, and related specialties. This position will manage the digital media library including property photography, floor plans, site maps, logos, and pre-recorded video tours, and oversee all social media content ensuring compliance with company policies and Seattle and WA State Fair Housing Laws. This role will also create and design social posts using Publisher, Canva, Adobe Illustrator, or similar programs. Responsibilities: Evolve the brand-vision, and tone across a multitude of creative projects. Measures and reports performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assesses against goals (ROI and KPIs). Design for brand and marketing content across multiple channels (web, digital, print) while maintaining brand consistency across all creative. Update business listings via Google, Yelp, Facebook, and other internet listing sites. Design and maintain Company's website and two luxury buildings. Prepare informational packages and flyers for property tours and flyer boxes. Travel to multiple properties within the Seattle area on a regular basis to determine the best marketing strategy and take photos. Manage Craigslist ad postings, ensuring team members are using best practices and photos. Identifies trends and insights and optimizes spend and performance based on the insights. Brainstorms new and creative growth strategies through digital marketing. Evaluates emerging technologies. Provides thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate. Requirements: A combination of education and related experience. Bachelor's (BA/BS) in Marketing or similar or 2 years’ experience in a similar role. A best-fit candidate will have proven success using social media for improving online presence, marketing, and sales/leasing efforts, excellent knowledge of Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Instagram, Google+, and other social media best practices and KPIs. An understanding of SEO and web traffic metrics; experience with Google Analytics and familiarity with web design and publishing. Benefits: We offer comprehensive compensation and benefits packages, that include Medical, Vision, Life Insurance, paid Vacation, and Holidays. Sick Time & 401k with company match. Work Schedule: Monday-Friday from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. Please send a resume and explanation of why you would be a good fit for this position. We are an equal opportunity employer. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $25.00 - $28.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Referral program Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Ability to Commute/Relocate: Seattle, WA (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Marketing: 2 years (Required) Willingness To Travel: 50% (Required) Work Location: Multiple locations Company's website: www.northwestapartments.com Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No COVID-19 Precaution(s): Personal protective equipment provided or required Plastic shield at work stations Temperature screenings Social distancing guidelines in place Virtual meetings Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Marketing Director ZippityPrint is looking for a motivated and passionate Marketing Director to build our Marketing Department. The Marketing Director will implement strategies to strengthen the company’s market presence. The ideal candidate will be a skilled marketing strategist with the ability to drive creativity and motivate others. The Marketing Director will be resolute in his/her mission to increase the company’s market share and maximize revenues. Responsibilities Design and implement comprehensive marketing strategies to create awareness of the company’s business products and services Build in-house marketing department and provide guidance and feedback to marketing and graphic design professionals Build a marketing team to consult and provide guidance to a diverse list of customers Oversee all aspects of marketing campaigns Plan and execute campaigns for launching of new product lines etc. Monitor progress and submit performance reports Responsible for producing valuable content for the company’s online presence Conduct general market research to keep abreast of trends and competitor’s marketing movements Control budgets and allocate resources amongst projects Become the organization’s agent towards external parties such as media and potential clients and build strategic partnerships Skills Proven experience as Marketing Director Excellent leadership and organizing skills Analytical and creative thinking Exquisite communication and interpersonal skills Up to speed with current and online marketing techniques and best practices Thorough knowledge of web analytics (e.g. Google Analytics, WebTrends etc.), SEO strategies, and Google Adwords Customer-oriented approach with aptitude Adobe Creative Suite knowledge preferred BS in marketing and communications or relevant field preferred Related keywords: marketing, marketing director, director of marketing, marketing manager Job Type: Full-time Pay: $61,000.00 - $91,000.00 per year Benefits: Health insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: Temperatures are taken from individuals entering building. title: Software Engineer
description: Looking for a career with purpose? One that challenges your mind, grows your skills and contributes to our Nation’s most critical missions? Do you pride yourself on solving problems that others think are impossible? If you answered yes to these questions, then we would like you to join Lockheed Martin's SSC Mission Solutions, Ground Systems & Solutions Engineering Team! Mission Solutions develops, delivers, and operates affordable engineering and sustainment solutions for commercial, military and intelligence users across the globe. These mission critical efforts include development of innovative enterprise, cloud and application-based solutions for mission management, command and control, collection orchestration and tasking, processing, data analysis and analytics along with premier operations and sustainment capabilities of space- based programs in support of national security. This is a 2021 Summer Intern position. Seeking an energetic, enthusiastic intern candidate who has training and interest in at least one of these skill areas: C, C++, C#, Java, XML, Windows, .NET, and UNIX, system software and scripting development, Java programming, web development, System analysis, System design, Software Design, Software Development and Implementation, Software Test, Cyber Security, System Operations. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Ability to obtain a TS/SCI Clearance required for this role. Basic Qualifications: Acceptable degree programs include only science and technology related disciplines such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Physics, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, Cyber Security or related discipline. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information, including US Citizenship. Desired Skills: Proficiency in one of the related: C, C++, C#, Java, XML, Windows, .NET, and UNIX, system software and scripting development, Java programming, web development, System analysis, System design, Software Design, Software Development and Implementation, Software Test or Cyber Security. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Co-op/Summer Intern

title: Marketing Manager
description: Marketing Analyttics - Sr. Analyst 245 Long Hill Rd, Middletown, CT 06457, USA Req #518 Sunday, January 10, 2021 Join the Hartford Courant/Fox 61 Top Workplace for 8 Years in a Row - #1 in 2019! Accountable for the reporting of business results, customer analytics, marketing programs, the marketing budget, and the competitive marketplace. Manage process to ensure timely availability of data and performs analysis of results. Prepares timely reports of the marketing budget activities including entering and tracking invoices and producing reports monthly and as needed. Strong analytical skills with ability to interpret analytic result and convert them into a business story Creative problem solver who enjoys thinking “outside of the box” to solve problem MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS Three or more years of demonstrated, related analytic experience Initiative with demonstrated experience in working independently to complete assigned tasks Demonstrated interest in data science and quantitative analytics with an emphasis on marketing analytics, customer analytics and promotion analytics Demonstrated experience in examining collected data for quality, consistency, and accuracy. Proven ability to analyze complex data sets for insights and results as well as understand/diagnose anomalies Ability to effectively plan and execute multiple projects simultaneously. title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a rapidly growing business at Microsoft and is considered one of the leaders in Software as a Service in the world of business applications. Dynamics 365 provides the best showcase for innovations across Microsoft such as Machine Learning, Augmented Reality, Predictive Analytics and end-to-end Digital Transformation for businesses. Are you looking to build Software as a Service (SaaS) applications to enable our business customers to undertake their journeys of digital transformation with the Dynamics 365 Service Cloud? Our team delivers business applications for Customer Service, and Field Service, and Project-based industries. We are building the next generation of our applications running on Azure that pull together Dynamics 365, Office 365, Teams and many Microsoft cloud services to deliver high value, complete, and predictive application scenarios across all devices and form factors. Our team innovates quickly and work closely with our partners and customers in a very agile, high energy environment. If the opportunity to collaborate with diverse engineering teams, on enabling end-to-end business scenarios using cutting-edge technologies and to solve challenging problems for large-scale 24x7 business SaaS applications excites you, please come and talk to us! We have an opportunity for you to make a broad positive impact, whether you like building appealing user experiences, enjoy solving complex algorithmic problems or have a real passion for enabling elaborate business processes. Come and learn together with us, how to develop, deploy and maintain cloud-based business applications, used by thousands of customers around the world. Responsibilities Design, develop, test & support providing technical leadership & significant contribution to features, experiences & solutions for end-to-end business scenarios over the full stack using cutting-edge modern development technologies Collaborate across diverse engineering teams to solve challenging problems for large-scale business SaaS applications Accountability for the quality, usability & performance of features Debug and handle customer reported issues Qualifications REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 7+ years of professional software development (C#/C++/Java, SQL, HTML5/JavaScript/React or ASP.NET/ReactNative) experience Background with online services and cloud computing PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Advanced Sciences Prior experience in developing, debugging and maintaining code in cloud scale environment, object-oriented languages and database query languages Database development experience Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. title: Data Scientist
description: About Conduent: Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments – creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them. You have an opportunity to personally thrive, make a difference and be part of a culture where individuality is noticed and valued every day. Job Description: Job Summmary Purpose: Responsible for those functions, activities, and skills required for analysis, design, coding, integration, test & maintenance of software modules, subsystems or systems which control other electrical, mechanical, electronic or network systems. General Scope: Builds knowledge of the organization, processes and customer Requires knowledge and experience in own discipline; still acquiring higher level knowledge and skills Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction Moderate decision making authority guided by policies, procedures, and business operations protocol Primary Responsibilities: May perform one or more of the following: Build strong analytics team with strong capabilities in statistical analysis, Big Data and Machine Learning Plans, designs, develops and tests software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products. To Contribute to model generation and model monitoring frame work Analyzes, programs, and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs. To work with customers to critical AI deployment problems and solve with innovation Using current programming languages and technologies, writes code, completes programming, and performs testing and debugging of applications. Plans and directs studies of potential electronic data processing applications. May make hardware or software purchasing recommendations regarding web development. Candidate Education: MS/PhD in CS with 5 years relevant experience in Data science Candidate Minimum Qualification: Knowledge of basic and advanced concepts of machine learning and deep learning. Deep technical and practical knowledge of Computer Vision and Machine learning/Deep learning algorithms Hands-on experience with OpenCV to design algorithms for image enhancement, object detection, etc on real-world noisy images. Proficiency in at least one higher level programming language such as Python or R Skilled in Data Modeling and Evaluation. Able to guide junior developers and interact with stake holders Minimum shows a systematic, analytical approach to problem solving. Minimum technical knowledge and understanding of major technology areas, platforms, development processes and system lifecycles Preferred Qualification: Experience working with data visualization tools. Experienced at least one of the popular deep learning frameworks such as Caffe, Darknet, PyTorch and Tensorflow. Being able to create and iterate on solutions and dashboards to empower operational and exploratory analysis. Understanding of the conventional image and video processing approaches. Working knowledge of database is added advantage. Minimum has a broad and moderately deep knowledge coupled with working knowledge of the activities of those businesses and other organizations that use software systems. Closing: Conduent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, gender expression, sex/gender, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply for or compete for employment with Conduent may request such accommodation(s) by clicking on the following link, completing the accommodation request form, and submitting the request by using the "Submit" button at the bottom of the form. For those using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox please download the form first: click here to access or download the form. You may also click here to access Conduent’s ADAAA Accommodation Policy.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Your Team responsibilities We are seeking a Vice President, Digital Marketing Insights and Analytics to lead the implementation of marketing tracking, reporting and analytic solutions that provide insightful data and visualizations. Candidates will have proven experience analyzing key account and client marketing data and present insight-led stories that inspire action. This includes facilitating discussions with key stakeholders to understand marketing objectives, provide strategic counsel and define KPIs. What we will offer you: Depending on your location of your role, you can expect … Competitive fixed and variable compensation, holiday/vacation allowance & retirement savings plans/pensions Employee Resource Groups to support you in and out of the office A wide range of benefits including – healthcare, dental plans, risk insurances and (location dependent) - cycletowork schemes, gym benefits, retail discounts, A purposeful approach to Wellbeing including training, support networks, membership to wellness platforms and vendors, and active local office communities A specific and deliberate planning to the physical offices in which we work, and support for everyone spending periods of time working remotely or at home. This approach mirrors our commitment to transparency and sustainability and puts the safety and wellness of our employees at the center of all we do. We aim to provide productive and sustainable work environments and technology that encourages collaboration, creativity and innovation. Your key responsibilities Be a great data storyteller. Synthesize complex data sets into clear, concise, and compelling insights that inspire action through powerfully engaging narratives that drive growth for our brand and business Partner with marketing stakeholders to measure marketing effectiveness; translate business objectives into measurable goals, define key performance indicators and relevant benchmarks Create interactive data stores in business intelligence tools (PowerBI preferred) by visualizing key insights to tell your story and convey the most meaningful information Apply analytic reasoning to draw out insights in alignment with business priorities, explain the logic and reasoning to stakeholders, and deliver recommendations in alignment with strategy Lead insights-driven discussions across marketing and internal teams to communicate a comprehensive view of the client experience Extract, transform and blend a diverse data set of data sources from systems and relational databases (e.g., CRM, SQL, Google Analytics) using tools such as Excel, SQL and PowerBI Inform the optimal marketing mix based on campaigns and business goals Flag and monitor data quality to ensure confidence in the data used for analysis Your skills and experience that will help you excel Minimum 5-8 years experience in marketing analytics or customer insights, B2B experience preferred Minimum 4 years experience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Coremetrics, and WebTrends (Google Analytics Certified preferred) Minimum 3 years experience in web analytics methodologies including but not limited to clickstream analysis, A/B testing and social media brand analysis Advanced data analysis skills with the ability to clearly present complex information in a simple manner, discern business meaning and inspire action based upon your point of view through strong storytelling Advanced knowledge of business intelligence tools; Microsoft Power BI (preferred) and Qlik to design data visualizations and dashboards to effectively evaluate marketing campaigns and communicate insights Experience in translating business objectives into measurement goals Experience data blending in relational databases through ETL tools/languages such as SQL, Excel A self-starter who can achieve results in an intense, fast-paced, virtual team environment; handle multiple projects and prioritize responsibilities Excellent oral/written presentation skills; proficiency in advising and influencing stakeholders at all levels of the business to achieve strategic objectives Preferred: Proficient in statistical techniques (e.g. cluster and regression analysis) and tools to derive insights from large, complex data environments Working knowledge of tag management tools (e.g. Google Tag Manager, Adobe Tag Manager) How we’ll support you Coaching and support from experts in your team A performance and growth-oriented culture and values Opportunities for continuous learning to aid progression Goal based objectives and development plans Transparent performance-based compensation schemes Employee resource groups such as the Women’s Leadership Forum, MSCIPRIDE, Black Leadership Network and Eco-Groups. About MSCI and our teams: MSCI is a market leader in Global Indexes, Smart Beta, ESG and Risk Management, and is at the forefront of the secular trends dominating the financial services landscape today. We are committed to the future sustainability and transparency of the financial markets. We create innovative products and services that allow our clients to make more informed investment decisions, and we provide investors with critical performance measurement and risk management data and analytics. Click here to see what we do (link to MSCI brochure) Our values define the working environment we strive to create. We are inclusive, we champion bold ideas, we always pursue excellence, and always act with integrity. Personal accountability and responsibility are key to success, and we always work as a team to remain client centric. MSCI is committed to developing a culture and workforce that reflects the clients and communities in which we operate. Increasing our diversity expands our talent pool which helps to accelerate innovation in all we do. We especially encourage members of historically underrepresented groups to apply, including women, ethnic minorities and those in the LGBTQ community. To all recruitment agencies: MSCI does not accept unsolicited CVs/Resumes. Please do not forward CVs/Resumes to any MSCI employee, location or website. MSCI is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs/Resumes. MSCI Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy/maternity leave), veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Product Manager
description: PLANOLY is the industry-leading social marketing platform trusted by over 5 million users to visually plan, schedule and measure performance across Instagram and Pinterest. PLANOLY is beautifully crafted to be simple, clean and easy to use. PLANOLY believes firmly in inclusivity and is thrilled to pave the way for brands, businesses and individuals of all backgrounds to carry out their digital marketing strategies seamlessly. PLANOLY is looking for a thoughtful, well-rounded Product Manager to join a rapidly growing startup and work on an application that brands, influencers, celebrities, agencies and marketing firms are using every day. You will have the opportunity to take a critical role on our product team, and have a huge impact on the PLANOLY applications, implementing new features, improving performance, and building beautiful user interfaces. Passion for social products and building great software is a must. Our ideal candidate for this role is smart, curious, practical but not afraid to challenge the status quo. You can develop a good feedback loop on who, how and why our customers use our platform and know how to turn that into tactical actions that achieve the strategic goals you’ve identified. Jumping in and figuring things out works for you because you have a knack for bringing order to chaos.You have an excellent track record of execution, and aren’t just living in the ideation phase. If you have a passion for product and an aptitude to work in a collaborative environment, can demonstrate empathy and strong advocacy for our users, while balancing the vision and constraints of engineering, then this might be the role for you! What you’ll do: Monitors all aspects of a product development process, collaborating with the product team to drive projects to completion. Interfaces with end users, designers, developers, product marketers and customer support managers to improve products and solve problems, create solutions and launch new products & offerings. Work with scrum master to improve the product development process. Be comfortable with agile development and ability to move quickly from idea to execution. What you’ll bring: A minimum of 3+ years of experience in product management with a proven track record of success. Excellent written, verbal communication and presentation skills. Basic understanding of UI/UX approaches and strategies. Basic understanding of web and mobile technologies. Initiative to identify problems and act on opportunities to improve the product offering. Analytically minded with experience leveraging data and analytics to uncover insights. Genuine passion for customers and creating awesome product experiences. Strong collaboration skills across disciplines to drive alignment and drive releases to completion/launch. Exceptional knowledge of social media channels is very helpful. Natural curiosity to understand problems, frame them, and communicate accordingly. Who We Are: We are digital marketing and social media experts. PLANOLY was built from a Brand and Influencer’s perspective so we understand how to enhance and streamline the workflow of a digital marketer. We’re a startup that is growing super fast and has been profitable since inception. We offer an open work environment where highly motivated team members take full ownership of the products and help steer the company. We are a huge advocate of work-life balance, which is seen in our open vacation and work-from-any-coffee-shops policies. We’ll provide you with catered lunches, snacks, drinks, and regular team outings. To learn more, visit www.planoly.com, or follow @PLANOLY on Instagram. ** This role is not eligible for an employment visa.** **This role will be based in Austin, Texas - no relocation.** PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE ABLE TO RESIDE IN AUSTIN U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Information PLANOLY is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified individuals seeking employment without regards to race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other protected classification jAPQZV3PRD

title: Marketing Manager
description: SUMMARY: The Marketing Manager provides leadership for local market advertising, public relations, marketing promotions, and may lead associate sales motivation activities. The incumbent develops and executes marketing campaigns for local banks, including community banks and lines of business. In partnership with Arvest Marketing, the incumbent also supports the bank’s business needs with branch merchandising, public relations and other local advertising. The incumbent will establish and maintain relationships with key community leaders and achieve a significant presence in the community to promote Arvest Bank. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Develop, implement and monitor the results of all local bank advertising and ensure maximum exposure is gained by the local bank within budgeted expenditures. Arvest marketing strategies should promote products and services in an intentional manner to all segments of Arvest’s community. Coordinate local bank management efforts to achieve community outreach goals. Organize projects external to the bank that provide outreach within the community such as seminars, educational forums, and grilling events. Prepare and oversee the annual marketing budget for Senior Management approval. Review the accuracy of monthly marketing transactions to ensure that expenditures are within annual marketing budget. Coordinate all charitable contributions made through the local bank and the Arvest Foundation. Align local community support with bank group giving initiatives. Identify opportunities for Community Reinvestment Act (CRA) in the local market. Ensure thorough tracking and reporting for CRA donations and volunteer service hours, including all required documentation. Participate in professional associations and outside activities to enhance the bank visibility, professional growth and the community. Serve as the primary point of contact for local media at all external events. Foster professional relationships on behalf of the bank with media outlets. Develop and distribute news releases for local bank, as well as distribute news releases in conjunction with the bank’s public relations firm and Arvest Bank Group PR (Public Relations) & Media Relations Manager. Oversee the advertising process by coordinating with Arvest Marketing and public relations/advertising firms. Ensure that graphic standards are maintained within the local market. Coordinate media purchases with the Media Strategist support global marketing plans, as well as purchase local media. Collaborate with Arvest Marketing and business lines to create ad design advertising promotion materials for print, billboard, electronic media, web and direct mail. Coordinate advertising projects, staying within established budgets, deadlines and maintaining accurate records. Work in partnership with all Arvest Marketing departments including Advertising & Digital Marketing, Direct Marketing & Analytics, Email Marketing, and Marketing Compliance. Actively participate in the Marketing Peer group and on occasion, participate in additional group-level projects as assigned within this group. Recommend to local bank management the best course of action for capturing additional households, services per household, and profitable business within each community. Execute at a local level campaigns that are consistent with the Arvest brand and strategic objectives while considering all aspects of market demographics. Oversee the purchase, inventory and distribution of premium/specialty items. Collaborate as needed with Arvest Purchasing. Develop and maintain vendor relationships and follow all procedures for vendor setup. Utilize the Marketing Compliance guide for all events and marketing materials. Ensure that all materials created by Arvest Marketing are used in the manner they were created for and that they are currently compliant. Conduct annual audit of all compliance-related signage. Ensure that tax forms for donations are sent to the Tax Department. May also be required to provide volunteer hours reports to local management. Create community sponsorship agreements to enhance brand awareness within the market. Review all sponsorship requests to make sure they are relevant to the community and the impact that Arvest makes in that community. May prepare and give reports at various meetings such as board, new employee onboarding, branch sales manager meetings. Understand and comply with bank policy, laws, regulations, and the bank's BSA/AML Program, as applicable to your job duties. This includes but is not limited to; complete compliance training and adhere to internal procedures and controls; report any known violations of compliance policy, laws, or regulations and report any suspicious customer and/or account activity. TEAM ACCOUNTABILITIES: Support and uphold the Arvest Mission Statement. Uphold the Arvest Code of Ethics and ensure that confidential information is safeguarded. Maintain a high level of cooperation and rapport with all associates in order to ensure accurate and efficient operations and service. Formulate and communicate new ideas and suggestions that will improve profitability and efficiency for the company’s overall operation. Foster and promote the proper company image at all times. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: May directly supervise Marketing Specialist(s) and/or Assistant(s) as assigned by the manager. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Ensure direct reports have completed required compliance training and are adhering to all internal procedures and controls as it relates to bank policy, laws, regulations and Arvest’s BSA/AML Program. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, appraising performance, rewarding, and disciplining associates. The incumbent has the authority and the appropriate influence to make recommendations regarding hiring, firing, advancement, promotion, or any other change of status of other associates within the guidelines of the bank’s procedures and guidelines for such change of status events. The incumbent provides training, planning, assigning, and directing w QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Associates degree in business, marketing, communications or related field of study or equivalent work experience required. BS/BA in Business, Marketing, Communications or related field preferred. 3 years’ experience in marketing, communications or related field with an assigned territory required. 2 years’ experience in at least two of the following areas required: marketing budgets, campaign planning, public relations and media relations, agency relationship management and/or media planning. Experience in community involvement, leadership groups and non-profits preferred. Strong knowledge of the basic regulatory consumer compliance as related to marketing and communications preferred. Management experience preferred. Arvest experience preferred. Completion of graduate banking school, American Bankers Association School of Bank Marketing and Management or Certified Financial Marketing Professional (CFMP) designation through American Bankers Association Institute of Certified Bankers preferred. OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Must have effective written and oral communication skills and possess an above-average command of the English language, both verbally and in written form. Good proofreading skills are a must Must be able to arrive at work on time, work on site and have regular work attendance Must be able to work cooperatively with other co-workers regardless of personality, presence or communication style Must be able to provide cordial customer service regardless of customer personality, presence or communication style Must be able to perform several tasks at once Must be able to work in a stressful atmosphere Must be able to rotate job tasks Must be able to greet others cordially Must be able to coordinate multiple and changing priorities Must be able to verbally communicate with all other associates Must be able to operate telephone, copier and scanner Must be able to occasionally work outside of normal business hours. Must be proficient in use of Microsoft Office products including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint as well as Skype for Business. Must have a working knowledge of Sprout, FaceBook, Instagram, and Twitter for social media purposes Must have the ability to enter job requests with detail in WorkFront software Must have working knowledge of SharePoint/MAX site Must be able to travel between departments and branches locally as well as the Arvest footprint to attend meetings PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, and to talk and hear. The associate must occasionally reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, or crouch. The associate may occasionally be required to lift or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance and color vision and the ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate may encounter while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: Data Scientist
description: Overview: AMYX is looking for a Data Scientist to join our USTRANSCOM Change Management Knowledge Management (CMKM) contract. Responsibilities: As a Data Scientist you will be the cross functional go-between functional and organizational analysts and organizational data scientists, developers, and operational research analysts to help translate requirements, develop analytical solutions and deliver metrics and analysis with the goal of providing insight into organizational Change Management effectiveness and process automation. You must be able to conceptualize a project from start to finish, identifying the appropriate data and methodologies to use and deliver customer-accepted visualization products. You will leverage the clients’ data assets to answer business questions using best practices and innovative approaches. This will mean employing various data science tools (Python, R, Julia, Scala) and techniques (dimensionality reduction, unsupervised learning, supervised learning) to create and test machine learning algorithms. You will research, develop, and apply statistical and machine learning model workflows and tools such as Argo and Kubeflow Pipelines to build, train, and test new machine learning models, such as ModelDB to carry out model tuning, data and model provenance, and storing trained models. You will develop analytic models and tools using a variety of commercial-off-the-shelf and open source capabilities like Jupyter or Zeppelin notebooks and exposed application programing interfaces, as well as business intelligence, and visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, and COGNOS. Once tested and verified you will work with development teams to implement solutions as a scalable, hosted service. In this role, you will own and share technical solutions with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple teams both internally and with external clients. Qualifications: Required Skills and Qualifications: Background in math including linear algebra, statistics, probability, and numerical analysis. Machine Learning Analysis: Must be able to execute, evaluate, and apply various models such as logistic regression, random forests/decision tree, nearest neighbor, neural net, support vector machine, an ensemble of multiple models Programming: Proficient coding in a language suited for machine learning systems such as Python or R (not reliant on GUI-based systems to execute analysis) for the purpose of cleaning, manipulating, visualizing, and analyzing data Proficient in business intelligence and data visualization tools such as COGNOS, Tableau Must be adaptable and have the drive to learn new technologies and frameworks to support developing client solutions Produces reports suitable for technical and non-technical audiences that include statuses, explanations of results, and recommendations to improve analytics performance Using browser based interactive computational environments (like Jupyter Notebook) to perform analysis activities and test / evaluate data models and algorithms. Communication: Must be able to explain analysis process and translate results into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences Teamwork: Must be accountable for individual responsibilities while working collaboratively with development and engineering teams to achieve project deliverables Comfort in an agile development environment (e.g. writing stories, participating in workshops, sprint planning and retros) Desired Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative discipline or commensurate experience; Master’s degree preferred 3-5 years analyzing organizational data sets Demonstrated proficiency in COGNOS, Tableau Data query and analytics experience to include using coding languages and tools SQL, Python, R Demonstrated ability to learn new technical tools and software applications Ability to interact professionally and communicate clearly, both verbally and in writing, with government customers to obtain information, respond to inquiries, analyze documentation and resolve issues Demonstrated strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills and the ability to manage numerous projects and work processes Ability to carry out assignments with minimal supervision as well as work effectively as a part of a team Demonstrated strong customer service skills in providing information to all levels of the organization and customers Position requires Secret Level Clearance Position requires US Citizenship Amyx is an Equal Opportunity employer. Amyx is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. Every qualified applicant receives focused consideration for employment and no one is discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Amyx complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Equal Opportunity Employer- Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity. Amyx is an E-Verify employer. Amyx proudly and proactively takes affirmative action to advance employment of individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities. Physical Demands Employee needs to be able to sit at a workstation for extended periods; use hand(s) to handle or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Most positions require ability to work on desktop or laptop computer for extended periods of time reading, reviewing/analyzing information, and providing recommendations, summaries and/or reports in written format. Must be able to effectively communicate with others verbally and in writing. Employee may be required to occasionally lift and/or move moderate amounts of weight, typically less than 20 pounds. Regular and predictable attendance is essential.

title: Senior Analyst - Data Science
description: About the Team: Business Science, which encompasses Digital Analytics, is one of the fastest growing fields within MediaCom and focuses on (1) providing data and analytics services to our clients, (2) developing optimal processes for managing data and performing analytics and (3) innovating in methods and algorithms used for data and analytics. MediaCom Business Science gives clients the power and confidence to make smarter investment decisions. The Business Science team supplies a wide range of advanced measurement options to drive business, channel & campaign planning as well as support our teams in developing optimization for clients, helping to set clear action plans for improvement. Business Science is staffed with a team of professionals trained and dedicated to three specific areas: Cross Channel Measurement, Digital Analytics and Business Consultation. We recognize individual skillset and career aspirations when building teams and creating departmental development opportunities. We are problem solvers at heart and apply data creatively working seamlessly with Planning and specialty functions. We like to share as well as teach and believe in data led decision making. We are passionate and enjoy the energy, variety and fast-paced environment a media agency has to offer. About the Role: You will act as the primary day-to-day execution contact for client deliverables including but not limited to measurement planning, weekly reporting, media and creative testing/analysis, as well as competitive research and analysis. Your Impact: Provide on-going analytical support utilizing data management, technology and modeling (such as Market Mix Modeling) to address client issues regarding advertising, media, and new products. Analyze data and generate graphics and insights for use in client presentations. Develop econometric modeling and simulations/forecasts applied to marketing mix optimization, campaign segmentation, pricing optimization and customer lifetime value analyses to support client engagements. Manage the retrieving, compiling, and formatting of large volumes of data Support senior modelers with methodology development and testing. Analyze data to generate graphics for use in client presentations. Utilize syndicated research tools to retrieve various types of data (macroeconomic, marketing, business, etc.). Write and test macros that help automate data/modeling process using Excel VBA, SQL Server, R Build forecasts and budgets based on historical data as part of the planning process Act as primary day-to-day contact on insights and analytics to digital and traditional media managers and clients Manage project timelines and deliverable schedules and share concerns about deliverables, timelines, and issues with project managers and directors. Manage and mentor analysts on the projects to ensure excellence and professional development Your Knowledge & Abilities: Strong analytical abilities and quantitative skills Ability to multi-task, work successfully with teams, and work under pressure Advanced Excel skills and understanding of Microsoft Access and databases Data Visualization experience (Tableau, Power BI, Domo, etc.) required Expert in at least one: SQL/R/Python required for data manipulation and modeling Knowledge of media industry research tools including MRI, Media Metrix, Nielsen, etc. a plus Must take initiative and create opportunities Must be able to work on large analytical projects Comprehensive understanding of metrics: Media (e.g. buying models, CPV, VCR, GRP), Measurement analytics, Quantitative business measures (LTV, NPV, ROI, Churn, etc.), Statistics (Correlations, sample sizing, etc.) Knowledge of visual techniques for data analysis and presentation Experience in managing and mentoring team members Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving abilities Your Qualifications: B.S. degree or higher in quantitative field 2+ years of relevant work experience About MediaCom: Welcome innovators, initiative takers and instigators. We are 8,500 of the world’s leading media communications specialists, in 125 offices, across 100 countries. We have a global client roster that’s the envy of our peers. Adidas, Coca-Cola, Mars, P&G, Richemont and Sony to name but a few. We help brands unlock growth through media. Our Systems Thinking approach combines data, technology and creativity to design communication strategies that build brands and generate sales. We’re part of WPP, the world's largest marketing communications services group, which gives us access to the richest data sets and most robust benchmarks in the business. All this has helped us become the first network to hold the big six Media Network of the Year titles concurrently. But the real secret to our success is simple (and not really a secret). It’s our People First, Better Results philosophy. We know that when we invest in our people, we’ll deliver better results not only for them, but also for our clients. We also know that talent comes in all shapes, sizes, genders and ethnicities. That’s why we are open environments that celebrate difference. Do you want to work with smart, creative, enthusiastic people? So do we. Welcome to MediaCom! www.mediacomusa.com https://www.facebook.com/MediaComUsa/ https://twitter.com/MediaComUS https://www.linkedin.com/company/mediacom GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: We are Emergn. We improve the way people and companies work. Forever. We are a different type of services company. We are passionate about helping companies build better products. Our work is complex. Helping our customers solve their hardest problems, in order that they can build better products, is both stimulating and challenging. To serve our clients well, we are building a diverse and talented, global team, who focus on supporting their colleagues, delighting our clients and upholding the Emergn Way with pride. In return, we are focused on providing our people with interesting and meaningful work, in an environment where they feel respected, appreciated and rewarded for their contributions. As our Digital Marketing Manager, you will lead, develop, and execute marketing programs that both optimize our assets and define new opportunities. Your work will be highly visible and directly impact our client growth and acquisition goals for B2B and B2C programs. Your work will encompass marketing automation, lead management in Salesforce.com CRM, PPC and social media. Are you comfortable being both analytical and creative? Are you interested in “moving the ball” and being recognized for your accomplishments? Are you ready to take on more strategy at this point in your career? If the answer to these questions is "Yes", then this opportunity is for you. Responsibilities: Create, implement and optimize marketing automation campaigns. Develop and manage demand generation and lead nurturing campaigns through targeted and persona-based marketing initiatives, with the goal of driving engagement at the top of our funnel. Determine and implement Emergn’s social media strategy. Collaborate cross-functionally with product, brand and business development groups to identify opportunities, execute initiatives and maximize return on investment. Test and experiment with channels of engagement, creative and offers, to cost effectively drive new business. Provide lead and list management within our Salesforce.com platform. Manage blogs. Partner on the development, utilization and distribution of content that supports business objectives including case studies, testimonials, videos and blogs. Combine creativity with analytical thinking to ensure performance metrics are met and channels are continually optimized for peak performance. Identify new growth opportunities and best practices based on emerging digital trends, competitive business intelligence and consumer insight. Partner with external agency for execution of media campaigns and share reporting information on a weekly basis to working team. Develop creative briefs for the development of assets and campaigns. Own the ongoing competitive insight and analysis program. Required skills: Bachelor's degree or equivalent. 5+ years experience, with various digital marketing disciplines including email marketing, social media management, lead generation, and funnel optimization. Experience in defining, developing, and managing marketing campaigns in digital channels, including email and social media to meet business goals and KPIs. Strong knowledge of marketing technology best practices - especially marketing automation (e.g., Marketo, Pardot, or HubSpot). Hands-on experience with email systems, Salesforce.com, campaign analytics, and web analytics. Assist in building a culture and processes for relentless optimization of digital marketing campaigns through iterative process of testing, evaluation and adjustment. Ability to work collaboratively and develop trusted cross-functional relationships to produce results within desired timelines, scope, and budget. Curious and able to act entrepreneurially in an established organization and find creative ways to get things done. Results oriented, self-directed, and acts with enthusiasm, resilience, and possesses a “can do” attitude. Familiarity with regulations and compliance requirements impacting digital marketing (e.g., GDPR, CCPA, etc.) Preferred but not required. What we offer We care for and invest in people. We will support you on your path for success, to become the best professional within your field. We provide an environment with communities of practice, for exchanging knowledge and best practice sharing, across all of our teams. We give insight and practical usage of "Value, Flow, Quality" mindset via training and experience sharing among colleagues. We hold regular performance reviews (enabling performance) and provide constructive feedback. We sponsor your participation in conferences, meet-ups, and other training, to help you enhance your skills. We provide comprehensive benefits, which include: 20 days paid vacations; Medical insurance; Dental insurance; Vision insurance; Short- and long-term disability coverage; Life and accidental death insurance; Employee assistance program; 401k eligibility. We have a Boston office and support a remote work environment. Contract length: 24 months Application Deadline: 14/01/2021 Job Types: Full-time, Contract Benefits: 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations: All work is remote at this time during Covid-19. Work Remotely: Yes

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: We are an Industrial Facilities Design and Build Company looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist to help in the planning, execution and optimization of our online marketing efforts. The ideal candidate will have a passion for all things marketing and technology. You will be well-versed in the concepts surrounding digital marketing and how the Internet can become a strong asset to securing growing revenue. You will be tech-savvy and intuitive with great ideas to reinforce our marketing campaign. *Work from your own private office along side our awesome CT management team. Responsibilities Plan and monitor the ongoing company presence on social media (Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin, Instagram, etc.) Create product listings, product descriptions, product contents on marketplaces such as eBay, Linkedin, Instagram, Facebook, etc. Launch optimized online adverts through Google Adwords, Facebook etc. to increase company and brand awareness Be actively involved in SEO efforts (keyword, image optimization etc.) Prepare and schedule promotional emails and organize their distribution through various channels. (Email Blasts and Social Media postings) Provide creative ideas for content marketing and update website Measure performance of digital marketing efforts using a variety of Web analytics tools (Google Analytics, etc.) Acquire insight in online marketing trends and keep strategies up-to-date Skills Excellent understanding of digital marketing concepts and best practices Experience with social media, Google Adwords and email campaigns and SEO/SEM Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics) Skills and experience in creative content writing Analytical mindset and critical thinking Job Type: Full-time Pay: $40,000.00 per year Benefits: Health insurance Paid time off Retirement plan Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Education: High school or equivalent (Preferred) Experience: Digital Marketing: 1 year (Preferred) Marketing: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction Innovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity Company's website: https://usindustrialcorp.com/ Work Remotely: No COVID-19 Precaution(s): Personal protective equipment provided or required Temperature screenings Social distancing guidelines in place Virtual meetings Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Brainshark Engineering is going through an exciting cultural and technical transformation and we are looking for highly collaborative engineers to join our team. The ideal candidate is a self- starter and excellent problem solver that can work on customer focused applications across the entire stack. Responsibilities: You will partner with both technical and business teams on multiple initiatives and collaborate to deliver new features, product and technical enhancements. You will design, build, and deliver features in multiple areas of the product, with an eye towards long-term sustainability and effectiveness Work closely with other engineers on the team to contribute to the development of best practices, coding standards and test coverage You can work effectively across the stack, developing polished features in the UI, implementing the APIs, processes and data models that support them Expertly participate in code reviews, have your work reviewed, and mentor other engineers Qualifications: Experience with C#, .NET and at least one JavaScript based development framework is a must. You have deep experience with multiple development frameworks, design patterns, build, deployment and automated testing tools You are willing to pick up new technologies and actively engage in all aspects of the software development process and discussions around architecture, testing, deployment and application monitoring You care deeply about the quality of the product and you sweat the details You come with proven leadership skills demonstrated by having led the development and roll out of multiple projects You thrive in a highly collaborative workplace and are a strong advocate of Lencioni based culture Nice to have: Experience with tools and techniques for monitoring and analytics of web applications at scale (eg., new relic, google analytics, sumologic) Azure, AWS or similar cloud development experience Experience building accessible interfaces; familiarity with WCAG 2.1 specification Technolgies we use: Angular 7 with Typescript, Redux, Ionic; Asp.Net, C#, MS SQL Server; Microsoft Azure Cloud Services, Redis; Jenkins, Jira, Octopus, Bitbucket At Brainshark, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to create a better experience for everyone. However you identify and whatever background you bring, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work each day.

title: Marketing Manager
description: Job Details Description SUCCESS AT WESTERN STATES: Western State’s culture is based on passion for our Vision, Mission, and VALUES. We are fiercely committed to SAFETY and sending every employee, safely home, every day. We strive for EXCELLENCE in all we do and are proud to be a “play to win” organization. We act with INTEGRITY in each and every decision we make. Our People and TEAMWORK drive a fun and engaging culture. We are ACCOUNTABLE as individuals and as an organization. JOB SUMMARY: The Marketing Manager, Machine Sales requires a thorough understanding of marketing practices with the ability to develop realistic and relevant marketing plans in support of organizational strategy and objectives. This position will manage and develop direct reports while working in tandem with the Marketing Director in utilizing current best practices to develop short- and long-term market strategies. Extensive experience in timeline development and budgeting is required in order to implement tactics with internal and external resources. This role will work closely with Caterpillar and key internal stakeholders to ensure strategic alignment and drive top line business results. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Safety Actively cares, promotes, manages, and advocates safety at Western States. As a leader and team member in the organization, it is critical to ensure all employees, vendors, and clients have a safe work environment while adhering to all applicable safety policies, procedures and standards. Maintains clean/clutter free work areas to ensure safe environment for all WSECO employees. Adhering to required personal protective equipment (PPE) as identified in safety policy. Strategy Acts as the primary marketing liaison for Machine Sales, attending and presenting at monthly DDVS meetings, and working closely with Sales team members to ensure alignment and achievement of Sales goals Understands the practice of marketing and can develop and mentor marketing skills in a team environment Involved with messaging and creative concepting on customer-facing and internal Marketing initiatives to include copywriting for radio, collateral materials and email strategy and execution. Contributes website content in support of quarterly and ad hoc promotions, enabling customer touch, consistency of messaging, simplifying the customer experience, and generating leads. Directs, researches and analyzes data or information regarding the customer and the industry competition. Directs third party marketing resources including ad agencies, printing services, videographers, research groups, writers, photographers, etc. Directs and nurtures our Lead Opportunity Management funnel, and oversees our web content – online lead generation activities. Manages the leads and opportunities created by software to reach customers with CAT machines. This includes managing the development of tools and processes to best automate various tactics of the program, marketing automation, developing reporting to help the business understand the performance of the program, and interpreting the data and other inputs to optimize the program. Leads the execution of marketing objectives from start to finish, leveraging support from Caterpillar and internal resources to obtain the desired results. Achieves organization goals by exploring non-traditional opportunities that add value to marketing tactics. Monitors budgets by comparing estimated costs and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts. Reporting and Data Management Leads monthly operational meetings with the Sales and Marketing teams, tactically supports the retail initiatives, and Sales-focused special events. Oversees and provides periodic and ad hoc reporting, data and analysis, list development for targeted marketing efforts, etc. as needed by the business. (i.e. Dodge, Building Permits, UCC-1) Pursues data and knowledge outside of internal data warehouse. Manages WSECO’s Transactional Survey Program, including vendor management, reporting, and working with internal customers. Attends periodic meetings with Machine Sales leaders and can effectively communicate the status and trends of our Marketing efforts. Brand Management Supports "Excellence" Programs and other WSECO initiatives Partners with internal customers and Caterpillar to manage inputs/resources and oversee the cleanliness and accuracy of prospect and customer data to include tracking and reporting progress. Safeguards the Cat and Western States brand identities as established in the guidelines and expectations. Serves as an active team member of the marketing department in the development and implementation of strategic and tactical plans that support specific objectives. This would include having a clear understanding for the business objective/desired end-result, and analyzing data, competitor and market information to help target and shape marketing programs. SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND ABILITIES: Demonstrated knowledge of marketing techniques, marketing segmentation, marketing automation, data analytics, and CRM platforms. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal with the ability to articulate well with a variety of people and departments. Ability to independently set and manage priorities as well as stay organized while managing multiple projects and deadlines. Strong project management skills, with emphasis on consultative management and teamwork with exceptional attention to detail. Capable of developing and maintain effective working relationships with others. Ability to travel overnight. Aptitude to work as a change agent and implement innovative solutions to related business problems/opportunities. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree required. Marketing, Business, Communication or related field preferred. Minimum of five years in professional marketing or sales experience preferred. (Preference given to Equipment industry experience) Minimum of 3 years’ experience leading teams preferred. Must be able to communicate (speak, read, comprehend, write in English), Spanish would be a plus. PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS: Frequent walking, standing, driving, pushing, pulling, lifting, bending, climbing, twisting and leaning required. Must be able to lift a minimum of 35lbs. Must be able to meet all safety requirements for applicable safety policies. Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. It is not intended be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees in this classification. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Marketing Manager
description: Overview: Wrike is a collaborative work management platform that unifies systems and transforms the way teams plan, manage, and complete work. The Wrike platform is the digital workplace for the enterprise and partner of choice for 18,000 organizations and 2M+ users worldwide. Our mission is to enable Operational Excellence by bringing out the best in teams and connecting work with business results. Wrike has been recognized as one of the fastest growing companies in North America on Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™ list for the last three years and has been named Leader in the Forrester Wave™ report for Collaborative Work Management Tools for the Enterprise in 2016 and 2018. In late 2018, Wrike joined the Vista Equity Partners’ portfolio of world-class technology companies to help fuel the company’s global growth. Our US headquarters is in Downtown San Jose, California and we have several international offices, including our EMEA HQ in Dublin, Ireland, and our APAC HQ in Melbourne, Australia. Wrike has been named a “Top Workplace” by the Bay Area News Group for the last five years and has earned similar accolades from the San Diego Business Journal, San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal. We are guided by our three core values: Grow, Execute, and Collaborate. These values help us recruit the right talent to join our rapidly expanding team of 1,000+ Wrikers around the globe. It is important to us that each and every Wriker is not only eager to challenge themselves and knows how to get work done, but is an awesome addition to our company culture. We pride ourselves on our ability to attract, retain, and promote the very best talent. Responsibilities: As a Marketing Development Rep at Wrike, you will help the demand generation team generate qualified leads by tapping into the large pool of monthly leads that are generated through our outbound efforts. You'll qualify these leads for sales hand-off. There will be daily call quotas and weekly MQL quotas. Generate a steady flow of MQLs every month Collaborate with our analytics team to create lists of high-potential leads for each vertical and segment Reach out to leads in the cold, awareness, and interest stages across different channels, and engage with them to move them through to the next stage in the funnel Support demand generation campaigns like events and webinars by reaching out to prospects to increase campaign response rates Create a reliable and consistent lead funnel for our demand generation team Collaborate with marketing on campaigns from ideation to execution, management and follow-up Identify and create target company leads lists Qualifications: 1-3 years of experience in a BDR /SDR role Bachelor's degree from a reputed institution Excellent communication skills Excellent messaging skills with the ability to customize your message instantly based on the audience (mock pitches will be required during screening stage) Research and analytics skills to analyze leads and prioritize them Desire and motivation to excel in a cold-outreach role where the conversion rates are low but upsides are high Ability to up-level message Familiarity with SFDC, Tableau, Marketo, dialing tools and chatbots Unafraid to dive into the data to understand funnel performance Overall team player that brings energy and a positive attitude to the workplace Process-minded with the ability to make continuous improvements for any given task Resourceful self-starter with clear bias for action and results Perks & Benefits At Wrike, you’ll benefit from unlimited PTO, medical & dental care, commuter benefits, daily catered meals & snacks galore, team off-sites & happy hours. Wrike is committed to creating and maintaining a diverse and inclusive space where our employees can thrive. We welcome all persons in to the Wrike family, embracing the diversity of racial and ethnic identity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status and any other protected status. Wrike has a public-facing Recruiting Notice that has been drafted to meet applicable law and regulatory requirements (e.g., CCPA, GDPR, etc.). Our most up to date Recruiting Notice can be found here: www.wrike.com/security/recruiting.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Our ideal candidate is a fitness enthusiast with experience managing back end of multiple business social media channels with graphic design capabilities. Digital Marketing Coordinator Graphic Designer, starting out part time with ability to grow in this inhouse staff position. Areas of responsibility to include, not limited to: Digital marketer administrator experienced business pages within social media platforms; Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Pinterest Report and interpret analytics from paid and organic reach offering recommendations to optimize ROI Train location staff on local social media postings, policy and monitor locations online presence for company compliance Contribute to strategy with understanding of and relating to health and fitness retail consumers Create and schedule postings across platforms to support sales campaigns and ongoing communications Manage information on Google My Business, YELP to ensure content is up-to-date and appropriate and to receive notifications as reviews are posted to forward to Company point person who will research with Management and write response to post Design all central campaign collateral, center or program specific marketing requests from multiple locations Ongoing review of existing material to be accurate or to be refreshed including but not limited to: Flyers, Posters, Banners, Artwork for Digital Signage, custom orders, Social Media graphics, apparel, Member Referral and Prospect campaign materials. Edit photography and videography for various applications and uses. Provide appropriate design files for small, large scale print and electronic marketing. Appropriate time and project management of work flow in order to stay on time, on target and within budget Ability to work well with multiple clients and vendors while maintaining integrity of brand Passion for fitness and interest in best in class practice within the Industry Website Management Back end experience working in Square Space. Update buttons, location hours, alerts, photography, links, videos and content Create multiple custom forms (using Formstack) and embed form code on the related website landing page on website for each monthly campaign for each location. Formstack also hosts the “contact us” form, “guest pass” form and other forms, as needed Maintain and review metatags monthly Work with Center managers to ensure web content is up to date Electronic Communication Knowledge creating impact communications in Constant Contact to support communications of monthly campaigns, templates for operations to use, data list management and tutorials to center staff Qualifications desired Graphic Design certification and, or education and retail business experience Digital Social Media business administration experience, 2 or more years Experience working in design software and platforms named in above job overview Proven success managing multiple project requests and multiple clients simultaneously and harmoniously Equipment and capability to produce work and complete projects remotely Part time position, hours and work demands will fluctuate around campaign deadlines, hourly rate of pay TBD.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Digital Marketer and Office Manager Job Description HIGHLIGHTS $40,000 Salary + Commissions + Bonuses (opportunity to earn much more than that!) $5000 Yearly Salary Increase (After each of the first 2 Years) - just need to meet very minimal requirements Book of Clients to service Independent Firm with most competitive products available on the market Industry leading training program with incredible team support Work/Life balance focused agency - Family is what is most important to us! After that you will spend a portion of your time learning our proven processes to support and advise our clients, and a portion of the time learning our Marketing Systems. High school diploma or equivalent required. Previous customer service experience highly preferred. We have a close family-like culture and have a lot of fun together. You will feel the difference on your first day! Initial licensing training will be done remotely (1-2 weeks). Office is also equipped with sneeze guards for everyone's safety.
