title: Marketing Manager
description: MARKETING CAMPAIGN COORDINATOR - Part time Job Number: 2100016T Primary Location: United States-Virginia-Virginia Beach Organization: Omni Channel Pay Range: $46,000 - $62,000 Job Summary: Develops and drives email and digital marketing campaigns that meet and exceed NEXCOM business objectives primarily through the use of Salesforce Marketing Cloud SFMC and its associated tools including Email Studio Web Studio Advertising Studio Journey Builder and Audience Builder. Applies functional knowledge of SFMC to develop strategies that optimize the customer journey and create highimpact CRM initiatives that drive customer acquisition retention engagement and loyalty. Duties and Responsibilities: Utilizes creative and technical expertise to develop and build emails to move prospective customers through the customer journey while managing email segmentation, SFMC implementations, and email delivery and acquisition efforts. Work closely with the digital marketing team to plan, create, and execute email campaigns to drive key metrics, including acquisition, engagement and sales both online and in store. Develop, map, and deploy Journey Builder journeys based on site/cart engagement, store focused promotional journeys, and category specific journeys matching category promotions. Manage and develop email content calendars and campaigns that support our email program, including coding emails, creating/segmenting lists, tagging links, scheduling emails, A/B tests and quality assurance. Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to create and execute data-driven, dynamic email campaigns and deliver highly-targeted/segmented marketing campaigns, lifecycle emails, retention/reactivation programs, and loyalty building communications. Segment lists based on behaviors like past email engagement and website interactions (add to cart, abandon browse, site visits, etc.). Work to minimize list decay and unsubscribes while increasing the productivity of our email sends. Partner with Digital Marketing Analyst to report on results and provide insights and recommendations. Stay current with best practices, strategies, and industry standards related to email marketing. Works closely with the digital marketing analyst and digital designers; reports directly to the Director, Digital Marketing & Communication. Requires a total of 5 years of required experience: GENERAL EXPERIENCE: Three years of experience that was gained in administrative, marketing support and/or retail sales or other related responsible work that enabled the applicant to gain knowledge of market strategy and campaign development; skill in dealing with others in person-to-person work relationships; and the ability to exercise mature judgment. OR SUBSTITUTION OF EDUCATION FOR EXPERIENCE: 1 year of academic study above the high school level may be substituted for 9 months of experience, up to a maximum of a 4 years bachelors degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications or related field for 3 years of general experience. AND SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: 2 years marketing management experience showing progressive growth in responsibilities that include: digital marketing experience with Retail and/or B2C or brands including email marketing, customer journey development, marketing automation, and web analytics; email marketing concepts and metrics such as Sender Score, deliverability, and sender reputation; understanding of web metrics, digital analytics, and ability to generate, analyze and interpret data; including through A/B testing and email optimization; HTML, Ampscript, JavaScript, SQL and CSS; and demonstrated written and verbal skills. Preferred experience/certifications: Design/Photoshop skills a plus, Marketing Cloud Certification preferred: Email Specialist, Marketing Cloud Developer, or Marketing Cloud Consultant. Job: E-Commerce Schedule: Part-time (20 - 34.5 hours) Unposting Date: Apr 9, 2021, 10:59:00 PM

title: Director Business Analyst
description: HomeXpress Mortgage Corp. is a face in the wholesale Non-QM mortgage market. This company was founded by a group of mortgage professionals who have a long history of providing flexible solutions to borrowers who fit outside of the Prime/Qualified Mortgage space all while providing the best service levels to our broker partners in the industry. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: · Manage and lead the Company’s accounting operations and personnel. · Develop, document, and maintain accounting position policies in accordance with GAAP. · Ensure that the accounting operations are functioning at a high standard and that there is transparency in the financial results and the presentation thereof. Such results are to be concise and relevant. · Maintain an effective accounting framework where all transactions are timely and accurately posted, with sufficient reconciliation and documentation. · Structure an effective and efficient internal control framework and ensure the implementation of such, as well as the appropriate maintenance, testing and remediation of any deficiencies. · Responsible for the accurate and timely monthly, quarterly, and year-end financial information and presentation, including the analysis of key performance indicators. · Design and develop accounting system improvements, including system integrations to enhance workflow. · Collaborates with other Company employees to achieve the Company’s financial goals and objectives. Monitor the Company’s financial performance on a pro-active basis. · Work with external audit and tax personnel to be proactive as to the timely completion of GAAP audits, as well as accomplishing tax planning and compliance. · Lead the development and implementation of new procedures and features to enhance the workflow of the accounting and tax activities. · Develop meaningful data analytics and accounting metrics for management to assess the financial operations of the Company. · Assist and/or lead the financial budgeting and planning processes, including the clear communication of such to Company leadership. · Monitor and implement new GAAP standards and provide assessments of such to management. · Identify and analyze potential risks and opportunities in the Company’s accounting operations. · Mentor, develop and manage the accounting operations staff. JOB REQUIREMENTS: · Experience and working knowledge of GAAP and accounting in general as well as for mortgage banking activities including fair value and derivatives. · Seven plus years of mortgage banking (or similar) industry experience. · CPA license required. · Proactive, detail-oriented, and solutions-oriented nature. · People-oriented with a demonstrated inclination for service excellence. · Demonstrated strong communication abilities. · Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite of products, including PowerPoint, as well as various accounting applications and platforms. · Organized and able to create and effectively manage multiple timelines and schedules. DESIRED PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS: · Self-Starter with positive “Can-Do” attitude. · Able to handle sensitive information on a confidential basis. · Works well under pressure and relishes the responsibility that comes with the position. · Able to be a problem solver with the ability to communicate well both externally and internally. · An open-minded individual that embraces change and innovation. EDUCATION: · Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related business degree with accounting requirements. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Accounting: 5 years (Required) Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Required) License/Certification: CPA (Required) Work Location: One location

title: Data Scientist
description: About Kraken Kraken is changing the world. Join the revolution! Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. Founded in 2011 and with over 4 million clients, Kraken is one of the world’s largest, most successful bitcoin exchanges and we’re growing faster than ever. Our range of successful products are playing an important role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We attract people who constantly push themselves to think differently and chart exciting new paths in a rapidly growing industry. Kraken is a diverse group of dreamers and doers who see value in being radically transparent. In less than a decade Kraken has risen to become one of the best and most respected crypto exchanges in the world. We are changing the way the world thinks about money and finance. The crypto industry is experiencing unprecedented growth and Kraken is leading the charge. We’ve grown from 70 Krakenites in January 2017 to over 1200 today and we have no intention of slowing down. The Compliance Systems team works at the intersection of Data Science, Product and Compliance. The Systems team is looking for a Data Scientist with a background in statistics, machine learning and/or natural language processing to help us build and maintain models to describe and predict anomalous customer activity on Kraken’s platform. The role will involve maintaining the transaction monitoring rules codebase, ensuring that requirements for model validation are met, and building a number of new models to enhance existing controls. There is significant scope for innovation in this role, and we are looking for someone who thrives in an environment of ‘freedom with responsibility’. The ideal candidate would have some familiarity with the control systems used to comply with regulatory requirements under BSA/AML or AMLD 4+, but this is not required. A great candidate will be someone who has experience solving customer and behaviour profiling problems in an evolving data environment. Responsibilities Partner with Compliance operations, Product, Engineering and other stakeholders to build descriptive and predictive models to identify anomalous activity. Maintain the existing transaction monitoring rules codebase. Ensure that all activities meet model validation requirements. Design and build proof-of-concept models to test hypotheses and help with idea generation and refinement. Use structured and unstructured data to enrich transaction monitoring metadata. Drive cross functional projects from beginning to end: build relationships with partner teams. Communicate model methodology and results to operations teams and Compliance leadership. Develop anomaly detection and data modelling tools to monitor key performance indicators to improve the efficiency of models. Requirements PhD or Masters degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Physical Sciences, Economics, Math or a related technical field. 3+ years industry experience in data science or analytics. A consistent track record of performing data analysis using Python, SQL or other CLI tools. Experience using statistics and predictive analytics to solve complex business problems. Versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job. The ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences. Familiarity with big data tools such as Zeppelin, Spark, Kubernetes is a strong plus. Familiarity with financial crime and market abuse typologies is a plus. We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique backgrounds and experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives.

title: Senior Analyst - Data Science
description: 799 million. That’s how many lives our products touch. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives? The Senior Analyst, Medicaid Rebates will adjudicate the rebate payments under the Medicaid Drug Rebate Program using multiple system and various validation techniques.in an effort to provide prompt, accurate and compliant payments for Novartis and all Shared Service Partners. Major Responsibilities: Receive Log & Process high volume of rebates payments in a tight 37 day frame. Provide advanced data analytics to obtain savings by disputing invoice errors. Investigate, explain & document trends and data anomalies. Assist in preparing the Medicaid system with rates and updates for each processing cycle. Enter contract updates for federal, state & supplemental rebate programs. Collaborate with Management and IT in Systems projects/ upgrades. Generate and collate evidence of compliance for internal and external audit. Ensure evidence of proper approvals and meet all Sox Requirements. EEO Statement The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential. Minimum requirements Education: BA/BS degree or Equivalent 4-Year degree required. Focus in Business Administration, Finance/Accounting, preferred. Experience: Experience in pharmaceutical, healthcare industry, financial or related field. Experience mentoring and coaching of others Advanced skills in all Microsoft Office Suite products is required Experience using data visualization software Broad knowledge of healthcare contracting procedures Proficiency in life sciences applications, Model N or other rebate processing applications Why consider Novartis? We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Imagine what you could do at Novartis! title: Data Scientist
description: Overview: Are you passionate about changing the world through machine learning and location intelligence? If yes, then it’s the right time to join our team because we are about to do so! With the IoT revolution, the consumerization of mapping and location data growing exponentially day after day, location is becoming extremely important to more and more people. We want to enable organizations and businesses to go beyond basic visualization and analytics of such massive data to the realm of being two or three steps ahead of the game by extracting advanced levels of intelligence from it, predicting important events, and automating significant proportions of their work through AI and machine learning. We are looking for an entrepreneurial, collaborative person with strong hands-on experience and solid track record with statistical analysis, machine learning, predictive analytics, software engineering, and passion for location to help us on our mission to build world class predictive location analytics solutions for our customers in 160+ countries. Responsibilities: Consult closely with customers to understand their needs Develop and pitch data science solutions by mapping business problems to machine learning or other advanced analytics approaches Build high-quality analytics systems that solve our customers' business problems using techniques from data mining, statistics, and machine learning Write clean, collaborative, and version-controlled code to process big data and streaming data from a variety of sources and types Perform feature engineering, model selection, and hyperparameter optimization to yield high predictive accuracy and deploy the model to production in a cloud, on-premises, or hybrid environment Implement best practices and patterns for geospatial machine learning and develop reusable technical components for demonstrations and rapid prototyping Keep up to date with the latest technology trends in machine and deep learning and incorporate them in project delivery Requirements: 2+ years of practical machine learning experience or applicable academic/lab work Experience in building and optimizing supervised and unsupervised machine learning models including deep learning and various other modern data science techniques A fundamental understanding of mathematical and machine learning concepts such as calculus, back propagation, ReLU, Bayes’ theorem, Random Forests, time series analysis, etc. Experience with applied statistics concepts Experience developing software collaboratively in Python using version control Ability to perform data extraction, transformation, loading from multiple sources and sinks Ability to produce data visualizations using tools such as matplotlib Self-motivated, life-long learner Strong communication skills, including to non-technical audiences Bachelor's in mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics or a similar field, depending on position level (master's preferred) Recommended Qualifications: Familiarity with one or more of the following: Git, Pytorch, Tensorflow, CUDA/GPU programming DevOps/MLOps experience using Docker/Kubernetes Experience handling massive batch/streaming data using big data tools, such as Apache Spark Experience interacting with AWS, Azure, or other cloud service Experience building reinforcement learning models Experience with spatial and GIS concepts, preferably using Esri software The Company: Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them. Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more. Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email humanresources@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address. #LI-MN1

title: Data Analyst
description: Are you interested in applying your analytical and technical concepts expertise to further your career? Do you enjoy working in a collaborative, fun environment where success is rewarded? Join us as Data Analyst where you will be responsible for focusing on end-to-end data analysis, including requirements gathering, data profiling, data mapping, data aggregation, and data visualization. This will require proficiency in interpreting data, trends, patterns in complex data sets, and technical expertise with SQL and Tableau. Pay: Salaried position. Based on experience. Hours: Full time, Monday – Friday, 8:30 – 5:00 Work location: Portsmouth, NH The Day to Day: Using SQL, Tableau and/or other appropriate tools interrogate data (profile, map & aggregate) to fulfill both ad-hoc and solution development requests. Independently or in collaboration with a Business Analyst, gather, analyze, document and validate the needs of the request originator and any other key stakeholders. Recognize opportunities to automate processes for optimization and increase efficiency. As an overlay to all work, provide continual assistance with the identification, assessment, and resolution of data quality issues. Support the use of governed referential data amongst the team, the wider data analytics community, request originators, and other stakeholders. We Can Offer You: Training to support your career goals. The chance to make a difference in your community, through day-to-day interactions and volunteerism. Career growth opportunities. Paid vacation and holidays. Comprehensive medical/dental/life benefits. 401(k) plan. Tuition assistance. Experience and Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree, relevant professional qualification or acceptable industry experience required 1-2 years of experience Previous experience in Financial Service strongly preferred. Intermediate capabilities with SQL Experience with Tableau or a similar visualization/BI tool Ability to organize and manipulate data sets to extrapolate conclusions Working knowledge and awareness of statistical techniques (regression modeling, classification, etc.) Knowledge of and experience with software development teams, industry best practices, regulations & compliance, and quality assurance techniques Able to identify and research data anomalies (e.g. mismatched records, nulls, repeating records) Previous experience in Financial Services is strongly preferred. Physical Requirements: Ability to stand for up to 2 hours. Ability to lift boxes up to 20 pounds. Ability to use computers for up to 8 hours. Ability to travel to other work locations as required, if needed. If you are looking for an exciting career, Service Credit Union is the place! Join us today! Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: For over 52 years, Action Day/Primary Plus Schools have proven to be steadfast leaders in the Bay Area’s private education and childcare industry. We pride ourselves on providing each child with quality care rooted in dedication and enthusiasm for their individual growth and development. We recognize the essential foundation of any school is its staff. To accommodate our thriving centers, we are seeking creative, positive, nurturing individuals to uphold our reputation of excellence. Join our team! The Digital Marketing Specialist will be based out of their San Jose Corporate office. Reporting to the Director of Corporate Services, you will be responsible for managing all digital marketing campaigns, identifying opportunities and strategies for increased lead generation, including oversight of SEO, PPC, Local Search, Display Advertising, and Social Media tactics. This is an opportunity in a highly collaborative and rewarding environment. About the role: As Digital Marketing Specialist, you will be responsible for: Performance of paid search activity across all digital marketing campaigns Launch, manage, and optimize Paid Search (SEM) campaigns Collaborate to build and refine keyword lists for campaigns Develop and implement link building strategies Work closely with Executive Team to optimize copy and SEO structural elements (title tags, metadata, alt text, descriptions, keywords and so on) across all brand websites Research and implement content and website architecture best practices and recommendations Suggest and prioritize necessary site development updates to improve SEO rankings Report insights and recommend effective growth strategies and budget Manage the company’s presence on social media Perform ongoing optimization and maintenance of on-site search Helping build, edit, and manage responsive web designs for website Other tasks related to digital marketing as required Requirements: Ideal Candidate will have: Bachelor’s degree in a related field, or pursuing Minimum 2 years of experience managing paid and organic search Knowledge of SEM, including keyword selection and utilization Experience with Google Search, SEO Optimization and Google Analytics Knowledge of social media advertising Strong attention to detail with well-honed organizational skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills A “Get It Done” attitude along with being a team player An ability to prioritize work and complete tasks with quick turnaround times. Passion for Education is a plus What you will get: Medical, Dental and Vision Childcare Discount 401k FSA (Flexible Spending Account) Paid holidays/Vacation Time/Sick Time Long Term Disability Life Insurance Apply by responding to this ad with your resume. Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship Pay: $30.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Disability insurance Employee discount Flexible spending account Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations: Start with a remote interview and move to an in-person interview for final round. Hybrid work environment is optimal (part time remote, part time in office). Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Digital Marketing: 2 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location Company's website: www.actiondayprimaryplus.com Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: Yes COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process

title: Marketing Manager
description: SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITY - Job Summary (general statement of purpose or objective of position) The Marketing Specialist-Tradigital role will play a part in aiding all marketing efforts that support the Baptist Health system. The job requires an individual that’s organized, works well with others and is willing to jump into a fast-paced environment where no day is the same. The role will support a myriad of areas within the Marketing & Communications Department including both traditional and digital marketing efforts, some of which include: social media, copy-writing, ordering promotional products, graphic design, google analytics, website support, print ad placement, photography and more! The position will also assist in planning, organizing and coordinating Baptist Health events such as booth staffing for partnerships, job fairs, recruitment events, and community sponsorships. The role will aid in creating and implementing marketing plans across the organization to drive initiatives to support Baptist Health's overall marketing and branding objectives. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS - Knowledge, skills, abilities, license, registration, certification, education, and experience Minimum Bachelor Degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism or related field 1-3 years’ experience in social media marketing, social content creation and use of digital platforms (website, blogs, social channels, e-newsletters, etc.) 1-3 years’ experience preferred in maintaining/managing a website or mobile app on a CMS tool 1-3 years’ experience with traditional/digital media placement and buying 1-3 years’ experience preferred in graphic design skills, photography or video editing 1-3 years’ experience preferred in knowledge and understanding of CRM tools (customer relationship marketing) Experience in copy writing and content research for articles, blogs and newsfeed Proficient in Microsoft suite, Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, etc Certified in reading and analyzing Google analytics Strong organizational skills and detail oriented Ability to prioritize and multi-task in fast-paced, changing environment Ability to work independently and efficiently on multiple projects and meet tight deadlines Excellent analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills Ability to foster collaborative working relationships An outgoing personality with an innate ability to connect with others in order to promote and advertise products and services Maintain a professional attitude, demeanor and appearance at all times Location: Baptist Health Arkansas · SYSTEM MARKETING Schedule: Full-time, Day, 8am-5pm

title: Data Analyst
description: About the Position: In partnership with the Director of Analytics, you will manage the analytics, insights, reporting, and distribution of key marketing performance indicators to stakeholders. The ideal candidate has strong background in analytics and has a proven track record of delivering insights that have successfully driven new revenue and strengthened brands. Through partnering with the marketing team, agencies and IT the data analyst will provide insights that will enhance personalization capabilities, campaign execution, performance/predictive analytics, and help develop models for future improvements. Role Description & Responsibilities: Work with the marketing team, agency partners, and sales teams to conduct ad hoc and in-depth analysis of customers, marketing initiatives and P&L to identify key insights to drive optimization and identify opportunities across the business Develop monthly, quarterly and annual reporting dashboards that bring together multiple data sources from across the marketing funnel and generate insights and inform business decisions Devise processes for data collection and monitoring to uphold data integrity; reconcile data from a number of sources Embed best practice and champion data standards into the business and be an advocate for improving data governance and quality Be seen as a trusted advisor to key business stakeholders on data driven Assist A/B testing, from identifying opportunities, running test, analyzing results and delivering recommendations to the business on optimization-based results Monitor technology trends related to data capabilities such as data analytics and reporting to identify new and emerging opportunities Job Requirements: 2+ years experience in data and analytics supporting marketing or eCommerce teams working with large datasets including data visualization Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.) and databases (SQL etc.) 2+ years experience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics or adobe Analytics. Proficient with data visualization tools such a Tableau, Google Data Studio or Power BI (preferred) Extensive experience with Excel Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Experience with CRM systems is a plus (Microsoft Dynamics CRM preferred) Experience in programming language is a plus (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks B.S. in quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Math, or Analytics/BI related field a plus Join a Winning Team at HUB International When you join the team at HUB International, you become part of the 5th largest global insurance broker, providing a broad array of property, casualty, risk management, life and health, employee benefits, investment and wealth management products and services. Becoming a part of HUB means that you thrive in an entrepreneurial and fast paced team environment supported by over 12,000 professionals in 450 offices across North America. You will be able to actively contribute to our track record of year over year growth fueled by innovative new products and services, mergers and acquisitions, and a great team of people. As part of our talent engine, you will exemplify our strong core values which drive our unique corporate culture. HUB’s entrepreneurial spirit is evident in our people, products and philanthropic initiatives and we are passionate about our talent! \#LI-KR Department Marketing Required Experience: 2-5 years of relevant experience Required Travel: No Travel Required Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree) HUB International Limited is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran's status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal laws, rules or regulations. title: Marketing Manager
description: Summary: As the Marketing Manager for Razer Gold America, you will own the design, content and execution of marketing campaigns to end users. This role will take the lead in creating and implementing marketing campaigns and promotions, reaching millions of gamers in the Americas every month. This role will help drive B2C marketing programs from conception to completion, working with top-tier online game publishers, top retailers and popular payment products. Responsibilities: Lead marketing campaigns with game publishers, payment and retail partners, including owning the design, content and distribution of banners, e-newsletters and social media posts to promote Razer Gold. Cooperate with other Razer business units to execute campaigns involving multiple Razer products and services. Coordinate international marketing activity with Razer Gold headquarters in Singapore and Razer Gold subsidiary in Brazil. Manage Razer Gold's Facebook page, YouTube account and other social media destinations in North America. Aid in the execution of referral programs, banner advertising and PR. Represent the company at popular esports tournaments, trade shows and other industry events. Travel required up to 15% of the time, domestic and/or internationally. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in related field required or equivalent work experience. 3+ years of experience in marketing or business development in the online games industry. Proficiency with tracking and reporting tools such as Google Analytics and Microsoft Power BI. Experience with Facebook and Google advertising (Google Search Ads, Google Display Network). Fluent in English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficiency in Spanish is a plus. Ability to work across time zones and cultures – evening teleconference calls with global teammates is required on a regular basis. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with customers as well as management and peers. Self-motivated, with high energy and a passion for online games. ABOUT RAZER Razer™ is the world's leading lifestyle brand for gamers. The triple-headed snake trademark of Razer is one of the most recognized logos in the global gaming and esports communities. With a fan base that spans every continent, the company has designed and built the world's largest gamer-focused ecosystem of hardware, software and services. Razer's award-winning hardware includes high-performance gaming peripherals and Blade gaming laptops. Razer's software platform, with over 100 million users, includes Razer Synapse (an Internet of Things platform), Razer Chroma RGB (a proprietary RGB lighting technology system), and Razer Cortex (a game optimizer and launcher). In services, Razer Gold is one of the world's largest virtual credit services for gamers, and Razer Fintech is one of the largest offline-to-online digital payment networks in SE Asia. Founded in 2005 and dual-headquartered in Irvine (California) and Singapore, Razer has 16 offices worldwide and is recognized as the leading brand for gamers in the USA, Europe and China. Razer is listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (Stock Code: 1337).

title: Senior Analyst - Data Science
description: SUMMARY: The Senior Analyst will be a skilled problem solver who has a passion for utilizing data to drive business growth. The position will involve working closely with the analytics and business intelligence teams for the planning, execution, and delivery of all KAGR analytics and data science products, which include a variety of predictive models, marketing analytics, forecasting, development of sales and business analytics, and more. Additionally, the Sr Analyst will participate in consulting projects focused on delivering insights to customers. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to make an impact in advanced analytics and data science within the sports industry. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Data mining and ability to translate raw data into meaningful insights and recommendations Strong interest in learning and applying statistical methodologies, techniques and processes Experience and understanding of advances analytical models and machine learning Construction and maintenance of a variety of predictive models (lead scoring, look-a-like, retention, and other customized predictive models) Develop revenue, ticket sales, attendance, and other forecasting models (familiarity with regression analysis and R) Develop new approaches to present complex concepts using data visualization Interest in learning and applying advanced machine learning algorithms to further enhance KAGR's analytical offerings Interest in marketing analytics and advanced market research (factor analysis, stated-preference surveys, etc.) Develop other custom solutions as required by KAGR clients SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This position has no supervisory responsibilities. SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS Degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or quantitative discipline (1-2 years experience) Understanding and willingness to learn statistical analysis and modeling Ability to present complex data sets and analysis in easy to understand ways Experience with R and/or Python required Experience with SQL required for data mining Experience processing and analyzing large data sets. Expertise with Excel is required Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work within a diverse team and serve a variety of stakeholders with different priorities Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail PHYSICAL DEMANDS Sitting for extended periods of time Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and other computing equipment The employee frequently is required to talk or hear The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. WORK ENVIRONMENT Fast paced office environment The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS None required OTHER DUTIES Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This company is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Software Engineer
description: Overview: Software Engineer, Skill Level 1 Develops, maintains, and enhances complex and diverse software systems (e.g., processing-intensive analytics, novel algorithm development, manipulation of extremely large data sets, real-time systems, and business management information systems) based upon documented requirements. Works individually or as part of a team. Reviews and tests software components for adherence to the design requirements and documents test results. Resolves software problem reports. Utilizes software development and software design methodologies appropriate to the development environment. Provides specific input to the software components of system design to include hardware/software trade-offs, software reuse, use of Commercial Off-the-shelf (COTS)/Government Off-the-shelf (GOTS) in place of new development, and requirements analysis and synthesis from system level to individual software components. Security Clearance Requirements: This position requires all candidates to be U.S. Citizens and possess an active TS/SCI Security Clearance with a Polygraph. Qualifications: Required Education: A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline from an accredited college or university. Seven (7) years of additional SWE experience on projects with similar software processes may be substituted for a bachelor’s degree. Required Qualifications: Strong Java skills Strong interpersonal, communication, and writing skills Desired Skills: Experience with SWING or JavaFX Experience designing and implementing object oriented solutions in Java Experience with Subversion, Teamwork, User Interface Design, writing Software Requirements, Software Development Processes, and Software Debugging Experience in inteliJ, NetBean, or Eclipse development environments Strong understanding of data structures and multi-threaded processing Experience developing Junit tests to automate the regression testing Basic understanding of modern telephony systems Experience with basic networking Experience with cellular technologies Familiarity navigating Linux using bash commands to configure administrative settings and evaluate system performance Able to identify and anticipate needs of a user community, development staff, and integrated applications Familiarity with various signals processing systems WOOD is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Lead, and deliver on enterprise wide value creation projects encompassing cost, agility, sustainability, and business continuity initiatives utilizing data analytics and proven methodologies, (Ideation workshops, Lean/CI, and Project Management) to drive efficient value delivery. Build market share and competitive advantage by driving leading edge capability within Manufacturing and Distribution organization and ensuring EDGE in technical execution across all activities, drive robust collaboration across the E2E Engineering Group, Supply Chain, R&D, and Brands Serve as the VRO manufacturing and distribution lead for skincare capacity improvement initiatives within NA/Global regions. This role will work with multiple and cross functional business partners in ensuring skin care supply sufficiency. This role will have a direct responsibility of leading skincare capacity enhancements across our internal and external manufacturing partners. Serve as VRO manufacturing and distribution lead for online as well brick and mortar distribution network (both ELC and 3PL) capacity and cost-performance (%NS) improvements within NA/Global regions. Support ELC brands, manufacturing and distribution organization with VRO process from initial ideation to final execution of the initiatives. Serve as the engineering project lead on the identified projects to coordinate and support timely execution of the identified initiatives to deliver expected financial returns/savings Draw on subject matter expertise in manufacturing optimization and project management approaches (e.g. Six Sigma, Lean, automation, robotics) in order to effectively and independently Project Manage key initiatives, and effectively form, lead, and influence project teams to get to desired outcome Support the VRO team in cross functional Brand and Factory ideation workshops to identify step change opportunities to drive sustainable and long term value creation Independently lead research & data collection and conduct expert interviews in partnership with Central Engineering Excellence Data Analytics team, and synthesize into value creation opportunities which are to be elevated to VRO leadership for review and action Based on audience, prepare strategic presentations, including key metrics and analytics, for various stakeholders Develop successful collaboration with key stakeholders outside engineering, in order to appropriately inform, influence, and execute on projects. Key stakeholders include brand marketing leadership, internal plant teams, QA, Procurement, Packaging up to VP level Collaborate with the Operations and Central Engineering teams to consider agility requirements when developing functional specifications that aligns with the Value Chain Strategy Accountable to deliver on set annual targets for assigned projects identified through cross functional collaboration and agreement with VRO Leadership Qualifications Deep understanding of the supply chain and business process within global CPG organization to identify value drivers, waste elimination opportunities and process optimization approach. Lean six sigma background preferred. Prior operations experiences highly desired. Solid understanding of manufacturing and distribution finance as well as ability to independently to identify long term and short term levers of cost optimization. Excellent project management and cross-functional collaboration skills Job: Supply Chain - Corporate Primary Location: US-NY-Melville Job Type: Standard Schedule: Full-time Shift: 1st (Day) Shift Job Number: 210153 We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. It is Company's policy not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: SUMMARY: The Business Intelligence Analyst (BIA) supports the Analytics Department and over-arching data warehouse and business intelligence function by assessing business needs, documenting requirements, validating requirements met, and facilitating infrastructure development work with data engineers to support corporate and departmental business intelligence objectives. The BIA also provides quality assurance support by ensuring the integrity and validation of data as it is presented to end stakeholders. In addition, ensures that all security protocols are met based on the role of the end stakeholders and that the privacy of data is maintained. This role interacts primarily with the Business Intelligence team and the end user community. This position will ensure the delivery of quality testing and test automation to support business requirements and code changes while certifying that testing best practices are developed and implemented. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Business Intelligence Analysis Gathers requirements using one or more of these methods: interviews, document analysis, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis Ensures the security, confidentiality, and integrity of information before publication. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Proactively communicates and collaborates with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, and Interface designs Conducts operational and customer design reviews with the customers and operational staff Develops specifications, coordinate changes with IT Data Management and Analytics, conduct workflow/process changes, and ensure the integrity and validation of data as it is presented to end stakeholders. Quality Assurance (QA) / Report and Visualization Validation Devises, executes, and documents detailed test plans and test cases based on requirements. Ensures “traceability” of test cases to requirements, working with stakeholders to ensure that all requirements and objectives are met. Documents that any gaps found during QA exercise, ensure these are documented and addressed. Communicates to stakeholders’ issues found so that they can be addressed, and then validate that issues have been corrected as per agreements. Facilitates QA issue prioritization and resolution Leads QA initiatives by working with all teams to formalize a holistic QA strategy. Ensures the security, confidentiality, and integrity of information prior to publication. Creates and executes SQL queries for testing purposes and documents problems, defects, and coordinates resolutions Implements testing best practices and processes for the Business Intelligence community. Develops test/defect metrics and produces reports for project status. Creates and Maintains Test data and ensures that all security protocols are met based on the role of the end stakeholders and that the privacy of data is maintained. Assists in project management by identifying issues and recommending solutions and communicating the status of the project in a timely fashion. Works closely with functional business areas to ensure the quality of changes implemented. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in MIS or a related field and a minimum of 2 years of progressively responsible experience conducting business analysis, business intelligence or an equivalent combination of education and experience. In addition, Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts Ability to collaborate effectively with business and technical audiences (internally and externally) Strong analytical and project management skills required Thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements and managing them. Advanced knowledge of SQL, knowledge of other analytical tools a plus. Healthcare market experience a plus Excellent teamwork skills WORKING CONDITIONS: Works in a standard office-based environment

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Overview: Acuity is searching for a dynamic, talented, and experienced Business Intelligence Lead to join our DHS team. The ideal candidate will work with stakeholders to review and improve the organization's BI strategy, processes, information, and technology. Responsibilities: Provides oversight and coordination to ensure all BI initiatives are prioritized and aligned to client’s business needs. Builds relationships through excellent communication skills and provides valuable insight into BI and analytics best practices. Assesses current BI processes and implements improvements where gaps are identified; formalizes and matures BI processes in alignment with industry best practices. Conducts analyses and make data-driven recommendations that affect the content, interpretation, and/or development of major programs and policies. Develops high-impact data outputs and presentations that enable strategic decision-making by senior leadership. Qualifications: Required Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or comparable degree. Minimum of 5 years’ experience leading BI or analytics initiatives Certification in OBIEE, Tableau or other BI tool. Experience delivering BI or analytics solutions (data visualization, reporting, etc.) Deep understanding of visual analytics best practices, development processes, and leading BI & analytics tools and technologies (Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, etc.) Excellent interpersonal, communication, and technical writing skills with the ability to effectively communicate data and methodologies with business audiences. Highly Preferred Master’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or comparable degree or experience DHS specific experience Clearance Requirements Must be US Citizen and be able to obtain and maintain DHS Suitability About Acuity Inc. Acuity is a leading management and technology consulting firm that specializes in serving the federal government. Our innovative, collaborative and rewarding work environment has earned repeat honors from the Washington Business Journal’s Best Places to Work and SmartCEO Corporate Culture awards. We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Description Ingram Micro touches 80% of the technology you use every day with our focus on Technology Solutions, Cloud, and Commerce and Lifecycle Solutions. With $46 billion in revenue, we have become the world’s largest technology distributor with operations in 56 countries and more than 30,000 associates. We continue to strategically expand our global reach with 32 acquisitions since 2012. The BI Account Manager is a critical team member within our growing Global Business Intelligence organization. Our team is highly specialized in digital marketing, data visualization and data sciences that can yield valuable market insights and craft effective strategies to capitalize on market opportunities at the right time. The right candidate will complement the team by bringing a willingness to drive results, engage in new opportunities, and undertake challenges big and small. The BI Account Manager works with the sales and the vendor management team(s) to facilitate BI discussions and deliver BI solutions to our vendors. The BI consultant will be responsible for maximum utilization of BI for marketing program execution, influencing vendor’s data-driven marketing strategies with Ingram Micro, generate awareness within marketing, establish relationships with the vendor partners, articulate ROIs, and develop action plans. Furthermore, the BI consultant takes a role in the global BI roll out and will assist the US based Consultant team to develop a robust BI practice in non-US regions. The BI Consultant has a thorough understanding of IM’s BI offerings so he/she can articulate BI benefits and align offerings with reseller/vendor/internal sales objectives in front of Sales/VM and resellers/vendors. He/she manages the opportunity pipeline and the projects associated with his/her assigned vendors. The BI Account Manager will also have many internally based responsibilities. You will be expected to hold an informal coaching/mentoring relationship with one or more members of the BI organization. The leadership team will look for you to proactivity bring new ideas to the larger BI team including new programs, program augmentation, process improvement, and proactive client opportunities. You’ll also be expected to take ownership, develop, persuade, and execute cross-functional team projects with other members outside of the Consulting team. Additional skills include strong communication skills to effectively interact with all levels of internal and client organizations (Business Intelligence Team, Ingram Micro Vendor Team, Vendor Team) to ensure project success, the ability to weigh alternatives/determine strategy, and negotiate contract terms when needed. Responsibilities, Supporting Actions & End-Results Account Management (30% of time) Manage the overall vendor relationships and act as the main BI point of contact for vendors and the vendor management teams. Represent BI in ongoing planning and strategy sessions Streamline the BI delivery process and work with the rest of the BI team to ensure high quality delivery Collaborate with Mktg and Vendor Mgmt teams to deliver clients a unified ONE Ingram message Listen to clients, interpret their needs, and recommend the appropriate BI solution Ability to scope projects effectively so all BI teams are aware of client objectives, commitments, and expectations so the BI team is in a position to be successful. Be comfortable presenting to groups big and small, internally and externally. Actively manage your project pipeline by identifying new opportunities, managing current opportunity list, and prioritizing high percentage opportunities. Business Development (25% of time) Build vendor targets that align to revenue goals. Review past Business Intelligence vendor engagements and recommend opportunities to add additional value with new BI offerings. Consistently look to engage new vendors with Business Intelligence offerings Network with IM Marketing and Vendor Mgmt teams to generate awareness of BI offerings and solutions Attend and represent BI at reseller and vendor face-to-face events Assist a regional lead with project execution and vendor planning for a region outside of US (Canada, LATAM, EMEA, or APAC). Project Management (25% of time) Assist with the delivery and timeline mgmt. of Global BI projects Plan execution/input meetings between vendor management, vendor, and BI team for project input Establish timelines and expectations of each project Communicate scope, expectations, and commitments to internal project teams in a timely manner Work internally and use existing workflow tools to ensure projects are progressing and meeting vendor expectations Monitor the progress of the project and course correct and reprioritize as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project Communicate expectations and deliverables needed from the vendor and IM vendor teams in a timely manner Provide feedback and develop best practices to evolve our processes. Provide coaching to the Associate BI Consultant regarding project management best practices Post Project Completion (20% of time) Develop and deliver full post campaign ROI analysis to clients Gather campaign feedback from both internal and external clients Communicate valuable feedback to IM BI leadership team Job Qualifications and Educational Requirement Bachelor’s degree and relevant experience 3 years of experience in marketing, planning strategy, direct marketing, and/or account management with at least 2 years translating marketing analytics OR data science to a non-technical audience Project Management Experience Knowledge in Supply Chain Logistics + computer industry a plus Managing cross functional project teams/change management Solving unique problems by applying past/best practices and principles and uses judgment to meet new conditions Proven ability to maintain professional relationships internal/external Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required to advise management of status on work and potential issues Proven ability to effectively interact with all levels within the organization Ability to negotiate and communicate ideas and suggestions to positively influence the team and process owners to moving forward with implementation PC literate, advanced levels in excel and word, experience with data warehouse information and SQL a plus Proven ability to resolve complex problems with minor direction Proved ability to achieve results through the motivation or influencing of others Thrives in a fast paced environment Set realistic/achievable targets Detail-oriented Analytical Proactive, self-starter This is not a complete listing of the job duties. It’s a representation of the things you will be doing and you may not perform all of these duties. Ingram Micro Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

title: Marketing Manager
description: About Us: CM Group has the Martech industry’s largest family of email and multichannel marketing products with 70,000+ customers and 180+ billion emails sent annually. We allow our clients to scale across brands as they grow, identifying the right solutions at every step of their journey. Bringing together a diverse group of email marketing platforms under a single umbrella, CM Group is able to offer solutions that meet the needs of every marketer. Initially, our family included Campaign Monitor, Delivra, and Emma, but we have since become home to Liveclicker, Sailthru, Selligent, and Vuture. Our vision is to be the most respected, fastest growing family of marketing technology brands in the world. We have teams all over the globe - from NYC to San Francisco, from London to New Zealand - all working together to make our vision a reality. The Role: Campaign Monitor is seeking a Marketing Data Analyst to support ongoing digital and traditional marketing initiatives to optimize our customer acquisition strategy. As a Marketing Data Analyst, your main responsibility is to help the greater marketing organization understand performance and suggest opportunities for improvement based on data. You will surface insights for the greater marketing organization through creating, managing, and expanding marketing dashboards and reporting including but not limited to business performance, marketing campaigns, and paid marketing initiatives. Delivering actionable insights to the greater marketing organization, this role is the perfect opportunity to work in a fast-paced, growing marketing tech environment. In This Role You Will: Conceptualize and build marketing dashboards and reporting to inform decision making Democratize marketing data across the organization to empower teams to make better business decisions based on data and key insights Perform deep dive as well as ad-hoc exploratory analyses on large volumes of data to help ensure we are achieving our planned goals, and run retroactive analysis on marketing campaigns, and present insights to the broader organization Work hand in hand with decision science and analytics engineering to automate, standardize, schedule, and publish key reports and dashboards to help disseminate data and insights to key leaders and other stakeholders Identify key trends within large data sets and draw insights and recommendations Help create robust tracking of our campaigns, by combining data from ad networks, internal databases, and analytics tools to build LTV and cohort analysis reports Work with a cross-functional team of marketers, designers, and analytics engineers Find effective ways to simplify and communicate analyses to a non-technical audience Comfortable working independently and in a team environment to execute assigned deliverables in a prompt and efficient manner What We’re Looking For: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field of study, such as Data Science, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Research, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Economics Aptitude to learn in a fast-paced environment Analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail Advanced Excel/google sheets skills incl. pivots, index-match, ability to build complex formulas Ability to translate business questions and needs into technical projects and specifications Ability to clearly translate technical data into an output that internal clients can understand Ability to persuasively present and clearly communicate data and conclusions in an organized manner to a wide variety of audiences, up to and including Executive management Not required, but nice to have: Prior experience with Business Intelligence tools (Looker, Power BI, Tableau, etc.) Ability to use SQL to extract data from large databases such as AWS Redshift or aptitude to learn Proficiency in a statistical programming language (R/Python) a huge plus Experience with Salesforce and Salesforce Reporting Experience evaluating and optimizing toward marketing KPIs (LTV:CAC, ROAS, conversion rates, etc.) Perks & Benefits: Competitive compensation and benefits package Life, AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance 401(k) with 6% company matching Open Time Away Paid parental leave #campaignmonitor

title: Senior Product Manager
description: Overview: IntelliBridge is an award-winning national security company with an immediate opening for a Junior Intelligence Analyst to support a federal law enforcement client. The Analyst will support a federal agency and will conduct research and analysis services in support of a vital US Intelligence Community (USIC) program. Primary duties will be to search for and analyze data from USIC systems on subjects of interest document their findings. This position is exempt. Description: This position will offer you a chance to support a federal agency by engineering all Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) design, deployment and maintenance of VDI systems and components. Responsible for installing, patching, upgrading, updating, and documenting the current environments; design, document and deploy upgrades, and provide on-site expertise for both Citrix and VMware VDI environments to meet the needs and support the missions of the agency. Clearance: Active Top-Secret Clearance Required Skills and Qualifications: Minimum of six (6) years of experience with designing and implementing virtual platforms for desktop, applications, and server virtualization solutions. Proactively address performance and anticipated user requirements in both Windows and Linux mixed environments. Hands on experience in implementing and supporting Citrix Xen Desktop, VMware vSphere, Hypervisor Management, Active Directory, GPO Management, and Virtual Desktop Infrastructure Deployments. Extensive experience in implementing and supporting Citrix Xen Desktop, Application Virtualization, Load Balancers, VMware vSphere, Hypervisor Design, Hyper Converged Deployments, VSAN Administration, Microsoft SQL, Active Directory, GPO Management, Virtual Desktop Infrastructure Deployments of 50000+ Desktops, and VMware VDI environments. Able to design overall VDI solutions, conduct planning, requirements analysis, pre- and post-implementation support, training, and maintenance. Responsible for ensuring that the client’s performance, security, user experience, reliability, availability, and all other functional and non-functional requirements are met. Maintain system documentation and assist with system accreditation and monitoring. Engineer and configure printing between various classification levels and ensuring security of data for all VDI systems. Engineer, deploy and perform O&M activities of Microsoft operating system baseline images for use on enterprise endpoints. Experience and understanding of DISA STIGs and internal agency security requirements. Provide engineering, deployment, and transition to O&M services for a broad range of current and future Microsoft applications and technologies, or other third-party tools that integrate with Microsoft products. Currently utilized technologies include but are not limited to Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), Microsoft System Center Software Portal (MSCSP), and Microsoft Office products. Create automation scripts and deploy orchestration and automation processes and products to support the agency’s VDI, workstation and Controlled Interface environments which are expected to provide reduced spin up / spin down times, standardized deployments, business process automation, self-service portals, user and customer experience enhancements, automated patching, and maintenance. Responsible for the engineering, deployment and O&M of enterprise server virtualization solutions and hyper converged server and storage solutions for in various VDI environments. Current implemented hyper converged technologies include but are not limited to Nutanix, Dell, and VMware. Ensure technical documentation exists for all systems and is kept up to date to include inventory and patch levels of all systems to include hostnames, property numbers, IP addresses, enclave, number of cores, number of processors, admin passwords, certificates, and service accounts on a monthly interval. Provide recommendations for future hardware requirements, as well as benchmarking and testing of hardware prior to agency adoption. Hardware categories include but are not limited to workstations and components, printers and components, hyper converged infrastructure, and peripherals. Install, configure, test, and maintain system management tools for all data center network components. Monitor and test application performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions, and work with developers to implement those fixes. Develop/write and maintain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks, such as automated provisioning of addresses and VLANs with Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS). Provide real-time reporting of provisioned and non-provisioned resources such as bandwidth utilized to include performance metrics for availability, performance, and trends. Desired Skills and Experience: Citrix Certified Associate (CCA-V), VMware Certified Professional 6 – Desktop and Mobility (VCP6-DTM), and/or Nutanix Platform Professional (NPP) Education Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree preferred (Additional years of experience may be substituted for the degree.) Location: Pocatello, ID Travel: less than 10% About Us: IntelliBridge delivers IT strategy, cloud, cybersecurity, application, data and analytics, enterprise IT, intelligence analysis, and mission operation support services to accelerate technical performance.

title: Financial Analyst
description: Confidio is a technology-enabled pharmacy benefits consulting firm. We optimize the value of pharmacy benefits through transparency, accountability and advanced data analytics paired with deep insider expertise. We help minimize drug spend while maximizing patient outcomes and satisfaction. Our reliable solutions are performance-based, results-driven and continuously validated. Confidio offers a full suite of pharmacy benefit procurement, consulting, audit and analytic services aimed at optimizing our clients' pharmacy benefit, significantly lowering costs and producing a tangible return on investment. Confidio is rapidly growing and looking to expand our team once again. We are looking to fill a full-time Financial Analyst position located locally in the Baltimore Area that will work in our corporate office upon re-opening. JOB TITLE Financial Analyst DESCRIPTION The Financial Analyst will work to support the goals of the Finance team at Confidio. This position will participate in financial planning of the organization by working with leadership to identify and discuss financial trends. The financial analyst will provide ad hoc strategic analysis that will support the growth of Confidio. Additionally, this role will assist with the monthly commission process. This role will provide key information that will help to drive the growth of Confidio and will report to the VP of Finance. RESPONSIBILITIES Support the company's monthly commission process by performing data intake, preparing data for processing and completing validation and review procedures. Maintain financial and budget spreadsheets, including preparation of Confidio's annual budget, to analyze financial data and prepare timely financial reporting to Company leadership. Assist with client opportunity renewal tracking, updating dashboards and providing concise, actionable information to the account management team. Performs analysis, gathers, compiles and interprets financial data to identify trends and provide insight for decision making. Prepare ad hoc proformas and budgets for new significant company projects and initiatives for analysis as part of the project selection. Other special projects as assigned. Adhere to Confidio's Information Security Management System as well as all other company policies. SALARY $65,000 to $75,000 REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's Degree Required, Accounting/Finance Preferred 1-3 years of progressive experience in Financial Planning and Analysis or Business Analysis Strong Excel and Financial Modeling experience Proven presentation and project management skills Ability to work effectively and independently with all levels of management Impeccable analytical and organizational skills Self-motivated and self-directed Independent critical thinking Confidio, LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Company: Oak Street Health Title: Senior Business Analyst - Data Engineering Oak Street Health is a network of value-based neighborhood primary care centers throughout the Midwest, East Coast, and the South. Oak Street operates an innovative model that drives patient engagement, improves health outcomes, and manages medical costs for the older adult population. In this virtuous cycle: every dollar saved is another dollar we can reinvest to improve patient care. Our model supports our social mission of improving the health and happiness of our patients and the community. Role Description The Senior Business Analyst will work with business unit subject matter experts and managers to define/document functional and technical requirements, align on project priorities with an emphasis on data engineering and data architecture, and ensure development and integration needs are aligned across all departments including software development. Responsibilities Manage all requests coming from assigned teams including new projects, bugs and enhancements Assist the Director, VP, and SVP on creating roadmap for assigned teams in order to plan for resourcing and long term timelines Work with Program Manager on maintaining project lists and foreseeing upcoming work for prioritization within an Agile environment Assist with the scoping, planning, and execution of data architecture initiatives including real time data streaming and FHIR initiatives that affect the organization’s IT infrastructure Plan, elicit, capture, analyze, and validate business, functional, and technical requirements for new and existing business processes, systems, and applications Provide prompt and up to date updates to internal and external team leaders when asked for project statuses Facilitate meetings with business owners and developers to identify, document, and communicate business needs and provide reporting solutions to ensure timely release of projects Coordinate functional and user acceptance testing by executing the testing strategy, scheduling resources, and tracking test performance Facilitate collaborative system and data design sessions with the user community and technical architecture resources/development resources Coordinate activities including on-time delivery, testing, and production moves Work as a technical support and liaison to designated IT personnel to provide testing, support, and feedback on enhancement requests and regular updates/releases; adhere to release schedules Demonstrate a high level of subject matter expertise in functional area to bridge business requirements and IT solutions; provide technical direction and ensure compliance with optimum practice solutions Practice knowledge transfer and foster change management as the organization changes and new skills are required, focusing on team/individual development; perform other assigned duties. Serve as a mentor and good steward to other business analysts on the Business Intelligence team What we’re looking for We’re looking for motivated, experienced application developer with: Undergraduate degree, preferably in Business, Analytics, Informatics, or related field More than five (5) years of relevant work experience Experience working with SQL Experience with Rapid FHIR Integration Understanding of Change Data Capture processes and best practices Ability to research and understand new complex technical initiatives and challenges Experience leveraging project management tools such as Azure DevOps Experience working within an Agile environment Ability to work independently as well as function as part of a team Release management and planning experience Ability to take ownership of a project and see it from end to end Ability to focus on deadlines and deliverables Ability to communicate clearly to stakeholders and users Knowledge and experience in technical aspects of software solution being tested Business process understanding Why Oak Street? Oak Street Health offers our coworkers advantages that can’t be found in other clinical workplaces, including: The opportunity to be part of a hyper-growth company, focused on changing the future of healthcare. Paid vacation/sick time, retirement options, as well as health, vision and dental benefits Brand new, beautiful working environment Flexible work from home culture High levels of responsibility and rapid advancement Supportive and fun culture Opportunity to be at the forefront of a revolution in healthcare Why does Oak Street Health offer all of these benefits? Because we know what it takes to deliver the highest level of care, and our team deserves the best resources to succeed and enjoy their work. In return, we expect the best out of co-workers. Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply to oakstreethealth.com/careers

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Purpose Explore an opportunity to join our ICE Data Services Desktop Solutions group as a Business Analyst in our Mid-town NYC location. The Desktop Solutions product offerings are global in scope and serve a broad section of the financial services industry. Through an integrated network of Desktop Solutions that we provide, our customers can access execution, messaging and analytics tools tailored to their existing workflows. The Business Analyst will work with the Product Management team in defining, prioritizing, planning, and executing the vision for our Desktop applications targeting our core Data Services customers. The Business Analyst will be responsible for translating user needs into business requirements; identifying opportunities to expand our application’s capabilities; interacting with various internal teams (including but not limited to development, QA, sales, and marketing), vendors, and end users; performing user acceptance testing, and training sales and support teams on new content or functionality.
