Responsibilities Prioritize requirements, engage in business analysis activities and create specifications to be used by development teams Work alongside product management to translate their vision into documents and wireframes Recommend improvements and new features for desktop and mobile applications Prepare training guides, release notes, and perform training for users Liaise with development and QA teams to deliver new features and resolve issues Perform UAT on new functionality or datasets Identify and communicate project risks and issues Collaborate with target market representatives, customers and partners to create powerful and compelling solutions for the marketplace Knowledge and Experience Knowledge of financial markets (minimum of 3+ years of experience); futures and energy markets knowledge are a plus Previous experience as a Business Analyst (minimum of 3+ years of experience) Requirements elicitation and documentation a must Able to create mockups/wireframes Great communication skills Must be able to supervise, organize, prioritize workload and work on numerous projects/tasks at one time Familiar with waterfall and agile methodologies Attention to detail, critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills Ability to work with technical teams (QA and development) as well as sales and end users Proactive and able to take initiative Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment Software: Jira and Balsamiq (or other wireframing tool) Desire to work in both data/content and functionality projects Bachelor’s degree in Finance and/or Computer Science (or foreign equivalent) Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: At Logical Position, we’re on a mission to help businesses grow. With nearly 5,000 clients and 7 locations across the U.S., we’re one of the fastest growing digital marketing agencies in the country. And we love what we do! We’re rated highly on Glassdoor and ranked #3 Best Workplace in America by Inc. Magazine. Every day we hustle to deliver exceptional outcomes for our clients while enjoying the amazing company culture we’ve worked hard to build. From catered meals and company parties to free event passes and outdoor excursions, we create an environment where our team can thrive. If you’ve got the drive to succeed and a passion for growth, we’re looking for you! Department: Mid-Market Client Services Location: Lake Oswego, Oregon Pay: Salary + Performance Bonus (DOE) Benefits: Health/Dental/Vision + 401(k) + Life + LTD Insurance, Birthing Leave, and Bonding Leave Hours: Full-time, Monday - Friday The Job in a Nutshell: We are looking for creative, talented, and motivated individuals who want to continue a career in the fast-paced digital marketing landscape. As an Account Manager in our Mid-Market department, you will work directly with medium-sized business clients to optimize, grow, and report on your book of accounts. You will act as the main point of contact for clients and as the liaison between other departments when multiple services are involved. All analytics, optimizing, and strategy aside, this position focuses on providing awesome customer service to our clients! What You Will Love Doing: Managing a book of approximately 50–60 clients that operate in a medium-sized business market and be the main point of contact for their marketing campaign and overall digital marketing strategy Maintaining and developing an advertising relationship through a consultative and strategy-driven approach; coordinating with other departments within Logical Position to ensure a cohesive digital marketing strategy across multiple products Using advanced knowledge in digital marketing while partnering with various departments, to provide analysis of existing PPC campaign performance and devising actionable insight for recommendations and strategies that align with our client’s objectives Completing daily tasks including reporting and client communication in a timely manner to maintain Account Manager performance expectations that include client retention benchmarks, upsells, and overall development Remaining current with industry trends and best practices that may be incorporated to improve account performance Exercising discretion and independent judgment when creating and modifying client accounts to ensure ad campaigns are positively impacting the client’s goals such as ROI, brand exposure, or awareness To Fit the Bill: Bachelor’s Degree (preferred) or 1+ years of account management/customer facing experience Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Driven, competitive, and confident with excellent customer service skills Creative and analytical, with strong attention to detail Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, and Excel) All candidates must be eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship To Score Extra Points: 1+ years of SEM/PPC experience, specifically Google Ads Bilingual; can speak, read and write in Spanish Google Ads Certified Experience working with tracking software (Google Analytics or other analytics software) All candidates must be eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship. All offers of employment at Logical Position are contingent upon clear results of a thorough background check. Background checks will be conducted on all candidates once a contingent offer has been accepted. _________________________________________________________________________ Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Logical Position currently allows all employees to work from home. *** IMPORTANT NOTE *** Consistent, reliable internet connection is required for all fully remote positions and for all positions during the COVID-19 work from home period. Wired or wireless minimum internet speed connection of download: 25Mbps and upload 5Mbps. Internet speeds can often be improved by contacting your internet service provider. ________________________________________________________________________ Logical Position is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) E-Verify Participation Right to Work Colorado Anti-Discrimination 9uQ3NT28jP

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Rarely - and I mean RARELY - do we use the word "corporate". It's stuffy, buttoned-up and not at all reflective of who we are. Those of us in Accounting, Inventory, Payroll, Benefits, Legal, Marketing, IT and HR are shared services and support the entire employee population for Camping World, Gander Outdoors, Good Sam and every other brand within our family. For those familiar with our departments, the work is self-explanatory, but where we work and how we work are definitely not. If you're still in love with the work you do, just not where you do it, join us in supporting the great outdoors! Digital Marketing Team Lead We are currently looking for a Digital Marketing Team Lead to join Camping World's premier in-house digital marketing team and lead our RV rentals vertical. If you are looking for a new challenge with a fun work environment and an entrepreneurial culture, we ask that you please apply-we'd love to have you join our team. Job Responsibilities Develop digital marketing strategy by studying economic indicators, tracking changes in supply and demand, identifying customers and their current and future needs, and monitoring the competition. Plan and support strategy for all SEM, database marketing, email, social media, and display advertising campaigns. Contribute to marketing effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed. Communicate with business owners Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assesses against goals (ROI and KPIs). Identify trends, insights, and optimize spend and performance based on the insights. Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies through digital marketing. Collaborate with internal teams to create landing pages and optimize user experience. Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points. Identify critical conversion points and drop off points and optimizes user funnels. Complete digital marketing department operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees and following up on work results. Maintain digital marketing staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees. Maintain digital marketing staff job results by counseling and disciplining employees; and planning, monitoring, and appraising job results. Develop digital marketing staff by providing information, educational opportunities, and experiential growth opportunities. Personality: Self-driven, results-oriented with a positive outlook, and a clear focus on high quality and business efficiency. A natural forward planner who critically assesses own performance. Mature, credible, and comfortable in dealing with company executives. Reliable, tolerant, and determined. Empathic communicator, able to see things from the other person's point of view. Well-presented and businesslike. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of proven digital marketing success and team lead experience High level knowledge in the following: Google Ads/Microsoft Ads/SA 360/Campaign Manager/Google Analytics 360/Data Studio/Facebook Ads/Email Marketing Experience with both lead generation and direct response. Must be self-motivated team player, professional, detail orientated, and possess excellent oral and written communication skills. Well-versed in performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition Up to date with the latest trends and best practices in search engine marketing Comfortable working under pressure with tight deadlines. Strong customer service skills with a commitment to superior quality. Outstanding creative presentation skills with ability to train others Capacity to scope, manage, and QA more than one project simultaneously through your direct reports Proven ability of leading by example with positive attitude and creating personal growth for team members. Skills and Talents for Advancement Able to provide strategy and training for campaign builds in commonly used platforms. (Google Ads/Microsoft Ads/SA 360/Campaign manager/Google Analytics 360/Data Studio/Facebook Ads Manager) Stretch assignments for personal and career development (Multi-Channel) Innovation - proven ability to identify trends in current space to optimize and create increased performance of existing campaigns. Deliver in the moment feedback to peers and leaders to grow the culture of One Team. Self-assessment and personal awareness. Master of skills necessary within current channels and vertical. 24 months minimum. Consistently produces exceptional results in channel - best there is in their role Knows business industry well and enhances skills for their current job and future Adapts well to new situations and challenges (Multi-Channel) Teach and train others and provide back-fill for your position (Succession Planning) Identify internal mentor for career path alignment People focused - development and performance Provide and maintain team culture (Multi-Channel) We are an equal employment opportunity employer. The Company's policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age (40 and over), disability, military status, genetic information or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Camping World is the leading outdoor lifestyle retailer. Since the Company's founding in 1966, Camping World has grown to become one of the most well-known destinations for camping, boating, hunting, fishing, biking, winter- and water sports, to name a few. The outdoors is a big place, bigger than just RVs, but when it comes to your RV needs, we're your one-stop shop for sales, maintenance, repair and the industry's broadest and deepest range of services, protection plans, products and resources. We have over 200 locations all over the U.S. under our ever-growing company and brands. Just as the outdoors offers endless adventures, so does our company. Stay tuned to see how and where we grow next. We consider Military experience equally as valuable as civilian work experience. Veterans, Reservists and Transitioning Service Members are encouraged to include Military duty and certifications on their resume and applications when applying for a position.

title: Product Manager
description: Product Manager Position: Full time Location: Carlsbad office (Initially Remote) About Us: NTENT provides a Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS), allowing industry partners to customize, localize and integrate leading Search technologies directly into their business-to-consumer offerings. NTENT utilizes a machine learning algorithmic approach to comprehend massive amounts of information across the web. Through the company’s proprietary search engine, advanced AI and knowledge graph, NTENT makes it easier to decipher meaning, surfacing the most relevant answers, results, images, videos, content and ads, via conversational interfaces or text. We are a unique group of brilliant minds intent on discovering, learning and building. We work in a vibrant atmosphere, with an emphasis on personal and professional development. This is an opportunity to tackle complex problems usually reserved for a handful of large companies in the search industry. About the Opportunity: We are a dynamic company looking for our next great hire to join our team in Carlsbad, California. We are looking for a talented Product Manager to join our team to deliver world class search technologies. You will be working with a smart team of Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Scientists, QA Engineers, and Marketers to drive the definition of all NTENT software, powering NTENT’s powerful semantic search technology. Responsibilities (including but not limited to): Lead the innovation and improvement of all NTENT products, existing and future, to ensure constant product improvement that meets consumer and end-user needs. Identify and understand market trends, consumer needs and opportunities to further innovate and develop products to increase user adoption and active usage. The scope will include customer facing features as well as back end capabilities, across mobile and the web. You will work cross-functionally to shepherd products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. Collaborate closely with the Engineering, Marketing and Business Development teams to define product goals and deliver key features. Ensure key features and capabilities are clearly communicated with the Marketing and Business Development teams. Undertake day-to-day product activities to ensure Engineering has clearly defined requirements, designs and any required data/components to implement and enhance features. Create and lead a transparent intake process, where requirements are collected and prioritized according to declared principles, and communicated to all stakeholders Participate in technical discussions to understand technology capabilities, existing or to be developed, to drive the product further. Skills and Qualifications: 3-5 years of relevant product management experience, including launching, building & growing software products. Bachelor’s degree in CS, related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Experience driving results in collaborative, cross-functional environments that include Engineering, Marketing and Business Development. Passion for building high-quality mobile & web user experiences Solid analytics background, with ability to dive into data analytics to make data-driven decisions Have a clear sense of ownership and drive, and show a willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to drive your initiatives to completion The following experience is a plus: Experience with enterprise or web search & information retrieval. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, possess excellent communication skills (both oral and written) and be able to work independently. A keen interest in various aspects of language processing is essential in our multi-disciplinary team. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental and vision. Employees receive a generous time off (PTO) plan and 13 holidays per year. We also offer 401(k) benefits, long term disability benefits and life insurance.

title: Business Analyst
description: Summary The Data Analyst role is to deliver a final business solution to the operations team through a Power Bi experience. The Data Analyst's technical skills will be put to the test as they shape data into a crispy design through a smooth user experience. Over time the Data Analyst will become a domain expert of supply chains and their use cases. This position will work on cutting edge data technology as a key user on Ryder's Azure Data Lake driving the analytics initiatives. Design critical analytical dashboards, reports and queries to drive strategic business decisions, ad-hoc analysis and identify descriptive and prescriptive solutions for internal Ryder teams and external customers. Dig deep into the core issues of business problems in order to drive a solution that gets at the heart of the causative problem. On this team, the Data Analyst will get the chance to be the expert of supply chain solutions, collaborating with Data Analysts and Scientists, using all the skills in order to exploit data to drive the business forward. This will push the envelope of what is possible within the big data space; streaming live data into a data lake and experimenting with data in the data sandbox. Essential Functions Develop Dashboards by understanding business needs, interpret the integrated data and translate this into usable visualizations to drive business decisions, interpreting results and how to utilize the dashboards Engage the business, evaluating their needs and ad-hoc requests to prioritize product efforts creating new innovative solutions Knowledge of the Ryder Business, understanding the complexity of the supply chain world and the role that data has within this ecosystem Enhance data maturity and integration to standardize the core value add functionality enabling a multiplier effect Additional Responsibilities Performs other duties as assigned. Skills and Abilities Experience developing BI solutions with tools like: Power BI Tableau Exposure using tools like: ETL tools (Alteryx or SSIS) Data manipulation tools (SQL) Object oriented development stacks (.net) (preferred) Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms Support product innovation, working closely with technology throughout the build, test, and release of the product using agile methodologies Qualifications Bachelor's degree required Supply Chain, Data Analytics or equivalent Master's degree preferred Supply Chain, Data Analytics, MBA or equivalent Two (2) years or more Applied Project(s) Experience: Experience in demonstrating, digital transformation, data management in an educational/project or intern type environment required Two (2) years or more 2-4 years experience in creating dashboards for diagnostic analysis across the business. Experience working in a cloud environment a plus. preferred DOT Regulated No Job Category Data Science & Analytics Ryder is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Overview: SMBC Capital Markets Inc. is hiring a Senior Software Engineer in the Software Development department, New York office. The position is in support of the trading flow, curve construction, pricing and analytics, risk, revaluation, models, and general front office tools. Responsibilities: Senior Software Engineer is responsible for assisting in the technical vision and strategic planning of all aspects of software solutions for the Capital Market business; including both in-house and external applications. Will be a part of mission critical projects and provide technical expertise for the development environment, technology architecture, and implementation. Will work together with the business users, traders, and analysts to ensure the applications meet users' specification and requirements. Qualifications: Undergraduate or graduate preparation in computer science from a top-tier computer science program (or equivalent). A significant, 10-15+ years of practical work experience involving software development and systems implementation, preferably in Financial Industry; or alternatively, a graduate preparation in a quantitative field (mathematics, physics, engineering) and a significant practical working knowledge of computer programming. A proven record of design and coding skills necessary for a hands-on programming position in numerical areas; requiring a strong amount of programming and support. The following skills are advantageous for the position: Proficient in C/C++ programming language; Microsoft .Net/C#, or Java, and scripting languages e.g. Python *C/C++ and C# strongly preferred. Familiarity with Microsoft Office technologies such as: Excel, COM, VSTO Familiarity with the database concept, relational SQL, coding with OLAP Formal background/training in mathematical finance Ability to design / architecture a software solution. Strong background in building enterprise wide software solutions in multi-technology environments and solid understanding of the impact of changes to the environments. Advanced understanding of current recovery solutions and high availability architectures. Expert ability to articulate points and provide summaries and explanations of technical concepts verbally or in writing to management or other internal departments providing the backing details as needed. Ability to build a network of relationships across the organization, obtain a detailed understanding of internal clients’ needs and drive organization wide design concepts gaining buy in and support of stakeholders. Strong solid analytical skills for diagnosing and troubleshooting potential system issues; Sharp mind to process solution with quick turn-around. Ability to operate in mathematical concepts, e.g.: analysis, linear algebra, calculus, statistics and probability Good teamwork and strong work ethic.

title: Marketing Manager
description: Chase's Marketing Analytics Team drives data driven, customer centric marketing across all of our lines of business and Chase's Chief Marketing Office to deliver world class marketing. The primary goal is to find the most impactful marketing opportunities through optimization and personalization across all marketing channels. Chase's marketing organization has a culture of putting data at the center of every decision and depends on a high performing analytics team to deliver strategic thought partnership, campaign and testing strategies, and insight that drives action. This role is focused on acquisition and engagement of our customers across all lines of business - Consumer Banking, Credit Cards, Business Banking, Auto, Home Lending and US Wealth Management. It is our mission to be customer focused and deliver messages that matter to grow relationships across the customer's journey. This in turn delivers value for the firm, our stakeholders, and our clients. As a member of the Marketing Analytics team, the right candidate will be a major contributor to the analytics book of work that is transforming Chase's marketing across our channels - particularly digital (chase.com site and mobile app) - to a hyper-personalized, data-driven, customer centric model. This will require deep understanding of our platforms, capability, data assets and analytic tools to craft the vision for the future and develop a roadmap to get there. The candidate will partner strategically across the firm with marketers, channel owners, digital experts, and the broader analytics community to help drive business goals through deep understanding of marketing analytics and optimization. The ideal candidate in this role with have a foundation of professional experiences to call on with depth in financial services, marketing, data and analytics as well as strong intellectual curiosity and communication skills. The candidate should be self-driven and independent, motivated to establish and grow a platform to push the business forward. Performance Measurement & Strategy Establish and track channel performance KPIs, communicating findings to senior CCB leadership to improve strategy Build business-critical data capabilities like marketing attribution, valuation of customer engagement, and tracking of cross-channel marketing touches for each customer Governance & Optimization Forecast performance of campaigns to prioritize resources towards high-potential initiatives Identify areas of improvement in ad-level performance, delivering recommended optimizations to marketers and channel management Personalization Drive a more personalized communication strategy enabled by development of better targeting and streamline customer journeys Provide opportunity assessment (audience sizing, revenue estimation, customer experience improvements) in partnership with line of business/product analytics teams Web Behavior Identify opportunities for a better digital user experience through studying customer journey on the Chase.com site and mobile app Work with the website technology team closely to identify gaps in the data capture strategy and collaboratively implement enhancements Testing Craft test designs, interpret results, translate results into a program's impact to the company, prepare final documents, and present results to senior management in a fast-paced cadence Qualifications 5+ years of experience owning an analytics book of work, with a financial services and marketing focus preferred 3+ years leveraging data visualization tools (Tableau preferred) for data exploration and marketing performance evaluation Comfort building and managing relationships with both analytics and business stakeholders Proven track record of problem-solving using data and building new analytics capabilities Experience in querying big data platforms and SAS/SQL querying Experience with best-in-class web analytic tools (Google Analytics, Adobe/Omniture Insight/Visual Sciences, Webtrends, CoreMetrics, etc.) Superior written, oral communication and presentation skills with experience communicating concisely and effectively with all levels of management and partners Bachelor's degree is required, with data science, mathematics, statistics, econometrics, engineering, MIS, or related fields preferredChase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

title: Senior Analyst - Data Science
description: Company Description Merkle is a leading data-driven, technology-enabled, global performance marketing agency that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices. For more than 30 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with Merkle to maximize the value of their customer portfolios. The agency’s heritage in data, technology, and analytics forms the foundation for its unmatched skills in understanding consumer insights that drive people-based marketing strategies. Its combined strengths in performance media, customer experience, customer relationship management, loyalty, and enterprise marketing technology drive improved marketing results and competitive advantage. With 9,600+ employees, Merkle is headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, with 50+ additional offices throughout the US, EMEA, and APAC. In 2016, the agency joined the Dentsu Aegis Network. For more information, contact Merkle at 1-877-9-Merkle or visit www.merkleinc.com. Job Description A highly qualified analytics professional with professional experience optimizing multiple digital marketing channels as well as leading projects/analysts to greatness. The Digital Media Analytics Senior Analyst is focused on supporting our Digital Media business (PPC/SEO, Display, Paid Social) within the Digital Agency Group. The position will be providing analytic direction on strategic clients and helping guide analysts to improve our clients’ digital marketing programs. Digital Media Analytics Senior Analyst will serve as a primary point of contact between many of our clients and stakeholders around managing and enhancing our client’s digital measurement. They will also be part of a growing multifaceted digital analytics team that develops advanced analytic solutions for top companies across industries. Key Responsibilities : Architect solutions & provide recommendations that drive results on client campaigns & objectives Develop custom performance reporting and analyses across multiple channels/clients Project manage the coding of models in SQL/Hadoop-Hive and SAS/R/Python Work with various internal stakeholders to ensure projects are completed in a timely manner Quickly understand multiple data sources and develop methodology for joining data that will add value Manage a team of analysts spanning multiple clients ensuring that objectives are being met Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics or related quantitative field required; advanced degree preferred. 1 - 5 years of experience Demonstrated proficiency in multiple digital marketing channels Understanding of relational databases and familiarity with data processing. Experience with high-level scripting languages Experience managing a team of analysts or other creative thinkers Quantitative field academic/professional experience (Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Engineering) Experience with digital marketing or web analytics preferred (Omniture, CoreMetrics, Google Analytics, WebTrends, etc.) Media Platforms and 3rd Party Tools (Google Adwords, DoubleClick, MediaMath, Bing Ads, ExactTarget, Hitwise, BrightEdge, Facebook, etc.) CRM Data Analysis (Customer Segmentation, Churn, Lifetime Value, Acquisition, etc.) Excellent written and oral presentation skills Strong problem solving and consulting skills Additional Information At Merkle, we believe that a diverse environment improves us as a community and as a business. We want to foster an environment of growth, where all ideas and contributions are encouraged. We need this culture of courage to continue to thrive in our fast-paced industry. We embrace differences of opinion. We value diversity of experience and thought, which help us to challenge and define industry-leading solutions, and support our goal of being a great place to work. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Business Analyst
description: Business Systems Analyst Bachelor's Degree preferred. Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Computer Science/MIS, science, healthcare-related science; or high school degree/general education diploma and 4-6 years of relevant experience in lieu of degree. Minimum number of years and type of relevant work experience: -A minimum of 2 years of professional work experience as business analyst, quality analyst, or product owner on technology development (analytics and data management) projects. -1+ year experience in a hands-on functional role supporting systems development, systems implementation, quality assurance, or similar experience. -Experience working under SDLC or other software-specific project management process, including Agile/Scrum Preferred Qualifications -Strong analytical skills. Synthesizes complex or diverse information; collects and researches data; uses intuition and experience to complement data; designs workflows and procedures -Infectious curiosity and learning mindset; independently identifies areas of competency development and designs learning goals to achieve expertise -Effective problem-solving skills. Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions; works well in group problem-solving situations -Knowledge of project management tools and software development lifecycle (SDLC) strongly desired. -Ability to effectively work with diverse constituencies -Proven record of process improvement strategies and implementation -Planning and organization & project management skills. Able to coordinate many different project tasks (determines relative importance of each; prioritizes and plans work activities; sets appropriate deadlines to complete activities accordingly); effectively manages time and resources; sets goals and objectives -Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to lead groups to consensus within defined timeframes -Knowledge of PeopleSoft HR/Finance/Student ERP back-end data structures highly desirable -Demonstrated expertise in the use of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Visio, Project, and PowerPoint) required -Demonstrated expertise in enterprise data analysis and query tools: e.g., Tableau, TOAD, OBIEE, Cognos, PowerBI, Hadoop, R/Python Position Summary: The Office of Data Management & Analytics Services (ODMAS) serves a vital role in providing reliable, consistent answers to critical campus questions through enterprise data architecture, integrations, and analytic solutions enabled through a robust data governance framework. (See http://data.wisc.edu). As part of an exciting modernization of the University of Wisconsin-Madison's data and analytics architecture, the Business Systems Analyst (Senior) will support the design and delivery of enterprise analytics solutions associated with the UW-Madison Analytics Strategy and Roadmap, which includes: migration to a cloud architecture and toolset; implementation of enterprise data management tools; rearchitecting curated data models around integrated cross-domain insights; new delivery of previously unavailable data domains; and building the framework for future expansion into unstructured data exploration, data mining, predictive analytics, and other advanced data science use cases. As part of their role, they will perform discovery and scoping activities for prioritized projects; lead subject-matter experts through requirements elicitation/documentation; facilitate iterative design/prototyping sessions; document functional specifications and ensure alignment with technical specifications; documents test cases, test solutions, facilitate user acceptance testing, troubleshoot/document issues, and coordinate fixes/enhancements through to production deployment. The individual in this role is expected to be a creative problem solver and process improver and is required to have strong analytical and technical skills combined with excellent communication skills, combined with the ability to build and maintain trusted client relationships with key stakeholders. Principal duties: 75% Business Systems Analyst 1. Elicit requirements using interviews, requirements workshops, user stories, scenarios, etc. 2. Document tasks, user stories, workflow processes, and use cases, ensuring requirements and to-be state are satisfied 3. Leverage subject matter expertise to advise customers on options, risks and costs, and ensure solutions meet the needs of the business 4. Document the detailed business requirements in a traceable, testable and verifiable format 5. Conduct and facilitate meetings/discussions to obtain business and functional requirements 6. Support test strategy and test requirements definition, development of test scenarios, and execution of test plans 7. Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and reconcile conflicts 8. Collaborate with developers to determine possible solutions 9. Document issues and manage conflict to resolve 10. Effectively communicate project status, issues, schedule and accomplishments to various management and stakeholder groups, as needed 11. Work within project deadlines, schedules, and multiple competing priorities to consistently deliver high-quality work product 12. Provides coaching and support to consultants and/or less senior staff in areas of expertise 15% Support & Maintenance 1. Provide technical/functional production support activities including timely resolution of all issues, issue tracking, and communication with other involved parties 2. Ensure ongoing configuration and maintenance of the system 3. Test, troubleshoot, and provide support to ensure that the system properly performs in accordance with predefined functional requirements 4. Perform quality assurance to ensure that newly developed processes meet the requirements of campus policies, accounting standards, and procedures. 5. Train end users on new and existing functionality 5% Other Duties 6. Other duties as assigned 7. Be an active member of regional and national user groups, including presenting at conferences 8. Serve as member of various campus teams and working groups Contract length: 12 months Job Types: Full-time, Contract Salary: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Education: Bachelor's (Preferred)

title: Marketing Manager
description: Marketing Analyst Irvine, CA, USA Plano, TX, USA Req #392 Friday, March 26, 2021 Auction.com is the nation’s leading online real estate marketplace focused exclusively on the sale of residential bank-owned and foreclosure properties via online auctions and live trustee sale events. By offering access to exclusive properties and technology designed to seamlessly connect buyers and sellers, Auction.com empowers residential real estate investors and financial institutions to achieve optimal, mutually beneficial results – to go beyond the bid. Auction.com is continuing to hire for all open roles with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new team members, addition to current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices. Auction.com is looking for a Marketing Analyst that will be a major contributor to the Advanced Analytics team. This individual will have strong experience in data modeling and machine learning skills. Responsibilities/Duties Make major contribution to the implementation of our real time big data initiative. Build and automate productized data processing pipelines in AWS big data platform. Help improve our development process and standards through mentoring and leading-by-example. Research and develop statistical learning models for data analysis. Implement new statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis. Help define and implement data ingestion contracts. Create data environment to support our data analytics, reporting and data science teams. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities In-depth understanding of modern big data technology, including Hadoop and Spark Knowledge of real time data streaming and aggregation architectural patterns and practice Proficient in programming languages such as Python, Scala and Java Familiarity with SQL as well as SQL databases Data modeling and machine learning skill is a plus. Education/Experience Bachelor's Degree in computer science, data science or related fields Familiarity with agile developmental process Previous experience developing data product required. Hands-on experience with real time data streaming, aggregation and presentation strongly preferred. Previous experience with production ETL pipeline development required. At least a years’ experience with AWS cloud or another cloud platform Why You’ll Want to Work for Us: Highly competitive total compensation, excellent health and wellness benefits, unlimited paid time off + company holidays; 401(k) plan with matching, employee recognition program, employee referral programs, and more. Auction.com is revolutionizing the way real estate is purchased with the vision of making the buying of distressed assets more accessible and convenient for both buyers and sellers making us the Company of Choice for all future transactions. To all recruitment agencies: Auction.com does not accept agency resumes unless you are part of our preferred partner network. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Auction.com employees or any other company location. Auction.com is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Auction.com is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Other details Job Family Data Job Function 05 - Career Pay Type Salary Travel Required No Required Education Bachelor’s Degree

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Overview This position coordinates and executes project-based initiatives that support the goals and strategies of the organization, the Department of Surgery, Marketing Department and digital marketing team. The ideal candidate has some experience in: digital marketing, email campaigns, website content management. Responsibilities Coordinates marketing activities and initiatives across digital channels, including website, email and social media. Assists with development, implementation, tracking and optimization of digital marketing content and campaigns across all digital channels. Works collaboratively with project stakeholders, team members, and end-users to understand business and user needs to produce requirement specifications and documentation of requirements. Coordinates and executes website copywriting and edits at the direction of key stakeholders Coordinates tracking and reporting of digital marketing activities Assists in the development of website content and applies standards and best practices to all clinical, brand and consumer-focused digital content. Assists with the creation, updating, and distribution of consumer and physician e-mail communications. Develops and creates detailed work plans, timelines and other appropriate documentation, identifies appropriate resources needed and provides timely status reports. Provides required project communication to project stakeholders and team members, including analysis and recommendations where appropriate. Provides assistance and training to project stakeholders. Participates in completion of user documentation and training procedures. Performs job functions adhering to service principles with customer service focus of innovation, service excellence and teamwork to provide the highest quality care and service to our patients, families, co-workers and others. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications or related field with a minimum of one to three years of experience in a role involving digital marketing or communications. Experience in a health care setting is preferred. In addition, the position requires: Proven ability to handle multiple projects through full spectrum of communication channels simultaneously. Experience with web content management platforms. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite. Familiarity with web analytics tools; Google Analytics preferred. Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite preferred. Experience with third-party SaaS tools preferred. Experience working with vendors and internal stakeholders to meet deadlines and remain within budget. Strong written and oral communication skills. Strong organization skills.

title: Marketing Manager
description: Granify is a rapidly evolving technology company at the intersection of e-commerce, machine intelligence and psychology. We’re building an industry-leading personalization and optimization platform for retailers to create a better online shopping experience for their customers. Our reach is growing exponentially and in the last year we optimized over 3 billion shopping sessions! We believe every major retailer should be working with us, so we’re searching for a Marketing Leader to help us craft and share our story! In this role, you will be responsible for creating and executing a lead generation strategy that will enable us to tell our story to a much greater number of retailers. This role will appeal to you if you thrive having a high degree of ownership and building a program from the ground up. Ideally, you will be able to work out of our office in Edmonton, Alberta or Austin, Texas but we can be flexible if you’re not located in either of these cities. Responsibility: You will create a detailed strategy to generate meetings with retailers on our target list. Refine our story and build a communication and marketing plan. Increase Granify’s visibility and presence in the e-commerce technology landscape. You and a small team you hire will execute your lead generation strategy at a high level. You will have a high degree of autonomy, but strong results will be required. You have: Several years experience in a hands-on leadership role creating repeatable lead generation strategies targeting six or seven figure annual deal sizes. Demonstrated an ability to take initiative to create reasonable, compelling, innovative, and detailed plans and then lead the execution of your plans to achieve extraordinary results. Excellent planning skills and a superb ability to communicate your strategies at a detailed, easily understood level in both written and verbal form. An exceptional ability to motivate, energize, and build a high level of accountability within your team to help each person operate at their highest level. Nice to Have: Undergraduate or graduate degree in marketing, business or similar. Experience at a marketing tech (martech), e-commerce optimization, analytics, adtech, or personalization software company. Experience leading a go-to-market launch of a new product or company. About Granify: You’ll work closely with an incredible group of the smartest, most interesting, genuinely good people around. You’ll work hard, learn quickly, and have plenty of excitement. You’ll also get a first hand view into the rapidly evolving, exciting intersection of e-commerce, machine intelligence and psychology. With our continued growth as a company, you’ll find limitless opportunities for growth, development, and career progression. Did you know? Granify is backed by early investors in Facebook, Uber, Twitter, Airbnb, Paypal, Pinterest, Palantir and Yelp. Wouldn’t it have been great to get in at one of those companies as they were taking off...

title: Senior Product Manager
description: Machines that Move Us. People who Inspire Us. Stories that Drive Us. Check us out: http://bit.ly/MotorTrendGroup About Us We are MotorTrend. With a monthly reach of more than 131 million, MTG is the largest automotive media company in the world. With franchises including MotorTrend, Hot Rod, Automobile, Wheeler Dealers, Roadkill, Best Driver's Car, and dozens of other world-class brands, we are reimagining storytelling around mobility. Our portfolio brings together Discovery's #1 TV network for automotive super fans, with our vast automotive digital platform that includes direct-to-consumer products, websites, apps, connected TVs, social, and live events. Our People The people who work at MotorTrend embody the passion of our content, and wake up every day intent on embracing, entertaining, and empowering the motoring world. The Role Job Summary & Responsibilities: The Senior Product Manager (full-time, salaried, regular) will be responsible for a product pod. Ideal candidates should have experience independently setting and executing against a product roadmap, managing a team of UX designers and front end/back end developers, and driving measurable key performance indicators. In addition, candidates should have a passion for creating customer-centric products, a strong background in product management, an analytic mindset, excellent communication skills and an eye for building customer experiences that will delight our users. Gather business requirements and customer needs from stakeholders and translate into best-in-class web experiences. Prioritize and oversee execution of the web product roadmap Drive continuous improvement in acquisition, conversion, engagement, and retention metrics Develop feature definition through detailed requirements and user stories Conduct A/B tests and perform other quantitative and qualitative analyses Gather and manage product feedback through surveys, concept testing, analytics tools, and A/B testing Integrate data analytics, product metrics, user experience research, and competitive analysis, to drive prioritization of product features and enhancements Ensure products are in line with the overall digital strategy and support business goals Supervisory Responsibility: This position will not include supervising one or more employees. Education/Experience: Requires a B.A/B.S, preferably in a business or technical discipline or equivalent experience. At least 5 years working in a software development environment. Experience working closely with software engineers in an Agile environment. Experience leading software development for web Experience in Adobe Analytics Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities: Passion for ongoing learning and ability to successfully operate in a dynamic fast-paced environment Working knowledge of all aspects of the software product development lifecycle, analytics, reporting, and usage tracking software. Proven track record of balancing multiple projects at once and delivery of projects successfully on time. Ability to think strategically and creatively. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Highly detail oriented, strong technical intuition, organized and collaborative. Ability to manage time and schedules with multiple stakeholders and cross-functional teams to meet deadlines. Flexible and adaptable to change. Physical Requirements: The ability to sit for prolonged period of time and view computer screen. Equipment/Software Used: Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Work Environment: Work is performed in an office environment that is well lit and ventilated. NOTE: This position description reflects management's assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict any other tasks that may be assigned.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Come join a growing company! For more than a century, NJM Insurance Group has built a reputation of being a leader in the property and casualty insurance industry. The company is nationally recognized by major consumer organizations for exceptional service and value. Over the last couple of years, the organization has grown into multiple states in the region, and further expansion is anticipated over the next several years. There's never been a better time to join the NJM team! What is it like to work at NJM? Click here to see! General Summary: The Digital Marketing Specialist will play a vital role in growing the Business Lines digital marketing portfolio. Working under the direction of the Commercial Lines Marketing Manager, the Digital Marketing Specialist’s primary role will be to strategize, build, execute and analyze digital marketing campaigns to drive new leads into the Sales funnel, convert leads within the funnel and increase brand awareness. This position will support the Commercial Lines Marketing Manager and will be responsible for expanding the current digital marketing portfolio and managing projects from conception to completion. Essential Duties and Requirements: Identify, test, and analyze digital strategies to drive new leads to the sales funnel and build brand awareness Working with our third-party partners and brand Digital Marketing Specialist, manage, analyze, optimize, and expand current portfolio of digital marketing campaigns Responsible for management of content marketing calendar including providing consultation on topics and tracking metrics and analytics Working with our Email Marketing Specialist manage, track, and analyze email campaigns using analytics from Salesforce MarketingCloud and Google Analytics Working with the brand Digital Marketing Specialist manage, analyze, and optimize digital remarketing campaigns Administration of lead distribution tool, (NJM uses Boberdoo) including daily management and weekly reporting Work closely with internal (including copy, graphics, and digital team) and external teams to collaborate and ensure all deliverables are understood and being delivered in a timely manner to the various stakeholders, including other internal departments Provide ongoing campaign analytics and offer recommendations for future campaigns Support Commercial Lines growth and sales goals Keep pace with industry trends and developments Submit work tickets on SharePoint and submit project updates in Basecamp. Become a subject matter expert on the competition’s methods of digital marketing using tools like Competiscan. Represent the marketing department at various product/geographic expansion and Business Lines meetings. Required Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: A 4-year Degree from an accredited college/university is required Experience in B2B marketing 4 – 6 years’ experience of digital marketing space Strategic thinker Experience using Google Analytics, Facebook Ads Manager, Sitecore CMS Creative thinker who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Strong attention to detail Enthusiastic collaborator with a positive attitude Excellent analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple tasks Advanced proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word Boberdoo and Power BI experience a plus NJM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to attracting, retaining, and promoting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is fully representative of the diversity that exists in the communities in which we do business.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Business Intelligence Analyst - SQL Server Purple Communications is one of the nation's most extensive communication services for the deaf and hard of hearing communities. As a leading provider of onsite interpreting services, video relay service, and video remote interpreting, the Company delivers a wide array of options designed to meet the unique communication needs of its customers. Please view our website: www.purplevrs.com Purple Communications' vision is to provide high-quality services with innovative products that break down communication barriers for its customers. We strive to change the game because we believe communication access is a right worthy of utmost respect and because every conversation matters. We are experiencing tremendous growth and are looking to add strong expertise to our world-class teams! Business Intelligence Analyst - SQL Server Job Responsibilities: This position is responsible for analyzing data that is used by the business to ensure these concepts are delivered as meaningful analytics. You will facilitate design and concept gathering and assist in the creation of new reports or analytics. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you are experienced with problem-solving and conflict resolution to help identify, communicate and resolve issues. Skilled in T-SQL using Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or later Skilled in Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) Develop and maintain solutions using SSIS, specifically ETL operations Maintain and support Data Warehousing and Data Cubes After hours on-call support for production issues will be required Business Intelligence Analyst - SQL Server Qualifications / Skills: Experience with database design best practices, including normalization, query optimization, referential integrity and logical database architecture Strong troubleshooting skills Familiarity with SQL Server tools including Profiler and Tuning Advisor Experience developing efficient stored procedures, views and triggers Ability to work independently and quickly while learning in a fast paced environment Must be capable of performing in a dynamic environment, handling multiple tasks simultaneously with the ability to work on multiple projects at any time Experience with call center and/or telecom data is a plus. Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent work experience required 3+ years as a professional working with Microsoft SQL Server, T-SQL, and Microsoft Reporting Services Work environment: Employees may experience the following physical demands for extended periods of time: Sitting, standing and walking (95-100%) Keyboarding (40-60%) Viewing computer monitor, videophone, and cell phone (40-60%) Lifting computers and other equipment. Position may require some travel. Disclaimer: The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees to this job. Employees are expected to follow their supervisor's instructions and to perform the tasks requested by their supervisors. Purple Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Senior Product Manager
description: Description of Work: Responsibilities for this position will include: · Responsible for applying industry standard Product Management frameworks to existing Federal agency processes to support the modernization and requirements development process · Subject Matter Expert for agency Product investments and presenting to executive audiences · Capable of describing and discussing data-driven value-seeking Product Management Practices in concert with improvements in software development productivity · Provide extensive assistance in defining and producing Product Management title: Director Business Analyst
description: Location Champaign, IL 61822-3733 Job Description The Director of Development will provide the leadership for all fundraising activities and strategies for the Stephens Family YMCA while working with staff, board members, and other volunteers. We are looking for an individual who can develop a culture of philanthropy that will position the Stephens Family YMCA as a “Charity of Choice”. This person’s work will help donors understand and support the YMCA’s mission and dedication to youth development, healthy living, and social responsibility.Our ideal candidate will have a bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 3 years of fund development experience. This role involves organizing fundraising initiatives, working with board members, managing our annual fund, and building relationships with corporations, foundations, individual donors, staff, and volunteers. Qualifications Strong oral communication, relationship building and "people" skills. Demonstrated experience in developing, managing, or working in a fund development program. Preference for a minimum of 3 years of development experience, or other related experience. Familiarity in identifying and securing grants. Experience in generating increased giving from individual donors and corporations using a strategic approach. Exceptional writing skills, especially for grant proposals, reports and related fundraising materials. Ability to think creatively about how to effectively engage new donor audiences. Track record of taking initiative and working independently. Experience working with nonprofit boards preferred. Commitment to organizational mission and desire to learn the field. Essential Functions Ensures that philanthropy and fund development are carried out in keeping with the Stephens Family YMCA's values, mission, and vision. Participates with the CEO, staff, the Board of Directors, and the Scholarship Committee in charting the Stephens Family YMCA's course in fund development. This includes major gifts, grants, sponsorships, event development, social media efforts, annual campaigns and capital campaigns. Provides general oversight of all the Stephens Family YMCA's fund development activities, manages the day-to-day operations of the development function, and monitors adequacy of activities through coordination with staff, appropriate committees, and governing body to ensure fund development revenue goals are met. Keeps informed of developments in philanthropy and fund development as well as the general fields of management and the not-for-profit sector; informs the CEO, the Board of Directors, and the Scholarship Committee on current trends, issues, problems, and activities that impact policymaking. Recommends policy positions concerning fund development. Develops an annual calendar to cover all crucial development issues in a timely fashion. Works with the CEO, the Board of Directors, the staff, and the development volunteers to function effectively in fund development. Solicits contributions on behalf of the Stephens Family YMCA by accompanying the CEO and volunteers on major asks. Helps CEO, the Board of Directors, other fundraising volunteers, and staff to identify, cultivate and solicit charitable gifts. Demonstrates success in learning the details of an organization's substantive work and applying that knowledge in drafting successful fundraising solicitations. Process all gifts and pledges in donor database; maintaining donor records including Daxko Fundraising and donor files; provide analytics and reporting as requested. Responsible for all donor acknowledgments, pledges, recognition, and stewardship including corporate, foundation, and individual donors. Cause-Driven Leadership® Competencies YMCA LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES (Team Leader) VALUES: DEMONSTRATES IN WORD AND ACTION THE Y’S CORE VALUES OF CARING, HONESTY, RESPECT, AND RESPONSIBILITY AND A COMMITMENT TO THE Y’S MISSION, IN ALL MATTERS AT ALL TIMES. QUALITY RESULTS: DEMONSTRATES AND FOSTERS A STRONG COMMITMENT TO ACHIEVING GOALS IN A MANNER THAT PROVIDES QUALITY EXPERIENCES. FUNCTIONAL EXPERTISE: HAS THE FUNCTIONAL AND TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO DO THE JOB AT A HIGH LEVEL OF ACCOMPLISHMENT. RELATIONSHIPS: BUILDS AUTHENTIC RELATIONSHIPS IN THE SERVICE OF ENHANCING INDIVIDUAL AND TEAM PERFORMANCE TO SUPPORT THE Y’S WORK. DEVELOPING OTHERS: RECOGNIZES AND ACTS ON THE NEED TO CONTINUALLY DEVELOP OTHERS’ CAPABILITIES TO ATTAIN THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF PERFORMANCE POSSIBLE. PHILANTHROPY: VALUES AND SUPPORTS THE MANY FACETS OF PHILANTHROPY AS AN ESSENTIAL COMPONENT IN ACHIEVING THE Y’S MISSION. Salary $50,000.00 - $60,000.00

title: Software Engineer
description: Description: Accuity Delivery Systems was founded in 2016 with the goal of reinventing the Clinical Documentation Process, through MD case review, and MD to MD education. Over the last 4 years, we have experienced rapid growth and now have roughly 350 employees. As a technology enabled mid revenue cycle company we focus on leveraging technology to improve our operational process flow, and develop best in class reporting & data analytics. Position Summary Accuity is growing very fast and is looking for software development engineers with solid skills in GO, Javascript, React, Azure, SQL Server, Docker, K8s to join the team and help drive the next 5x growth. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company where development cycles are measured in weeks, not years. Primary Responsibilities Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary teams to conceive, design, and bring innovative products and services to life Work in an agile environment to deliver high-quality software You keep up on the latest developments in your field and bring new ideas to the team You believe in healthy codes bases, TDD, test automation, CI/CD, DevOps, SecOps Develops SaaS enterprise applications by designing, developing solutions Enhances applications by identifying opportunities for improvement, making recommendations and designing and implementing systems Determines operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development, and proposed solutions Develops software solutions by studying information needs, conferring with users, and studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes Applies computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis to the software development process Accomplishes engineering and organization mission by completing related results as needed . Requirements: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Science, or equivalent experience. Experience: At least five years of related experience required Experience with languages like Go, Python or Java, as well as an interest and ability to learn other languages quickly Experience developing high-performance web applications and APIs Experience using Docker containers for packaging applications and then deploying them to cloud-based environments using Kubernetes Experience working with version control systems and CI/CD pipelines (GitHub, Azure DevOps) Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Knowledge of relational databases like Microsoft SQL Server, Postgres and MySQL Understanding of manual and automated testing methodologies and frameworks An ability to learn quickly and work efficiently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Awareness of SDLC, secure software development best practices and HIPAA privacy and security guidelines Proven written and verbal communication skills A willingness to take ownership of your work and a drive to find innovative solutions to complex problems Orchestration and automation skills (e.g. Kubernetes, Jenkins, Ansible, Chef)

title: Marketing Manager
description: As the Marketing Research and Analytics Associate within the IDEXX Customer & Market Insights (CMI) team, you will effectively support the growing demand for Customer Research and Insights in our business. Analyses from the CMI team directly impact and influence strategic decision-making across our company. Therefore, the CMI team is seeking a hardworking and collaborative individual who is passionate about data to join our team of researchers, analysts and business partners. What will be your responsibilities: As the Marketing Research and Analytics Associate you will: Assist with survey programming and deployment, data analysis and presentations for market research projects Collaborate with commercial and product teams on project needs. Work with teams to understand customer and marketplace need for insights, building upon and refreshing existing insights while developing incremental marketplace knowledge Participate in project planning and scheduling resources Manage third party vendors to ensure projects are completed on time and on budget Select and preparing survey sample files Continuously strengthen individual capabilities and stay current with best marketing research and analysis practices Develop understanding of marketing plans, key business imperatives and objectives, and product and market knowledge Provide additional operational support as needed What you will need to succeed: You are a self-starter who can drive projects independently You are intellectually curious You possess an interest to follow the latest trends in market research You are well-versed in Microsoft Office suite, with demonstrated skills in PowerPoint and Excel Skills and Abilities that will help you navigate in this role: You possess a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or equivalent combination of education and experience. You have strong communication skills in English, both verbal and written. Any other language is a plus. Preferably 2+ years of experience in market research with knowledge of marketing research operations and techniques Proficiency with MS Office, PowerPoint, and Excel Strong project management skills; ability to plan, manage and complete projects Ability to handle different projects simultaneously Capability to work independently, collaboratively, and as part of a team Experience with survey programming (e.g. Qualtrics, Survey Monkey) a plus Knowledge of statistical software (e.g. SPSS, WinCross) a plus Why IDEXX We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals health and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? We enrich livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement. Let’s pursue what matters together! IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Data Analyst/Power BI Developer JOB PROFILE: The Data Analyst/Power BI Developer reports directly to the Chief Operating Officer. This individual will also be a member of the Technology Task Force and work closely with both software teams and engagement teams. In the Data Analyst role, this person will perform various analytical reporting and programming duties primarily using Microsoft Power BI. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Work directly with the Chief Operating Officer and engage with members of the Technology Task Force, Software Teams and engagement teams to acquire necessary data and documentation for various projects. Maintain the firm’s Microsoft Power BI system. Work with the Professional Resource Manager to generate firm capacity reports using Power BI in XCM. Create functional requirements, design delivery and maintain dashboards as well as tabular reporting in Power BI from variety of data sources. Automate recurring analyses at a firm-wide and client level. Focus on KPI reporting for internal projects as well as developing data and analytics to meet business goals. Provide valuable insight and clarity to engagement teams regarding potential efficiency and effectiveness gains for engagements. Implement AI systems to maximize firm efficiency. Analyze, design, develop, test, and support enterprise applications and batch software solutions. Understand business needs, facilitating and developing process workflow, data requirements, and specifications required to support implementation. Analyze, design, develop, test, and support open API architecture integrations. Remain current on best practices and new developments in the industry. Other duties as assigned Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in in Computer Science/Data Science, Management Information Systems, or related field 3 or more years’ experience using Microsoft Power BI, Power Query and similar data analytics tools Strong Excel experience developed from analytically focused engagements (preferably accounting industry related) Strong management skills, including the ability to effectively plan, monitor, influence and negotiate Critical thinking skills to break down complex issues and identify potential solutions Ability to think strategically and analytically, and manage multiple responsibilities and projects Strong presentation and interpersonal skills; strong written and oral communication skills Reliable transportation Ability to work overtime when necessary Preferred Experience: Building Dashboards Ability to Integrate Open API Architecture Alteryx UiPath Automation Robotic Process Automation We offer a general benefits package, plus we pay for continuing education, in most cases. We offer referral fees for business development success, and we offer in-house leadership development programs. Related keywords: power bi developer, business intelligence, bi developer, power bi, business intelligence developer, sql, tableau Job Type: Full-time Pay: $70,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Disability insurance Employee assistance program Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Professional development assistance Referral program Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Overtime Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: To keep our employees safe, all staff are currently working remotely. Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: Data analytics: 3 years (Required) Microsoft Excel: 3 years (Required) License/Certification: Power BI certification (Preferred) Work Location: One location Company's website: www.taxwarriors.com Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process Personal protective equipment provided or required Social distancing guidelines in place Virtual meetings Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Will you be the next addition to our expanding team? We are a family owned business that produces small batch tshirts and gifts for our amazing customers. Quality products, exceptional customer service, and quick turn around time are the driving forces of our company. We are looking to add someone who demonstrates those core values in their work and attitude. This digital marketing position is for someone who has a high attention to detail, ability to switch between tasks smoothly, and is a quick learner. The position consists of learning and mastering search engine optimization (SEO) for Etsy, email marketing, and Pinterest marketing. Previous marketing experience or knowledge is a plus, but not necessary as you will have on the job training. Tasks include: SEO for new listings on Etsy + updating existing listings Creating SEO spreadsheets Building emails for our monthly email sequences Writing subject lines + body copy Making sure all images are linked correctly in emails Scheduling each email Pulling all email analytics Segmenting email contacts Scheduling all Pinterest graphics Job Type: Part-time Pay: From $12.00 per hour Benefits: Employee discount Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: Let job seekers know how you’re responding to COVID-19. Experience: Digital Marketing: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location Hours per week: 10-19 Typical start time: 9AM Typical end time: 4AM Company's website: www.maleydesigns.com Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Work Remotely: No COVID-19 Precaution(s): Social distancing guidelines in place Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. Job Description Summary: Envestnet is a leading independent provider of technology-enabled, web-based investment solutions and services to financial advisors. Our mission is to help investors achieve their financial goals, by providing financial advisors the access, tools, and support they need to deliver excellence in wealth management. Job Description: The Envestnet Summer Internship is a full-time internship program designed for qualified college students to gain hands-on experience within the Envestnet Raleigh Office. In the case that it is not safe to work in-office at the scheduled time of the program, the internships will continue forward as a partially or fully remote program. Interns will work alongside various department experts and collaborate with fellow Envestnet interns on a project presented to leaders in the company. The Summer Internship program will run from June 2, 2021 through August 6, 2021. Business Intelligence Analyst: Discover business intelligence and customer insights to increase proficiency and enhance customer experience ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES Data analytics Collect and analyze data from multiple sources (reporting database and CRM console) ; integrate information and put it together in a logical, high quality report. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data sets Provide analysis regarding data trends, history, and forecasts and makes recommendations that impact business performance.
