Prepares periodic and regularly scheduled written reports and makes presentations to executive leadership at the System Office, Regional Health Ministries, and Functional Service Organizations. Oversees and manages support staff, which includes responsibility for the hiring, supervision, development and evaluation of direct reports. Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct, as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical, and professional behavior. LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES (USE FOR LEADERS ONLY) As a Trinity Health Leader, the incumbent is expected to demonstrate leadership traits which support our Mission Statement and Core Values as identified below: Mission Statement: We, Trinity Health, serve together in the spirit of the Gospel as a compassionate and transforming healing presence within our communities. Core Values: Reverence: We honor the sacredness and dignity of every person. Commitment to Those who are Poor: We stand with and serve those who are poor, especially those most vulnerable. Justice: We foster right relationships to promote the common good, including sustainability of Earth. Stewardship: We honor our heritage and hold ourselves accountable for the human, financial and natural resources entrusted to our care. Integrity: We are faithful to those we say we are. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Required possession of a thorough understanding of the theory and application of performance improvement processes and methodologies as well as health care operations usually obtained through a Bachelor of Science degree in Management Engineering, Health Care Administration and/or BSN or other clinically related degree. Master’s degree is preferred. Health care experience preferred. Minimum of seven (7) years of experience, which may include as a performance engineer, or hospital leadership team experience with increasing levels of responsibility and titled leadership, or an equivalent combination of education and related experience. Demonstrated expertise in productivity management, typical of a management engineer role or hospital leadership team experience. Individuals with significant senior leadership experience in clinical operations highly desirable. Comprehensive knowledge of health care operations preferred. Possesses expert skills in managing productivity, demonstrating proficiency in the use of various tools and methodologies and successfully coaching all levels of the organization to manage to established targets. Possesses education and working knowledge of standard operational performance methods. Collaboration Team facilitation, etc. adopted by the Regional Health Ministries, Functional Service Organizations and System Office. Proven track record of effectively consulting with and coaching business executives and entities in performance improvement initiatives and designing and implementing organizational capability interventions in large, complex, multi-hospital or multi-system organizations. Demonstrated ability and skill in identifying performance gaps. Experience developing applicable statistical, financial and business plans and models. Experience with advanced computer applications for benchmarking, productivity, statistical analysis and decision support. Must possess a clear understanding of the uniqueness of the hospital environment. Must demonstrate proficiency in applying performance improvement techniques to health care related problems. Must possess excellent data analytical skills, as well as effective communication and human relations skills. Must be able to operate effectively in a collaborative, shared leadership environment. Must possess a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health. PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS This position operates in a typical office environment, often in cubicles and shared space. The area is well-lit, temperature-controlled and free from hazards. Incumbent communicates frequently in person, via e-mail, teleconference or telephone, with people in a number of different locations, on a variety of issues. Manual dexterity is needed in order to operate a keyboard. Hearing is needed for extensive telephone and in person communications. Must be able to adapt to frequently changing work priorities and be able to prioritize and balance the needs and expectations of System Office, Regional Health Ministry and Functional Service Organization leadership and associates. Must be able to travel to the various Trinity Health sites, both local and distant, as needed, which may be up to 50-60% of the time, or greater, depending upon current work assignment. Work hours and intensity will vary, and flexibility is expected to accomplish tasks outside normal work hours. Trinity Health's Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Trinity Health employs about 133,000 colleagues at dozens of hospitals and hundreds of health centers in 22 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions. Trinity Health's dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

title: Data Analyst
description: Required: SQL experience Power BI, Microstrategy, Tableau - highly preferred HEDIS experience - highly preferred Managed Care experience. Prefer experience within a health plan. Position Purpose: Responsible for analytic data needs of the business unit. Handle complex data projects and acts as a lead for other Data Analysts. Provide advanced analytical support for business operations in all or some of the following areas: claims, provider data, member data, clinical data, HEDIS, pharmacy, external reporting Extract, load, model, and reconcile large amounts of data across multiple system platforms and sources Review data to determine operational impacts and needed actions; elevate issues, trends, areas for improvement and opportunities to management. Develop reports and deliverables for management Model data using MS Excel, Access, SQL, and/or other data ware house analytical tools Ensure compliance with federal and state deliverable reporting requirements by performing data quality audits and analysis. Assist with training and mentoring other Data Analysts. Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4+ years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience. Healthcare experience preferred. Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation. HEDIS: Bachelor’s degree related field or equivalent experience. 4+ years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience or 2-4 years of HEDIS data analysis experience including measurement and rates impacted. Advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence Tools, SQL, and Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access. BUSINESS ANALYTICS:: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4+ years of statistical analysis or 2+ years of related IT experience, including data warehouse, coding or ETL experience. Healthcare experience preferred. Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation. Encounters experience preferred. Data Governance: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4+ years of data analysis or 2+ years of related IT experience, including data warehouse. Healthcare experience preferred. Advanced knowledge of, Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation. HRIS Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4+ years of related IT experience and/or data analysis experience, including 2+ years’ experience with HRMS such as PeopleSoft, SAP or Workday. Healthcare experience preferred. Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Strong understanding of HRMS database design, structure, functions and processes, and experience with databases tools. Supports HR systems as functional administrator evaluating new release functionality to include testing and implementation of new functionality. Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation. PHARMACY UNDERWRITING Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4+ years of experience in underwriting analysis (preferred in pharmacy or medical field), or 5+ years of experience in data analysis, financial reporting/auditing, data warehouse, coding, or predictive analytics. Advanced knowledge of SQL, Excel, and Microsoft applications Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Director Business Analyst
description: About AbbVie AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn. Director, Above Brand is responsible for leading a consistent, consolidated and strategic approach across U.S. Public Affairs with the ultimate goal of driving AbbVie’s narrative in the U.S. and realizing the Public Affairs team vision. The Director must have the ability of strategically defining priorities, partnering across the team, becoming an advocate for the team’s vision, and establishing a roadmap to execute against. The Director leads one team and reports to the Head, U.S. Public Affairs. Core Job Responsibilities Leads and oversees the development and execution of a strategic roadmap, including priorities across therapeutic areas (TAs) and critical competencies and tactics that will realize the team’s vision. Develops and oversees a content strategy and calendar for AbbVie in the U.S., including all therapeutic areas, and partners with TAs and internal and external agencies on its execution. Provides consistency, coordination and strategic insight into AbbVie’s content distribution strategy and investment in the U.S. as a part of broader PESO (paid, earned, shared, owned) programs being executed at a TA level. Partners with Corporate Responsibility, Brand and Communications teams, including social media, digital, corporate responsibility, corporate communications, etc. to ensure full alignment and a smart use of resources and budget. Partners with market analytics and business technology solutions to increase the use and understanding of analytics across the team, to ensure analytics inform strategic and tactical decisions, and to develop robust measurement models for Public Affairs work. Oversees the content development for and across AbbVie social media and digital channels in the U.S., and evaluates AbbVie owned channels strategy on an ongoing basis to explore new opportunities. Anticipates future trends, ensures the Public Affairs team is constantly exposed to innovative, new ideas, and leads the discussion in regards to the implementation of those new ideas. Leads strategic planning for U.S. Public Affairs, including team meetings, annual plan and roadmap, team building and development, relationship with agencies, and internal and external networking to socialize the team’s vision and work. Partners with Corporate Communications and business functions to align on approach and execution around key environmental issues that are impacting or may impact the business going forward. Represents AbbVie’s point of view and interests at industry forums and organizations Oversees the development of external visibility plans for U.S. Area senior leaders that can contribute to further driving AbbVie’s narrative in the U.S. across select external audiences. Partners with Compliance and Legal to develop and implement governance, processes and procedures specific to Public Affairs work that will help advance the team’s work and vision. Qualifications Minimum Experience/Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Public Relations, Communications, Journalism or Equivalent. 12-15 years of public affairs experience Strategic mindset and vision along with knowledge of emerging communications trends and technologies. Strong people management skills and ability to drive action and results. Deep understanding of the healthcare system, environmental issues and biopharmaceutical industry and business. Established track record building productive relationships and partnerships across internal and external teams. Able to drive higher performance, is clear and courageous and can manage difficult conversations though direct and constructive dialogue Learns fast, grasps the 'essence' and can change course quickly where indicated; raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo; creates a learning and innovative environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement A track record of innovation, challenging the status quo and taking action to identify and implement improvement opportunities. Detail-oriented, proactive, efficient, creative, well-organized, enthusiastic, able to make decisions with less-than-perfect information, able to stick to processes, results-oriented, outgoing and able to establish positive relationships, enjoys complex challenges, flexible, takes initiative and spurs others. Travel required less than 10% Key Stakeholders U.S. Public Affairs, Business Analytics, Business Technology Solutions, Commercial, Managed Care, Medical Affairs, President U.S. Area Commercial Operations, Area Management Team, Enterprise Communications, Creative Agencies, PR Agencies, Business Human Resources Significant Work Activities N/A Travel Yes, 5 % of the Time Job Type Experienced Schedule Full-time Job Level Code D Equal Employment Opportunity At AbbVie, we value bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds to develop new and innovative solutions for patients. As an equal opportunity employer we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Are you looking to put your skills to work and provide value to clients? We are looking for an outstanding Digital Marketing Strategist to be responsible for the building, optimizing, executing, analyzing and reporting of our clients SEO, PPC, Social Ads & Campaigns. Marketing Strategist Job Specific Details The responsibilities include building out client tactical strategies using SEO, PPC and Paid Social Media. You will also be executing these campaigns and implementations as well as analyzing and reporting on performance. Job Responsibilities Operations Conduct daily check-ins on client SEO & Paid Media work Report in Daily Strategy items to Account Management On-Boarding Digital Marketing Audit Lead Complete owned audit items Finalize Audit for delivery and review Complete Kickoff Checklist owned items Lead Market Research Research & Assess Channel Needs Establish & Set Goals Digital Strategy Lead Research & Assess Ongoing Channel Needs Monitor KPI’s Recommend updates to increase overall performance Strategic SEO Lead Give direction on opportunity focus Lead Technical SEO Web Development Strategic Paid Media Lead (PPC & Paid Social) Give direction on opportunity focus Review Performance KPI’s Work with Paid Media Manager on Recommendations Conversion Optimization Lead Analyze funnel behavior & identify optimizations Direct Developers on updates that convert visitors to leads Email & Automation Develop Automation Workflows and Build Create Email Outlines Analysis & Reporting Setup Report Dashboard Report all KPI’s to Account Manager Request reviews on critical performance observance You are smart and have the ability to write persuasively, with clarity and purpose.You think like a scientist and can empirically justify recommendations confidently.You think about lead generation and sales always in your work. We value passion for the work and want you to as well. Those who take pride in what they do, with a vision to learn and grow are ideal members of the Acumen Team. Preferred Experience Moderate to Advanced level of experience in SEO, PPC, Social Advertising and Analytics processes Knowledge of and ability to update & optimize WordPress websites Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem solving skills Strong organizational skills to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets with business acumen Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse marketing technologies and techniques. Excellent independent work ability as well as team collaboration skills Attention to detail with a strong sense of ownership Self-motivated problem solver – ability to research solutions and learn independently Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to meet tight deadlines Tools we use: Moz Screaming Frog SEMRush Google Analytics Google Ads Google Search Console Google Tag Manager BuzzSumo Facebook Business Manager Facebook Ads Manager AdEspresso LinkedIn Ads Manager HootSuite HubSpot Dasheroo Benefits and Perks: Medical, 401K, Dental, Vision Huge opportunity for growth 3 Weeks Paid Vacation Sick Days All Major Holidays Paid when the office is closed New Year’s Eve New Year’s Day Easter (Friday Before Easter) Memorial Day Independence Day Labor Day Thanksgiving Day after Thanksgiving Christmas Eve Christmas Day Days between Christmas & New Year’s Eve Flexible Work Schedule Work from Home Mondays *** READ HERE *** If you do not have at least 2 to 3 years of legitimately executing digital marketing tactics across the disciplines of SEO, PPC, Social Ads or know Analytics pretty well then you are not qualified for this role. Just being real here. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $43,000.00 to $49,000.00 /year Location: St. Louis, MO (Must work from our St. Louis office) Job Type: Full-time Pay: $43,000.00 - $49,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations: No mandated COVID19 precautions. You can choose to wear a mask if you want to. Education: Associate (Preferred) Experience: Digital Marketing: 2 years (Preferred) Marketing: 2 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location Company's website: AcumenStudio.com Work Remotely: No

title: Software Engineer
description: Category: Intern Title: Software Engineering Intern (Summer 2021) Locations(s): Columbia, MD Required Security Clearance: Must be willing and able to obtain proper security clearances Description: Software Engineering Summer 2021 internship, located out of Freedom Consulting Group's corporate office in Columbia, MD. The intern will gain experience in the following: Develops, maintains, and enhances complex and diverse software systems (e.g., processing-intensive analytics, novel algorithm development, manipulation of extremely large data sets, real-time systems, and business management information systems) based upon documented requirements. Works individually or as part of a team. Reviews and tests software components for adherence to the design requirements and documents test results. Resolves software problem reports. title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Overview As a Digital Marketing Specialist at Fisher Investments, you will help manage and develop our ongoing digital marketing strategy. Reporting to the Global Digital Media Manager, you will implement lead generation campaigns across display, native and video ads on an international level. You will be an expert in digital strategies while optimizing campaigns across several platforms. The Day-to-Day: Optimize Programmatic Media programs including Display, Native, Video ads while applying 1st party and 3rd party targeting tactics Collect and analyze data, identify trends and act on insights ensuring positive ROAS and other Indicators Complete daily targeting tactics inclusive of creation of custom audiences, bid adjustment and budget management using DSP technologies Identify creative solutions to meet our client acquisition needs and increase scale to meet business demands Collaborate with internal and external partners to maximize the value the programs Qualifications: 1+ years online programmatic experience as a media buyer/planner, campaign analyst or account manager (other online advertising background a plus) Experience working in ad tech such as an ad server or DSP Experience in Excel, including the ability to use formulas and pivot tables (Tableau a plus) Experience using web analytics tools and optimizing campaigns based on performance A proven track record of driving results Why Fisher Investments: At Fisher Investments, we work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. From unmatched service to unique perspectives on investing, it’s the people that make the Fisher purpose possible. And we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like: 100% coverage of premiums for health, vision and dental insurance A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum 20 days of PTO*, plus 9 paid holidays 8 weeks paid Primary Caregiver Parental Leave Back-up Child Care Program available, offering up to 10 days annually A cumulative learning and development framework customized for every employee An award-winning work environment - we're Great Place to Work Certified, and Top Workplace winners from The Oregonian We take great pride in our inclusive culture. We value the different perspectives and unique skills you bring to the team – it makes us all better. Success at Fisher Investments is motivated by results, a collaborative mindset and a commitment to accomplishing great things – so if you are ready to do that, we are ready for you! Apply today to be a part of a team environment where you make a difference in the lives of people by bettering the investment universe. California employees accrue up to 17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time per year. FISHER INVESTMENTS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER #LI-TQ1

title: Product Manager
description: Product Manager Overview As our Product Manager you’ll be responsible for supporting KWI’s mission and vision, understanding the requirements, and imagining the system needs of our customers and supporting the company’s strategic direction. Working for and with, our Head of Product & Customer Experience you’ll be shaping KWI’s product development strategy and ensuring the delivery of successful, innovative products. You’ll work closely with peers in design, development, marketing, business development, client services, and support to ensure we’re delivering meaningful products that drive KWI’s clients’ success. The successful candidate will demonstrate the personal and organizational leadership needed to ensure that the KWI brand is reflected in the products and solutions delivered. About the Job Gain an in-depth understanding of customer business requirements and needs Leverage OKR framework to help drive results that align to product objectives Build use cases and user stories around the platform and communicate effectively to educate the internal community and drive internal and external adoption Integrate usability studies and user community feedback into product requirements to ensure products satisfy user needs as well as wants Effectively communicate and work with our customers and KWI executives on initiatives, managing expectations and providing timely information on status of projects Drive business case analysis; ensure proper business case/ROI has been done for feature prioritization Maintain competitive landscape and analysis of major competitors’ strategy, products and future direction About You You’re an expert in determining customer needs and business requirements You have 2+ years working in Product Management or Product Delivery You have 5+ years working with B2B SaaS products Retail experience is a strong plus You have strong user experience sensibilities and an appreciation for minimal interface design You are extremely detail oriented You have strong technical abilities and experience working closely with engineers You have experience using analytics, user research, and business cases to drive decisions and improve products You have that “start-up DNA” and are a champion of change You’re a leader and influencer who can manage multiple projects at once Advanced project management skills; proficient in managing tight deadlines and priority changes You have exceptional written and oral communication skills and ability to set and manage expectations with internal and external stakeholders About Us KWI. FIRST IN SaaS. FIRST IN THE CLOUD. We are a small team with a big vision: to be the premier provider of cloud technology solutions for retailers. KWI’s culture is rooted in our core values – commitment, respect & dignity, accountability, reliability, passion, and caring. Our office environment is casual and fun – we recharge with a quick afternoon ping-pong game and are a culture that celebrates. We celebrate birthdays and holidays, and victories and failures. We encourage our people to take risks, to challenge the status quo, to improve processes, and to be better every day. We have a team of passionate and dedicated employees who are committed to making themselves and our clients better. We offer complete Cloud-based solutions for a broad range of clients in specialty retailing. Since 1985 we've helped retailers achieve success through use of our leading systems including, merchandising, POS, Mobile POS, CRM, and loss prevention. We're a privately held, debt-free and 100% management owned company. Our company has never had a layoff and continues to grow! We offer a collaborative work environment with colleagues who have a passion for retail and technology. At KWI, we know that cultivating diversity and fostering an inclusive work environment is critical to our impact and success. We create an environment where no individual is advantaged or disadvantaged because of their background. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. With a commitment to maintaining a bias-free environment in which harassment is prohibited, we respect cultural diversity and comply with the laws of the places in which we operate. We expect our business partners, suppliers, clients, and all of our team members to uphold these commitments.

title: Business Analyst
description: Position Summary Job Scope: The Business Analyst will be part of the global marketing team, which unites deep market knowledge, vast experience in Life Sciences and a collaborative culture to deliver the solutions that our customers need to achieve their scientific goals. Reporting to the Division Marketing Manager but working in close concert with the Strategic Pricing Manager, the Business Analyst will be focused on using data to recommend and execute business improvement projects that result in impactful results. The business analyst’s role will interact with global sales, engineering, pricing, strategic marketing and product management teams working on a wide variety of projects that seek to optimize product offering, streamline pricing analyses and quoting, inform strategic planning actions for medium term double digit sales growth and align the Division around a comprehensive data set that aggregates market, competitive and global pricing inputs. The position is ideal for a self-motivated individual with a strong analytical background and experience in Marketing, Business, Finance and/or Engineering, specifically in a high performing strategic planning, or finance environment, demanding a sophisticated approach to understanding strategic needs, financial/market models, pricing models, competitive trends and business impact. The candidate should have demonstrated financial and business acumen with a high level of curiosity about customers’ needs and be able to translate those needs into a clear and concise business strategy to promote value-based solutions using the PPF technology platform to support those unmet customer needs. The successful candidate should be a creative and resourceful team player who demonstrates strategic agility, structured thinking, and intellectual curiosity with the ability to deal with ambiguity and translate complex concepts into actionable insights while utilizing a collaborative approach, across matrixed organizations with multiple global cross-functional teams (Sales, Engineering, Pricing, Applications, Manufacturing, Quality, and Procurement). Responsibilities As a key member of the Pricing cell, the business analyst will undertake the following responsibilities: • Audit daily price variance reports to ensure compliance to established pricing policy and delegation of authority • Utilize Siebel quote system to obtain quote approvals from management stakeholders • Execute quarterly contract renewals and approvals in Siebel, working closely with the pricing manager and commercial team • Implement Division annual list price adjustments including communication to customer service, sales teams and intercompany partners • Process relevant pricing information on new part number/product family set ups • Track and report win/loss metrics on issued quotes • Run monthly pricing metrics scorecard report and report results to Finance and Instrumentation Group • Maintain automated self-service quoting tools for standard parts to be provided to internal stakeholders (customer service, applications engineering and distributors) • Develop and maintain dynamic pricing analysis tools for activities such as SPI calculation & forecasting and segmented price variance analysis; utilizing these to recommend strategic pricing decisions Other analyst responsibilities: • Maintain data integrity on customer market segmentation database • Develop system to assign and track customer parenting on sales made through intermediary entities • Collaborate with product management team to develop, implement and maintain a comprehensive competitor database tracking information such as pricing by product type, region and market as well as competitor profiles and personas; to inform pricing strategy support with value pricing analyses • Collaborate with strategic marketing team to develop, implement and maintain comprehensive database for tracking information as segment size and growth rates, product/solution/technology fit and competitive market share ownership for both • Assume responsibility of Division POP (Parker Operating Protocol) champion o Establish and manage cost and margin targets for the global PPF product lines and portfolios o Conduct regular POP analysis by business units, region, market segments etc. to identify projects to streamline product offerings, pricing strategy, cost position and/or marketing programs o Collaborate with pricing manager, product managers and commercial teams to establish customer and product POP classifications o Provide required analysis to support Simple-by-Design efforts and generate project pipeline that focuses on cost optimization and increasing component utilization across product families • Assume responsibility of Division Customer Experience champion o Acting as an impartial party, reviewing all customer responses received through Likelihood-To-Recommend (LTR) program o Collaborate with Instrumentation Group peers to share best practices o Report monthly LTR results to Division management and other stakeholders o Facilitate customer experience improvement project through cross functional teams • Participate in Product Development Gate Review Process and support pricing manager on value-based pricing analyses • Any other duties as assigned Qualifications We are looking for people who are passionate about business impact, solving problems, and driving results. We cherish curiosity, innovation, and diversity in thought and experience. • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Finance, Engineering, or related discipline. • Master’s degree in Business, Marketing or Finance preferred • 5+ years' experience of business, marketing, finance or related experience specifically in a high performing strategic planning, or finance environment, demanding a sophisticated approach to understanding strategic needs, market models, pricing models, competitive trends and business impact a must • Experience in B2B and life science industry preferred • Solid computer skills, and experience with data processing and analytics a must; including but not limited to: o Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, vba macro programming, simulators) o Database management tools (Access, sql coding) o Microsoft PowerBI o Familiarity with ERP and CRM systems • Demonstrated ability to perform in depth data analyses and derive meaningful insights • Ability to grasp technical concepts associated with Division’s product portfolio • Demonstrated ability to work across matrixed organizations with multiple global cross-functional teams (Sales, Engineering, Pricing, Applications, Manufacturing, Quality, and Procurement) • Demonstrated strategic thinking and implementation skills; strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable plans • Sharp business acumen, analytic and communication skills; experience with financial statements a must • Demonstrated agility to manage time, handle uncertainty, and work under pressure • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills with strong technical writing competency • No travel anticipated Parker Hannifin Founded in 1917, Parker Hannifin Corporation is a $13.7 billion, global company. With annual sales of $13.7 billion in fiscal year 2020, Parker Hannifin is the world's leading diversified manufacturer of motion and control technologies and systems, providing precision-engineered solutions for a wide variety of mobile, industrial and aerospace markets. The company has operations in 49 countries around the world. Parker has increased its annual dividends paid to shareholders for 63 consecutive fiscal years, among the top five longest-running dividend-increase records in the S&P 500 index. Parker’s engineering expertise and broad range of core technologies uniquely positions the company to solve some of the world’s greatest engineering challenges. By partnering with customers, Parker improves their productivity and profitability and seeks new ways to solve humanity's biggest challenges. Parker Hannifin Parker Precision Fluidics [www.parker.com/ppf], a division of Parker Hannifin Corporation is a leading provider of miniature fluidic components and subsystems serving the medical, diagnostic and analytical instrumentation. The Division delivers leading edge fluidic solutions that enhance the customer’s technology and increases their speed to market. This is achieved through direct engineering collaboration with customers to generate compact, reliable and high-performance components and systems optimized for application specific requirements. Product technologies include miniature solenoid valves, proportional valves, multimedia valves, application-specific manifolds, pumps, and electronic pressure controllers.

title: Marketing Manager
description: Securonix (securonix.com) is the market leader in entity and user behavior analytics offering risk mitigation, incident response and rapid detection of sophisticated insider threats and cyber-attacks. Securonix helps their clients across the globe address their cyber security needs including the detection of advanced persistent threats (APTs), insider threats, privilege account misuses, and enterprise and online fraud. Our security analytics platform is used by some of the largest organizations in the financial, healthcare, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, and federal sectors. Reporting to the Director of Demand Generation, the Marketing Operations (Senior) Manager is responsible for the strategy, design, execution and operations of the business's lead management processes, marketing database, marketing automation solution, and tracking performance in order to plan, report, and optimize marketing performance. We are looking for an individual with a strong attention to detail, a well-developed understanding of Salesforce, Marketing Automation and Account Based Marketing best practices, a passion for data and reporting, and an ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. In this role, you will work to create scalable processes, ensure best practices in lead generation and database management, and will work closely with marketing stakeholders to ensure the success and measurement of their programs to drive growth. Key Responsibilities: Manage technical aspects of key marketing systems used to generate, distribute, and report. Execute, measure, and optimize marketing campaigns. Manage all marketing operations with the main focus of enabling efficient lead scoring, campaign tracking, lead management, database health, targeting, segmentation strategies, and alignment with sales initiatives. Own the marketing technology stack – Marketo, SFDC, 6Sense, including implementation, technical management, reporting, integration, and vendor management. Evaluate new technologies and add-on applications to improve and optimize marketing team performance. Establish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices in campaign and lead management. Responsible for website conversion tracking. Create monthly, quarterly and annual reporting that details marketing effectiveness, areas for optimization and business impact. Maintain strict Marketing system data governance. Manage email compliance with privacy laws, including CAN-SPAM, CASL and GDPR. Monitor full lead flow lifecycle – from routing and consumption to nurturing and campaign efforts. Conduct complex data analyses that will be used to inform strategic decisions by stakeholders across the company, and pair findings with the full revenue funnel. Monitor quality of the sales and marketing pipeline and spot efficiencies that will make the company work better as a whole. Required Qualifications, Skills and Experience: BA/BS in management, data science or marketing/sales automation. 5+ years of experience using a marketing automation software (Marketo preferred) & Salesforce. Strong analytical skills and experience with reporting, data analysis, and data presentation. Proficiency in SFDC, know how the system works and integrates with Marketing and BDR software. Technically capable, excellent communicator, and have a desire to improve processes. Ability to drive cross-functional projects from ideation through to implementation – strong team collaboration since you will be working with data across multiple departments and stakeholders. Excel in operations that facilitate scalability, predictability, and efficiency of marketing operations. Strong attention to detail and accuracy with a passion for data, metrics and reporting. Ability to grasp business operations, solve problems, and handle last minute course corrections. Strong experience with email marketing in a B2B environment. Familiarity with business process design with expert knowledge of marketing and data quality best-practices. Deep understanding of sales process and marketing/sales hand-off. Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment managing multiple projects at once. Is a Plus: Working knowledge of HTML Experience with Drift Familiar with ABM platforms, such as 6sense Familiar with multi-touch marketing attribution Securonix, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Securonix complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Securonix expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, disability or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Securonix employees to perform their expected job duties is absolutely not tolerated.

title: Financial Analyst
description: At Nautilus, fitness isn’t just a job, it’s our passion. We strive to improve the health and wellbeing of everyone who works with us because we see the benefits of a happier, more productive, engaged and creative workforce. We're a leading marketer and developer of health and fitness products with some of the most recognized brands in the industry, including Nautilus®, Bowflex®, Schwinn® Fitness. We are currently recruiting for a Financial Analyst, FP&A Functional Support to join our Finance team at our headquarters in Vancouver, WA. To be considered for this position, candidates must be able to work remotely in the short term and in the office after that. SUMMARY This position will serve as a key member of the finance team and will be a strategic partner to the Product Development and Information Technology leadership team. In addition to managing core FP&A functions like the Long-Range Plan, annual Budget, and monthly forecast and management reporting, the Financial Analyst will be responsible for tracking, managing, reporting, validating and continuously improving the key performance indicators to monitor overall Product Development and Information Technology performance and achievement of Long-Range Plan goals. The ideal candidate will be a hands-on collaborator who can drive the development and improvement of analytics. The ideal candidate must be able to interpret complex data from a variety of sources, develop insightful analysis of the data, and then drive improvements in the business across the various functional areas. What you’ll do: Create and maintain effective management reporting products and provide value added analysis to management on the results. Specifically, for the PD & IT team(s)- Drive the corporate annual Budgeting process along with the monthly forecasting process. Lead the Finance support for our new product development gating process Own and drive all financial modeling related to New Product Introductions (NPI), including hardware and software launches Work with sales, marketing and product development teams to understand, analyze and model projected investments and payback associated with NPI projects Track and report on project performance against gate projections, analyzing post-launch performance to understand the variance drivers and integrate learnings into future modeling, Design and implement process improvements to achieve operating excellence. Serve as a project leader on cross-functional teams. Deliver presentations to finance and executive management as needed. Identify business trends and continuous improvement solutions. Analyze and interpret financial statements, reports, and performance trends to establish metrics and key performance indicators. Develop and utilize analytical tools to help the functional leaders drive efficiency and effectiveness. Identify opportunities for process improvement (people, process or technology) to increase efficiency within the organization. Assist in the periodic reviews of various activities performed in order to improve the quality and productivity of services provided to the business. Implement analytical standards and models that can be utilized on a recurring basis to guide effective and informed decision making. Analyze departmental capital investment projects to ensure achievement of established objectives, and to validate assumptions for use in planning future projects. On both an individual and team basis, serve as a positive, energetic agent of change and improvement within Nautilus. Perform other related duties as deemed necessary and appropriate. Who you are: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 3 to 5 years of directly related, progressively responsible experience in financial planning and analysis, performing sophisticated financial analyses of businesses or business divisions, or equivalent combination of training and experience Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics or other analytical degree, MBA a plus Experience in software related industry a plus Demonstrated track record as an outstanding problem-solver and driver of results Very strong analytic and financial modeling skills Able to quickly identify key issues and develop hypotheses (what happened? why did it happen? what does this mean for the future?) Works in the details but easily clicks up a level to grasp the "big picture" Able to work in ambiguous environments – willingness to dive into the Engineering environment to understand challenges and opportunities. Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills Able to collaborate effectively using broad range of influence styles to drive desired results; works well with others and is considered a true team player Very strong communicator, written and oral, with proven ability to communicate across the spectrum—from senior executives to hourly Operations associates Strong executive presence and command skills Able to identify barriers to successful implementation and capable of working with teams/leaders to mitigate barriers Approaches conflicts as opportunities; understands others quickly; can find common ground without comprising total position Very strong project and process management skills, including ability to independently disaggregate problems into defined workplans Able to effectively juggle multiple projects at one time Demonstrated initiative and ability to work independently and to manage cross-functional business partners who are not direct line reports Proven record of independent development of analytical tools and methodologies, including creation of spreadsheet-based reports leveraging/merging multi-source data acquisition, tools and analysis. Must have experience with strategic planning, financial systems, budgets, and general accounting functions including knowledge of financial and general accounting principles. Excel Power User, Experience with NetSuite a plus Experience with skills such as Power BI or Python a plus. Benefits and Culture: We offer continuing education on topics ranging from improving workplace skills to better financial security; and promotes the importance of getting involved and giving back to the community. We offer a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k) match, ESPP, life & accident insurance, disability insurance, paid vacation and holidays, wellness program, tuition reimbursement, product discounts and free use of our employee fitness center for yourself and spouse. Nautilus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to diversity in its workforce. In demonstration of our commitment to a healthier lifestyle, we are proud to be a smoke-free campus.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Position Type Full Time Position Location Fort Campbell, KY Tracking Code 00862 Daily Responsibilities As a Business Intelligence Analyst you will collaborate with all other departments of our organization to include, Knowledge Management, Operations, Budget and Finance, Human Resources, Manpower, the Command Team and many more. You will collaborate with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery. Improve and streamline processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy, viability and value. Provide ongoing development and maintenance of a business intelligence architecture that enables fact‐based decision making and ad-hoc analysis and insight generation. Business Intelligence Analysts are responsible for gathering organizational data through the USASOC data warehouse, and other information systems and platforms to include MS SharePoint, MS CRM, SQL Server and data created at the user level. With the data collected, the Business Intelligence Analyst is expected to help develop a picture of the organization’s overall operational readiness, efficiency, or capability. Accordingly, they are expected to be able to recommend solutions for improvement in these areas based on the data presented. Required: Years of Experience (min) 6+ years’ experience Required: Degree Four-year college degree required; Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance or similar (Preferred) Required: Experience Develop and manage BI solutions Provide reports, processes and dashboards Collaborate with key stakeholders and information owners Analyze organizational data to identify opportunities to improve outcomes through data analytics Provide solutions using the Microsoft Business Intelligence stack, Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management (CRM), SQL Server, SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) with ability to write DAX queries ETL Tools and Process Provide ongoing development and maintenance of an operational data store and enterprise data warehouse using BI best practices, relational structures, dimensional data modeling, structured query language skills, data warehouse and reporting techniques. Requirements: Knowledge in the following systems and tools Microsoft Business Intelligence stack, SQL Server, SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) and ability to write DAX queries, use of ETL process and tools, knowledge of SQL database development. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to contribute both independently and as part of a team Excellent listening, communication, interpersonal and presentation skills Required: Clearance Secret

title: Financial Analyst
description: Our reliability is one of the best in the nation, and we’re working to make it even better. We live here too. That’s why we’re committed to making Florida a better place. Join our team today Learn more Position Specific Description Employee will be part of the Corporate Support group in FP&A and will be responsible for supporting specific business units with accurate and timely financial analysis. Typical duties will include month end reporting, annual budget formulation, and completing ad hoc projects at the customer’s request. Employee’s primary customer to begin with will be the Human Resources & Corporate Services group and potentially NEECH G&A spend but can change in the future. Expectation is that the employee has the ability to comprehend, analyze, and resolve analytical issues and convey them into simple to understand deliverables for management decision making. Required skills include Microsoft Excel, financial reporting experience, and strong customer service skills. A strong background with SAP and dashboard knowledge is preferred but not required. Job Overview Employees in this role supports Senior Management decision making via financial modeling, including but not limited to, revenue requirement and customer bill impacts, discounted cash flow analysis and financial statement modeling. This position identifies and conducts moderately complex analyses of financial impacts of issues and/or decisions facing the company and proposes strategies to maximize financial performance of company. Job Duties & Responsibilities Identifies, analyzes, and communicates to management the impact on the Company's financial structure, profitability, financial integrity, and competitive position utilizing relevant analytical methods and/or department’s forecasting models Provides financial analysis support for various projects, calculating revenue requirements, net present value, customer bill impact, etc. Provides expertise, support, and financial training for the company departments requiring these services Performs financial analyses as required by management or regulatory bodies Prepares PowerPoint presentations to be provided to Senior and Executive Management Performs other job-related duties as assigned Required Qualifications High School Grad / GED Bachelor's or Equivalent Experience Experience: 3+ years Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's - Accounting / Finance Master's - Business Administration Employee Group: Exempt Employee Type: Full Time Job Category: Finance, Accounting & Business Analytics Organization: Florida Power & Light Company Location: Juno Beach, Florida Other Work Locations: Florida Relocation Provided: No NextEra Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, age, national origin, religion, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetics, disability, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. If you require special support or accommodation while seeking employment with NextEra Energy, please send an e-mail to recruiting-coordinator.sharedmailbox@nexteraenergy.com, providing your name, telephone number and the best time for us to reach you. Alternatively, you may call 1-844-694-4748. Please do not use this line to inquire about your application status. NextEra Energy will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. NextEra Energy does not accept any unsolicited resumes or referrals from any third-party recruiting firms or agencies. Please see our policy for more information. #LI-DS1

title: Product Manager
description: About the Role DoorDash’s mission is to grow and empower local economies. By building intelligent, last-mile delivery technology for local cities, DoorDash connects people with the local businesses they care about — helping grow businesses and the communities that support those businesses. To further this mission, we’re looking for an experienced B2B product marketing expert to join our growing product marketing team at a pivotal and exciting time for DoorDash. The Product Marketing team at DoorDash is small, but growing rapidly and it is expected this person will be a leader on the team, help build the Product Marketing function, and grow their career as the team grows. As Product Marketing Manager, B2B Advertising & Promotions, you will be the Chief Marketing Officer for our merchant promotions product and the ad network that we are building within DoorDash. In the near term, you’ll be responsible for defining the strategy to launch new features and drive ongoing engagement with promotions. Over the long term, you’ll help DoorDash build a world-class advertising network. Through close collaboration with the Advertising & Promotions product management team, you will surface audience insights that inform the roadmap and leverage those to build scaled go-to-market campaigns that encourage adoption of promotions. The ideal candidate will be comfortable operating at highly strategic and tactical levels, switching between them effortlessly. You will be deeply grounded in audience insights through partnership with research, analytics, and by driving original research to define the needs of the merchant audience. You will have a track record of leveraging insights to build consensus with large cross-functional teams and of building trusted relationships with senior product leaders. You should be comfortable working closely with customer-facing teams (sales, account management) in addition to leading scaled marketing efforts. You will thrive on analytics and set a learning agenda for all projects that raises the bar for impact against engagement and business goals. This role is based out of our San Francisco or New York headquarters and reports to the Director of B2B Product Marketing. You’re excited about this opportunity because you will… Drive self-serve promotions revenue across all merchant segments (enterprise, SMB, franchisees), in partnership with the sales and account management teams Own the development of marketing strategies that drive adoption and ongoing engagement with promotions Partner closely across teams to design, build and refine the promotions product that merchants use to fund targeted growth and the advertising platform that we use to showcase these promotions Define and drive comprehensive go-to-market plans for new features from audience definition, development of core value proposition, to launch and sustain through owned and in-product channels Partner closely with research and analytics to develop a deeper understanding of the merchant audience and surface opportunities to senior product leadership to improve the merchant experience with ads and promotions Proactively identify, test, and scale opportunities to improve merchant retention through close partnership with analytics, product management, and business strategy Lead complex cross-functional teams to execute marketing programs at scale, including partnering with Product Management, Engineering, Comms, Strategy & Ops, Finance, and Analytics We’re excited about you because… You have: BA required 6+ years of professional experience in Marketing or Product in a corporate or startup environment Proven track record of driving successful go-to-market launches that drive adoption and bottom line impact Fluency with data - including market/segment sizing, forecasting, and working with analytics to understand efficacy of campaigns after the fact Experience collaborating with various cross-functional stakeholders (Marketing, Product, Sales, Strategy/Ops) to build products or services for business customers Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies. We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day. We are learning - We’re not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if it’s scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute. We are customer obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility. We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights. We offer great compensation packages and comprehensive health benefits. About DoorDash DoorDash is a technology company that connects customers with their favorite local and national businesses in over 4,000 cities and all 50 states across the United States and Canada. Founded in 2013, DoorDash empowers merchants to grow their businesses by offering on-demand delivery, data-driven insights, and better in-store efficiency, providing delightful experiences from door to door. By building the last-mile delivery infrastructure for local cities, DoorDash is bringing communities closer, one doorstep at a time. Read more on the DoorDash blog or at www.doordash.com . Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Software Engineer
description: COMPANY OVERVIEW: Founded in 2000, Analytic Partners (AP) has grown to be the independent global leader in analytics consulting and technology. We help top-tier companies adapt to the rapidly evolving world of data, analytics, and strategic and tactical decisioning. We are fast growing with global operations across our full-service offices in New York City, Denver, Charlottesville, Miami, Hamburg, Paris, Dublin, Australia, Singapore, and Shanghai. We provide highly customized, results-oriented analytics and consulting services including marketing mix modeling, ROI measurement, and econometric modeling. With a wide breadth of business experience, technology, and analytic techniques, we guide our clients toward more cost-effective and profitable marketing strategies. We help our clients make wiser choices for their marketing budget, build market share, increase revenue and profit – and achieve their best Return on Investment (ROI). In The Forrester Wave™ Marketing Measurement and Optimization Q1 2020, Analytic Partners was named a Leader and was top ranked in Strategy and Current Offering categories among all evaluated vendors. OUR VALUES: Our differentiator in the marketing place is – Our People! We hire the brightest talent and develop them into leaders. We foster a culture of PEOPLE, PASSION and GROWTH. People: We value our people, clients, and partners Passion: We love what we do Growth: Unlimited growth means unlimited potential AP is a client-focused, team-oriented organization where innovation and results are rewarded, and individuals can chart the course of their own careers. TEAM OVERVIEW: This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated technical talent to pursue a career in an innovative and fast-growing company. This role sits in the Technology Engineering (TE) department. The mission of the TE department is to build business intelligence applications to solve practical marketing analytics problems. Software Engineer will participate in the full life-cycle of software development, from design, implementation, testing, and release while also leading and driving development within the team. At the core, this role is responsible for implementing innovative solutions and drive transformational change across our application suite. This exciting opportunity will put you at the forefront of cutting-edge technologies as we continue to expand our solutions over time. You will join a multi-disciplinary team where Hard Work, Creativity, Vision and Talent is valued and rewarded. Development work is geared toward assisting Fortune 500 class clients discover real-world opportunities and efficiencies in their businesses. This role will be an integral part of shaping the development suite for our next-generation analytic solutions designed and built for our global clients. We work within an agile environment utilizing SCRUM concepts. This position offers tremendous professional growth opportunities. WE’LL TRUST YOU TO: Be a highly valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team Architect, design, develop deploy and maintain services and products platform at scale Evaluate technical needs and requirements related to proposed solutions Follow team programming standards and enforce them with peers Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables Provide technical leadership to less experienced developers YOU WILL HAVE: Have an interest in bringing knowledge to software development Value continuous learning and can work independently as a natural problem solver Love to ideate, bring forth creative and practical solutions Challenge the status quo and always thinking about ways to improve Like to wear multiple hats and jump in to get the job done Receptive to feedback and are proactive about finding solutions Team player, with flexibility to adapt to new working environments A multitasker with excellent time management skills who can handle tight deadlines Possess strong technical competency in emerging technologies QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field 2 years of formal professional experience as a developer Excellent written and verbal communication skills Agile learner and growth mindset with curiosity for learning and growth Ability to work independently or within a team Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks Drive solutions with minimal supervision Mastery of data structures and algorithms Familiar with Jira, agile development process, and story mapping Drive to deliver on time with high-quality software Excellent verbal and written communication Ability to present complex design from requirements TECHNOLOGIES: Required: Python, MySQL/SQL Server, MongoDB, RESTful APIs, Docker, Cloud computing Optional: Linux/Unix experience, JIRA, GitHub, Flask, R, Statistics/linear regression background, Jenkins, Ansible, Terraform, Systems Architecture, AngularJS, React, Node.js, JavaScript You must be eligible to work in the United States on an unlimited basis to be considered for this job.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Paradigm Digital Group is seeking a talented individual to join our Digital Marketing department. This is a full-time position and is not remote. We are a leading full-service digital marketing agency, specializing in the transportation, education, and career training industries across North America. We provide our clients with website development and design, marketing strategy, local SEO, content writing, PPC, email marketing, social media management, video production, digital advertising, lead generation and more. Our entire team is in-house, and with over 30 years of experience, we are able to provide our clients with the expertise and experience they need for their digital marketing and advertising. In this position, you will need to be proficient in writing, editing, updating, and placing content on client websites to ensure the website message is cohesive with other various online channels. You will create content that is consistent across the client’s website, social media networks, blogs, and email marketing. Candidates will be expected to execute email marketing & nurturing campaigns to increase ROI for the agency and our clients. Our team is highly collaborative. When necessary, you will collaborate with an internal designer, videographer and web developer to update or create new website designs. You will work in conjunction with the CMO, and other employees to provide marketing solutions based on consumer demographics, industry trends, and client needs. Our clients extend from coast to coast, therefore there are also occasional travel opportunities. Paradigm Digital Group is a growing firm and is looking for the best talent possible to add to our current team. Our work environment is considered relaxed and our team’s work style is supportive, collaborative, and fun. And while our work is challenging, we have an atmosphere at our company that encourages long-term growth with our clients and company. Our office is pet-friendly, and we look forward to periodic visits from your fur kids. We are well stocked with coffee, espresso, cold beverages, snacks, filtered water, periodic donut runs, Thursday wine tastings and outdoor BBQs in the summer. To allow our staff to enjoy the Summer months, we provide Summer hours between Memorial Day and Labor Day! Specific Duties Establish, manage, and maintain contact with multiple clients for content creation. Must understand clients’ needs and objectives and work closely with clients, often on a weekly, if not daily basis. Edit, update, optimize, and manage client websites, in WordPress. Responsible for writing website copy and blog posts while also incorporating both on-page and technical SEO. Maintain and optimize websites, landing pages, online engagement, and conversion tactics to ensure the success of Client/Team/Company goals. Create and maintain a monthly content calendar that comprises of upcoming events, class starts, topics of interest, and holidays to manage posting schedules across multiple channels. Research and develop relevant posting materials and topics for use on the website, social media, and email accounts to help clients with content creation and lead nurturing. Setup, monitor, engage, and respond to social media accounts, on a daily basis, in a timely manner. Collaborating with our in-house video editor in creating client videos for both their website and social media. Create and manage email nurturing campaigns for existing leads. Complete monthly reports; monitor the effectiveness of campaigns, advertising, and web performance, make changes as needed in a proactive manner. Update technical skills and knowledge through webinars and online certification programs. Additional duties as assigned. Job Requirements Proficient in the use of social media platforms, especially Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, Vimeo, etc. Proficient with WordPress, Unbounce (or related WYSIWYG landing page platform). Good skills with Adobe Creative Suite Programs (primarily Photoshop) and Microsoft Office Products. Solid understanding of Google Analytics and Search Console tools for monitoring and reporting. Skilled in writing and conducting online SEO optimization, while staying current with Google's latest algorithms. Able to implement best-practice SEM solutions to meet customer needs. Plan, implement, and assess conversion rate optimization strategies. Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, internal and external. Creative problem solving, organizational & time management skills. Great attitude & strong work ethic! Do what it takes to get things done. Work well with others and multiple personalities. Self-starter, self-motivated, self-sufficient, and able to work in a relaxed, non-corporate, work environment. An appreciation for cats! We are a pet-friendly office with an office cat, Tango! Job Type: Full-time Pay: $3,790.00 - $4,208.00 per month Benefits: 401(k) Disability insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Digital Marketing: 2 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location This Job Is: A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to apply A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply Work Remotely: No COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process Temperature screenings Social distancing guidelines in place Virtual meetings Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Company Description We are proud to be one of the most recognized brands in the world, with restaurants in over 100 countries and billions of customers served each year. McDonald's is people business just as much as we are a restaurant business. We strive to be the most inclusive brand on the globe by building a workforce with different strengths who make delicious, feel good moments that are easy for everyone to enjoy. At McDonald's, we are dedicated to using our scale for good: good for people, our industry and the planet. We see every single day as a chance to have a lasting impact on our customers, our people and our partners. We will continue to pursue big, global initiatives while remaining kind neighbors and supporters of our local communities. We are moving fast and are building a passionate team to help us. This means the company is looking for innovators, leaders, sprinters who are focused on crafting memorable experiences for our customers, employees and partners. Joining McDonald's means thinking big daily and preparing for a career that can have impact around the world. Job Description We are in search of a Director to join our growing Global Data Science and Analytics Center of Excellence. This role will be critical in helping both corporate and global markets enhance their adoption and use of analytics, data and upskill their ability to both improve their use of existing analytics tools as well as to build their own analytic solutions. This dynamic individual will build and lead a team of analysts, strategists and data scientists responsible to increase fluency, skill and usage of data analytics tools and solutions. As a key member of the Data Analytics Hub leadership team, you will be a vital advisor and contributor to the Chief Data Analytics Officer, and other leadership, democratizing data literacy globally. This role will interact with both the central corporate headquarters as well as the various regional and global offices impacting all 118 countries. We are looking for an experienced leader with a strong data science background and experience in helping to enable and upskill both experienced data science professionals and most importantly those without formal data science training in large global markets. This will help the regions to drive and improve business results through data driven strategies. This person will create and direct a training program and support construct for all analytic solutions and users across the company. In this role you will: Provide leadership to enable global growth and upskilling in the use of data, data science tools and analytics Develop and run a global strategy to enable global growth in data science usage and skill Build a team and curriculum for training/teaching in data science and analytics solution development and tools. This will also include building a digital platform with proper resources, forums for discussion and other mean to deliver state of the art content globally - both live, virtual and on demand. Serve as a champion and spokesperson for data and analytics, enabling our teams to see the power of their story through data and providing the mentorship and support for each global team Build a governance forum and process to ensure the quality of data analytics. This will include building a deployment strategy balancing on demand self-deployment with proper security and access controls Serve as a key stakeholder in tool selection, vendor relations and tool management Maintain a focus on storytelling - understanding how data analytics can both tell, inform and drive improvement into the McDonald’s story Collaborate cross-functionally with every department and region in need of data driven analytics Build and manage support models for data and analytics solutions built by the various global teams Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar technical fields Master’s degree in Data Science, Math or Data Analytics preferred but not required Experience in building strategies in data science democratization and upskilling citizen data scientists to build their own data analytics solutions Extensive experience in teaching and communicating data science principles and a proven track record in recruiting a team with similar skills Previous corporate or consulting experience in managing analytical projects in large cross-functional organizations such as retail, restaurant or food service, CPG, financial services, etc Strong understanding of data warehousing principles and big data architecture; prior experience in partnering with IT to drive large data management initiatives Proficiency with data science tools like Alteryx, Microstrategy and understanding of languages like R, python and SQL Experience with varied data environments and data storytelling Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI Experience with regression and other supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning modeling techniques, with the ability to explain these complex principles in simple understandable language Experience in creating and supporting communities of excellence in analytics across global teams Strong people skills required to lead and inspire small teams of direct reports and consulting resources Strong written and verbal communication skills - ability to communicate complex issues to senior leadership Additional Information McDonald’s is committed to providing qualified individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to perform the essential functions of their jobs. Additionally, if you (or another applicant of whom you are aware) require assistance accessing or reading this job posting or otherwise seek assistance in the application process, please contact recruiting.supportteam@us.mcd.com McDonald’s provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to sex, sex stereotyping, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), race, color, religion, ancestry or national origin, age, disability status, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, protected military or veteran status, citizenship status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
