Understand who our customers are and the ability to propose and architect solutions to meet their needs. Have the ability to take high-level system initiatives and decompose them into workable user stories for the team to work on. Have in-depth system knowledge, architectural design, project execution, and solution design Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals Qualifications Our Next Software Engineer Tech Lead Has: Experience leading a team of junior-to-senior level engineers Effective leadership skills and the ability to drive results Ability to objectively evaluate new technology offerings, understanding when to build a solution and when to buy a solution Expert ability to work across multiple systems and diagnose systems and create well-documented interfaces for intra-system software systems/dependencies. Work cohesively with other departments (UX, online marketing, online merchandising, analytics) E-commerce/retail domain knowledge Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Software Engineer
description: The Role Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering team is currently seeking a frontend engineer that will own the web components of our computer vision platform for vehicle assembly and warehousing, our analytics and pattern recognition platform that governs Tesla’s purchasing decisions, or, depending on fit and opportunity, any one of a suite of apps this team is building that address the most difficult problems facing our growing Gigafactory network. Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering team, in general, owns the centralized technical aspects of our multi-continent Gigafactory network and product line. The systems we work on include Tesla’s most important programs, such as Cybertruck, cell production, Robotaxi, and new factories globally. The software team is responsible for making these systems and operations every bit as intelligent and dynamic as the products themselves. As a frontend software engineer on the Vehicle Engineering team, you will be in a product ownership role, leveraging whatever tech you feel fits best, e.g., React, graphQL, and/or websockets, to re-imagine what the global Gigafactory network should look like. Knowledge of both frontend frameworks and computer science fundamentals, like data structures and algorithms, are highly desired traits. The ideal candidates care foremost about the end-user experience, despite the issues that inevitably arise in complex industrial and scientific environments. The role will require the confidence to flex into design, backend, and network security, as needed, to make the final product successful. Responsibilities Deliver web applications that are useful to diverse groups, e.g. professional design engineers, program managers, production associates, and forklift drivers Write reusable components with clean, modular patterns Work closely with other software engineers to integrate with backend systems and solve networking problems Work cross functionally with mechanical and design engineers to support evolving research projects and implement new features Maintain and improve existing applications to better support the Vehicle Engineering team Requirements BS/MS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent industry experience Working knowledge of the React framework Proficiency with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript Experience building streaming applications using, e.g., websockets Expertise in debugging live software systems Ability to demonstrate object-oriented, test-driven, and responsibility-driven design Leadership experience in an engineering domain is a plus (not required) Employee Benefits As a full time Tesla employee you will receive full benefits from day 1 for you and your dependents. Kaiser and UnitedHealthcare PPO and HSA plans (including infertility coverage) 3 medical plan choices with $0 paycheck contribution Vision & dental plans (including orthodontic coverage) Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits Employee Assistance Program, Paid Time Off, and Paid Holidays Back-up childcare and employee discounts

title: Data Scientist
description: Company Overview: At ADT, we've been in the business of helping save lives for more than 145 years. As the number one smart home security provider serving residential and business customers, our people are our most important asset. Headquartered in Boca Raton, FL and at more than 200 locations across North America, our employees help empower our customers to live more secure and confident lives. Join our team and help us protect what matters most. For more information, visit www.adt.com or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram. Position Summary: This position is responsible for providing thought leadership on execution of strategic analytics initiatives, people data modeling and experimentation to solve essential business and HR challenges with a focus on key issues such as predicting great hires, employees at risk of leaving, and supporting our company's employee engagement and diversity and inclusion goals and objectives. Additional responsibilities will encompass quantitative analytics, predictive modeling, research design, consulting, and soft skills applicable to people research. This position will have direct involvement in operationalizing our people strategy with our analytics team to solve complex human and data questions and communicating solutions that provide insights and lead to data-driven recommendations. The successful person in this role will be forward-thinking–a committed supporter for predictive analytics and enjoy constantly learning and growing skills within people analytics and data science. This position will work directly with the People Analytics Leader, as well as data analysts, data engineers, and HR Business Partners. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES include the following. To perform this job successfully, the Data Scientist, People Analytics may be expected to perform special projects and other duties as requested. Seek to understand people-related business problems and help frame them into actual research questions that can be answered with data. Bring together our organization's data, as well as external data and research, to help our business leaders understand and act on people issues. Translate data and insights into meaningful visualizations and stories to drive strategy, action, and decision-making at executive levels, within HR, and with people managers. Deliver strong customer service including translation of requests into requirements and communication of technical information to a non-technical audience. Use platforms, programming, and systems to establish single-source data to be leveraged across the business to support insights and improved decision-making. Lead data-driven and evidence-based research to support the delivery of people metrics, reporting, and advanced and predictive analytics. Align research priorities with business priorities and take a customer-focused mindset in working with stakeholders. Leverage expertise and knowledge of HR industry and people analytics trends to address practical business challenges. Collaborate with and communicate broadly within the People Analytics team, HR, and the business in a cross-functional effort with key stakeholders to identify key initiatives and execute delivery of sustainable solutions to expand our data universe. Exercise traits of adaptability and good judgment to support organizational agility. Be a constant learner, active listener, and teacher to advance data science, people analytics, and our organization. Exude passion for your field, people analytics, and our organization both internally and externally to establish us as thoughtful and effective use of data and people analytics. CORE COMPETENCIES: Experience in research design, visualization techniques, and analysis approaches in which you manage and analyze both structured and unstructured data. Experience in advanced statistical methods around hypothesis testing, clustering, machine learning predictions, and text mining. Experience modeling high-dimensional data. Experience with tools and languages such as SQL, R, Python, Tableau, and in the design and implementation of data pipelines that support the continuous delivery of insight. Understanding of the external people analytics landscape and trends. Ideally experience with people research, the human capital domain, user interface, consulting, and our industry. Experience in applying data privacy regulations and navigating how to effectively use data while protecting an individual's privacy. Experience in thriving in project environments that often start with uncertain requirements or outcomes; ability to apply definition and structure around uncertain problems. Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment and the versatility to manage multiple projects, priorities, and urgent issues successfully and simultaneously Experience in positively interacting with people of opposing thoughts and ideas within a team environment. EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION: Four (4) year degree or equivalent experience required in either Analytics, Mathematics, Operations or Computer Science, Statistics, or similar highly quantitative degree. WORK EXPERIENCE: 3+ year's directly applicable experience in data modeling and data tools and languages such as Python required. ADT LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We are committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce and do our best to foster a culture and environment where every employee feels valued. Our goal is to serve our customers and help save lives. We can achieve this goal when we have the best talent working in an environment where employees feel included and recognized. Visit us online at jobs.adt.com to learn more.

title: Business Analyst
description: At American Family Insurance, we believe people are an organization’s most valuable asset, and their ideas and experiences matter. From our CEO to our agency force, we’re committed to growing a diverse and inclusive culture that empowers innovation that will inspire, protect, and restore our customers’ dreams in ways never imagined. American Family Insurance is driven by our customers and employees. That’s why we provide more than just a job – we provide opportunity. Whether you’re already part of our team in search of a new challenge or new to our company and ready for what’s next, you’re in the right place. Every dream is a journey that starts with a single step. Start your journey right here. Join our team. Bring your dreams. Job ID: R25841 Business Analytics Analyst II- Open to Remote (Open) Compensation may vary based on the job level and your geographic work location. Compensation Minimum:$66,800 Compensation Maximum:$107,000 Summary: Job Family Summary Provides analytics services to the business. Develops new insights and understands the business performance based on data and statistical methods. Analyzes business results, external market dynamics and other data sources to assess trends and develop actionable insights and recommendations to management, via understanding of the business model and the information available for analysis. Typically uses data, statistical and quantitative analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, and fact-based management to drive decision making. Job Description: Level Summary Requires in-depth conceptual and practical knowledge in own job discipline and basic knowledge of related job disciplines Solves complex problems Works independently, receives minimal guidance May lead projects or project steps within a broader project or may have accountability for on-going activities or objectives Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience Level at which career may stabilize for many years or until Primary Accountabilities Conducts accurate and timely business analysis and reporting to support and drive business decisions using statistical modeling and other business analysis tools. Collaborates with key stakeholders to define key financial and operational metrics to continuously monitor, track, and report performance. Collaborates with business partners in the development and delivery of key performance analysis and reporting. Builds and maintains models used to project business results; enhances the model where there is business value in adjusting the models. Ensures analysis and reporting accuracy and integrity and explains performance drivers and provides insights into performance trends. Analyzes and addresses data quality issues, tests and analyzes impact of system changes to data/reporting infrastructure. Develops, tests, and deploys automated reporting solutions and automated decision analytics to replace manual business processes. Travel Requirements This position requires travel up to 10% of the time. Specialized Knowledge & Skills Requirements Demonstrated experience providing customer-driven solutions, support or service Solid knowledge and understanding of forecasting techniques or statistical analysis Demonstrated strong experience utilizing data tools to build complex formulas and create reports Understanding of software tools to query and report data Knowledge of a variety of standard reporting software packages and best practices for report deployment processes Demonstrated experience developing data sets Additional Job Information: When you work at American Family you can expect benefits that support your physical, emotional, and financial wellbeing. You will have access to comprehensive medical, dental, vision and wellbeing benefits that enable you to take care of your health. We also offer a competitive 401(k) contribution, a pension plan, an annual incentive, and a paid-time off program. In addition, our student loan repayment program and paid-family leave are available to support our employees and their families. Interns and contingent workers are not eligible for American Family Enterprise benefits. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Stay connected: Join Our Enterprise Talent Community! LI:YM1

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Commvault is a worldwide leader in delivering backup and recovery for the progressive enterprise. Commvault enables you to protect, manage, and use your data, while managing it in a consistent, compliant way. Our automated solutions work on-prem and in the cloud, and work with the digital tools and procedures you’re already using. Keep your data accessible and actionable with a single solution that ensures your data is always available — no matter what. Description The Director of Web Marketing is responsible for conception through to execution of the B2B digital experience across our web properties including www.commvault.com. The candidate would manage the team, agency, and budget necessary to build a high converting demand generation focused website with a differentiated and carefully planned and tested user experience. Requirements Handling strategic online initiatives Creating SEO strategy to support business requirements, measuring impact and tuning for ROI Leading website projects from the idea stage through to execution and implementation Monitoring and evaluating web pages and journey to keep them fresh and effective Directing the hiring of content manager, and web developer staff and supervising their work Negotiating agency contracts and relationships Working with other department heads and staff to discuss plans and marketing strategies Planning and collaboration to stay within budget and maximize ROI across efforts Staying current with emerging opportunities in the websites, specifically B2B Clearly communicate vision and strategy through verbal, written, and PowerPoint presentations Proven track record for delivering high quality websites Highly organized, self motivated Experience/Knowledge Strong knowledge of latest web standards Strong knowledge of latest B2B trends Content Management best practices Testing/QA methodologies 3+ Years leading a team of 5 or more 3+ years with WordPress 3+ years with Google Analytics Preferred knowledge of additional tools: WordPressVIP, Vidyard, Marketo, Vidyard, Unbounce, VWO, Triblio, Google Data Studio #LI-AM1 Commvault is an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. title: Marketing Manager
description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library Foundation Library Communications Spec I Salary range: $56,552.0000 - $84,830.0000 Apply by: 10/24/2021 POSITION SUMMARY This position focuses on program and services promotions and materials innovation. The Library Communications Specialist I, promotes Library programs and events, develops, and manages digital content resource promotions, manages communications about programs and services, generates content, writes, develops, and designs Library communications as needed. Create and implement an annual communication and marketing plan for the Library Foundation. Charlotte Mecklenburg Library Foundation: The Library Foundation was established as a supporting organization in partnership with Foundation For The Carolinas. The Library Foundation exists to help the Charlotte Mecklenburg Library create a community where reading, learning, and imagination thrive. Created in 2012, the Foundation supports the Library’s programs and services through advocacy, fundraising and building relationships with others who share a passion for the Library’s work. The Foundation believes that free and open access to information can change lives for the better, and build a brighter future for our community. For more information on the Library Foundation, please visit: http://foundation.cmlibrary.org/ For more information on the Charlotte Mecklenburg Library, please visit: http://cmlibrary.org/ ESSENTIAL FUNCTION Promote system-wide programs, manage all promotional materials, and promote innovative programs and events. Develop and manage digital content resource promotions. Manage communications about programs and services to engage and reengage customers, generates content. Assist with updates to system-wide communication tools, help execute M&C program of work, including tracking progress and reporting goals. Increase community awareness of programs and activities impacting locations, services and programs, manages promotional materials. Participate in local, state, and national professional organizations. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Experience: Minimum of three years of related experience in marketing, communications, or related field. Education: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Public Relations, Communications, or related field. Combination of relevant education and relevant experience accepted?: Yes LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONS N/A PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Three to five years of related experience in marketing, communications, or related field. Highly organized, independent worker, yet also effective in a team setting Strong writing and editing skills with versatility in styles and tailoring to specific audiences or channels Experience writing content for both print and digital media Organizational and project management skills; attention to detail; and ability to juggle multiple projects and priorities KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES Knowledge of Knowledge of marketing Knowledge of data analytics Knowledge of basic design principles to create flyers, images, web banners Knowledge of social media trends and best practices General knowledge of library functions and activities Skills Excellent verbal, grammatical and written communication skills Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail Excellent time management skills with attention to detail Media monitoring Social media publishing, etc. Showing initiative, creativity, and adaptability Abilities Building Partnerships: Identifying opportunities and taking action to build strategic relationships between one’s area and other areas, teams, departments, community groups or organizations to help achieve business goals Communication: Clearly conveying information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the information provided Decision Making: Identifying and understanding issues, problems and opportunities; comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions; using effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; taking action that is consistent with available facts, constraints, and probable consequence Information Monitoring: Setting up ongoing procedures to collect and review information needed to manage an organization or ongoing activities within it Technical/professional Knowledge and Skills: Having achieved a satisfactory level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; keeping up with current developments and trends in areas of expertise Work Standards: Setting high standards of performance for self and others; assuming responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks; self-imposing standards of excellence COMPUTER SKILLS Excellent command of various computer applications including Microsoft Office Suite Adobe Creative Suite (Acrobat Professional, Adobe Cloud, Photoshop, etc.) Proficient in Microsoft Office suite, WordPress, design, and video editing software WORK ENVIRONMENT Works in an office setting with moderate noise SELECTION This classification has been identified as having a role in the development of ADA compliant technologies and for which the incumbent agrees to follow County policies to the best of their abilities in order to meet these obligations. No REASONABLE ACCOMMODATIONS STATEMENT To accomplish this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation, each essential function satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to help enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. DISCLAIMER STATEMENT This is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job-related responsibilities, duties, skills, requirements or working conditions. Other duties may be assigned based on business need and the supervisor’s request. Mecklenburg County reserves the right to revise the job description at any time. Designated positions may be required to assist in emergency and/or disaster situations. COMPENSATION & BENEFITS In addition to a competitive salary, Mecklenburg County offers a generous benefits package which greatly increases your total compensation. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life, short term disability, long term disability, accident, cancer, critical illness, medical bridge and pet insurance; dependent care, healthcare and commuter flexible spending accounts; health savings account; paid holiday, vacation and sick days; near site clinics for preventive care and illnesses; an employee discount program which provides discounts for retail, dining, shopping, travel, tickets and more; an employee assistance program including financial and legal counseling; access to Mecklenburg County fitness and aquatic facilities; paid family leave; tuition reimbursement; a 5% employer match on retirement savings plan contributions and a defined benefit plan for retirement.

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Do you have a proven track record of developing innovative sourcing strategies and selecting high-quality talent? Are you a relationship-driven leader who will inspire your team to exceed expectations and reach their full potential? Do you have a passion for using data to drive effective decisions? If you answered “yes” to these questions, we would love to meet you! We are Mental Health Cooperative, and we are a different kind of agency. We believe every person who walks through our doors has the potential to grow and change. We believe the individuals we serve are people first. We do not define them by their mental illness. We believe relationships matter and are the most important part of our services. We believe in working in small multidisciplinary teams, with the individual we serve as the focus. We believe in an open agency where staff and those we serve share common space in all our facilities. We are now accepting applications for a Director of Talent Acquisition in our Nashville headquarters. Your leadership, problem-solving skills, and talent acquisition expertise will enable the creation of our Talent Acquisition Center of Excellence. Your Impact You will partner with HR leadership to build talent management strategies, including workforce planning, talent acquisition, onboarding, and retention. You will craft a compelling branding strategy to attract a diverse, qualified pipeline of candidates. You will serve as an internal consultant to hiring managers and others to ensure that we deliver a consistently exceptional candidate experience. What makes this opportunity right for you? You want to be part of a team of HR professionals who value each other’s contributions and collaborate to raise everyone to greater success. You will receive a competitive salary with stellar benefits, including substantial PTO, with accrual starting immediately upon employment. We also offer immediate eligibility for a 403(b) retirement plan with a generous employer match. You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment that offers true work-life balance. What makes you right for this opportunity? You have 5 or more years of progressive talent acquisition experience, including at least 2 years of managing a team of recruiting specialists. You have strong data analytics skills and the ability to think critically and creatively. You build exceptional relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and organizational leaders. If you have a passion for talent acquisition and would love to work in an organization which empowers individuals and families with mental and behavioral health issues to live healthier lives, we invite you to complete our online application today. MHC: Where We Face the Challenges Together. Job Type: Full-time

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: WAGO Corporation is seeking an individual to assist the Director of Marketing & Digitalization in the day to day interactions with website and related content. WAGO offers a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, company-paid insurance plans-life, AD&D, short-term disability and long-term disability, and a retirement 401k plan. Experience Required: Bachelor's degree or 4+ years of equivalent work experience. A fundamental understanding of digital marketing programs and technologies. Thorough understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) and social media marketing strategies. Demonstrated analytical and organizational skills. Familiarity with keyword research, large amounts of data, and various analytics tools. Strong computer skills in Microsoft Word, Power Point, and Excel. SAP CRM, SAP CRP, SAP Sales Cloud, SAP Marketing Cloud experience a plus. Experience with defining, collecting, organizing, analyzing, and reporting on information with accuracy. Proven ability to develop, audit, and test campaigns to optimize key performance indicators (KPIs). Position Description: Responsible for the design, collection, analysis, and reporting of sales and marketing data in an ongoing effort to increase revenue, maximize ROI, maximize lead efficacy, and to improve the quality of the overall customer experience. Will design processes in which to engage new audiences and to convert more customers. Assists the Director of Marketing & Digitalization in determining which data will be collected through internal resources and to select appropriate digital channels to budget resources. These digital channels may include but are not limited to: Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn; display, search or video ads; email marketing, and affiliate marketing sites. Must be able to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines. Must be able to work independently or within a group. Must have excellent organization and communication skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to prepare and present complex materials across various levels of the organization. Will create standardized/customized analytic reports to produce periodic, static and specialized insights using internal resources and the structured collection of digital activity from multiple sources including the company's website, social media channels, and a variety of other marketing channels. This individual will work closely with marketing, sales, and various other groups within our organizations; they must be able to liaise between groups fluidly while helping engage the organization in data literacy Duties and Responsibilities: Track, collect, and report accurate digital data related to an organization's digital media (online advertising, social media, Google Ads, and other associated digital assets of the company) creating accurate reports, analysis and dashboards that accurately reflect vital information about the company's digital assets. Analyze and interpret data received through various tools to track traffic, leads, conversions, and other strategically-specified metrics. Assist the design and subsequent testing of campaigns to optimize KPI's Translate complex data into easy-to-understand, snackable' content Communicate insights across various levels of the organization Collaborate with global stakeholders, agencies and other vendor partners as needed. Meet or exceed all KPIs established for this position in accordance with Company goals and strategies. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. Additional job related duties may be assigned as required.

title: Business Analyst
description: Introduction About DuPont Water & Protection Our purpose is clear, we create water, shelter and safety solutions for a more sustainable world. DuPont develops solutions that protect, shelter and enhance lives. Our expertise spans high-performance fibers and foams, aramid papers, non-woven structures, water purification technologies, and protective garments, and includes well-known brands like Kevlar®, Nomex®, Tyvek®, Styrofoam™, Corian®, and Great Stuff™. Learn more about our Featured solutions here: https://www.dupont.com/about/our-businesses.html The Role and Responsibilities As a Business Analytics Specialist in DuPont Water & Protection, you are a thought partner for our businesses. In addition to understanding requirements and creating stunning visuals, you are able to collaborate in the development of reporting strategies, contribute your own ideas, weigh up different options, explore benefits and home in on the top few critical analytics projects that will enable our businesses to continually meet critical objectives. You will have the opportunity to scale your existing skills rapidly through training, mentoring and collaboration with experts in fields from data engineering to Machine Learning and process automation. You'll have a high level of ownership of your projects so that you can take full advantage of your talent and imagination. Your Key Responsibilities: Own analytics projects providing high quality visual solutions that guide our business partners to take well informed decisions with respect to their areas of responsibility. Work directly with business partners across a range of product areas and functions to fully understand their specific requirements. Collaborate with our Data Engineering team to ensure you have all the data you need to provide the required solution and then design and build the finished visual analytics. Identify opportunities to make your analytics actionable so that in addition to tracking critical KPIs, our business partners are guided to take the right actions to achieve the desired outcomes. Use your change management skills to ensure business users are well prepared for the new tools, are fully trained and supported through deployment and beyond. Your Qualification Profile: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Science, Technology, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a STEM related field 3+ years practical experience in Analytics. Strong communicator, able to write clear instructions, provide high quality end user training and share stories of your successful projects with all levels of the business. Strong technically competencies, you are able to engage with people in business roles in a way that allows them to understand our analytics solutions and allows us to understand their specific needs. You understand business value and are able to prioritize your activities in a way that drives business growth, cost reduction and best business practices. You have exceptional skills in Power BI. You are able to quickly grasp business requirements and transform them into efficient and effective visual analytics solutions. You understand how to make data actionable and are able to create high quality solutions using Power Apps, fully integrated with your Power BI data and dashboards. Practical business experience, e.g. in Sales and Marketing, Supply Chain or Operations. Project Management and Change Management. Azure Data Lake or Databricks. Microsoft Power Automate. DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit our Accessibility Page for Contact Information. For US Applicants: See the “Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law” poster at: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf For our U.S. Affirmative Action Policy, click here.

title: Marketing Manager
description: Summary: Oversee and provide strategic direction to staff in carrying out advertising, promotions, player development and entertainment for the resort. Work with operations to develop effective marketing and advertising programs that support all aspects of the resort including non-gaming amenities. Working closely with the Chief Marketing Officer and Shared Services, develop and execute short-and long-range advertising and marketing plans to enhance the opportunity for market share and profit growth. Utilize analytics and reports, industry treads, competition and demographics to capitalize on marketing opportunities and stay competitive in the industry. Communicate marketing plans and details to the property operations team.Essential Functions: Provide exceptional guest service to all customers. Create public relations plans for property activities and product releases including use of social media. In coordination with ECR Business Intelligence, develop and manage annual marketing plan for the resort, including direct mail, advertising, promotions and special events. In coordination with ECR Business Intelligence, develop and manage short and long-range strategic marketing plans for Resort Club and Player Development. Prepare and present the annual marketing plan. Ensure satisfactory profit/loss ratios are attained for casino promotions. Track and manage monthly marketing department expenses to budget and prior year. Ensure completion of monthly competitor tracking information and oversee the shopping program. Implement special programs for Elite and Classic Resort Club members to maximize profitability. Oversee the development of offers, promotions and special events. In coordination with ECR Marketing, develop the annual entertainment events plan and the execution of entertainment events during the year. Work with agency and internal partners to schedule all types of advertising to reach desired demographics through digital media, direct mail, newspaper, radio, television, billboard, etc. Work with the ECR Digital Marketing Coordinator to develop quarterly and annual Digital Advertising, Social Media and Reputation Management goals. Ensure all creative is done in accordance with the brand guidelines for Elite Casino Resorts and the resort location. Provide internal signage and support to promote all outlets and promotions within the resort. Continually search out new markets, identify consumer needs and effectively match and/or package existing products to meet needs. Provide on-going training to ensure staff is making sound reinvestment decisions and remain thoroughly knowledgeable of the card program, club benefits, resort amenities/promotions and all marketing programs and promotions. Oversee and administer policy and procedure for operational initiatives and event/promotional support. Work closely with operations to develop specific advertising plans to achieve each outlet’s annual goals. Communicate all casino and outlet promotions and events to the ECR Business Intelligence team in the monthly marketing planning and proforma process. Keep up on casino and non-gaming promotion performance and communicate results to the General Manager and Department Directors. Communicate all marketing updates and changes to the General Manager and Department Directors. Work closely with Chief Marketing Officer and Elite Casino Resorts Business Intelligence team. Provide feedback to General Manager regarding service levels, profitability and opportunities. Required: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Business and five (5) years of experience directing a professional marketing department or comparable management experience required. Proven communication and organizational skills required. Proven success in areas of advertising, digital marketing, direct mail, social media, budgeting, financial planning, profitability, productivity and concept of development required. Proven experience creating, proofing and implementing direct marketing programs. Proven ability to identify qualified personnel and provide leadership to develop and direct staff maximizing performance required. Previous casino management experience preferred. Ability to conceptualize, create and execute promotions that entice patron visits and spend. Ability to analyze a patron’s spend habits and corresponding value to the resort. Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) required. Experience in dealing with media agencies is preferred. Schedule: Full-time to include Days, Evenings, Weekends, and HolidaysSalary: DOE Job Type: Full-time

description: Role/Responsibilities Reverse engineer Structure Finance transactions in our Moody’s proprietary cashflow engines Model cash flow waterfalls based on indentures and legal documentation Update and validate collateral for Structured Finance transactions Work with proprietary datasets and data developers to maintain and improve data quality, consistency and breadth, with a specific focus toward extending our derived data Assist senior members of the team in maintaining and improving data and modelling processes.
