title: Business Analyst
description: Location: For Those Who Work At Home - Various, Ohio 44145 ABOUT THE JOB (JOB BRIEF) Successful candidates will have proven track records in these three areas: (1) strong people leader, leading a team of highly professional analysts with statistics, economics, business analytics, and data science backgrounds. (2) strong strategic partner, working closely with consumer product team leaders quantifying, prioritizing, and building analytical learning agendas to drive business goals. (3) Ability to influence using data and analytics, written and oral presentations that drive decisions. The Senior Business Analytics Manager is primarily responsible for leading a business analytics team in support of line of business priorities and objectives or a significant set of shared analytics capabilities. This role must establish priorities for the team, assign and define the work to the right resources, and understand the strengths and opportunities of the team to ensure the group meets and exceeds expectations. This role is responsible for building analytical capability enabling greater insight into solving critical business problems. The Senior Business Analytics Manager acts as a leader, strategic advisor and credible thought partner to senior / executive level business partners. This position is also responsible for managing the integration of activities within and across teams as well as effectively manage, coach, develop, and guide a team of professionals to anticipate business needs, recommend the right solutions, and communicate the right message. As such, the Senior Business Analytics Manager uses industry trends to identify new capabilities and analytics opportunities and must be able to translate and connect strategy to the team’s day-to-day work through superior communication, coaching, and proactive management of workloads and assignments. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS Lead a team of analytics professionals in providing insights using diagnostic statistics Drive cross-functional and enterprise-wide solutions Provide strategic consultation to senior / executive level business partners Anticipate business partner needs Drive the output of the team – ensure “client ready” work product in alignment with business priorities Provide thought leadership within and beyond the working group Actively listens and knows when to probe for further information Promote the group and their capabilities to stakeholders Able to effectively collaborate and partner at all levels of the organization; guides, advises, challenges, and influences to drive organizational impact Provide solutions based on “connecting the dots”; leverage business insights to align, develop, and build holistic strategies and solutions that align with LOB priorities and consider knowledge of cross-LOB interdependencies; develop this skill in others REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Master’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, or the Natural Sciences and 5+ years of relevant experience; or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, or the Natural Sciences and relevant experience Advanced proficiency with: Microsoft Excel / PowerPoint Query writing/coding including complex joins Data visualization Understanding of: Source systems Process flow and automation Familiarity with big data and understands the need to navigate data warehouse and/or data supply chain May not apply technical skills as frequently #LI-REMOTE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS This position is eligible to earn a base salary in the range of $120,000 to $160,000 annually depending on job-related factors such as level of experience. Compensation for this role also includes eligibility for short-term incentive compensation and deferred incentive compensation subject to individual and company performance. Please click here for a list of benefits for which this position is eligible. Key has implemented a role-based Mobile by Design approach to our employee workspaces, dedicating space to those whose roles require specific workspaces, while providing flexible options for roles which are less dependent on assigned workspaces and can be performed effectively in a mobile environment. As a result, this role may be mobile or home based, which means you may work either at a home office or in a Key facility to perform your job duties. KeyCorp is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other protected category. Qualified individuals with disabilities or disabled veterans who are unable or limited in their ability to apply on this site may request reasonable accommodations by emailing HR_Compliance@keybank.com .

title: Product Manager
description: We are inspired by solving big problems. We are all about progress; we set out to do something and we do it. – Rob Cohen President, Bamboo Health Bamboo Health is a leader in cloud-based care coordination software and analytics solutions focused on patients with complex needs, including those suffering from physical health and mental health issues and substance use disorders. We deliver on a mission of enabling better care for patients across the continuum, and our software solutions help healthcare professionals collaborate on shared patients across the spectrum of care. Summary: The Manager of Product Marketing owns the go to market strategy of products supporting a market segment. This position is a player-coach role. We have 5 market segments that we serve: state government, payers, health systems, pharmacy chains and post-acute providers. As a Product Marketing Manager, you will drive and own go-to-market strategy inclusive of positioning, messaging, packaging, and pricing. You will be responsible for understanding how our customers want to buy, and helping them to do so, by articulating customer pain points and our corresponding solutions and value props clearly and in their own language. You will lead new product and feature launches, arming the sales channel to market and sell our products, and collaborating with our Marketing team on materials and strategies to promote the product and drive leads. You will have a deep understanding of the industry, our buyers, and the competitive landscape and will be expected to distill market and buyer insights to inform our Product roadmap in collaboration with Product Management. The Product Marketing Manager role is highly visible and cross-functional, requiring communication with company leadership and regular collaboration with Product Management, Sales, and Marketing, among other functions. You should enjoy rolling up your sleeves as a self-starter and moving quickly up your learning curve while working in a dynamic, fast-paced, and cross-functional environment. What You’ll Do: Meet established KPIs and report effectiveness Develop the product positioning and messaging for each product in your portfolio by understanding the competitive and pricing landscape Develop a pricing policy and procedure that leads the company to a contracting model that drives gross margin Ensure all products have a list price and track adherence to the pricing model Develop a value driven pricing strategy for each product that results in a high ACV while minimizing the sales cycle time Partner with product development to communicate market needs by researching competitors and collaborating on new features and benefits to ensure customer satisfaction Conduct customer research to understand product performance Conduct win loss analysis Establish a sales training process and ensure effective training of product sales teams What You Need: Bachelor’s degree in Business with an emphasis in finance or product marketing. If a non-business undergraduate was achieved, an MBA or appropriate level of experience is required. 3-5 years in healthcare product marketing with identified responsibility of a service or technology focused product. MBA preferred Experience with Salesforce and NetSuite preferred Prior experience in enterprise SAAS healthcare IT Competencies Analytical Skills & Strategic Thinking Ability to develop pricing models, develop customer ROIs, sensitivity analysis and primary/secondary market research. Ability to crosswalk market needs with our unique set of capabilities and competencies to identify revenue growth opportunities. Solid business acumen with the ability to draw conclusions based on data. Ability to understand and respond to nuance in qualitative insights from both customer feedback and industry insights. Communication Skills Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills Ability to distill complex topics into simple key points and messaging building blocks Strong interpersonal skills for use in both internal cross-functional work and external conversations with customers and prospects Effectively communicate up, down, and across an organization Ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams. Agility and Independence Agility to continuously tackle new problems while simultaneously leading multiple projects that span different stakeholder groups and Product Marketing core competencies Ability to quickly take in new information and drive cross-functional stakeholders to alignment on the solution or best course of action Self-starter with a willingness to jump into new problems with a can-do attitude What You Get: Join one of the fastest growing health tech companies in the country Have the autonomy to build something with an enthusiastically supportive team Learn best practices from world class investors and advisors Work closely with the country’s largest and most innovative health systems Receive competitive cash compensation with health, dental, vision and other benefits We are an equal opportunity employer. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $110,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible schedule Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Experience: product marketing management: 4 years (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote Work Remotely: Yes Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: What we offer Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now! SAP Concur is seeking an experienced stategist and analyst to help review and guide the organization's long-term strategy and develop goals and measurements that support realization of the criticial business objectives. The Senior Business Strategy Specialist will be tasked with assessing organizational performance, researching and analyzing key challenges and opportunities, developing achievable goals, and working with business stakeholders to implement processes that improve organizational effectiveness. The role will report into senior SAP Concur Operations leadership and interface with all levels and functions within SAP Concur, including the executive leadership team. The role will also have opportunities to work within the greater SAP organization on selected inter-functional initiatives. Responsibilities include: Supporting development of long-term organizational strategy Conducting research and analyses of strategic options and operational effectiveness Identifying threats and opportunities Presenting findings to audiences throughout the organization, including executive leadership Working cross-functionally to determine the best courses of action Experience include: Degree in business or related field, MBA preferred Minimum 3-5 years of experience in business administration/operations, management consulting, or strategic planning Excellent understanding of business operations and procedures Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational and planning skills Outstanding analytical capabilities Ability to translate operational measures to financial outcomes Confidence in working with all levels of management Project management skills Ability to work positively with peers throughout the organization SAP Concur is the global leader in spend management, committed to reinventing travel, expense, and invoice management with tools that simplify everyday processes and create better experiences. We are SAP SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together. Our inclusion promise SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world. SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability: Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. Requisition ID:298698 | Work Area: Sales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

title: Software Engineer
description: Company Description Farmers Fire is a property & casualty insurance company headquartered in York, Pennsylvania, established in 1853. Insurance may not be the first industry you think of for your future career, but the charter to sustainably protect and restore individuals' and families' most valuable assets in the event of loss is both a noble pursuit and a dynamic, interesting problem set. With under 20 employees, you won't have to worry about towering organizational structures. You will report to the company CTO and your daily contributions will have direct, positive impacts on our employees, agents, and customers. Farmers Fire puts family first with 4 weeks paid time off per year, a 37.5 hour work week, and while this is not a remote-work position, there is the ability to work remotely on an as-needed basis. Job Description As a Software Engineer, you will create, maintain, and support applications for your co-workers as well as our agents and customers. Your work will be done under the direction and guidance of our CTO. You will be working with and gaining expertise in a wide array of technologies and frameworks, including: Python - Flask, Django, SQLAlchemy, Jinja, Jupyter SQL - MySQL Query and DDL for reporting and analytics, 3NF, star-schema JavaScript - jQuery, Knockout, Vue HTML/CSS - Bootstrap AWS - EC2, VPC, S3, RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, Route53, WorkSpaces Windows - AD, File Server, Print Server Linux - Ubuntu, bash, cron, sftp SCM, CI/CD - git, github, drone.io Regular operating hours are Monday to Friday, 8:00AM to 4:30PM. This position will require regular in-office hours for co-worker and general systems support. Qualifications Prior personal and/or professional experience in several of the referenced technologies (or close analogues) is expected, in addition to: Academics - this role requires fast and continuous self-learning and application of new concepts, so while no explicit academic degree is required, whatever education levels you have completed should have been completed with excellence Interests - you enjoy and keep current with multiple facets of technology. You are the person your friends and family call for help with their PCs, phones, home networks, etc. Skills - along with your resume, you should provide evidence of any applied knowledge you have in the technologies above - eg URLs to public web sites or applications you've built, description of deployment & purpose for servers you've stood up (ec2 or local), github repositories you maintain or have contributed to, etc. Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Director Business Analyst
description: General information Reference 2021-777 Position description Job title Director of Marketing Job Summary Septodont is a leading manufacturer of dental pharmaceuticals and medical devices. The French-based company employs over 1,800 people globally. We have six manufacturing plants in France, India, North and South America, and an international distribution network that is dedicated to serving the needs of dental professionals in more than 150 countries. Our North American operations has facilities in Ontario, Montreal, and Pennsylvania. It also has Latin American operations with facilities in Brazil and Colombia. The company has an opening at its facility in Lancaster, PA for a Director of Marketing! The Director of Marketing manages all aspects of marketing in North America (USA/CAN). Leads the North American marketing team in the design, development and execution of marketing strategies for the territory. Responsibilities Lead the marketing team to achieve objectives established in the Company’s strategic plan through the design, development and execution of the marketing plan Designs and deploy the marketing plan to achieve expected sales growth, profit and brand penetration Coordinates marketing operations with all other departments/divisions of the Company Ensures a strong link with corporate marketing team and ensure alignment with the company’s marketing strategies/initiatives Creates and maintain the North American KOL network and fuel it (lectures, articles, roadshows,…) Collaborates closely with the Sales teams when developing marketing strategies, material and services for clients. Drives marketing efforts with distribution partners in the efforts to promotes products and increase sale Drives North American VOC plan, analyze market data (sales, MS%, competition,…) – Deploy corrective actions to the plan if needed Leads the digital transformation within the marketing department Manage the North American marketing team Provides leadership for day-to-day operations in the department Establishes performance goals for marketing department employees, and monitor performance on a continual basis. Oversees all hiring, training and termination of marketing personnel. Ensure compliance with all internal and external processes Manages and control the allocated Marketing Budget Actively represent the US organization in the processes related to portfolio management (Ideation, NPD, NPI,..;) Ensures perfect compliance with legal framework (Sunshine Act…), all internal SOP and reporting systems Endorses the Septodont service standards within all activities Reliable – Does the job right. Performs with precision and ensures safe, error-free interactions with each customer. Efficient – Is accessible to our customers and always ensures that their experience with us is efficient and timely. Respectful – Cares about the long-term success of each stakeholder and strives to build trust-based relationships. Informative – Our customers learn from us and are better because of the relationship Qualifications Education Bachelor in marketing / MBA is preferred Training on dental techniques Experience 10 years experience in marketing (including brand management and people management) in a company well-known for its marketing strength, in dental (preferred) or medical device fields Experience in a matrix organization (experience with (or in) a corporate/central/international marketing department) Familiarity/interest for digital technologies/digital marketing KEY COMPETENCIES: Proven leadership to empower his/her team to achieve objectives Expert in marketing fundamentals and techniques Able to work in a matrix organization, reporting in solid line to VP Sales and Marketing North America and in dotted line to the Director of Corporate Marketing. Able to work in project mode Team player Able to work with other cultures and able to interact efficiently with various hierarchical levels Strong communication skills (oral and written) Comfortable in numbers/data analytics and in market analysis Manages deadlines and retro-plannings Strong interest in digital technologies Customer orientation Innovative skills to design effective marketing initiatives and communication/selling skills to be able to convince business partners Able to coordinate different product strategies and deploy those strategies Read/analyze product analytics (BI, panels, ad’hoc research) Contract type Permanent We offer Excellent compensation/benefits package. Bonus and reward programs Programs supporting work life balance Employee recognition program Professional and personal development programs Social events and spirit days Position location Job location North America, USA, Lancaster, PA

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: USCB America is 100% employee owned company. We are direct hire and offer full-time positions. We offer benefits such as: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, PTO, sick pay, holiday pay and 401(k) with company match! This position is remote and corresponds with our California office (PST). GENERAL SUMMARY Partner with subject matter experts of source systems as well as business and customer users of Power BI implementation. Build dataflows, datasets, and reports as well as creating and maintaining documentation for all aspects of BI system. Partner with managers, executives, and customers to identify, analyze, and document new reporting opportunities and translate them to required specifications. With minimal supervision accomplishes organization goals by directly completing, or guiding, full phases of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) to include analysis, requirement gathering, functional design, coding/configuration, documenting, testing, implementation activities, and post implementation support. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Design, develop, implement, and support highly complex BI applications of strategic or functional importance including, integration with data sources, highly automated data refresh processes, best-in-class data visualizations, dashboards, and reports that communicate critical insights to drive decision making.  Execute roadmap of business focused BI initiatives with a clear understanding of all deliverables and associated deadlines.  Consult with end users to gather and clarify data and reporting needs for complex business intelligence solutions.  Evangelize self-service BI, analytics and reporting as well as the effective use of PowerBI and related data & toolsets by the widest possible audience.  Develop and maintain data management standards, and documentation of current data sources, raw data, data marts, transformations, and report specifications.  Oversee data quality including validation, cleansing/scrubbing, ETL methods, etc.  Formulate and recommend standards for achieving maximum performance and efficiency of the data ecosystem.  Create and maintain documentation and training materials for end users.  Applying architectural and engineering concepts to design a solution that meets operational requirements, such as scalability, maintainability, security, reliability, extensibility, flexibility, availability and manageability.  Solicit and translate business needs into requirements for data objects including metrics, attributes, reports, and dashboards.  Build data visualization reports and tools for self-service consumption using Power BI.  Extract, analyze and model relevant data from various data sources.  Ability to design and build Dashboards on Power BI.  Develop new techniques to process large data sets, address quantitative problems, and recommend white spaces for experimentation.  Think outside the box to deliver innovative solutions to core business problems and client needs.  Draft concise documents communicating results to stakeholders, visualizing data where beneficial to drive decision-making.  Participates in the identification, development, and communication of new standards and best practices as appropriate.  Complies with and enforces all company policies and procedures.  Other duties as assigned. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Referral program Retirement plan Vision insurance Experience: SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Power BI Implementation: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: Remote

title: Data Analyst
description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm) Some people take things as they come. Others relentlessly push themselves to go farther. Combine health care and technology, which are two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet, with UnitedHealth Group's culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get: industry-leading health care services at a company that's improving the lives of millions. As a Data Analyst/SQL Reporting Specialist, your analyses will be used to create viable, real-world solutions in a complex health care landscape. The work is as challenging as it is rewarding. You'll open doors to new opportunities. This is where bold people with big ideas are writing the next chapter in health care. Join us. You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges. Primary Responsibilities: Design and develop reports using SQL Analyze data to measure clinical outcomes, network performance and methodology levers Investigate key business problems through quantitative analyses of utilization and health care costs data Interpret and analyze clinical data from various sources and recommend best approaches for its consolidation You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Required Qualifications: 3+ years of work experience in a corporate setting 3+ years of experience in analytics and working with large data sets Intermediate level of proficiency working with MS Excel including formulas, calculations, charts, graphs, etc. Advanced level of proficiency with SQL, including coding Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or 2+ years of equivalent work experience Healthcare Analytics experience Experience using Crystal Reports Experience using Talend Experience using Tableau or a similar data visualization tool UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 5 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work.(sm) Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. *All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Job Keywords: Data Analyst, Data Analysis, SQL Reporting Specialist, Coding, Telecommute, Telecommuting, Telecommuter, Work From Home, Work At Home, Remote

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Company Description QuantumWork Advisory is founded on a culture that is passionate about transforming the way the world acquires talent by delivering client-focused solutions that make a difference for businesses worldwide. Our business provides advisory services for clients in the space of talent acquisition and external workforce. From selecting processes and technologies to transforming a client technology landscape, QuantumWork Advisory supports clients end-to-end in their journey. As an industry leader, we draw upon decades of experience to design innovative tools, products, and processes. We develop competitive practices that position organizations for growth, and we deliver the insight needed to succeed in today's global marketplace. QuantumWork Advisory is a specialized, independent Worktech advisory and transformation firm, run by industry practitioners with deep operational experience. We design beautiful, human centered experiences, enabled by technology, transforming how companies acquire and manage talent, across all workforce categories. We leverage the power of digital and AI to improve organizational agility, productivity, and workforce engagement, all with a clear ROI linked to business strategy. Advisory - We provide strategic advice on Worktech, Workforce Management, and Service Design, leveraging our in-depth domain expertise to design your optimal digital strategy for workforce management and talent acquisition. Transformation Services - We are specialists in Worktech, including Vendor Management Systems (VMS) and Talent Technology. We offer services in SI and implementation, reengineering business processes; change management and adoption; and design and build of service delivery operations. Backed by the Allegis Group, we are part of the largest privately held human capital firm globally, with 14bn in revenues, 20,000 employees, and 450 offices globally. Job Description We are searching for a highly creative digital marketing manager to lead our marketing capability. In this position, you will be responsible for all aspects of our marketing operations. Your central goal is to help grow our brand’s influence locally while also increasing brand loyalty and awareness. Your duties will include planning, implementing, and monitoring our digital marketing campaigns across all digital networks. Our ideal candidate is someone with experience in marketing, and social media management. In addition to being an outstanding communicator, you will also demonstrate excellent interpersonal and analytical skills. RESPONSIBILITIES Develop and own the execution of the marketing strategy Develop, implement, and manage digital marketing campaigns that promote the new brand and services. Monitor the effectiveness of all digital marketing campaigns against agreed key performance indicators and provide regular reports on results, progress, and recommendations for the future. Create social media strategy that focuses on the optimal channels and activities. Support and manage the development of email marketing programs focusing efforts on list building, email automation/drip campaigns, and email blasting, tracking, and reporting Develop strong and innovative digital marketing strategies using PPC, SEO, SEM, and other techniques to attract traffic to our website and increase awareness of our brand and its products and/or services. Develop realistic content strategy and media channels. Work with partners, to develop co marketing campaigns. Develop realistic content strategy and media channels to distribute – this could be driven around the podcast series if competed well establish panel and podcast series with clients, partners, and targets on key topics and identify a media partner to distribute content after each podcast Build out high quality standard decks, e-brochures, and whitepapers for each product. Develop collateral and messaging for internal channels including AGS and Opcos to develop sales leads. Develop and distribute newsletters quarterly. Establish a podcast series with clients, partners and targets on key topics and identify a media partner to distribute content after each podcast Qualifications 5+ years of experience working in digital marketing. Ideally, experience Marketing B2B Services. A background in software or consulting marketing working closely with partners and through channels, would be ideal. Qualifications in marketing. Strong understanding of current online marketing concepts, strategy, and best practice. Advanced knowledge across all key aspects of digital marketing including tracking and analytics platforms such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics. Superusers in HubSpot with HubSpot Certification desirable. · Ability to interact with people at all levels of an organization and to develop strong relationships. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a focus on generating results and increasing engagement. Proven ability to multi-task, perform under pressure and manage tight deadlines. Ability to perform independently in addition to collaborating within a team environment. Commitment to providing excellent customer service. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word). Additional Information QuantumWork is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to disability, please call 844-604-7059 or email accomodation@allegisglobalsolutions.com.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Senior Business Analyst with Tax or Finance background EY Technology: Technology has always been at the heart of what we do and deliver at EY. We need technology to keep an organization the size of ours working efficiently. We have 250,000 people in more than 140 countries, all of whom rely on secure technology to be able to do their job every single day. Everything from the laptops we use, to the ability to work remotely on our mobile devices and connecting our people and our clients, to enabling hundreds of internal tools and external solutions delivered to our clients. Technology solutions are integrated in the client services we deliver and is key to us being more innovative as an organization. EY Technology supports our technology needs through three business units: Client Technology (CT) - focuses on developing new technology services for our clients. It enables EY to identify new technology-based opportunities faster and pursue those opportunities more rapidly. Enterprise Technology (ET) – ET supports our Core Business Services functions and will deliver fit-for-purpose technology infrastructure at the most affordable possible cost for quality services. ET will also support our internal technology needs by focusing on a better user experience. Information Security (Info Sec) - Info Sec prevents, detects, responds and mitigates cyber-risk, protecting EY and client data, and our information management systems. The opportunity As part of Global Tax Platform (GTP) team you will be part of a client technology organization that develops and maintains innovative solutions for our client-serving Tax professionals. The purpose of the role, and the combined contributions of the roles of this team, is to serve the aggregate technology needs of a Tax Service Line and its products including building relationships with assigned practice areas and the various product sponsors within them, technical tax professionals, internal technology professionals, external clients and third-party software vendors. We are looking for an experienced, passionate, results-oriented business analyst who is a great problem solver with deep and proven experience in delivering innovative solutions. Your key responsibilities As a senior business data analyst you will be responsible for: Elicitation, analysis and documentation of business, stakeholder, solution and transition requirements driving data models for the assigned business areas/portfolios Responsible for leveraging appropriate techniques such as data flow diagrams, data mining and data modelling techniques to gather, analyse, and report Tax and Finance data requirements as a member of a data modelling delivery team Work closely with product owners and other subject matter experts to understand business and technology strategies affecting and affected by their Tax and Finance data. Plan and actively manage the BA requirements management strategy; communicating, driving and managing the business analysis effort for each project in the Program throughout all phases of project lifecycle Actively manage requirements traceability for impact and coverage analysis throughout the program Provide guidance and oversight on effective utilization of Business Analysis techniques in compliance with organizational standards Development of clear, concise, and consumable functional and non-functional requirements during all phases of the software development lifecycle Work with the Business Analysis Community of Practice to ensure consistent application of the business analysis standards and advise on exceptions To qualify for the role you must have Skills/Experience: Authoritative experience gathering and interpreting business requirements Experienced developing technical requirements and specifications, including knowledge of software engineering methodologies, reporting tools, modelling and testing Professional understanding of Lean Six Sigma and Business Process Modelling and Notation Well-versed with least one of the industry leading Finance systems such as SAP R3, SAP HANA, SAP BPC, Oracle EBS, PeopleSoft, Hyperion Consolidations, Hyperion Planning, Anaplan to gather/elicit, and conduct business requirements workshops Proficient knowledge of at least one of the industry leading Business intelligence such as Power BI, SAP Analytics (eg HANA, BW, BusinessObjects), Oracle BI to develop requirements/ product design for the delivery team Knowledge of Tax Systems such as OneSource Tax Provision, OneSource Income Tax, CorpTax Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change based on client needs Ability to build relationships and network at all levels. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Attention to detail and accuracy Strong work ethic capable of planning and managing own time effectively Excellent verbal and written communication skills and negotiation skills Customer focus with ability to identify and understand customer's needs. Qualifications / Technical Skills: A bachelor's degree (computer science, engineering, accounting, finance preferred) or equivalent work experience. Master's degree preferred 5 years of relevant experience Expert on industry-standard, structured business analysis techniques (i.e., user story creation, UML/logical modelling, data modelling, etc.) Knowledge of Agile, SCRUM and/or Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) is highly preferred TAX or Finance domain knowledge with a strong understanding of databases and data analysis. Ideally, you’ll also have Master's degree in Information Technology/Computer science IIBA CBAP or CBATL certification for business analyst Data Analytics degree or certification What we offer We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Marketing Manager
description: ABOUT THE DAVINCI GROUP: TheDaVinci Group, Inc. (“TDG”) is a designer and manufacturer of award winning hi-fi residential and commercial audio products for custom built luxury homes and offices. We strive to build the best sounding and highest quality speakers, amplifiers, and accessories. We service the construction industry all over the world with audio products indoor and outdoor audio solutions for whole house music. What We Can Do For You: Provide the opportunity to develop and acquire highly sought out skills Provide the opportunity to further enhance current professional strengths Provide insight into a niche industry working closely with founding partners Provide a safe environment to produce quality work TDG is seeking a talented and energetic graphic artist and leader with a passion for technology. The Marketing Specialist/Graphic Designer will be responsible for marketing campaigns to let the world know about our products and generate leads. We have cultivated a professional, but friendly atmosphere where respect and communication are highly valued What You Will Do: Develop and manage digital marketing strategy including SEO, social media and more Execute targeted, multi-channel marketing programs to increase traffic to tdgaudio.com and channel partners Create email marketing campaigns to drive sales and generate leads. Coordinate analytics setup for various marketing efforts with cross-functional teams Manage digital advertising campaigns across various platforms including Google Adwords, Facebook, Instagram, and Amazon Marketing Services (AMS) Product photography and video production for marketing campaigns. Create stunning graphic art for marketing material. Assist in providing the best customer service and order processing for our valued customers throughout the world. Create promotional and education videos. Maintain company websites to stay up to date with the latest information. Qualifications: Three years of hands-on digital marketing experience. Four-year degree Working knowledge of any of the following programs: Google Analytics, Google Adwords, and major email platforms Experience developing and maintaining successful lead nurturing marketing campaigns. Experience creating and managing Amazon Marketing Services (AMS) campaigns strongly preferred Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills Ability to juggle multiple projects and complete tasks under tight deadlines Strong passion for and knowledge of home audio and smart home technology. Self-starter with an ability to thrive in a fluid and entrepreneurial environment. Expert in Photoshop, Illustrator, and Outlook. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $36,000.00 per year Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Graphic design: 1 year (Preferred) Adobe Creative Suite: 1 year (Preferred) Adobe Illustrator: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 Work Location: One location

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Forcura is a dynamic high-growth SaaS technology company focused on driving efficiency and interoperability for healthcare organizations. We are seeking a seasoned demand generation leader to develop a predictable and scalable pipeline generation engine that will drive Forcura’s growth. The Director of Demand Generation, while reporting to the VP of Marketing, will define and create our lead generation strategy across the entire acquisition funnel. As a key leader in our fast-paced and nimble operating company, this role demands clear communication, resourcefulness, influence, and ability to drive both strategy and execution. This individual will be someone who consistently overachieves in high Demand Generation environments and actively contributes to building high-performance marketing organizations. The role requires an individual to establish results and performance-based culture while infusing an appropriate level of process and prioritization. Job Duties Develop and execute a multi-channel demand generation and account-based marketing strategy Scale inbound programs to grow revenue Develop and orchestrate repeatable marketing programs across all channels that maximize both results and ROI Manage and develop a team of digital marketers and business development Roll out improvements to SEO elements such as internal linking, meta content and on-page content to increase traffic and lead generation. Partner closely with cross-functional teams (Sales, Customer Experience, and Product) to hit business goals Forecast and present to senior management and help the VP of Marketing achieve greater marketing success Manage relationships with external advertising vendors Conduct analytical projects to improve go-to market strategy Establish closed-loop analytics with sales to understand how our marketing activity turns into customers, retain customers, and continually refine our process Experience and Education Bachelor’s in marketing preferred, with experience in data driven marketing/strategy 5+ years’ experience managing marketing campaigns Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Proven track record of building and leading effective marketing teams and fostering career development through mentorship and coaching Track record of success working with a B2B sales team and delivering high quality pipeline A strong understanding of ABM, marketing automation, Salesforce, lead-scoring, segmentation, revenue attribution, influence, and ROI Deep expertise in developing enterprise marketing channels - digital programs, thought leadership, channel partners, website, events, industry partners, and more Superb organization skills and attention to detail A good boss – this individual is empathetic, understanding and genuinely cares about the personal growth of their team. Ability to move quickly, problem solve on the fly and present new ideas. Preferred Qualifications B2B SaaS and healthcare experience a plus Work Environment This role is located out of Forcura’s Jacksonville offices About Forcura Forcura, a leading healthcare technology company headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, facilitates continuity of care via technology, analytics and a deep commitment to enabling better patient care. The Forcura suite of tools is powered by Forcura Connect, a proprietary framework for standardizing interoperability and integration among post-acute health care organizations, physicians, electronic health records (EHRs) and other supporting technology vendors. Through our technology and analytics solutions, we are a step closer every day to elevating the opportunities of post-acute care. The company has received awards for Fastest Growing Company for the fourth consecutive year, Best UI/UX Design in SaaS, and Best Places to Work by Inc. Magazine. For more information visit www.forcura.com or follow Forcura on LinkedIn .

title: Marketing Manager
description: Part art. Part science. All passion. Our marketing and advertising teams bring a unique blend of skills to tell the DISH story with invention. Whether coordinating high-level messaging for the C-suite, interacting with journalists to drive our own breaking news or launching a campaign around our latest innovation, our team lends their voice to the future of communication. The Strategic Marketing Analyst will directly influence the future of the Dish business by shaping the marketing strategy and driving performance through quantitative forecasting, response modeling, and support of special projects. You will evaluate existing and proposed marketing strategies to develop both strategic and granular forecasting insights and recommendations. We’re looking for strategic and analytic minds with the capability and desire to position themselves and the Dish business for rapid growth. The ideal candidate will combine proven analytical capabilities with excellent communication skills to be able to frame a business initiative, understand what data are needed as well as most pertinent, and work with subject matter experts to develop strong recommendations and action plans. Primary responsibilities will be focused on modeling and reporting, with secondary responsibilities including marketing unit support and ad hoc projects. Responsibilities will include: Generating weekly forecasts and reporting combined with insightful analysis to drive strategic decisions throughout the organization Supporting campaign strategy development, campaign test and measurement design and post-campaign analysis Using various quantitative and qualitative techniques to build performance reports, analyze data and provide actionable insights and recommendations Partnering with key internal clients and agencies to ask and answer questions related to Dish’s customers, prospective customers, strategy, available data, and competitive situation Managing multiple concurrent projects and deliverables from multiple team members Contributing to on-going marketing systems development and process improvement Education and Experience BS/BA from 4-year college or university MBA or related Masters Degree in Marketing, Economics, Analytics or similar preferred Consulting experience a plus Skills and Qualifications 4+ years of experience in a highly analytical setting Strong quantitative, statistical, strategic thinking, and analytical skills and the ability to work cross functionally with internal clients to drive and communicate results on an ongoing basis Some level of proficiency and interest in analytical work. Either work experience or sufficient course work in analytical field - Analytics, Math, Economics, Finance, etc Role is more public facing than most analytics roles so communication skills are important Ability to independently frame analysis, source data and drive to results, often in an ambiguous environment Sharp attention to detail; high personal standards for quality and thoroughness Self-starter, independently initiating and driving multiple simultaneous projects toward completion in a high-pressure environment High level of Microsoft Office skills are required with Word, Excel, and PowerPoint as well as a working knowledge of statistical analysis tools, data warehouses, and relational databases; SAS/R, SQL, and Tableau experience preferred #LI-NN1 Compensation: $55,800.00/Year - $98,000.00/Year From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our benefits on our careers website. Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test.

title: Data Engineer
description: Bachelors degree in software engineering or a relevant quantitative discipline 2+ years of experience with and detailed knowledge of data warehouse technical architectures, data modeling, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT and reporting/analytic tools and environments, data structures and hands-on SQL coding. 2+ years development experience in python or similar scripting language for automation 2+ years of work experience with ETL, Data Modeling, and Data Architecture with hundreds of terabytes of data 2+ years experience working with core AWS data and analytics services. Understand of the applicability, limitations, and trade offs between a wide set of AWS database and analytics technologies. 1+ years experience working with distributed computing and associated technologies such as Spark, EMR, etc. 2+ years experience with Redshift or very large DW environments. Tangible experience working with Redshift Spectrum, AWS Glue, DynamoDB, and S3 Strong grasp of SQL and at least one scripting or programming language. 2+ years of large IT project delivery for BI oriented projects Who we are We are part of AWS Product BI team. This team supports the business intelligence needs for Compute, Storage, Networking, Automation & Messaging, Management Tools and Developer Tools product families. We own the data, metrics and reporting for these orgs. We empower all our stakeholders to make data driven business decisions by providing Daily Reports, WBRs, Analyses/Narratives and Datasets. We innovate on behalf of our end-users to produce relevant Metrics, Automations and Tools to make Data and Insights actionable. “Nothing is beyond our reach” We operate by the slogan that “nothing is beyond our reach”. We think big. We sometimes find ourselves asking “how in the world is there no tool or solution for this?”, or “how have we managed to operate like this for so long?”. Our response in these moments, is “well, let’s fix it”. If the idea of pioneering solutions to unsolved problems from the ground up in uncharted territory sounds exciting to you, come join us! AWS produces an outrageous amount of data, and our org is seeking a data engineer to usher in a new generation of data management where data can be a first class citizen in our operations. AWS is looking for an excellent Data Engineer to join the AWS Product BI team. This is your opportunity to be a core part of the team that has direct impact on the day-to-day decision making in the many AWS Product teams like EC2, S3 and IoT. Since early 2006, AWS has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud. AWS is a high-growth, fast-moving division within Amazon with a start-up mentality where new and diverse challenges arise every day. On the AWS Product BI team you will be surrounded by people that are exceptionally talented, bright, and driven, and believe that world class BI is critical to our success. To help build this growing team, you should be highly analytical and possess a strong passion for analytics and accountability, set high standards with a focus on committed business success. We take working hard, having fun, and making history seriously. AWS sets the standard for functionality, cost, and performance for many cloud based services, but it’s still early days for cloud computing, and there are boundless opportunities to continue to redefine the world of cloud computing - come help us make history!As a Data engineer on this team, you will be a technical leader in our team, and own the technical architecture of our BI and Data platforms. You will get the exciting opportunity to work on very large data sets in one of the world's largest and most complex data warehouse environments. You will work closely with the business and technical teams in analysis on many non-standard and unique business problems and use creative-problem solving to deliver actionable output. Our team is serious about great design and redefining best practices with a cloud-based approach to scalability and automation. A successful candidate will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and an ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Roles and responsibilities: Designing, developing, troubleshooting, evaluating, deploying, and documenting data management and business intelligence systems, enabling stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions. Building secure, available, scalable, stable, and cost-effective data solutions using data storage technologies, distributed file system, data processing, and business intelligence best practices. Working with business customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing solutions to support analytical and reporting needs. Designing and planning for solutions in the various engineering subject areas as it relates to data storage and movement solutions: data warehousing, enterprise system data architecture, data design (e.g., Logical and Physical Modeling), data persistence technologies, data processing, data management, and data analysis. Ensuring completeness and compatibility of the technical infrastructure to support system performance, availability and architecture requirements Reviewing and participating in testing of the data design, tool design, data extracts/transforms, networks and hardware selections About Us Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. Experience in designing and delivering cross functional custom reporting solutions. Experience with Massively Parallel Processing (MPP) databases - Redshift, Teradata etc Experience with distributed systems and NoSQL databases - Experience with Big Data technologies e.g. Hadoop, Hive, Oozie, Presto, Hue, Spark, Scala and more! Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Proven ability to meet tight deadlines, multi-task, and prioritize workload - A work ethic based on a strong desire to exceed expectations. Excellent analytical skills Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success and we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: Senior Analyst - Data Science
description: Team Name: Job Title: Senior Analyst, Global Growth Marketing Analytics Requisition ID: R009680 Job Description: Job Title: Senior Analyst, Global Growth Marketing Analytics Reporting To: Director, Global Growth Marketing Analytics Department: Global Growth Marketing Location: Irvine, CA Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission This position is a business role that requires both technical skills and marketing knowledge. In this role, you will be responsible for measuring and optimizing user acquisition, user retention and personalization strategies by reporting marketing performance data, maintaining data pipelines, assuring data quality and analyzing audiences. You’ll also be heavily involved in the creation, curation, and analyses of audience data across several marketing platforms including Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Google Marketing Cloud, Facebook, Twitter, among others. The ideal candidate is a nimble problem solver and has a moderate understanding of the digital marketing ecosystem. COVID-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position and may remain remote for the duration of the contract. Key Responsibilities: Function as a decision-making partner to Global Growth Marketing and Game commercial teams Collaborate cross functionally to identify areas of growth opportunity and to develop capabilities to measure the impact of marketing on business outcomes Partner with Strategy, Activation, Commercial, and Data engineering teams to design and execute campaign-specific measurement plans Independently conduct analyses end to end starting with stakeholder interviews to presenting learnings Develop marketing experiments to better understand the business impact of marketing strategy and tactics. Build dashboards/reports to socialize marketing campaign performance and customer behavior data Scope projects, manage stakeholders’ expectations with the ability to push back when needed Effectively communicate analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences Player Profile Minimum Requirements: 5+ years of experience in marketing analytics roles supporting Paid media, Email, Push Notification, Web analytics Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field High proficiency in SQL Knowledge of scripting languages (R, Python) is a bonus Familiarity with visualization tools (Tableau) Familiarity with marketing technology (GCM, GA, Adobe Analytics, SFMC, Swrve, Singular, mParticle) and measurement tools (Mixpanel, Optimizely, Appsflyer) Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Business Analyst
description: Our Mission Happiest Baby is a mission-driven company helping parents raise healthy, happy children and saving lives. We make SNOO, the world's first smart sleeper and the safest baby bed ever made—proven to add 1-2 hours of sleep per night—and develop landmark products, content, and services. Our CEO is the renowned pediatrician, Dr. Harvey Karp, author of the best-selling parenting guide, "The Happiest Baby on the Block." SNOO was built with a team of MIT engineers and celebrated designers. It is the most awarded baby product in history and has been exhibited in six of the world's top museums (e.g., Smithsonian, SF MOMA, London Design Museum). Your Role: This role will report to the Associate Manager of Business Analysis and will play an integral part by supporting decision and projects with actionable data insights, reports and tools used to make key business decisions. The ideal candidate is passionate about Happiest Baby and E-commerce, has a strong analytical and consultative mindset, a deep understanding of financial and operational analysis, excellent modeling skills, excellent data visualization skills, the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment delivering against tight and dynamic deadlines, and a passion for scaling processes through automation. Duties and Responsibilities: Become an expert of our data and optimize our current processes, create new processes as needed, and seek out and build scalable automation solutions utilizing SQL, Tableau, Excel, and other tools that increase productivity Perform complex analysis of datasets and conduct regular data validation and governance Collecting and understanding business requirements and writing documentation Develop, structure, optimize, and maintain databases, dashboards, visualizations, and reports to assist with decision making in departments across the company Work with accounting and finance staff to ensure accurate data preparation of monthly closing items and support for the audit Act as a liaison between Finance and Accounting and Data Engineering to drive key operational metrics for enabling business success within the data and analytics domain Required Skills/Abilities: BA/BS with 1-3+ years experience in data analytics, financial analysis, or another discipline with similar analytical rigor Strong SQL Proficiency with joins, subqueries/temp tables, stored procedures, experience working with large datasets (Python is a plus) Demonstrate advanced MS Excel/spreadsheet skills (pivot tables, formula building, v-lookups, charts, power tools, etc.). Comfortable working with complex financial models Strong ability to model data to meet reporting requirements Data visualization/BI experience (Tableau a plus) Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational skills Solid presentation and technical and non-technical communication skills, both verbal and written A quick learner, a self-starter, able to work independently, and able to handle the pressures of an increasing level of responsibility Perks Competitive health/dental/eyecare plan 401(k) plan Daily catered lunches Take-what-you-need vacation Dog-friendly environment Indoor-outdoor workspace Working with a great team that is literally saving babies’ lives mYRITmjWQm Job Type: Full-time

description: Meraki Solar is seeking a senior level Brand Communications Director for their growing team. Excellent interpersonal communications skills Able to engage and manage people Self-Motivated to deliver high levels of performance excellence Capacity for creative and strategic thinking with an ability to execute Management of complex communications projects within a fast-paced, growing organization Technical Skills: Working knowledge of: Teamwork, Baseline or other time and task management software All Google applications including Analytics and Ads Manager Facebook Business Manager and other social platform analytics and insight reporting Powerpoint, Keynote or equivalent presentation
