OptumCare is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Job Keywords: Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Healthcare, Telecommute, Telecommuting, Telecommuter, Work From Home, Work At Home, Remote

title: Marketing Manager
description: Jergens, Inc. has been a strong presence in the manufacturing industry for over 75 years, becoming one of the world’s largest manufacturers of standard tooling components, vises and other workholding equipment. Jergens has career opportunities for anyone interested in manufacturing and we are looking for individuals who are motivated, team-oriented, and passionate about growing or starting their career in manufacturing! Our work culture: Jergens, Inc., is a privately owned manufacturer founded by the Schron Family in 1942. Headquartered in Cleveland, OH, Jergens has a global reach, with activities across 4 continents and 30+ countries around the world. Through the many changes over the past 75 years, one thing has remained a constant – the core values of Jergens. A dedication to: Honesty Hard work Excellence in all we do A commitment to family These values are the foundation upon which the company was built, the standard for how every Jergens employee conducts themselves today and will continue to set the direction into the future as we continue to grow our family of employees. About Jergens, Inc. Jergens, Inc. is comprised of 3 distinct business units: Workholding Solutions, Lifting Solutions and Specialty Fasteners. Building on its reputation of uncompromising quality standards, Jergens is committed to helping its customers achieve leaner, more profitable manufacturing, and continues to add products and engineered solutions for an integrated approach to “Manufacturing Efficiency.” To learn more about Jergens, Inc., visit us at www.jergensinc.com Also, be sure to check out our video to see what it's like to work at Jergens: https://youtu.be/UVkHTp6OH54 Benefits of Working at Jergens, Inc. Jergens offers employees Competitive compensation Comprehensive insurance benefits package (including medical, dental and vision coverage as well as company paid life insurance and disability) Tuition reimbursement Fun staff events and activities 401k plan with profit sharing Paid vacation time starting at 13 days 11 paid holiday Responsibilities Has a basic understanding of our company’s digital marketing service needs. Seeks assistance, as necessary with unfamiliar situations. Oversee organization-wide online advertising initiatives and the company’s social media strategy including Search Engine Marketing, brand advertising, social media advertising and customer engagement. Maintain messaging and branding consistency across online platforms. Develops, coordinates, and executes digital marketing campaigns by providing content messaging, coordinating with team members, managing deadlines, and communicating with key stakeholders. Recommend viable upgrades or changes to internal systems and digital marketing solutions for products and services. Assess performance metrics including project and campaign analytics, efficiency metrics, brand metrics, customer metrics, and overall return on investment for digital marketing initiatives and make recommendations based on findings. Perform writing, editing, and proofing of marketing materials, web content, social media posts, blogs and online advertising. Compile competitive information. Work with and manage external partners as needed to achieve digital marketing goals. Complete special projects as assigned. Observe good housekeeping and safety habits, follow Jergen’s policies and procedures and perform other duties as assigned. What will make a candidate successful: At least two years of formal training in a related field. A bachelor’s degree is preferred. Has the necessary training to be proficient in the position. Through related experience, has demonstrated the skills and ability to be an effective marketing specialist with the company. Must be proficient in graphics, web advertising, social media and web development. Has a thorough understanding of digital/social media marketing, digital production, web metrics, digital analytics, and the ability to analyze data. Proven experience delivering effective and innovative digital and social media campaigns. Has excellent communications and interpersonal skills to be able to interact effectively with other employees, vendors, customers, and other external contacts. Must have ability to work independently as well as in partnership with a team. Has excellent computer skills and is proficient with all related company systems and programs. Is analytical with an eye for detail. Is a self-starter and able to work with minimal management input. Demonstrates initiative and innovation. Has demonstrated sound judgment in dealing with difficult interpersonal situations. Must be extremely organized and detail oriented. Effective time management skills in prioritizing and addressing multiple and at times conflicting demands. Must be able to define and work to deadlines. High level of personal and professional integrity. Is committed to the company’s values. Attention to detail in maintaining required records and reports. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Referral program Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location

title: Data Analyst
description: South River Mortgage is one of the fastest-growing mortgage originators in the country, focused on helping American seniors find security in retirement. Our analytics department is expanding, and we are currently seeking a full-time Data Analyst to join the team at our headquarters in Annapolis, MD. Responsibilities: Derive insights from large and diverse data sets to tell compelling stories in order to guide strategic decision-making Develop and maintain machine learning models to optimize marketing strategies and business processes Collaborate with cross-functional teams across the organization to address analytic needs Identify opportunities to improve the customer experience throughout the loan process Run and optimize day-to-day business functions Qualifications: Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field with exposure to advanced statistical concepts Familiarity with R / Python for data analysis and modeling Data visualization Strong Verbal & Written communication skills Experience with MySQL Prior work experience preferred but not required. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $60,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Ability to commute/relocate: Annapolis, MD 21401: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Work Location: One location

title: Product Manager
description: Position Summary: We are seeking an experienced Data and Business Analyst to join the client's Product Marketing team. This role will support the product marketing function by gathering, maintaining, and reporting on measures of product marketing impact, including pipeline movement, competitive win/loss, and content performance. Top candidates will have excellent analytical and communication skills. They will possess a curiosity to discover trends and correlations that don’t just jump to the surface. They will have the skills and desire to create and maintain self-service analytical tools for others to use with easy navigation and the ability to view data from multiple perspectives. And they will be able to create presentations and confidently present insights to stakeholders. This role will report to a Sr. Director, Product Marketing. Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain high-quality reports and insights to measure pipeline movement, competitive win/loss, and content engagement and performance From the data, identify trends and anomalies and summarize for stakeholders Engage with sales reps to gather anecdotal data about competitive deals and buyer perceptions of the client and its competitors Partner with data services team to improve data quality and completeness; as needed, prescribe application and workflow changes to achieve this Maintain data augmentation outside of the systems to provide necessary details and filters for analysis Test dashboards and datasets provided by the data services team; provide input and feedback on dashboard designs Manage processes to gather, store, track, measure, analyze, evaluate, and distribute reports to optimize the productivity of these tasks Create and utilize data visualization tools (Microsoft Excel, Qlik) to ensure data analysis is easily consumable and provides a clear story and opportunity for action by stakeholders Additional Responsibilities Perform a variety of organizational and process tasks for continuous improvement of productivity and best practices within Product Marketing Qualifications: Education Bachelor's degree or higher in business or computer science, or comparable education/experience Experience 5+ years of experience with data analytics and tools Skills Highly analytical and capable of extracting business insights from data Exceptional Excel skills including linking to and importing external data sources, Pivot Tables, Power Pivot, advanced formulas, and macros Familiarity with creating and modifying SFDC reports and dashboards—earnest desire to become an expert Ability to prioritize and manage time on multiple concurrent projects Ability to deal with ambiguity, take high-level requirements, and independently get to the required level of granularity Demonstrated ability to work independently, and within a team environment with consistent follow up organization and prioritization skills, and excellent attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communication skills, particularly the ability to synthesize complex issues/scenarios into easy-to-understand concepts Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with corporate and field marketing team Preferred Qualifications Capability to engage with people across departments and levels to collaboratively share information and solve problems—work together to make tomorrow better than today A penchant for accuracy, an eye for detail, and a drive for doing things right (and the patience and persistence to help others get there over time) Positive working demeanor; a team player, willing to apply your skills and influence to improve the insights and productivity of the whole team Career Portal Published Date 2021-11-15 Experience 5+ years Primary Skills Highly analytical and capable of extracting business insights from data, Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with corporate and field marketing team, Develop and maintain high-quality reports and insights to measure pipeline movement, competitive win/loss, and content engagement and performance

title: Product Manager
description: Ready to help build a more sustainable future through electric vehicles? Then we want to talk to you! EV Connect believes in electricity as a fuel to help solve the challenges we face with climate change and pollution. That’s why we’ve developed the most flexible and reliable EV charging solutions on the market, giving businesses and organizations everywhere the resources they need to service a growing number of EV drivers. We are seeking a talented and seasoned Product Manager to drive the growth of our SaaS platform offering that connects charging stations, drivers, vehicles, sites, and utilities across a variety of smart charging applications and solutions. Your touch and vision will influence products that are transforming an industry and will power the future of EV charging. We're looking for a teammate who is resourceful, dedicated, and passionate about solving challenging problems. This role is for someone who loves diving into technical details while also driving overall strategy. Key Responsibilities: Deliver innovative products to solve the industry’s biggest challenges based on a deep understanding of customer needs, objectives and pain points Write product requirements / user stories and define Lean, metrics-driven milestones to validate assumptions and hypotheses and ensure the right product is being built Lead engineering and QA teams through the product development process, facilitating sprint grooming, planning and standup sessions Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products Maintain product / user documentation, planning and writing new documentation as products evolve Plan and oversee product rollouts, working closely with marketing and providing assets and talking points for sales & marketing collateral, creating training materials, and developing any other materials needed to enable customers, sales and customer support Participate in the development of RFP responses Support sales and customer support teams as a key technical advisor Position Requirements: 2+ years in SaaS product management, working cross-functionally with engineering, QA, and design teams in a fast-paced environment A BIG thinker with strong track record of creating world class customer experience with technology products Strong executor that can push through obstacles and challenges to get to the finish line while maintaining impeccable quality and integrity Experience with Agile Scrum and Lean methodologies Experience using analytics, user research and other approaches to make decisions and iterate on the product Excellent verbal and written communication skills and proven ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals Collaborative team player with great listening skills and willingness to go above and beyond to get the job done Continuous desire to hone your craft and learn / incorporate best practices Bachelor’s degree in Computer Software, Engineering or equivalent work experience About EV Connect: EV Connect is the home of the most innovative, robust, and feature-rich cloud-based software platform for managing electric vehicle (EV) charging stations, their interaction with utilities and the driver experience. The world’s largest companies from enterprise, to hospitality and retail, to universities and government facilities leverage the EV Connect platform to bring simplicity and flexibility to their EV charging initiatives. Established in 2009, EV Connect customers include Yahoo!, Marriott, Hilton, Western Digital, Electrify America, ADP, Los Angeles Metropolitan Transportation Authority, New York Power Authority, and numerous municipalities. For more information, please visit www.evconnect.com and follow us on twitter @EVConnect and LinkedIn and Facebook. Our Benefits and Perks: Paid time off (vacation and flex time), covered parking, free EV charging, office one block from Metro stop, health insurance, life insurance, dental insurance, 401k, telecommuting options, workplace perks such as free healthy snacks, drinks and coffee.

title: Data Scientist
description: Responsibilities: The NAVAIR Digital Group leads the digital transformation of NAVAIR and works to accelerate and scale digital/analytic technologies and capabilities across the NAVAIR Enterprise as a means to increase speed in the delivery and sustainment of warfighting capability. The Digital Group delivers and executes command-wide strategies that align activities and provides the workforce with agile self-service infrastructure, data accessibility, visualization and analytic tools, and digital/IT services to rapidly research, create, deploy, integrate, and maintain, applications, enterprise solutions, and other digital capabilities. NAVAIR’s digital transformation will require leveraging advanced digital tools to implement fundamentally different business models across all business, technology development, workforce, and mission operation domains. NAVAIR is committed to a digital culture that empowers the workforce to accelerate, innovate, collaborate, develop, and deliver capabilities to meet mission outcomes. Selected candidate will: Develop analytics methods and processes; identifies appropriate methods and tools to extract knowledge from data; leverages large volumes of data to answer challenges; prepares data for use in predictive and prescriptive modeling (data cleansing); automates organizational work through scripts for data processing and analytics; develops and applies algorithms and machine learning methods; applies analytic methods and software tools to design and develop analytic programs; performs mathematical modeling. Interact with the government customer, military personal and other contractors as required Qualifications: Bachelors degree is required in related filed, plus Three (3) to Ten (10) years of experience Candidate is required to pass a background Investigation Security+ certification is required. Security Clearance Requirements: An active DoD secret clearance is required or higher Overview: Sabre Systems, Inc. is a quality driven, customer focused large business providing innovative solutions in the areas of Cyber, C4ISR, Business Intelligence and Data Analytics, and Enterprise Modernization to federal and civilian customers. Our mission is to ensure our customers have the technology, services, and expertise to overcome threats, maintain superiority, and quickly adapt to emerging obstacles. At Sabre, we're more than just a job - we're a team - and we care for and nurture our employees like family. If you want to be a part of creating and implementing enduring solutions that transform mission challenges into mission success – join Sabre! Sabre provides an excellent benefits package, which includes healthcare, paid days off, tuition reimbursement, and a 401K plan. We respect the unique perspectives that a diverse workforce of minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans brings not only to our company, but also to our customers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability or gender information. EOE: Minorities/Females/Disability/Veterans; VEVRAA Federal Contractor LI #PH As a Government Contractor, all Sabre employees must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 per Government regulation. Unless you have a medical and/or religious exemption, you will be required to be vaccinated in order to meet the requirements of working for Sabre Systems, Inc. Job Type: Full-time Work Location: Multiple Locations

title: Product Manager
description: Scope: Responsible for the execution of the master production schedule - assure components are on order, through inspection for raw material & through manufacturing for sub-assemblies, and on hand so that manufacturing orders start on time. All issues that will hinder manufacturing orders starting on time - identify, communicate, solve. Duties and Responsibilities: Owner ship of medium complexity established product lines, programs, planner codes Reschedule of manufacturing orders as required - direction from the master scheduler Report status of planned and released orders. Responsible for oversight of material disposition of all RCNs. Participate as necessary in MRB, M0R's, and other evaluation and disposition Modifying manufacturing orders / routers as required Cycle counts of manufacturing orders Participate in physical inventory - throughout the year and at year end Essential Knowledge and Skills: Demonstrated ability to lead and achieve results through others Thorough understanding of MRP and the planning process Strong computer skills, strong excel skills, basic analytics Formal root cause/ corrective action training Experience working in a lean manufacturing / continuous improvement manufacturing environment - Green Belt certification preferred. Ability to lead C.I. Projects. Education and Experience: Degree Field: Business, Accounting, Supply Chain 2-4 Years Relevant Experience Export Statement: Must comply with TTM Export Control Policies and Procedures and all applicable laws including ITAR, EAR and OFAC including but not limited to: a) being able to identify ITAR product on the manufacturing floor and understand that access to these products and related technical data is restricted to only US Citizens and US Permanent Residents; b) recognition of Foreign Person visitors by badge differentiation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability or protected veteran status

title: Product Manager
description: Upwork ($UPWK) is the world's work marketplace. We help connect companies large and small with top independent talent from around the world. Simply put, our mission is to create economic opportunities so people have better lives. Every year, more than $2 billion of work is done through Upwork by skilled independent professionals who want the freedom of working anytime, anywhere. The Trust & Safety team seeks to deliver the trustworthy, safe, and inclusive work marketplace that sparks a global movement to reimagine work. As our Product Manager responsible for user experience, verification, and enforcement systems, you'll help shape how we protect the work marketplace of the future. You'll drive the roadmap for Identity Verification, design more friendly customer experiences when we work to remediate violations, and build the platform infrastructure needed to sustain a safe marketplace far into the future. Your Responsibilities: Build a prioritized roadmap that modernizes our identity verification experience and improves our users' experiences when Trust & Safety violations occur, to help keep Upwork's community safe. Collaborate with partners in design, engineering, marketing, research, sales, legal, and analytics to execute against that roadmap, rigorously testing hypotheses and iterating as you learn Build a strategic vision that maps the projects we build into a broader ecosystem of systems and tools to support the future needs of Upwork Trust & Safety. Deliver measurable results that show progress in improving customer experiences while reducing fraud and abuse on Upwork What it takes to catch our eye: Fluency in crafting sophisticated 'iceberg' systems, with small user-facing surface areas masking high engineering complexity (potentially acquired as a product manager, technology consultant, software engineer or architect) Empathy for customers and an understanding of how to work with designers to deliver experiences that surprise and delight customers while creating friction and blocks for bad actors Ability to synthesize quantitative and qualitative data to frame problems and develop solutions Ability to get things done and drive impact within a cross-functional team Flexibility to adapt to constantly evolving goals and priorities Come change how the world works. At Upwork, you'll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also support hiring of corporate full-time employees in 15 states in the United States. Please speak with a member of our recruitment team to determine whether you are located in a state in which we are hiring corporate full-time employees. Our vibrant culture is built on shared values and our mission to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster amazing teams, put our community first, and have a bias toward action. We encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work and grow together through development opportunities, mentorship, and employee resource groups. Oh yeah, we've also got amazing benefits. Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about the employee experience. Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. The Trust & Safety team seeks to deliver the trustworthy, safe, and inclusive work marketplace that sparks a global movement to reimagine work. As our Product Manager responsible for user experience, verification, and enforcement systems, you'll help shape how we protect the work marketplace of the future. You'll drive the roadmap for Identity Verification, design more friendly customer experiences when we work to remediate violations, and build the platform infrastructure needed to sustain a safe marketplace far into the future. #LI-Remote

title: Product Manager
description: Who is Credible? We believe life's changes create financial needs for people and that the traditional financial system often puts up unnecessary obstacles. People celebrate major milestones like going to college, getting married, and buying a home. And most of the time, these milestones come with financial implications. At Credible, we have built a company with the mission of bringing transparency, choice, simple processes and savings to accessing credit for life's important moments. What you see is what you get. We are committed to being upfront, honest, and clear about your options. There are no mysteries, no hidden fees, and no secret clauses. Credible is a fast-growing Fintech company that has world class management, has raised multiple rounds of funding, is generating significant revenue and is disrupting the lending market and helping people save money and get out of debt faster. About the Role: Credible is looking for a user-centric, data-driven, results-oriented Product Manager to join our team. This is an opportunity for you to own key aspects of the product and have a real impact on the users we serve. This is a great opportunity for you to join a growth-stage company and shape the direction of the product. The role is full time and compensation will be based on experience. Responsibilities: Own features from conception to launch, working directly with our design, engineering and QA teams to deliver improvements to our product Develop a deep understanding of user behavior and product metrics, looking for ways to improve key product metrics and our user experience Work in a dynamic environment where iterating quickly is critical Help establish and conduct user research sessions Collaborate with our growth, marketing, partnership and operations teams to support product launches Set aggressive goals and meet them Take ownership of hard problems, and find novel solutions Education and Experience: At least 2 years of experience in a Product Management role for web-based consumer Internet products Bachelor's Degree Ability to use data, your experience and product instincts to identify the most impactful areas of focus Strong analytical abilities, including experience with Excel and other analytics tools Strong project management skills, and willingness/ability to own critical parts of the product, end-to-end Technical aptitude - whether through education or experience, it's important that you can work closely with engineers to evaluate different approaches to implementing product features, weighing cost/benefit tradeoffs Nice to Have: Passion for creating exceptional user experiences that address real user needs Strong problem solving skills with ability to simplify the complex Thrive on collaboration with other teams to accomplish shared goals Resourceful and mindful; you move fast but don't break things Possess a build-measure-learn iterative mindset Strong communication skills Why work at Credible? We are a fast moving, fun-loving, seriously smart group of people who really care about impacting the lives of our customers. We empower our employees to make decisions, take risks, drive our business and make changes when we don't get it right. These are our values: Exceed Customer Expectations: We provide an exceptional experience to each and every customer that compels them to share it with others. Take Ownership: We are trusted to make decisions that are in the best interests of our customers and our business. We think and act like owners. We care – and that makes all the difference. Be Curious: We are curious, ask questions, seek to understand and try new things. Do the Right Thing: We earn trust by being transparent, respectful and honest with each person with whom we interact. Get Results: Results fuel our excitement and we know how our personal accomplishments tie to the success of the company. Be Bold: We are courageous and take risks that scare us. Our enthusiasm for experimenting is how we will find the next breakthrough. Our benefits: We offer competitive compensation, generous benefits, free food and a flexible vacation policy. But mainly, you want to work at Credible because you believe in our mission and want to have a major role in delivering on it! We look forward to getting to know you. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. #LI-CM1

title: Data Analyst
description: We’re looking for a highly motivated, detail-oriented, insightful, and experienced analyst with a proven ability to deliver value through analytics. We are based in Austin, TX, but this position can be 100% remote. What That Means You will play a key role in the team responsible for most of the company’s revenue, by making a meaningful contribution toward improving our valuations and sales at automotive auctions. Your responsibilities will include: Work closely with our Project Director of Auction Sales Analyze data from a variety of sources and produce actionable business insights Make business and pricing recommendations based on data analysis Pull in data from multiple sources "ETL” and mine the data, looking for patterns to make the business more profitable Build reports and visualizations for stakeholders Provide intelligence for tests and experiments Collaborate across multiple teams including developers What You’ll Need 5+ years of experience working as an analyst, and have a proven track record of adding value through analytics Be able to articulate when/how you added value for business units Experience influencing others to improve effectiveness Advanced capabilities in digging into data at various stages of readiness using SQL and/or Python Advanced ability to communicate observations and action from the data with visualization applications (Tableau, Domo) Strong grasp on statistical concepts with experience putting these into practice Experience with testing and experimentation, and their analysis An aptitude for going beyond the data: how a business runs and what drives profit Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong attention to detail A creative problem-solving mindset ready to tackle the cutting edge Well-rounded technological capability (Atlassian and Salesforce experience a plus) What You’ll Get A hip downtown office in Austin, Texas at 6th Street & Congress Access to robust health, vision, dental, and life insurance plans Employer matching 401(k) plan Generous PTO (Paid Time Off) Tuition reimbursement Donation matching program Paid parental leave Remote work opportunities Complimentary fitness & wellness membership Free weekly lunches Student loan assistance Employee recognition programs Who We Are Peddle is a modern car buying service that makes selling any car fast, easy, and awesome. Sellers simply answer a few questions about the vehicle they are looking to sell and are instantly presented with a guaranteed offer. To complete the sale, Peddle sends a carrier to pick up the vehicle and pay the Seller. Peddle’s buyer network consists of top licensed retail and salvage dealers across the country that buy used cars for resale, parts, or scrap. Buyers can place pre-set bids, based on the types of vehicles they would like to buy, which get factored into Peddle’s instant offers.

title: Data Scientist
description: At Kia, we’re creating award-winning products and redefining what value means in the automotive industry. It takes a special group of individuals to do what we do, and we do it together. Our culture is fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative. Our people thrive on thinking differently and challenging the status quo. We are creating something special here, a culture of learning and opportunity, where you can help Kia achieve big things and most importantly, feel passionate and connected to your work every day. Kia provides team members with competitive benefits including premium paid medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) plan matching of 100% up to 6% of the salary deferral, and time off starting at 14 days per year. Kia also offers company lease and purchase programs, company-wide holiday shutdown, paid volunteer hours, and premium lifestyle amenities at our corporate campus in Irvine, California. Status Exempt Summary We are greatly pleased to announce our search for a resourceful and experienced data scientist to join our fast-growing Kia United States (KUS) Big Data Center. This position will play an important role in executing data analysis for Kia North America’s regional subsidiaries (KUS/KCA/KaGA/KMX). A future-driven automotive company, Kia has access to vast and diverse datasets and are excited to fill this position with an individual that can derive business improvements and insight from this data. Strong applicants for this role will have statistics, machine learning, and computer science skills to leverage high-performance compute clusters as well as perform reproducible data analysis at scale. With these requirements in mind, our mindset is that data, analytics, automation, and responsible AI can revolutionize our many lines of business. Major Responsibilities Priority Major Responsibility % 1st Data Wrangling and Analysis Assess the accuracy of new data sources Understand the relationship between the data and the business process Preprocess structured and unstructured data Analyze large amounts of data to discover trends and patterns Build prediction and classification models Coordinate with different functional teams for feature engineering 30% 2nd Assess, Visualize and Improve Analysis Test and continuously improve the accuracy of statistical and machine learning models Present information using Python and/or dashboards Simplify and explain complex stats in an intuitive manner Continuously monitor and validate production analysis results 30% 3rd Collaborate IT Team to deploy analysis results Build REST APIs for data and analysis result consumption Assist the IT system developers to deploy analysis as a service 20% 4th Clear Documentation, VCS, and Reproducible Analysis Use git within Gitlab Create conda, venv, etc to isolate project dependencies and requirements Track model performance and hyperparameter configurations with mlflow Track data versioning with dvc 20% Education/Certification Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in related field of technology required Certification(s) in data analysis field is highly desirable Master’s degree in data analysis preferred Overall Experience Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages (SQL, Python) Experience using Hadoop echo system (Hadoop, Hive, Impala and Spark etc.) Experience with Dask; dask-ml and dask.DataFrames Experience using statistics, machine learning and deep learning algorithms Experience visualizing data using visualization tools (Power BI, MicroStrategy, Tableau etc.) Directly Related Experience 3+ years of experience preferred Web scraping (preferred) Skills Coding Knowledge and experience with several languages : Python, SQL, Docker, Javascript/Typescript Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL etc.) to handle data Knowledge and experience with NLP (natural language processing) Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques including deep learning Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques Social network analysis Strong problem solving skills based on data analysis Understanding big data analysis technique: Map/Reduce, Hadoop echo system, Spark etc. Competencies CHALLENGE - Solving Complex Problems COLLABORATION - Building and Supporting Teams CUSTOMER - Serving Customers GLOBALITY - Showing Community and Social Responsibility PEOPLE - Interacting with People at Different Levels Equal Employment Opportunities KUS provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, including pregnancy and childbirth and related medical conditions, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, legally protected physical disability or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, family care or medical leave status, protected veteran or military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. KUS complies with applicable law governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which KUS has offices. The KUS EEO policy applies to all areas of employment, including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits, discipline, termination and all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment. Disclaimer: The above information on this job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification and for this position. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

title: Business Analyst
description: Randa Apparel & Accessories is one of the world’s leading fashion clothing and accessories companies, spanning 11 countries, with a portfolio of 30 brands including Levi’s, Tommy Hilfiger, Calvin Klein, Dickies and over 100 years of industry leadership. From the #1 dress pant brand in North America to the #1 belt and wallet, RAA produces exceptional products and services worldwide, delighting customers and making partners successful. Position Overview: The Business Analyst-Project Manager is responsible for managing projects and performing analysis of business processes, applications, and systems. The PMO manages projects in the area of ERP enhancements, ERP migrations, WMS improvements, forecasting software support, order fulfillment process improvement, Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), and other business initiatives. The position will also be responsible for developing and creating business requirements, documentation, and project plans. This individual will write and update status reports for projects, share with users and departmental management. Additionally, this position will need to provide critical metrics on processes and assist in reviewing performance analysis to help business leaders make more intelligent and data-driven decisions. Essential Role Functions: Create and maintain project plans/task lists, including milestones, tasks, dependencies, and deliverables using processes/tools appropriate for the complexity level of the project. Drive due dates and task completion for business and technology teams Lead project meetings with stakeholders, users, and technical teams. Understand business and system processes. Analyze different business metrics and conduct gap analysis and process optimization. Maintain Issues and Risks logs, proactively monitoring and coordinating to resolve issues and risks in a timely manner. Meet with business team members to discuss and assist with project requests and work with developers to determine technical feasibility and scope of projects. Maintain project documentation through the project’s lifecycle Act as a liaison between business and technology teams to drive and facilitate requirement and design sessions and clarifications throughout the project lifecycle. Strong analytical, organization and communication skills accompanied by flexibility to quickly adapt in a fast paced, changing environment. Create both user workflows, and technical documentation. Perform other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of the activities enumerated above. Minimum Qualifications: 3-5 years experience as a business analyst or project manager Knowledge of various project management methodologies including Kanban, Critical Path Method (CPM), Integrated Project Management (IPM) and others. Proficiency in Office365 Well versed in the use of various project management tools: Microsoft Project, Monday.com, Smartsheets, etc… Managed both small and larger cross departmental projects. Clear and strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Excellent time management and problem-solving skills Experiencing with data measuring, analytics, and reporting. College degree Bonus Qualifications Knowledge of UniquePLM – Gerber Technology Experience with Apparel Business Solutions (ABS) Skill using John Galt’s DME Forecasting software Experience in ERP, Forecasting, Warehouse Management and customer service in a pick and pack shipping environment PMP Certification Strong operational and development knowledge using Business Intelligence tools (Power BI) Working Environment: Work in an office environment. What we Offer: Competitive base salary. Three weeks of paid time off within the first year of employment. Company provided life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, and paid parental leave. Health, vision, and dental insurance options with low employee contributions. Commuter benefit plan. Optional supplemental life insurance, pet insurance, and accident & critical illness insurance offered at a group discount rate. 401(k). Unlimited access to our award-winning online fitness, and wellness program. A great place to work, fast-paced, with terrific career growth. #LI-180793916_LS1

title: Marketing Manager
description: We’re hiring for a dynamic marketing coordinator to bring our brand to the next level. As a member of the marketing team, you’ll assist the marketing manager with the implementation and execution of marketing campaigns through promotional materials, creative content, advertising strategies, and social media. The ideal candidate for this position balances creativity with structure, can effectively work with a team to bring great ideas to life, and is committed to on-brand quality work. If you can’t wait to get started, we want you on our team.Compensation: $13 - $16 yearly Responsibilities: Write social media content, web content, blogs, and other copy that contributes to our overall marketing strategy and goals Oversee website, mailing lists, analytics, and SEO to ensure content is regularly updated with the most recent information Help marketing staff achieve our goals through the implementation of advertising, digital, and communication plans Regularly update social media and respond to followers Deliver reports on monthly analytics across web and social platforms and advise on improvements Qualifications: 2+ years of experience in Marketing or related field Should be an experienced communicator with solid project management skills Candidate should have their finger on the pulse of the current marketing landscape Strong understanding of web and email systems, public relations, brand messaging, and social platforms Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related majors About Company Strata Group, is a fast-growing and dynamic real estate team serving the Central Florida market. Come join our team!

title: Financial Analyst
description: We offer great benefits, paid holidays and vacations, a generous company match for 401(k) plans, and an encouraging work environment. Our Bloomington office offers several perks including an on-site gym, on-site cafeteria, free airport shuttle, free covered parking, and adjacent to major metro transit lines! Job Summary This is a highly visible and critical role within the Naviga Finance team. The Financial Analyst will be responsible for P&L analysis, reporting, budgeting and forecasting, with a focus on operational costs across the organization. You will be involved in real-time analysis and interact directly with Executives, including the CFO and CEO, on a regular basis. Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities Coordinate and assist in production of recurring reporting packages on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis, focusing on key financial results, operational metrics, and performance to targets, quotas and budget. Analyze trends in key performance indicators including all areas of expenses and operations, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variances and refining forecasts. Utilize Adaptive Insights financial system to develop and improve automated reporting and analytics. Communicate effectively and proactively with internal stakeholders, including C-Level Executives, to ensure information is presented logically and consistently. Provide financial modeling and scenario analysis as required. Complete special projects as assigned, including financial modeling of business initiatives, implementation of changes to reporting methodology and evaluation / re-engineering of recurring processes. All other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Desired Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance or other analytical discipline 0-2 years of experience in a related field, preferred Proficiency in Excel, including use of pivot tables, advanced functions and ability to analyze and reconcile large datasets efficiently Analytical aptitude, business mindset, curiosity / desire to learn, personal pride in work product Interest in working in a fast-paced environment with frequent change and endless opportunity to learn and make a real impact Strong communication skills with the ability to present results of complex analysis clearly and effectively to a wide range of stakeholders Strong organization skills with the ability to independently manage multiple projects and deliverables against deadlines Experience with business intelligence tools such as Adaptive Insights and Salesforce

title: Data Analyst
description: eBay Inc. is a global commerce leader that connects millions of buyers and sellers around the world. We exist to enable economic opportunity for individuals, entrepreneurs, businesses and organizations of all sizes. eBay Marketplaces operates in 190 markets around the world. Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where one can be onthe team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay – a company you can be proud to be a part of. About the team: The Global Collections analytics team is responsible for delivering business insights and performance insights for Collections and Treasury. In this role, you will be reporting to the Analytics Manager of Global Collections. We are looking for a hardworking, highly talented and self-motivated data analyst to join the team. The team currently supports all functions of Treasury: Global Collections, the FX team, Cash management, Investments, insurance and Procurement. This role will provide analysis and insights on current performance and determine ways to improve performance and strategy. The individual will analyze data from several sources, build statistical models, develop queries, and develop visualizations to support team efforts. Characteristics: In this role the Data Analyst will: Deliver insights into customers, processes and products to drive improvements in collections and reduce bad debt for eBay Design eye-catching visualizations in Tableau and build supporting calculations for all areas of Collections and Treasury (Establishing connection to live data sources, understanding measures and dimensions, developing dashboards and publishing it to the server) Maintain and enhance existing Tableau dashboards (self-serve reporting) and provide insights and understanding on how to interpret dashboard data to drive decisions and understand performance Develop SQL queries, database tables and schemas to extract data for both analysis and model construction and support the organization of data Write SQL queries and perform ETL that uses time/space efficiently Perform exploratory data analysis to develop hypotheses on operational performance Write python code to create automation and ETLs that support the automated refresh of data tables. Understand line commands to establish connection to servers and use Git version control commands to manage the team's code repository Perform loss analyses when vital to measure expected/actual bad debt impact due to new products as well as product gaps Support critical metrics and build self-serve reporting that will strengthen decision quality through meaningful data Partner with other cross functional teams within eBay to use standard methodology, share data analysis, and establish business cases Support collections team in the implementation of a new CRM tool Basic Qualifications If you work well in a fast-paced and evolving environment, learn quickly and possess extensive analytics experience, this is a role to consider! Should demonstrate the ability to breakdown processes, deliver on time, work with minimal oversight and look for immediate opportunities. We need someone who will scope and size things globally, recommend solutions that are scalable and balanced while considering future growth expectations for the company. Having Experience developing Tableau dashboards with a deep understanding of associated data architecture trade-offs will be key. Collections and Loss Financial Data Analysis Experience is preferred but it is not required. Remember, we provide opportunities to learn and grow! +2 years Analytics/database experience in Collections, Tech, Financial Services or Consulting desirable Experience with Big Data technology: Hadoop framework, Hive, Spark, etc. a plus Experience in SQL, NoSQL databases 1-2 years of experience using Tableau Advanced Excel skills and Unix/command line commands, and version control (such as Git) Intermediate to Advanced proficiency in Python Basic understanding of SAS Experience using machine learning techniques like segmentation is preferred Experience with Marketplace business model is a plus Excellent communications skills, collaborating with the team and influencing business outcomes across a matrixed environment Experience communicating the results of analyses with presentation to wider audience Collaborating with team members across various time zones Experience working with people from a diverse set of backgrounds and global teams BA/BS degree require We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Benefits: Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important. Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about eBay’s Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/ eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes CO, HI, NM)" excludes Colorado, Hawaii and New Mexico.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Department VP COMMUNICATIONS & MARKETING (UA-VPCM-IUBLA) Department Information IU Studios is the central Marketing and Communications unit at Indiana University, and includes the University Events and Conferences teams. Our insights and technology-driven teams serve as strategic consultants throughout the university, with a central mission to create experiences that lead to a lifelong love for IU. Job Summary Department-Specific Responsibilities: The IU Office of the Vice President for Communications and Marketing seeks a Business Intelligence Analyst who reports directly to the Analytics Leader and is tasked with helping evolve our usage of the Enterprise Datorama Marketing Intelligence Platform by managing data from marketing campaigns and other sources, as well as supporting data needs on other business intelligence platforms. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for supporting our data collection, management, analysis, and reporting processes and execution. Works with relevant stakeholders to gather data, maintain the Enterprise Datorama platform and provide support to meet the teams’ data analytics and reporting needs. This role will present data visually in a meaningful way that enhances the university’s ability to understand and act on the information. Develops, documents, and implements the team’s data management processes and usage. This position will: Work in collaboration with other teams including, but not limited to, paid media, brand teams, among others, and determine data, reports, analytics, training, documentation, and service requirements. Create, deliver and update visualizations that support the organization’s reporting needs. Apply analytical thinking to identify key trends and opportunities to improve business-related decisions and processes. Generate ad-hoc reports to support the university’s recruitment and marketing initiatives. General Responsibilities: Conducts experienced assessments to understand client business needs and strategic direction and identifies technology solutions to achieve goals; consults with IT staff and business users to identify, analyze, refine and document business requirements and processes and develop associated solutions. Facilitates and leads interviews, focus groups, and workshops to establish current and future business requirements; coordinates the communication between stakeholders and service owners in order to effectively implement solutions. Performs experienced business analyses, including construction of data models, business use cases, process flows and technical specifications for transition to IT solutions; establishes system requirements through functional and technical assessments of existing software. Provides stakeholders with necessary analysis documentation for buy-in, leadership decision, and implementation; conducts walk-throughs of recommended system functionality and prototypes with business users in small group or large group settings. Ensures uniform documentation presentation and content structure including, but not limited to, online documentation. Develops test plans and conducts system/integration testing; can test changes, enhancements, and new programs or functions to ensure they meet business needs. Qualifications EDUCATION Required Bachelor's degree (preferably in analytic or computer related field). Preferred Master’s degree. Degree in Business Administration, Business Analytics, Informatics, Computer Science, or a related discipline. WORK EXPERIENCE Required 2 years of business analysis experience working on complex problems and producing concrete, actionable solutions. Preferred Experience in Datorama, Tableau, Google Data Studio or similar platforms. Combinations of related education and experience may be considered. SKILLS Required Proficient communication skills. Maintains a high degree of professionalism. Demonstrated time management and priority setting skills. Demonstrates a high commitment to quality. Possesses flexibility to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Seeks to acquire knowledge in area of specialty. Highly thorough and dependable. Demonstrates a high level of accuracy, even under pressure. Service-oriented and skilled in providing positive, friendly customer service. Preferred Demonstrated expertise in data visualization techniques for reporting purposes. Ability to understand complex business processes and problems and identify relevant data sets. Ability to quickly troubleshoot and resolve problems and find creative, scalable technical solutions. Excellent interpersonal and problem solving skills. Comfort in navigating ambiguity with a can-do attitude. Experience with SQL, data modeling, and automation a plus. High level of comfort with learning new data tools desired. Working Conditions / Demands This role requires the ability to effectively communicate and to operate a computer and other standard office productivity equipment. The position involves sedentary work as well as periods of time moving around an office environment and the campus. The person in this role must be able to perform the essential functions with or without an accommodation. Work Location Bloomington Indiana or Indianapolis Indiana.
