title: Director Business Analyst
description: Overview: The Director of Financial Planning and Analysis will provide financial and business support within the Landmark Health organization. The primary responsibility of this position will be supporting the Landmark Health finance team with budgeting, financial planning, forecasting and analysis. Opportunity is Full Time Remote, will to consider candidates based on Locations: Locations Responsibilities: Serves as principle owner of Landmark’s budget process and systems. Oversees the timely development of annual budgets, including interactions with Landmark leadership to assist in preparation of business unit or administrative department budgets. Prepares multiple periodic financial reports and presentations for various audiences on a timely basis. Coordinates with all levels of management and departments to gather, analyze, summarize and prepare recommendations regarding financial plans, trended future requirements and operating forecasts Assists in the preparation of studies, reports, analyses and recommendations in areas such as budgets, forecasts, financial plans, governmental requirements, statistical reports and business forecasts Conducts special studies to analyze financial actions and prepare recommendations for company policy, procedure, control or action. Interprets financial policies, governmental legislation Prepares reports that track financial status by monitoring variances from plan, prior periods, and other benchmarks. Interacts with business unit and administrative department management to share drivers of variances and related recommended actions, and to increase the overall financial acumen of Landmark management. Increases productivity by developing automated applications, eliminating duplications, coordinating information requirements Provides information to management by assembling and summarizing data, preparing reports, and analyzing information gathered to ensure it meets management’s needs and eliminating ineffective reports by communicating frequently with users of prepared reports Supports the development of financial models and analytics for potential future clients. Manages multiple reporting requirements and ensure deadlines are met Ad hoc information gathering, analysis, reporting, as needed Performs other related duties as directed by supervisor Qualifications: Bachelor’s or 4-year college degree required, MBA preferred At least 8 to 10 years budgeting, planning and analytics experience required At least 5 years’ experience in healthcare required Required skills – Advanced MS Excel, Access, PowerPoint and SQL. Strong data analysis; attention to detail; and communication skills. Presentation and reporting experience. #LI-MR1 Company Statement: We are now part of Optum and the United Health Group family of businesses, backed by the resources of a global health organization working to help people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone. As part of our hiring process, upon accepting an offer, candidates will be required to complete a 9-panel drug test. Due to our partnership with the Medicare Advantage program, our drug testing policies are consistent with Federal law. Please be aware that Landmark Health does not solicit money or offer payment for job applications, nor do we ask candidates to email or submit any personal information over unsecured channels. Landmark Health requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.

title: Product Manager
description: 1+ years of experience with end to end product delivery Experience directly managing teams of 3 or more Experience owning roadmap strategy and definition Experience owning feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product Experience with product cycles of 6+ months 7+ years of experience in product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology Bachelor's Degree 3+ years of experience managing teams If you love sport and solving big customer problems, then Amazon Advertising’s Principal PM of Live Sports Ad Innovation is an amazing opportunity for a role that lies at the intersection of your interests. With broadcast agreements around the world including the NFL’s Thursday Night Football in the US and The English Premier League in the UK, Amazon Prime Video is delivering the future of Live Sports for our Prime customers. Advertising is a crucial part of our success in Live Sports. We are endeavoring to build a world-class live sports ad program that benefits our customers, advertisers and league partners with unique, never-been-done-before ad experiences. Live sports on Amazon offers viewers will allow customers to watch events on any device, including televisions, and across multiple distribution channels including Prime Video, Twitch and other first-party streaming apps. This capability opens up new opportunities for advertising to customers that is less interruptive to the content viewing experience while still driving impact for advertisers. In this role, you own defining the ad experiences that show up in and around live sports outside of the standard 15/30 second commercial spots. You will develop new-to-Amazon products like squeeze backs, overlays and other typical live sports ad units as well as innovating on new placements such as in the Prime Video App, on Fire TV and in Amazon X-ray. You will partner closely with the production teams and ideate monetization options within the broadcast. You will also partner with sales and advertisers to understand their motivations and how best to marry Amazon’s live sports assets with advertiser objectives The leader in this role must stay well-informed about trends in live sports broadcasting and advertising, as well as innovations from Amazon’s internal advertising teams. They must address feedback from clients and sales partners and prioritize their resources to deliver on commitments to their partners. They will establish goals for the organization, will create mechanisms to manage the goals and are responsible for providing visibility across the organization on the program vision, goals and success. Core Responsibilities 1. Advertiser Engagement: Engage with advertisers to deeply understand their current and emerging needs. Video is rapidly evolving and the leader in the video program needs to develop customer insight to identify solutions and invent on behalf of their customer. 2. Set Program Vision: Articulate a long-term vision for the program including the product vision and plan and business strategy. Align the organization around the vision and identify dependencies on other portions of the organization removing or influencing those dependencies to achieve the vision. 3. Product Development: Lead product development and go-to-market which includes capturing VoC, product requirements, new product development, definition of a clear value proposition and sales strategy for our existing products and defining the go-to-market plans for new products. 4. Partnership with Production teams: Developing innovative ad experiences will require you to partner with and influence the production teams to innovate on the production and so you can capture requirements. It is crucial that we account for each these requirements while also delivering on advertiser goals. 5. Partnership with Sales teams: Delivery against campaign goals is the key determination of customer satisfaction and renewal. You need to partner with sales to develop a deep understanding of client objectives and account for these needs in our feature development. 6. Strategy authorship: Write 1, 4 and 6 page documents communicating your plans to internal stakeholders from across and at all levels within Amazon. This includes monthly and quarterly business reviews and as lead author for OP1. 5+ experience working in streaming media, especially in live event streaming. 5+ years’ experience in digital advertising Demonstrated agility across a host of skill sets, including customer definition, new product strategy and execution, business analytics, and running day-to-day business operations. Customer-first mentality Experience operating in a fast-moving, high-stakes environment with a proven ability to maintain composure in high pressure situations Ability to earn trust across all levels of an organization Passion for technology, curiosity to dive deep into Amazon’s suite of technical products and commitment to learning and expanding technical knowledge

title: Software Engineer
description: We look for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation & engineering practices. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. J.P. Morgan Asset Management is a global institution that prides itself in the power of scale - offering first class financial products and services to its clients (and its clients' clients) across the spectrum of client needs. The Business Intelligence and Analytics team's mission is to leverage large datasets to power cutting-edge applications and analytical capabilities within the Asset Management Distribution Business. As a Data Engineer, you will evolve at the intersection of business analytics, data warehousing and software engineering, and will be responsible for building the foundational data layer critical to the Business Intelligence and Analytics platform success. Responsibilities Build large-scale batch, ETL and real-time data pipelines using cloud and on-premises data technologies, such as Redshift, Python, Spark, PySpark, and Apache Kafka Design best practices for data processing, data modeling and warehouse development throughout our team and group Develop strategy to provide proactive solutions and enable stakeholders to extract insights and value from data Understand end to end data interactions and dependencies across complex data pipelines and data transformation and how they impact business decisions. Qualifications Preferred qualifications Hands-on experience building a data warehouse and data pipelines using Java, Python or Scala in a data intensive engineering role Hands-on experience with data warehouse / data lake architectures based on Hadoop, Redshift or Snowflake Experience with workflow orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow, Autosys Familiarity with data transformation and collection tools such as Pentaho, Informatica Experience with stream processing platforms such as Kafka or Dataflow Knowledge of data columnar and serialization formats such as JSON, XML, Parquet, Avro Experience with container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Experience with CI/CD systems e.g. Jenkins and automation / DevOps best practices Familiarity with AWS ecosystem including S3, Glue, Redshift, Kinesis, EMR, EC2, SQS Familiarity of microservices stack based on AWS Lambdas. Elastic Search, Spring Boot, NodeJS Minimum requirements BS/BA degree or equivalent experience in computer science or engineering Advanced level skills in SQL, data integration, data modeling and data architecture Expert level skills in Python its standard library and its package JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. title: Senior Product Manager
description: Unum is a company of people serving people. As one of the world's leading employee benefits providers and a Fortune 500 company, Unum's financial protection benefits help protect more than 36 million working people and their families from the financial impact of illness or injury. Unum's three distinct, but similarly focused US businesses – Unum US, Colonial Life, and Starmount Life – are each a market leader in making disability, life, accident, critical illness, dental, and vision insurance accessible in the workplace. Headquartered in Chattanooga, Tennessee, Unum also has significant US operations in Portland, Maine, - and over 35 field offices nationwide. Colonial Life is headquartered in Columbia, South Carolina with over 40 field offices nationwide. Starmount Life is based in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, and is the dental and vision center of excellence for Unum in the US. General Summary: Unum is hiring a Senior Product Owner with an Agile mindset to join the Digital Incubator & Advanced Analytics team which is an inter-disciplinary team of Digital strategist, Product Innovators, Data Scientist, and technical enthusiasts. We provide digital thought leadership to inform our business strategies and incubate next-gen cloud-based digital and analytical offerings. We drive ideas from concept to launch in a rapid fashion, taking smart risks on strategic and innovative offerings. We assemble solutions by building and integrating with a broader partner ecosystems of emerging tech start-ups and established companies. The team plays an integral role in driving innovation across new digital offering as well as shared capabilities based on emerging technologies. As such, we seek someone who can fluidly move among both worlds – Stretching the bounds of what is possible, at the same time, demonstrating rigor, transparency, and discipline in clearly-articulated, business-driven, outcome-oriented decision-making. We seek someone forward-thinking and future-oriented, but pragmatic in execution, who balances the creative with the analytic and is unafraid to challenge the status-quo. Job Specifications: 6+ years’ experience in product management with experience in successfully launching new capabilities, products or platforms Familiarity and comfort with technology is a must to effectively communicate with architects, designers and Devops An entrepreneurial spirit excited about the opportunity to lean into new emerging technology to solve business problems and create new opportunities A structured, data-backed and first-principles thinker who can cut through complexity Exceptionally clear oral and written communication who can flex across technical and business, and influence people across all levels Quick learner with a curious mind on top of the latest technology and industry trends Proven ability to lead a team, influence with and without authority, challenge the status quo, and create a competitive advantage for the organization. Demonstrates high levels of ownership and accountability. Self-starter and ability to effectively chart a path forward in ambiguous situations or under a general direction. Demonstrated results against ‘We are Unum’ principles. Primary Responsibilities: Set the strategic vision, product roadmap and success metrics for the new offering / capability in partnership with business and technology leadership Source emerging technology in partnership with procurement and business development Determine problem – solution fit by continuously pivoting and prioritizing features based on client feedback Accountable for creation and ownership of product backlog Contribute to business case development within their product scope Ensure product/capability delivery roadmap is aligned to the enterprise strategic goals Influence business partners and secure buy in to opportunities reflected on the product roadmap Lead a matrixed cross-functional team of UX, technology delivery and shared services to deliver the product roadmap and track value capture Designs and adjusts product and adoption KPIs as product matures and derives cascading metrics down through to the development and delivery activities #LI-SM1 #LI-MULTI #LI-REMOTE ~IN1 Our company is built on helping individuals and families, and this starts with our employees. We want employees to maintain a positive balance, which is why we provide access to the benefits and resources they need to invest in themselves. From our onsite fitness facilities and generous paid time off to employee professional development programs, we are committed to helping employees live and work their best – both inside and outside the office. Unum is an equal opportunity employer, considering all qualified applicants and employees for hiring, placement, and advancement, without regard to a person's race, color, religion, national origin, age, genetic information, military status, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or protected veteran status. Company: Unum In accordance with Colorado’s Equal Pay For Equal Work Act, if you are a resident of the state of Colorado and wish to review the salary information for a role posted in Colorado, please fill out the form below and our Unum HR representative will reply to your inquiry within three business days. Colorado’s Equal Pay For Equal Work Act

title: Marketing Manager
description: Position Overview: The Marketing Communications Coordinator serves as a member of the Estacar Communications Division and works closely with the CEO and Communications Director to support client companies, community and industry awareness of Estacar Companies activities and relevant issues to support resource development efforts including digital communications campaigns and marketing implementation efforts with client companies and for Estacar Companies. The Marketing Communications Coordinator will produce content for both print and digital, including but not limited to social media, press releases, print collateral, website design support and branding/promotional items. This position will report to the Communications Director. Essential Responsibilities: Write, edit and distribute materials, including print collateral, weekly/monthly client correspondence, website updates, graphics, social media and press releases. Support digital development and campaign efforts including creating graphics and other digital assets, building emails, and drafting social content. Support public events planning, marketing and implementation for Estacar Companies and related client projects. This includes events in Amarillo and surrounding areas and could include some travel. Accurately collect and track data and analytics from the Estacar Managed digital platforms and track and monitor media coverage. Provide support in preparing presentations and reports. Provide general communications and administrative support to the Estacar Executive Team. Other related duties as assigned. Key Working Relationships: Position Reports to: Communications Director Other Internal and/or external: Internal: The Marketing Communications Coordinator works closely with the Estacar Executive team. In addition, the Communications Assistant may work with client companies, partners and with resource acquisition staff as well as TGC Athletics Managers and Staff. External: The Marketing Communications Coordinator will liaise with a wide variety of community stakeholders including partner orgs, investment groups, client companies and contract agencies. Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in marketing or communications preferred. Minimum 2 years of experience developing professional communications and promotional materials, event planning and/or community organizing required. Familiarity with social media platforms (e.g., Facebook, Linked In, Instagram, etc.) within a professional context. Excellent computer skills (e.g., MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) required; proficiency in graphic design (e.g., Canva, Adobe Creative Cloud, etc.) preferred. Strong writing and editing skills. Fluency in English, written and spoken. Fluency in Spanish is helpful. Excellent attention to detail and strong follow through. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Ability to communicate effectively and work as a team member in a diverse, cross-cultural environment. Strong interest in economic development or strong interest to learn. Commitment to Diversity and Inclusivity: Estacar Companies is committed to building a diverse organization and a climate of inclusivity. We strongly encourage applications from candidates who can demonstrate that they can contribute to this goal. Equal Opportunity Employer: We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Estacar Companies and our employees must adhere to the values and principles outlined in Estacar Companies - Standards for Professional Conduct. These include core values of Integrity, Investment, Connection, and Team. Company Overview Estacar Companies is a multidimensional fractional executive and consulting firm working with companies around the world. Founders and CEOs often utilize us when they have a vision for where to take their company but are frustrated with the rate of progress towards their vision. We work as an addition to the organization’s state and stakeholders, focusing on developing the CEO’s or Director’s vision into a financially sound, market-based, growth strategy and then overseeing the implementation. Often the internal management team is completely focused on managing the business this week, month and quarter, and there is no one to drive the implementation today that is needed to deliver on the vision for tomorrow. Estacar can fill a gap between the type of strategic leadership growth that focused organizations need and the resources they can afford. Founded by Cori Burns, CEO in 2012, Estacar Companies is headquartered in Amarillo, Texas and serves clients in multiple industries through out the US and internationally. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $38,500.00 - $55,000.00 per year Benefits: Paid time off Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekend availability Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Ability to commute/relocate: Amarillo, TX 79101: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: professional marketing or design: 2 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location

title: Data Scientist
description: Job Details Level Experienced Job Location Irving, TX - Irving, TX Remote Type N/A Position Type Full Time Education Level Graduate Degree Salary Range Undisclosed Travel Percentage Negligible Job Shift Undisclosed Job Category Science Description Design machine/deep learning systems; develop, implement, refine, and test algorithms and workflows to achieve specific goal in the project. Study and transform data science prototypes. Research and implement appropriate machine learning algorithms and tools; deploy and monitor models in production environments. Extend existing machine learning libraries and frameworks. Provide statistical support for design and development of quality control process for diagnostic assays and products. Utilize data science techniques and analytics skills to extract information from multisource data and turn it into actionable business insights. Implement and develop bioinformatics tools/pipelines/workflows for analyzing genome and transcriptome data. In connection with above duties, utilize experience in the following: Assess and validate quality, accuracy and effectiveness of diverse data; Identify, clean, and transform multisource data for modeling purposes; Establish processing methodology of structured and unstructured data; Build analytics systems and predictive models; Build computer vision models for object detection and segmentation; SOTA detection/segmentation algorithms including Mask-RCNN and YOLO and tools including detectron2, SimpleDet and mmdetection; GAN models for image -to-image translation tasks; Analyzing environmental and biological data with statistical methods and machine learning, deep learning techniques; Python and R; Shell scripting, awk, grep, regex expression; Querying data from SQL and NoSQL databases; Deep learning frameworks (PyTorch or Tensorflow); Apache Spark to process large datasets; Airflow to schedule and monitor workflows; Cloud computing platforms (AWS, GCP); AWS’s EC2, Sagemaker, S3 services; Docker container technique; Applying descriptive and predictive statistics and statistical inference; Productionize machine learning models and generate data science reports; Maintain data science solutions with version control tools; Deliver complex quantitative analyses in a clear manner; Development of time-series algorithms and application of tools including prophet, arima, pydlm; Common supervised & unsupervised ML algorithms; Standard machine learning libraries including Scikit-Learn and H2O; Creating visualization and reporting dashboards with BI dashboards such as Tableau, Looker, and Sisense; Developing R shiny apps and Python Dash apps for BI dashboards, data visualization and model deployment; and Common plotting libraries such as matplotlib, plotly, seaborn and ggplot. Requirements Master’s degree in Statistics, Business Analytics, or related field plus 1 year experience in job offered or 1 year experience in related occupation using experience in the following: Assess and validate quality, accuracy and effectiveness of diverse data; Identify, clean, and transform multisource data for modeling purposes; Establish processing methodology of structured and unstructured data; Build analytics systems and predictive models; Build computer vision models for object detection and segmentation; SOTA detection/segmentation algorithms including Mask-RCNN and YOLO and tools including detectron2, SimpleDet and mmdetection; GAN models for image -to-image translation tasks; Analyzing environmental and biological data with statistical methods and machine learning, deep learning techniques; Python and R; Shell scripting, awk, grep, regex expression; Querying data from SQL and NoSQL databases; Deep learning frameworks (PyTorch or Tensorflow); Apache Spark to process large datasets; Airflow to schedule and monitor workflows; Cloud computing platforms (AWS, GCP); AWS’s EC2, Sagemaker, S3 services; Docker container technique; Applying descriptive and predictive statistics and statistical inference; Productionize machine learning models and generate data science reports; Maintain data science solutions with version control tools; Deliver complex quantitative analyses in a clear manner; Development of time-series algorithms and application of tools including prophet, arima, pydlm; Common supervised & unsupervised ML algorithms; Standard machine learning libraries including Scikit-Learn and H2O; Creating visualization and reporting dashboards with BI dashboards such as Tableau, Looker, and Sisense; Developing R shiny apps and Python Dash apps for BI dashboards, data visualization and model deployment; Common plotting libraries such as matplotlib, plotly, seaborn and ggplot. In lieu of Master’s degree, employer will accept Bachelor’s degree in above listed fields plus 5 years of progressive work experience in related occupation. Experience may be gained concurrently. Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience. Caris Life Sciences is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Data Analyst
description: You could be the one who changes everything for our 25 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, multi-national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility. About Us: We are revolutionizing the world of healthcare through digital transformation and building a world-class software engineering practice. Our high caliber team delivers leading edge technology and drives innovation to solve complex business challenges. Using collective innovation we are turning visions into action and challenging what is possible to support the healthcare of 1 in 15 individuals. About You: You are a highly collaborative, strategic risk-taker driven to make a difference and change the face of healthcare. You thrive in a supportive, result-oriented community and are committed to the relentless pursuit of continuous growth. You are highly agile, excel in fast-paced environments and willing to push outside your comfort zone. You are ready to find your purpose at work The Role: We are transforming technology and creating a digital evolution that will empower Centene to better serve our members. Data Analyst II (Healthcare Analytics) will manipulate large data sets to provide insights and trends for our health plans. As Data Analyst II (Healthcare Analytics): Have the opportunity to make a significant impact through the discovery, development, and implementation of leading-edge analytics that answer important business questions. Collaborate with key corporate and health plan business partners for the purpose of identifying and delivering robust reporting and analytics capabilities to drive improved business performance. Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims, provider, member, and encounters data. Identify and assess the business impact of trends Develop, execute, maintain, and troubleshoot complex scripts and reports developed using SQL, Microsoft Excel, or other analytics tools Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines and thrive in a demanding, quickly changing environment Support the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products Support multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility Competitive pay Paid Time Off including paid holidays Health insurance coverage for you and dependents 401(k) and stock purchase plans Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development Additionally you will bring: Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Knowledge of query development of basic to moderate complexity using SQL or other coding languages. Healthcare experience preferred Power BI experience preferred Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: KeyPoint Consulting is currently looking for a Senior Software Engineer for a direct hire position in Baltimore, MD. The role is currently remote but will transition into a partially onsite role This is a great opportunity to be part of the team that is developing a new, innovative product offering from the ground up using current cloud-based technology stack that will reach millions of users. The role is building a new type of web application product offering for investors combining proprietary analysis, publicly available content, portfolio optimization, advanced analytics, and execution services. Responsibilities Participate in software design and architecture sessions and own the overall technical design along with the systems architect. Willing and able to mentor a team of junior developers. Write high-quality code in Python. Work with quick development cycles of 2 week sprints. Communicate engineering issues and requirements to management and other stakeholders. Qualifications Minimum of 5-10 years of experience in software engineering, design, and development of scalable web-based applications. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Mathematics, Physics, or a similar field. 7+ years of experience in full stack web development. Excellent Python coding skills and understanding of Python best practices. Experience with Python web frameworks and front-end frameworks like Angular. Experience in designing and developing Web Services and RESTFUL APIs using Python. Three (3) years of cloud-based development experience (Amazon Web Services (AWS), Azure, or Google Cloud). Ability to write clean, maintainable code, including unit tests (TDD). Passion for learning and adopting new technology. Obsession with customer focus and delivering business value. Demonstrate ownership, urgency, and drive. Strong understanding of data structures. Knowledge of architecture and software design patterns (Collections, DI, IoC, MVC, TDD etc). Job Type: Full-time Pay: $150,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year Benefits: Health insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Signing bonus Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work Location: One location

title: Product Manager
description: Overview: LSAC is a not-for-profit corporation devoted to promoting and furthering the quality, access, and fairness of the law school admission process by providing core products and services to law school candidates and law schools in the United States and throughout the world. LSAC’s mission is to advance law and justice by encouraging diverse, talented individuals to study law and by supporting their enrollment and learning journeys from prelaw through practice. Summary of Position: LawHub is an exciting new platform by which LSAC is supporting the success of talented, diverse individuals on their journeys from prelaw through practice. As the product marketing manager, you will help shape and bring new offerings from LSAC LawHub to market. You will work as part of a cross-functional team to understand what our customers value, to enhance product positionings and develop messaging of new offerings, and to communicate LawHub’s benefits effectively in order to drive conversion and measure results to optimize on-going efforts. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in creating and implementing product marketing campaigns and communications plans, and ensuring that offerings complement LSAC’s overall legal education solutions portfolio. Responsibilities: Translate product market research into customer-centric insights that align with the organization’s mission and complement existing products and services. In collaboration with LawHub Product Management, follow and analyze the existing market landscape; participate in market research to hone the product’s value proposition with an eye toward identifying new trends and growth opportunities. Work with product and cross-functional team members to implement compelling marketing strategies to reach target audiences across multiple channels. Develop and manage product positioning and messaging to drive brand trust, product adoption, and increase customer retention. Drive product conversion by effectively partnering with internal teams on marketing campaigns and growth initiatives. Conceptualize and develop product marketing content for a variety of channels. Collaborate with product and cross-functional team members to create customer feedback loop to bring market insights into the team; leveraging customer input to continually test, evaluate, and optimize marketing strategies based on relevant KPIs. Represent the product’s value to internal stakeholders and external constituents. Performs other tasks and duties as assigned. Qualifications: A minimum of 3+ years’ experience in marketing agency, product marketing, brand management, and/or product management role(s). Experience working with software product or cloud-based application and working within an agile product development environment preferred. BA/BS in marketing, communications, or similar field. A track record of successful go-to-market efforts and marketing campaigns with demonstrated contribution to revenue growth. Goal-oriented, collaborative, and comfortable working closely within cross-functional teams and matrix organizations. Experience in leading integrated marketing campaigns. Experience in market analysis. Creative, open-minded, with a good eye for aesthetics. Working knowledge of web analytic tools (e.g., Google Analytics). Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; experience with copywriting is desired. Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking capability. Strong attention to details. Analytical mind and strong quantitative skills. Desire to be part of a mission-driven organization working to advance law and justice. LSAC actively seeks to foster greater levels of diversity in our workforce and in our pipeline of future leaders. We are committed to attract and retain candidates who have a passion for their work and encourage all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, LGBTQIA+, and individuals with a disability, to apply. LSAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior Analyst - Data Science
description: About CRISIL GR&A: CRISIL Global Research & Analytics (GR&A) is the largest and top-ranked provider of high end research and analytics services to the world's leading commercial and investment banks, insurance companies, corporations, consulting firms, private equity firms and asset management firms. CRISIL GR&A operates from centres in Argentina, China, India and Poland, providing support across several time zones and in multiple languages to global organizations. It has deep expertise in the areas of equity and fixed income research (covering global economies, 150 global sectors and over 3000 global companies), credit analysis, exotic derivatives valuation, structured finance, risk modelling and management, actuarial analysis and business intelligence. CRISIL GR&A includes Irevna, Pipal Research and Coalition, firms which were acquired by CRISIL. For more information, please visit www.irevna.com, www.pipalresearch.com and www.coalition.com Job title Senior Analyst / Manager – Data Modeling Location New York Qualifications B. Tech. / MBA from a top tier college/CA/CFA Graduation/Post Graduation qualifications in Engineering stream or equivalent master’s degree (MBA) with specialization in Finance with · A very good academic record throughout from premier institutions. · A high degree of Analytical ability and Quantitative skills is desirable Job Duties The job duties would involve: Research industry standards and best practices on data attribute and modelling requirements for Lending business Build PoC studies for data models and deliver walkthroughs or system/domain trainings to stakeholders Take on responsibility in defining and modelling of a common wholesale lending Data model, and physicalisation of the logical data model by working in close collaboration with Business, Change and IT Partners Ability to analyse large volumes of data and understand commonalities in data Develop conceptual / logical / physical data models and create linkages between these; Design functionality to handle incremental data load and manage duplicate data Transform model requirements into functional and technical specifications after discussions with stakeholders Formulate test scenarios and test the data model / transformation logic implemented by the IT partners, generate status reports and run sign-off sessions with senior program managers Create Data Quality and exception management framework including functionalities to handle manual / auto data correction, manual uploads, etc. Skills Required Should have exposure to Data Modelling and Data Analysis concepts to support Data Analytics and Reporting Requirements Should have functional / business knowledge on financial products Ability to combine strong conceptual and critical thinking and apply a practical mind to drive tasks Excellent communication and partner management skills to enable team success Good to have experience in Magic Draw, EA Architect, Collibra, Visio. Good proficiency in SQL, Excel VBA; Hands on experience/fluency in SQL joins and ability to write simple to moderately complex SQL queries Flexible and adaptable Hands-on approach with excellent problem-solving skills Should have experience in big data assignments Qualifications/Certifications in Data Modelling and Finance is a plus Job Type: Full-time Schedule: 8 hour shift

title: Marketing Manager
description: Arts Marketing Coordinator About us The Center for Arts in Natick defines the ideal venue for an intimate music concert, movie screenings, arts education programs and special functions in the MetroWest area. The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for increasing awareness of TCAN’s mission and arts programming; generating demand for its mainstage and cinema events, children’s programs, membership program, fundraising events, and campaigns. The Marketing Coordinator reports directly to the Executive Director. The Marketing Coordinator is primarily responsible for driving ticket sales, class registrations, membership and donations by implementing a variety of unified marketing activities. These activities include management of TCAN’s brand identity, design and production of email messages, maintenance of TCAN’s website content and e-signage, managing TCAN’s presence on social media platforms, and the design and production of printed and digital collateral. Strong copywriting and graphic design skills are essential. The Marketing Coordinator is also responsible for managing the segmentation of TCAN’s audience and event categories through the use of data tags and patron surveys, and measurement of marketing effectiveness using reporting tools and data analytics. Responsibilities Manage TCAN’s social media platforms - Maintain regular communication on all social media platforms to meet TCAN’s marketing and fundraising objectives (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Bandsintown). Produce marketing and fundraising collateral - Collect and create content for promotional use, including images, artist biographies, program descriptions, web links, music, and video clips. Develop printed and digital marketing materials to promote attendance at arts programs and events, including flyers and brochures, Member Guide, email campaigns, press releases, ad placements. Develop brochures and collateral for membership and development campaigns, including the Annual Report, solicitation letters, and membership packets. Represent TCAN at public events - Coordinate TCAN’s presence at community events including MetroFest, Natick Days, local volunteer fairs, including personal participation to represent the organization to the general public. Manage the company brand - Maintain the archive of branding graphic assets including fonts, logo, images. Manage the proper use of branding materials and writing/copy editing to unify messaging across print, email, web, social, and traditional media channels by all staff and volunteers. Maintain TCAN website and E-signage - Maintain website content including event listings, program descriptions, membership, and donation campaigns. Maintain electronic signage, lobby displays, and signage. Manage audience and program segmentation - Design and analyze audience surveys to identify patron preferences and demographics. Define and maintain database categories for arts programs that support segmentation of the audience for use in targeted marketing campaigns. Skills Bachelor's or Advanced degree in marketing or related field required 3-5 years of professional experience in arts marketing or related field Exceptional computer skills, including a high level of proficiency with Microsoft Office, CRM applications (Salesforce/PatronManager preferred), website CMS, social media, email (Constant Contact preferred). Expertise with Adobe Creative Suite, including InDesign, PhotoShop and Illustrator. Video editing experience with Sony Vegas, Premiere Pro, or similar platform is highly preferred. Excellent business communication skills, including copywriting and public presentations. Highly organized, self-motivated, and self-directed with strong time management skills. Ability to work effectively under pressure with tight schedules and deadlines. The ability to work occasional nights and weekends for special events is a must A passion for the arts – music, theater, film, and arts education A cover letter and salary requirements must be included for consideration. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $18.00 - $26.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: Full COVID-19 vaccination and a commitment to COVID-safe practices are required. Proof of vaccination is required for attendance at all programs and events. Candidates must be willing to work on-premises. Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Marketing: 3 years (Required) Work Location: One location Work Remotely: No Work Location: One location

title: Product Manager
description: At Nextiva, we create connected communication tools that help businesses stay in touch with their customers and teams. Over 100,000 companies rely on Nextiva for phone service and customer management tools. We're not your parent's phone company. Founded in 2008, Nextiva took on the trillion-dollar telecom industry and succeeded in changing the game by making technology more accessible and affordable for everyone. Companies solve their toughest challenges using our VoIP innovations and signature Amazing Service®. Today, Nextiva is the fastest-growing, privately held provider of cloud communications. We don't study industry trends; we create them. Business leaders look to Nextiva to equip their teams in the office and while working from home. Nextiva is not just a tech company — we're the backbone of the economy. By joining our global team, you're saying yes to an opportunity to be part of a tech company with massive growth potential and exciting opportunities ahead. We're actively looking for amazing people like you to join our team! Nextiva empowers businesses to manage their communications, productivity, and customer relationships on a truly unified platform. Nextiva is a fast-growing exciting place with great team spirit to work. The Product Manager – Sales enablement is responsible for analyzing, modifying and supporting the Salesforce Sales cloud, Marketing and boundary under minimal supervision. This position is in the Business Enablement department but works primarily with Business personnel to understand business requirements and help the business transform. This role will take the lead in identifying current operation procedures, clarify system objectives, interpret and evaluate business requirements and design and execute test scripts and test scenarios in a fast-paced team-oriented environment Key Responsibilities: Leads work-in-take and prioritizes the backlog for sales and marketing applications Leans in with recommendations with leading practices for implementation of Sales cloud, Einstein activity capture, Outreach, marketing tools, chat and Sales analytics Works with business leads to gather requirements to document functional specifications and process flows Promote user adoption by facilitating user acceptance testing and training Responsible for proactive action regarding quarterly updates, including researching known issues, testing key processes, and educating business SME/business process owners on new functionality Identify opportunities for improvements and enhancements to maximize the use of salesforce throughout the organization Plan, create, and execute detailed task list based on high-level goals and objectives. Uses expertise in Salesforce.com platform and products to support business needs and and translates these into effective solutions that are aligned with the technology roadmap and strategic direction of the Sales and Marketing organization. Encourage adoption of new functionality by deploying training and documentation. Communicate regularly with the user base regarding new features, enhancements, and changes Assist the cross functional technical teams with business requirement and business process knowledge Perform gap analyses for as-is and to-be processes Lead cross-functional meetings and planning sessions with internal stakeholders and external vendors Works with the cross functional technical teams to create iterative prototypes of solutions as required to demonstrate and ensure business alignment with proposals Works with business stakeholders to manage deliverables, including successful user acceptance testing Document processes, field maps, procedures, and workflows Manage multiple competing priorities through effective organization and communication Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology or master's degree in business Expertise in Salesforce platform, Apex programming, Lightning, Flows, Triggers, SOQL and integrations Experience/ Qualifications: Minimum 15 years of progressive IT experience with systems, processes and managing business users. Minimum of 10 years' professional experience with the Salesforce.com platform, including hands-on experience with declarative tools 10 years of experience in delivery leadership in software development as a Program Lead, delivery Lead, and similar roles leading complex projects Previous experience supporting Sales and Marketing organizations Strong exposure to Campaigns, Lead Management, Account, Opportunities Experience with Sales cloud, CPQ, forecasting, process mapping, Marketing cloud & social marketing applications Demonstrable ability to effectively exert influence across teams without direct authority and especially towards senior management Must be able to visualize, analyze, communicate and solve complex problems, and make disciplined decisions based on available information Takes ownership and proactively resolves problems, ensuring that solutions continue to meet business requirements and aligns with the vision, mission, objectives, and strategy of the team Experience in all phases of product development, software development, and testing lifecycles Experience in management of established technology and product departments with mature program management processes and standards for both Agile and Waterfall project methodologies Outstanding verbal and written communication skills to audiences of all levels including executive leadership Expertise in agile software delivery methodologies: Scrum, Kanban Embrace challenging situations and enjoy solving complex problems Expert at project delivery, including all aspects of program management and the SDLC Experience with business analysis and technology implementation. So, why Nextiva? Nextiva is a trailblazer in the Voice over IP (VoIP) and Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) industries. We're outpacing our competitors, and it's an exciting time to join our team. If you're looking to join a fast-paced tech company with massive potential, Nextiva is the place for you. Our 1,000+ team members worldwide embrace our promise of Amazing Service. We're passionate about upholding our energetic culture of forward-thinking, caring, and simplicity. Nextiva seeks diverse individuals who share our values and vision to help take us to the next level. Nextiva provides an impressive benefits package and has a resilient company culture. Glassdoor named us one of the Best Places to Work in 2020 nationwide. Employees rate Nextiva a 4.9/5 on Comparably, and we've earned many more accolades along the way. Help us redefine the future of business communications. Apply today! Nextiva is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. title: Marketing Manager
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Marketing Job Details What you'll be doing... The Marketing eCommerce Manager is responsible for day-to-day management and oversight of eCommerce purchasing experience within marketing, as well as related website properties and systems. Driven by a focus on eCommerce performance metrics and optimizing customer journeys, this role will leverage technical, business, and people skills to ensure eCommerce initiatives maximize online revenue, conversion and ROI, while staying connected with sales and various other stakeholders in the company. This role will work closely with technical teams in both marketing and Technical Operations (our IT organization), requiring the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements. This role requires a broad range of skills encompassing: eCommerce funnel optimization & user experience, A/B testing, project management, web analytics, webpage development and stakeholder management, as well as familiarity with the creative development process. Primary Responsibilities... Build upon existing eCommerce strategy to drive online revenue, while expanding customer self-service capabilities and also manage and prioritize upcoming feature development Drive / own eCommerce requirements, delivery, and support for ongoing eCommerce projects, requests, and tactical needs across multiple teams/organizations in and outside of marketing Route projects and requests efficiently and appropriately, with an understanding of underlying technologies A “roll up your sleeves” attitude to help with activities such as funnel optimization & user experience, A/B testing, webpage development, web analysis, documentation, communication, content, etc. Help identify technologies to maximize our eCommerce funnel outcomes and user experience Communicate and report on the status of requests to customers and ensure they know where their requests are in each stage of the project-development/deployment lifecycle. Effectively manage, communicate, and drive roadmaps and plans taking requirements, resources, and constraints into account. Who you are… Experienced. 5+ years of relevant work experience in eCommerce Management with Project Management experience Domain. Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, or relevant field of study. Analytical. Strong ability to wrangle with the flow of data and the ability to look beyond just the numbers to see the underlying patterns and trends so it’s delivering data driven insights that are actionable for the business to move forward. Operational . Ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects and tasks to see the bigger picture and prioritize accordingly Builder. Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and marketing, with the ability to build. Data Rock Star. Experience collecting/interpreting data from a variety of sources to make solid business recommendations. Expertise in Excel and Tableau. A True Team Player. Strong collaboration, project management skills and great execution. Strong Partner & Customer Focus. High energy, enthusiasm, and passion for the business. You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world! #LI-SC2 Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes.
