Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: We’re Medicus. We do things a little differently here and we’re proud of it. Medicus Healthcare Solutions has been revolutionizing the healthcare staffing industry since 2004. We’re a nationwide company with our headquarters located in Windham, NH, our west-based office just outside Denver, CO. Our dynamic, innovative team has been dedicated to changing the game by building lasting relationships with our clients and physicians and truly understanding their goals and the challenges they face. We’re here to make a difference; connecting healthcare providers to the communities that need them most. The Opportunity: The Business Intelligence Analyst plays a critical role in creating and curating analytics across all lines of business at Medicus. They are positioned to empower leaders with the insights required to continue moving the business forward and solve emerging business challenges. The ideal candidate has strong attention to detail, is driven by intellectual curiosity, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. What You Will Be Doing: Full Life-Cycle BI Report Deployment Capture, understand, and document business needs and objectives. Develop and manage the processes to acquire and organize critical business information, using ETL and database tools. Design actionable visualizations and supporting data models with Microsoft PowerBI and other modern BI software. Test, deploy, and refine deliverables. Solicit feedback from business stakeholders. Trusted Business Partner and Subject Matter Expert Build a strong understanding of how the daily operations of the business show up as data across a range of systems (CRM, Financial, etc.). Be an active participant in discussions of the evolving reporting and analytic needs of a fast-growing business. Become a trusted point of contact for data and reporting questions, brainstorming, solutioning. BI Infrastructure Management and Support Create and maintain documentation for data and reporting systems. Ensure reliable and accurate reporting tools and data processes. Drive continuous improvement of BI infrastructure and data processes, adapting to ever-changing business systems. Participate in enhancing and maintaining data quality and data governance. Here’s what we look for: 2+ years of experience in business intelligence or similar role. Candidates must be able to provide specific examples of their past work in the following areas: Development and design of report in modern BI Tools, and the data models used to power them (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Qliksense). Extracting and warehousing data from business systems. Communication skills with non-technical audience, such as training and requirements gathering workshops. Experience with predictive modeling or machine learning a plus. Bachelor’s degree with a focus in information systems, business management, or data science Ability to effectively prioritize and manage workload. Proactively communicating progress, hurdles, etc. Excellent interpersonal, teamwork, and communication skills. Your character is more important than any level of skill, experience, or education. We expect all of our people to exhibit these common attributes: High level of integrity Intellectual curiosity and desire for excellence Strong work ethic Results-oriented team player Compensation & Benefits: At Medicus, we offer extensive training programs and a comprehensive benefits package for all full-time employees beginning day one! Our benefits include medical, dental, vision, life, short term, and long-term insurance, plus medical and dependent care flex spending accounts, and unlimited paid time off. We have a matching, fully vested 401k available after 90 days of employment, tuition reimbursement, monthly sales awards, and the opportunity to become part of our President’s Club and receive an all-expense-paid trip for two. Why Medicus? Join a company that appreciates your talent and contributions, enabling you to earn your value through a robust compensation plan and exciting performance incentives that provide you with a verifiable growth path! We are a dynamic company that is growing rapidly and committed to promoting talent based on merit. We believe in the values of teamwork, openness, and treating everyone with dignity and respect. When you join Medicus, you can see the direct impact of your contributions on our success. Medicus is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in its workforce and diversity of thought.

title: Marketing Manager
description: Submittable is looking for an experienced Marketing Operations and Analytics Manager to drive revenue growth through a deep understanding of our business and our market. You will be the backbone of a marketing team, delivering planning, governance and support functions to allow core marketing functions to focus on delivering value. In this role you will focus on end-to-end marketing optimization ranging from planning and budgeting to execution and analysis. This is a full time position reporting to the Vice President of Revenue Operations. The Manager responsibilities include: Oversee the marketing operations and analytics tech stack (Pardot, Salesforce, Intercom, Google Analytics, ect.), evaluating opportunities to improve integrations and adopt new technologies to support growth Build multipurpose analytics tools and methodologies for sales, marketing, and Submittable leadership teams; from channel conversion analysis to sales intelligence and everything in between, you'll become the resident expert on marketing data Assist the demand generation team operations and analytics to help the team effectively measure campaign success across and within channels Develop and implement best practices for our marketing system (Pardot), including data enrichment; lead management, and routing Source of truth for reporting and dashboard accuracy QA testing all aspects of our lead generation, routing, and marketing/sales data to ensure our systems are online and data is accurate Measure overall website performance KPIs, analyze key health metrics, communicate trends, share insights and make recommendations to the content and product marketing team Measure website optimization tests to prove (or disprove) the team's theories and report on results with recommendations for the next steps Advise Marketing and Sales leadership on how to adjust internal processes and approaches to maximize potential revenue growth An ideal candidate will have these qualities and experience: Experience designing and implementing operational best practices in B2B marketing team Excellent organization and project management skills Deep knowledge of integration and implementation of marketing automation and digital technologies; expert experience with Pardot and Salesforce Experience or education in data analytics and data management Outstanding analytical skills We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we currently do not sponsor H-1B visas About Submittable Submittable is on a mission to empower social good organizations with technology that accelerates their work and scales their impact. We partnered with thousands of organizations, governments, and corporations last year to launch 10,000+ programs, process over 4 million applications, and distribute $2.5 billion in funding and aid. Grow your career at an Inc. 5000 fastest-growing company, while having a positive impact on people globally. Submittable has its headquarters in downtown Missoula, Montana, with a satellite office in Seattle, Washington and remote employees located around the U.S. We offer highly-competitive benefits for full-time employees, including: Health insurance, 401K, life insurance, and optional HSA, FSA, and DCA accounts Flexible hours, including flexible vacations and sick leave, and remote work options Generous paid parental leave policy for mothers, fathers, and adoptive parents Discounted fitness memberships, professional development stipends, and book purchase reimbursement Involvement in community outreach programs for all employees, including company volunteer outings at local nonprofits Fully-stocked kitchens with complimentary snacks and beverages for all employees Gender-neutral bathrooms with free pads/tampons As a product used globally, we're very motivated to hire and support employees who are representative of different and diverse backgrounds and experiences, including but not limited to diversity of ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, religion, ability, culture, and socioeconomics.

title: Data Engineer
description: You + Helix Helix is a place where innovators and doers gather in order to drive significant progress in population genomics. We have come together to work at the intersection of clinical care, research, and genomics. If you're excited by the idea of making a meaningful impact and joining a team where we pride ourselves on driving innovation through fostering an environment with an emphasis on empowering one another to grow, Helix might be the place for you! Helix + The World Our end-to-end population genomics platform enables health systems, life sciences companies, and payers to advance genomic research and accelerate the integration of genomic data into routine clinical care. We support all aspects of population genomics from recruitment to translational research and help our partners use genomics to improve health outcomes, increase patient engagement, and lower costs. Leading health systems, including Renown Health, AdventHealth, and Mayo Clinic, use our population genomics platform to power some of the world's largest and fastest-growing population genomics initiatives. For the COVID-19 public health crisis, Helix has built one of the nation's largest COVID diagnostic labs and has been on the leading edge of national viral surveillance efforts tracking B.1.1.7 and other viral strains. Data Engineer, Analytics Remote What is special about this role: As part of a nascent product team at Helix, you will be innovating alongside other data engineers and scientists to ship products that surface key insights from complex healthcare datasets. This is an opportunity to apply your data engineering talents towards a high-impact, life-saving mission. As a Data Engineer, you will: Implement data warehousing solutions for clinical and public health data. Maintain data integrity and quality throughout the data lifecycle, including ensuring regulatory compliance (e.g., blinding) where appropriate. Author data models that are simple, functional, and support varied use cases. Collaboratively design and build data infrastructure and tools. Develop a strong domain understanding of genomics, infectious disease, and healthcare data at large. Mentor other engineers to reinforce a culture of learning and teaching. About You: 4+ years experience in Go, Python, or a similar language Expertise architecting and building large data warehousing solutions on AWS, Azure, or GCP Command of data modeling, data stores, and query optimization Deep understanding of data technology implementation and architectural tradeoffs Strong written and verbal communication skills Pluses: Health data experience Experience building with AWS Redshift Experience using infrastructure as code tooling/frameworks (e.g. Terraform, CloudFormation) Proficiency with serverless architectures BS+ in Computer Science; coursework in statistics, genetics, or bioinformatics What's important to us: Curiosity — we are all passionate about the possibilities enabled by having access to your own genome Responsibility — we have an obligation to people and our partners to operate with highly credible research guided by well respected advisors, with clear and effective communication about our products Agility — flexibility and a desire to be nimble, smart, and effective are important to the Helix culture Follow-through — we're building a diverse team with amazing track records of achievement in multidisciplinary environments What Helix has to offer you: Aside from working alongside brilliant, dedicated, passionate, down-to-earth, curious, warm, and thoughtful people, we also provide great benefits: Competitive compensation, including meaningful equity Health insurance, including medical, dental, and vision 12 weeks of Maternity or Paternity leave 4 weeks of paid Pregnancy Disability 401(k) with employer matching On-premise nursing room Corporate fitness rate Commuter benefits Catered meals Flexible PTO Helix is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Job Type: Full-time Work Location: Multiple Locations

title: Director Business Analyst
description: As a Director in the Corporate practice within Risk and Analytics, you will drive revenue generation by developing and proactively managing client relationships to expand and create new business opportunities for our healthcare and corporate clients. You will play a key role in our marketing efforts and the growth of this practice area for key client groups. You will be responsible for project delivery and serve as a resource to analysts as you help them build their technical and client-facing expertise. The Role The Risk and Analytics Corporate Practice includes over 100 actuarial professionals focused on large market, U.S. clients. Our primary services include reserving and funding for retained losses, captive feasibility and retention optimization, and cost allocation models. We also perform actuarial analysis of loyalty programs for hospitality, airlines and financial institutions, and are actively involved in the development of predictive analytics for our clients. As a Director, you will lead varied and interesting projects such as: Self-Insurance and Captives – Pricing/funding analyses, valuation of liabilities, captive feasibility, and risk retention optimization Predictive Modeling – Development and application of advanced predictive modeling techniques to help clients improve loss experience and enhance overall business performance Analysis of Loyalty rewards programs for various industries We are looking for a motivated, independent learner, looking to deliver exceptional performance in the following areas: Clients Proactively manage client relationships to ensure and increase client satisfaction, improve our strength and position with our clients, broaden and deepen our relationships within the organization. Identify prospective client organizations and respond to new business opportunities with prospects as they emerge; bring additional value to clients through extension sales opportunities. Take ultimate responsibility for the delivery of projects, which meet or exceed client expectations, ensuring that they are delivered on time and to budget. Develop a trusted advisor relationship with client contacts through effective communication and efficient, quality execution of projects. Interface with colleagues from other practices and regions on assignments that reflect the client’s broader business issues Undertake broadcast marketing activities to help advance the practice’s thought leadership position and promote our brand. Excellence Ensure that projects are appropriately defined, pitched, budgeted, resourced and delivered to enable maximization of revenue potential along with high quality and efficient delivery to ensure client satisfaction. Deliver high quality work in compliance with Excellence standards and proactively look for process improvements. Develop and promote our company as a key player in the market with excellent industry knowledge, insights and analysis. Maintain and develop your own technical and industry knowledge. Contribute to the development of our product and service offerings. Financial Meet billable hours target, operating as a highly respected and market-leading consultant. Meet recurring revenue and new sales targets by remaining a trusted advisor, maximizing business through existing relationships and contacts and actively seeking new business development opportunities. Participate fully in the collective task of building a profitable practice. People Facilitate collaboration and teamwork across the RA Corporate practice and among WTW colleagues. Build relationships internally and collaborate effectively on cross-functional teams. Demonstrate natural ease and effectiveness when dealing with clients/colleagues at all levels. Actively engage in colleague development through on-the-job training, mentoring and coaching of more junior colleagues and new staff and serve as a best practices resource for these colleagues. The Requirements Undergraduate degree required. Fellowship in the Casualty Actuarial Society (CAS) is required. Experience in an insurance and/or actuarial environment with significant exposure to commercial lines, preferably professional liability. Broad knowledge of most of the technical areas including reserving and funding for retained losses, captive feasibility and retention optimization, and cost allocation models. Proven experience successfully managing multiple projects and producing quality deliverables on time and within budget. Demonstrated ability to propose on and win profitable new business. Strong client relationship, interpersonal and team skills. Flexibility and proven ability to diagnose and resolve issues. The ability to see the "big picture," leveraging the resources of related practices to address clients' business challenges. Working knowledge of Excel, MS Project, MS Word. Availability to travel on an as needed basis. EOE, including disability/vets

title: Product Manager
description: Nipro Medical Corporation is a subsidiary of Nipro Corporation Japan, established in 1954 and a world-leader in healthcare with over 30,000 employees around the globe. We are committed to delivering innovative, high quality solutions in the form of renal, medical-surgical, and vascular products – with the ultimate goal of improving patient care and quality of life. This fundamental objective drives us to develop cutting-edge, value-added products for healthcare professionals that are safe, effective, and easy to use. As an integral part of our vast global manufacturing network, Nipro Medical Corporation is responsible for managing the sales, marketing, and business operations of North and South America. To accommodate our growth, we are looking for a full-time Product Manager, Renal to be based in Bridgewater, New Jersey. ABOUT THE ROLE: As Product Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing marketing strategy to drive growth and profitability of existing and new product portfolios in our Renal business line. In this role, you will report to the Sr. Manager, Marketing and work on market development, product life cycle management, marketing analytics, customer segmentation, targeting, and message development while working closely with internal and external stakeholders. A successful candidate should possess strong marketing and cross-functional leadership skills and abilities to synthesize solutions and recommendations for assigned projects. This role leads and supports both strategic and tactical marketing activities. PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORKING CONDITIONS: This role operates in a professional open office environment; this role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers and phones Prolonged sitting at a desk and using of computer equipment may be necessary RESPONSIBILITIES: Collaborate with both external and internal stakeholders (e.g. sales, clinical, finance, RAQA, legal, R&D, and healthcare professionals) to create and execute a 3-5 year strategic plan Lead projects and programs to bolster existing accounts and increase market development in new territories – focused on growing Nipro’s overall renal market share Analyze and articulate market attractiveness, growth opportunities, risks, and mitigations Function as a central resource for product-related inquiries Author original content in the form of marketing collateral and training material destined for internal and external audiences Upgrade existing content as needed and across all channels/platforms Conduct sales training to new hires and for ongoing educational efforts Develop external executive presentations with quantitative arguments and qualitative data Demonstrate a general command of clinical literature and hemodialysis, as well as knowledge of regulatory and compliance procedures in medical and healthcare marketing Monitor the competitive landscape and learn competitive technologies, products, strategies, strengths, and weaknesses Create and execute comprehensive competitive responses and objection handling plans Support field activities such as sales demos, hands-on workshops, education, and lead generation Contribute to the achievement of sales goals and track the marketing expense budget for renal activities Identify and establish relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs) while working with the sales team to develop product advocates Manage relationships with professional societies Work cohesively and collaboratively with marketing communications to build the brand, deliver messaging and marketing tools, create awareness and buzz to generate market pull Plan, execute, and track projects in timely and effective manner Develop KPIs to assess performance, then report accordingly Attend regional and national events, tradeshows, conferences, meetings, etc. Other Duties: Please note, this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. EDUCATION & CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: Undergraduate degree required Advanced Degree is a plus EXPERIENCE & REQUIRED SKILLS: 3-5 years of experience in marketing, product management, sales, or related business management role Experience with medical devices, preferably related to nephrology, hemodialysis, vascular access, etc. Demonstrated record of success working in a team environment Proven ability to drive success in an entrepreneurial organization, working with different internal and external/customer cultures Proven drive and willingness to succeed in an entrepreneurial organization Proven analytical and creative talent, tactical and strategic thinking, and innovative and pragmatic approaches Proven strengths in multi-tasking and project management Excellent communication and interpersonal skills WORK AUTHORIZATION & SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: Must be able to provide proof of eligibility to work in the United States at time of hire EEO Statement: Nipro Medical Corporation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any time without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Bridgewater, NJ 08807: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Agile: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location Work Remotely: No Work Location: One location

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Welcome to the University of North Texas System, or UNT World as we like to call ourselves. UNT World includes the University of North Texas in Denton, the University of North Texas at Dallas and the University of North Texas Health Science Center in Fort Worth. We are the only university system based exclusively in the robust Dallas-Fort Worth region and we are committed to transforming lives and creating economic opportunity through education. We are growing with the DFW region, enrolling a record 47,000+ students across our system and awarding nearly 12,000 degrees each year. Posting Title Business Intelligence Analyst Department UNT-Data Analytics & Instl Rsrch-110110 Job Location Denton Full Time/Part Time Full-Time Salary Information Department Summary Data, Analytics, and Institutional Research (DAIR) serves the University of North Texas by providing accurate and reliable data, enhanced insights via analytics, and robust reporting in support of planning, policy making, academic assessment and program reviews. The team has a wide array of experience in higher education policy and practice, quantitative and qualitative analysis, computer science, financial analysis, and business intelligence. DAIR is a fast-paced work environment with numerous projects and opportunities. A commitment to training and professional development exists and is encouraged to promote competency in an evolving higher education data landscape. Position Overview The Business Intelligence Analyst position in Data Management is an excellent role for an individual wishing to join a team of hard working and future-focused data and analytics professionals. The successful candidate will work collaboratively as a member of the Data, Analytics, and Institutional Research (DAIR) team and will interact with internal and external stakeholders to support a variety of data management, training, analysis and benchmarking initiatives at The University of North Texas (UNT). The person in this role will assist with the ongoing development and implementation of SAS Business Intelligence tools (SAS Visual Analytics, SAS Visual Statistics, SAS Business Data Network, SAS Workflow Studio, and SAS Data Management Studio) to promote data warehousing, data governance, data quality and the development and use of analytic dashboards (known collectively as the Insights Program) designed for wide distribution to the UNT community. The primary functions of this role will be to 1) assist the Director of Data Management with building relationships with functional and technical Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to develop documentation of data resources and institutional processes, 2) assist with training and knowledge transfer activities related to the Insights Program, and 3) perform data analysis, generate analytics, and communicate results involving external benchmarking and peer comparisons. The successful candidate will join a strong team of data modelers, analysts, and institutional researchers to provide direct support to internal and external stakeholders, manage relationships with data providers and end users, and assist with communication and collaboration to notify the user community of changes, enhancements and new analytics and data resources. Finally, the successful candidate will be tasked with monitoring security roles and permissions of individuals who are provided access to the Insights Program and provide regular audits to the Director. DAIR is focused on helping all employees expand their skills and encourage technology adoption through formal professional development. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in related field and five years of professional experience in a related field; or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Ability to analyze data, including numerical detail, identify patterns or trends, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to present various data in clear concise forms to a variety of audiences. Basic working knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, legal statutes, and analysis and reporting of financial data. Preferred Qualifications This 12 month position requires excellent writing, oral communication, and computer skills. The successful candidate will possess a strong working knowledge of SQL and SAS programming and will be required to establish and maintain effective working relationships with data providers and consumers. A Master’s Degree in a related field and two years of data analysis work experience is preferred. The person in this position will be required to comply with all UNT Computing, State, and Federal rules regarding data usage and confidentiality. Preferred qualifications include experience working in an institutional research setting, a working knowledge of external student tracking and peer benchmarking data resources available to higher education (e.g., the National Student Clearinghouse, National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) Integrated Post-Secondary Educational Data System (IPEDS), and the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board (THECB). Required License / Registration / Certification Work Schedule Monday thru Friday 8-5pm Driving University Vehicle No Security Sensitive This is a security sensitive position. EEO Statement The University of North Texas System and its component institutions are committed to equal opportunity and comply with all applicable federal and state laws regarding nondiscrimination and affirmative action. The University of North Texas System and its component institutions do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or veteran status in its application and admission processes, educational programs and activities, and employment practices. Classification Title Business Intelligence Analyst Physical Requirements Sitting, Squatting, Stooping, Bending, Standing Job Duties o Build relationships and collaborate with System, Provost’s Office, and departmental colleagues to better understand faculty data. o Actively engage in learning PeopleSoft data structures to assist Insights data modeling and visualization needs. o Work to identify and provide assistance to data stewards and SMEs to correct data quality issues. o Assist with documentation and governance of faculty data. o Engage in continued training, exposure, and new technical learning related to the SAS Business Intelligence/Insights environment. o Assist with Insights Program training to maximize usage of faculty dashboard and other tools. o Provide direct support to university leadership related to peer benchmarking using resources at the State and Federal levels related to faculty data. o Adhere to all Federal, State and University rules, ethics/compliance standards, and policies. o Ensure all work is complete, accurate, and delivered in line with agreed upon timelines. o Perform job functions as a collaborative team member who shares expertise, individual knowledge, and skills through working closely with others to increase value to the University. Posting Number S3260P Position End Date (if temporary) Special Instructions to Applicants

title: Software Engineer
description: Software Engineer (Front-End)   Job Description   OVERVIEW Apartments.com is the leading online apartment rental listing website, offering property, commuter, and neighborhood information for more than 1,000,000 available units nationwide. A CoStar Group subsidiary, the Apartments.com network includes Apartments.com, ForRent.com, ApartmentFinder.com, Apartamentos.com, ApartmentHomeLiving.com, ForRentUniversity.com, After55.com, CorporateHousing.com and WestsideRentals.com. Reaching millions of renters worldwide, enabling both qualified traffic and highly engaged renters, Apartments.com is the fastest growing site within the residential rental industry. We are searching for Web Developers to join our development team in the Charlottesville office. You will be responsible for supporting and implementing new products and features across our University Off Campus student housing sites and Apartments Network sites. These include high traffic sites like Apartments.com, ForRent.com, ApartmentFinder.com, and others. Universities select CoStar as their exclusive outsourcing partners, to extend their university website and promote the service to students, parents, and faculty/staff. You will work with a broad range of technologies and will be integral in driving our products to provide the best experience in the industry. We need someone that is a team motivator and driven to produce robust products in a fast-paced environment. Join us in supporting our mission. RESPONSIBILITIES Designing, building, testing and deploying scalable, reusable and maintainable applications that handle large amounts of data. Taking full ownership of your work, from development and testing, to eventual deployment and support in production. Collaborating with other engineers, product owners, designers, and leadership. Becoming a trusted team member in matters of technical architecture, design and code. Advocating for evolution and improvement - both technical and non-technical - within our teams. Includes new tech, tools and best practices. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree 3+ years of professional software development experience. Expertise in modern front-end framework (JavaScript, Angular, React, NodeJS etc.) Expertise with software development best practices, including standards, code reviews, source control, builds, testing and operations Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities Solid understanding and experience with Object Oriented Programming PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Hands on experience with Source Control, such as Git or TFS Hands on experience with Cloud platforms such as AWS and/or Docker is a plus Experience with relational database systems such as SQL Server and experience with NoSQL (Elasticsearch, etc.) is a plus Knowledgeable with debugging tools including Chrome Debugger, Postman, Fiddler, Kibana etc. OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide. WHATS IN IT FOR YOU: Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it - see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group:

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Are you a force for good? Do you enjoy providing insights through data and excel at presenting complex information to others that is both understandable and action-oriented? Does the opportunity to devote your talents to a cause much greater than yourself excite you? The Arbor Day Foundation is a place you can do work that matters, with people who care. As we say at the Foundation: life is short, love where you work. As one of the world's largest conservation organizations, the Arbor Day Foundation inspires people to plant, nurture, and celebrate trees. We help others understand and use trees as a solution to global issues (like air quality, water quality, climate change, deforestation, poverty, and hunger) that are critical to survival. We need a Business Intelligence Analyst to provide data support to business leaders through dashboards, automated and custom models and ad hoc reports; helping them understand their operational drivers and make sound business decisions. ***YOU HAVE:*** + An analytical mindset. You understand the cause-effect relationships between drivers and outcomes. You are able to see the problem or opportunity and develop analyses that helps business owners make the best decisions. + Technical skills. You’re strong in SQL, data modeling and reporting. Ideally, you have prior experience with Power BI or Tableau. + Great communication skills. Seeing things from someone else’s perspective is how you operate. You enjoy interacting with others and having variety in your work. + An organized approach. You’ve found success by staying organized, adjusting priorities and communicating with stakeholders in a constantly changing business landscape. You consider the impact of work on other areas when designing solutions. + An autonomous nature. Working independently to develop solutions with little explicit direction is your sweet spot. + Experience. Our ideal candidate has 2-4 years of business intelligence/data analysis experience. ***YOU WILL:*** + Develop framework for how to deliver insights. Along with the BI team, you will play an important role in establishing best practices for how to work with internal areas to provide value through the use of data. + Build and maintain reporting solutions in Power BI, SSRS with automation and long-term sustainability in mind. + Answer BI questions and anticipate needs to support areas with insights into their data. + Be a partner. You’ll work with business stakeholders to influence decisions and provide strategic value. + Collaborate and learn. You’ll take the time to understand and learn processes and the most important questions across multiple areas. This will help you determine useful business questions or opportunities and define and design reporting and analytics solutions. ***LOVE WHERE YOU WORK:*** + We’re in this together. A culture focused on a genuine interest in the wellbeing of others, collaboration, and the intrinsic shared purpose to do what’s right. We pride ourselves on the culture we’ve built. We love it, and we know you will too. + We care about your health. We offer competitive healthcare (health, dental, vision) coverage for you and your loved ones matched with a wellness incentives program. + We invest in your future. Company paid short-term and long-term disability, life insurance and 401k with company match are available. + We want you to unplug when needed. We believe in taking your time off without guilt, including the week between Christmas and New Years that we close our Lincoln Campus to recharge. + We know the little things matter. Team members receive a monthly transportation stipend, a fully stocked kitchen, and access to a plethora of learning and development opportunities. + We’ll round out the experience. We put our culture first, and we host events and experiences throughout the year to show that we care about you (and your family).

title: Data Engineer
description: OVERVIEW As a Data Engineer on our solutions delivery team, you will have the unique opportunity to work on programs advancing the digital transformation of critical government systems. This program will support one of our intelligence customers in Chantilly, VA. Our delivery teams are driven to explore new ideas and technology, and care deeply about collaboration, feedback, and iteration. We follow SAFe agile practices, embrace the Ops (DataOps/DevSecOps/MLOps) to "automate-first", use modern tech stacks, and constantly challenge each other to grow and improve. If large-scale, data-driven projects resonate with you, and you care deeply about joining a mission-driven company with a strong growth direction and diverse culture, we'd love to learn more about you. Check out the details below, and let's connect. RESPONSIBILITIES Technical members of our solutions teams require little guidance, but love to learn, collaborate, and problem solve. This position requires a senior level of experience and a strong desire to solve our customers' hardest technical and data challenges. The Data Engineer will be responsible for the following: Responsible for assisting in curriculum creation and instruction to help students learn how to develop, construct, test and maintain architectures, Align architecture with business requirements Data acquisition Develop data set processes Use programming language and tools Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality, Conduct research for industry and business questions Use large data sets to address business issues Deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods Prepare data for predictive and prescriptive modeling Find hidden patterns using data Use data to discover tasks that can be automated Deliver updates to stakeholders based on analytics QUALIFICATIONS Requirements: Senior skill level 5+ years of data engineering or data management experience Proficiency with major data sciences tools such as SQL, Python, R, and Git. Demonstrated experience with cleaning, management, optimizing performance and processing large volumes of data. Familiarity with industry best-practices for software-hardware optimization when processing large sets of data. Experience with machine learning, with statistical modeling, time-series forecasting, and/or geospatial analytics is preferred. Experience with Hadoop, Spark or other parallel storage/computing processes is a plus TS/SCI+ Poly required We're looking for a motivated Data Engineer eager to advance not only your professional career, but also the missions of our Intelligence and Defense communities. At NT Concepts, you'll be able to: Have a meaningful impact on the company's growth, and share in the rewards accordingly Develop your own career path through our What's Next program, which emphasizes person growth through training and certification Work on programs of importance that directly impact National Security and the world Work in a fun, "challenging yet rewarding" fast-paced environment Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods setting at a desk and working on a computer Must be able to lift up to 10-15 pounds at times. #CJ

title: Product Manager
description: We are looking for a Product Analyst to help data driven decision making for Product Management and the development leadership teams. Qualitative & Quantitative data is the start and stop of all our product decision making (not our opinions). Our users vote with their clicks. You will leverage your technical skills to find answers to business problems. Working and contributing towards multiple initiatives, you will engage closely with cross functional teams to drive practices, design and execution of experiments from inception to completion. You will recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis, including data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation and drive results in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment. Essential Responsibilities: Embedded within product teams and working alongside Product Owners, UX, Engineering and Data Science to ensure daily experiments lead to a continuous discovery methodology, and results are aggregated. Work with product managers to structure and execute disciplined experiments: A/B testing, multivariate testing to check hypothesis, measure and analyze results, and drive product recommendations. Be able to understand user needs, understand user behavior on page, being able to divide users in groups depending on their target on page, and conversions vs. dropouts. Leverage technical skills to research and mine big data sources to understand, develop a point of view to guide the development of product experiences. Help with data driven research for new product initiatives. Become an analytics/data subject matter expert. Make a business impact through analytical and strategic guidance and reporting. Excellent collaborative and influencing skills. Must be able to work with teams of Data Engineers and Analysts and resolve dependencies. Help develop KPIs and metrics to track initiative progress/performance to enable a focus on results, performance of our products/ diagnose problems. Facilitate building of dashboards to monitor the performance of our products and diagnose problems to share insights and present to senior leadership regularly. Illustrate key business trends and drivers through effective data interpretation and visualization. Clearly and concisely present strategic and tactical recommendations. Job Requirements: Required Knowledge and Skills: Bachelors or Advanced Degree preferred in Business, Statistics, Finance or related field 5+ years of progressively responsible experience with product analytics, experimentation techniques (A/B testing, multivariate testing), and a data driven culture Strong hands-on SQL query experience (must be able to analyze large, complex data sets) Experience with data/analytical tools including Excel, Tableau Experience with Data Warehouse Techniques (Data Modeling, ETL, Database systems, Business Intelligence) in cloud stack such as AWS, etc. Excellent problem-solving skills, self-motivated with the capacity to work under pressure and tight deadlines Experience executing on projects with diverse stakeholder groups Intellectual curiosity for what creates value for our customers and drives the business Experience working directly with product owners and software development teams Experience with automation of reporting to drive improvements in business processes Knowledge of visualization techniques with an ability to translate findings for a general business audience Experience with Google Analytics a plus CareerBuilder employees are currently remote. We do have offices based in Chicago and Atlanta. When it is safe to return to the office, you will have the ability to continue to be remote or utilize the Chicago or Atlanta offices as determined by your manager. Benefits and Perks Connecting people with meaningful work is one of the most important things anyone can do – which means we need to support the employees who make that possible. CareerBuilder’s team enjoys a host of perks and benefits, including: Comprehensive Medical, Dental & Vision, Life & Disability Programs Option to enroll in supplemental Life, AD&D, Accident, Critical Illness, Home & Auto, Transit and Legal Programs Parental support including paid maternity and parental leave, Milk Stork, Healthy Pregnancy Program and Fertility Support Services Education Reimbursement Program allowing up to $5k per year towards completion of a Bachelor’s and non-MBA graduate degree, and up to $10K per year towards completion of an MBA Wellness Support & Initiatives Employee Assistance Program with free counseling sessions Wellness/Tobacco Free credits towards medical premiums On-site meditation rooms 401(k) Program with a two year vesting schedule, annual employer match, and an opportunity to make Pretax and Roth contributions. Financial educational webinars and individual retirement planning advising available. CareerBuilder, LLC is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, ancestry, marital or veteran status. TSR ID: 002399

title: Data Analyst
description: We have an opening for a Data Analyst. This position may sit in any of our U.S. offices. The Data Analyst will assist with gathering, validating, synthesizing, reporting and analyzing data from a variety of sources and systems, and using data visualization techniques to produce data-driven reports and products to support legal practice. The Data Analyst will assist in developing data-driven publications and products for various practice groups, reporting findings to explain trends, and making recommendations and collaborating with other staff in Practice Innovation (PI) and Firm practitioners to identify opportunities. In this capacity, the Data Analyst will: Work directly with the Firm’s attorneys, Practice Innovation staff and leaders to collect and analyze data; produce tangible insights; develop actionable reports, dashboards and other visualizations and contribute to client-facing publications and other deliverables; Maintain data on specific practice group clients, matter work, and competitive trends; Support data needs related to ad-hoc Practice Group, client, and departmental requests, including by providing regular reporting including monthly and quarterly business reviews; Work with Practice Innovation staff and leaders to improve Firm data repositories and processes as appropriate; Work directly with the Firm’s strategic data initiative team; Display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format; Present findings in a clear and concise manner; Work independently and follow through on assignments with minimal direction; take action when answers to a problem are not readily apparent; Manage, mine and analyze a broad array of quantitative and qualitative data assets; Be analytical and passionate about working with data, driven to dive deep, and eager to make broad business impact; Act as an ambassador for Practice Innovation while interacting with other Firm departments and practices; Handle additional related projects as necessary, including assisting on special projects for PI; and Work beyond scheduled hours as necessary. Qualifications: BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management or related discipline highly preferred; Law firm or legal industry experience preferred; Minimum 3 years of experience working in a data analysis role; Minimum 3 years of experience developing summary reports; Demonstrated knowledge of MS Office tools including Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Power BI and deep experience with reporting and query tools (i.e. Sharepoint, Tableau, Business Objects, etc.), databases and data management; Adept in writing database queries (i.e. SQL, MySQL, PL/SQL, T-SQL)and programming/scripting (VBA, C#, Python, R, Javascript or ETL frameworks); Experience developing data standards and formulating metrics for reporting; Spreadsheet modeling and presentation-making skills to effectively present data in a compelling way, both verbal and written; Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy; Strong organizational and problem solving skills; Ability to prioritize multiple assignments, use initiative and judgment to accomplish timely results, and work under tight deadlines; A passion for and belief in the power of making data-driven decisions; Willingness to work a flexible schedule; and Excellent written and oral communication skills; excellent interpersonal skills.

title: Data Scientist
description: Who We Are: Take-Two develops, publishes and markets some of the world's biggest games. We publish products through our labels Rockstar Games, 2K, Ghost Story, PlayDots, Social Point as well as Private Division label and Nordeus. Our Rockstar label creates Grand Theft Auto and Red Dead Redemption, two of the most critically acclaimed gaming franchises in history. Our 2K label creates games like NBA 2K, WWE 2K, Bioshock, Borderlands, Evolve, XCOM and the beloved Sid Meier's Civilization. Our Private Division label publishes Kerbal Space Program, Ancestors and The Outer Worlds. While our offices (physical and virtual) are casual and inviting, we are deeply committed to our core tenets of creativity, innovation and efficiency, and individual and team development opportunities. Our industry and business are continually evolving and fast-paced, providing numerous opportunities to learn and hone your skills. We work hard, but we also like to have fun, and believe that we provide a great place to come to work each day to pursue your passions. The Challenge Take-Two Interactive, Inc., a leader in the interactive entertainment industry, is looking for dynamic, highly analytical data scientists to join the enterprise-wide data science center of excellence. This CoE is a critical component of our overall enterprise analytics strategy. You will be working with data engineers and analysts to find valuable insights about our industry, the market, the games, and our player communities. You will also find the best ways to turn these insights into reliable and scalable solutions for our creative and corporate teams throughout the global organization What You'll Take On Champion the use of data science, machine learning, and AI to reduce cost and increase the value of human judgment in decision making. Work with business partners to understand how data science can help meet their business needs, formulate quantitative and measurable objectives, and guide them to actionable solutions. Use advanced research techniques such as statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization to explore data, test hypotheses, identify underlying causes and patterns. Collaborate with divisions to leverage best in breed data science practice already in place, share knowledge and create new models and algorithms to solve problems distinct to corporate (e.g. sales forecasting, promo optimization, etc.) Develop models to identify, monitor and measure results of various key performance indicators reflecting the health of various Take-Two products in different segments of the interactive entertainment field. Build optimization models aligned with key performance indicators that are predictive of profit for each stage of the interactive entertainment industry's life cycle. Participate in the design and building of the data science center of excellence. What You Bring 4-6 years of relevant experience and a Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Operational Research, Engineering, etc). Proficient in Python and Jupiter Notebook Experience using data science and ML libraries, such as SciPy and scikit-learn Data visualization tools (e.g. MatPlotLib, Seaborn, Tableau, etc.) Familiar with Git/Github Operating with data at scale (e.g. Apache Spark, Snowflake, Databricks, etc.) Solid understanding and professional experience in statistical analysis Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with experience in breaking down a complex problem into solvable components Solid skills in data extraction, exploration, transformation and visualization Deep understanding of best-in-class and emerging methods and techniques in data science, with a high level of analytical rigor in formulating insights and strategies A confident, self-starter with the ability to think logically and make fact-based decisions Able to communicate clearly and concisely – to distill clear and simple themes from complex analytical findings Enjoy forward and critical thinking Great to Have: Advanced degree in a quantitative field Experience in a deep learning library (e.g. PyTorch, Keras/Tensorflow) Cloud machine learning platforms, e.g. AWS SageMaker Writing and tuning SQL What We Offer You: Great Company Culture. Ranked as one of the most creative and innovative places to work, creativity, innovation, efficiency, diversity and philanthropy are among the core tenets of our organization and are integral drivers of our continued success. Growth: As a global entertainment company, we pride ourselves on creating environments where employees are encouraged to be themselves, inquisitive, collaborative and to grow within and around the company. Work Hard, Play Hard. Our employees bond, blow-off steam, and flex some creative muscles – through corporate boot camp classes, company parties, game release events, monthly socials, and team challenges. Benefits. Medical (HSA & FSA), dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase plan, commuter benefits, in-house wellness program, broad learning & development opportunities, a charitable giving platform with company match and more! Perks. Fitness allowance, employee discount programs, free games & events, stocked pantries and the ability to earn up to $500+ per year for taking care of yourself and more! Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. ("T2") is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, which means we are committed to creating and celebrating diverse thoughts, cultures, and backgrounds throughout our organization. Employment at T2 is based on substantive ability, objective qualifications, and work ethic – not an individual's race, creed, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sex offenses, reproductive health decision, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law. #LI-VE1 Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Analyst
description: KnowBe4, Inc. is the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day. Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4's platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day. We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years. The Data Analyst will be a part of the Data Science & Analytics team, who are focused on turning data into business value. The individual in this role will be designing and developing reports, dashboards, and other analytical solutions to one of core business areas. To accomplish this, the ideal candidate will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, and to solve problems for them both proactively and reactively. This position will work with the data platform team in order to ensure the necessary data is accessible, documented, and transformed properly to facilitate analysis. Responsibilities: Design and develop dashboards, reports, and analyses to answer business questions Collaborate with business area leadership to understand their operations, needs, and strategic initiatives Collaborate with data platform team to understand how to best use the data available Help data platform team refine requirements and prioritize projects that affect the analyst's covered business area Proactively educate business stakeholders about the data and capabilities available within the data platform Translate high-level or ambiguous business requests into detailed, actionable insights. Validate and improve the quality of data displayed in reports and dashboards Serve as a business area's primary point of contact for data and analytical needs, refining requirements and routing to other teams as needed Minimum Qualifications: A bachelor's degree or approved data analytics certification (e.g. Google's Data Analytics Certification) 1 year of experience in a similar role preferred Experience with SQL, preferably with experience using Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, etc. Understanding of relational databases and data modeling Experience with a data visualization tool like Looker, Tableau, etc. Experience communicating analytical findings to a non-technical audience Excellent analytical skills with knowledge of statistical techniques preferred Experience building spreadsheets and presentations (Excel/PowerPoint/Sheets etc.) Note: An applicant assessment and background check may be part of your hiring procedure. Individuals seeking employment at KnowBe4 are considered without prejudice to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please visit www.knowbe4.com/careers/request-accommodation. No recruitment agencies, please.

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Director, Food Service Sales Tribe 9 Foods is a manufacturer and partnership of value-based brands (RP's Pasta Co., Carla's Pasta, Taste Republic, and Yumbutter) with a mission to promote eating and living well. Tribe 9 is positioned to make big inroads in the co-manufacturing space and is looking for a strategic person to lead our Food Service sales team. Summary of Role: Sales Director takes a multi-focused strategic approach to developing sales opportunities with key accounts and national business development. The individual will be responsible for presenting product lines in a favorable light, negotiating sales contracts, and developing/managing sales leads. The primary responsibility of this role will be to drive the sale of products produced by Tribe 9 Foods within the food service channel. Primary Responsibilities: Involved with the day-to-day sales associated with existing and prospective customers, project management, including national growth of Carla's Pasta, Taste Republic, and co-packed private label brands. Ownership of P&L; understanding of pricing and corresponding cost models. Oversee Food Service business development & contract negotiations. Direct responsibility of Sysco Category Management and other distribution partners. Manage Brokers and Regional Managers where necessary in each market to establish growth goals and implement strategy to accomplish those goals. Review sales analytics and develop market strategy. Negotiate program agreements with customers. Plan, schedule, develop, and execute sales trainings and new product introductions with Broker offices. Regular collaboration with VP of Sales to review and update strategies and initiatives. Accept ownership of Sales objectives and all facets of our business that impact sales growth. Work in tandem with Tribe 9 Foods HQ office to develop and be responsible for margin realization. Contribute to ideation sessions with R&D to identify potential new products. Contribute to project management and organization of new product launches. Attend key trade shows. This position is also called upon to perform other duties not specifically outlined by this posting. Qualifications: Independent, resourceful, entrepreneurial and go-getter. Bachelor's Degree; relevant experience will be considered in lieu of education. 5+ years of B2B Manufacturing experience and sales experience preferred. Ideal candidate would have experience within the Food Service category. Proven experience working with R&D to develop the next generation of products. Ability to represent Tribe 9 Foods and sell our brand and corporate mission. Negotiation skills, Team Player, Multitasking. Basic computer skills including Microsoft Office. Collaborative/Accountable/Results driven/ Detail Oriented. Quick grasp of business model including economic factors/influences. Analytical and process oriented. Able and willing to communicate effectively. Motivated, persuasive, individuals willing to take ownership of duties. Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time within a large geographic area. Among the top benefits Tribe 9 Foods offers: Competitive wages with promotional opportunities Health, Dental, and Vision insurance Company-paid vacation and holiday time 401(k) retirement plan with matching contributions by Tribe 9 Foods Health savings account (HSA) Health fitness reimbursement Professional development Paid volunteer hours Our guiding principles: Tackle Anything: embrace the unknown; bring ideas to reality; conquer lofty goals Relationship Driven: build partnerships and amaze our customers Inspire Each Other: as each individual grows, so does the organization; unlock each other's potential B Corp Values: balance profit and purpose; use business as a force for good Entrepreneurial Spirit: challenge the status quo through creative destruction and innovation Tribe 9 Foods is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Data Scientist
description: Stefanini is looking for Data Scientist with Linux in VA. Responsibilities: Serve as intermediate or senior staff specialist providing assistance and direction to economists and quantitative analysts who work with analytics in an HPC Linux environment. Responsible for Tier 1 and 2 software support, including technical advice, guidance and informal training to customers using hardware and software programs. Works in a team setting for cross-collaboration and end-user support. Serve as first point of contact and issue owner, providing assistance and direction to users while working with other technical staff on resolution. Troubleshoots and restores routine technical service and platform problems by analyzing, identifying and diagnosing faults and symptoms using established processes and procedures. Builds strong relationships with business staff and advocates for the benefits of HPC and Big Data tools to optimize existing analytical efforts. Partners with internal business owners, technical team members, and senior management to assist and support the design, development, and implementation of analytic workflows to meet mission-critical business objectives and inform executive decision-making. Assist in recommending and implementing software and configuration changes needed to effectively meet business needs. Assists where necessary with business process redesign to take advantage of the efficiencies offered by automation. Assists in recommending and implementing software packages needed based on business/user needs while meeting standards (i.e. FISMA, CMMI, NIST) Researches, recommends and writes processes and procedures to meet necessary standards. Qualifications: We have an immediate opening for a Senior Developer to support Open Source and Commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) data analytics software products and the end users who are proficient on a broad range of data analytics and business intelligence tools. The individual must be experienced in the system development life cycle (SDLC), especially change management processes and procedures. The team follows a methodology requiring the individual to have hands-on experience with Agile processes and practices. The individual should have experience working with remote, matrixed teams. The individual is responsible for delivering a production-grade experience in a structured, integrated, analytics computing environment through SDLC best practices, including detailed technical design, development, testing, and evaluating automation used to provide analytics solutions. This includes the ability to work with the customer to clarify and interpret requirements, as well as working with common application designs and specifications. Ability to provide innovative solutions to technical needs and business requirements. Ability to accurately assess impact, urgency, and priority of competing end user requests for assistance, and manage support activities accordingly. Experience working in a 'service desk' or support role with users. Ability to anticipate typical follow up questions and provide direction and answers proactively. Experience with following up on open issues, seeing an issue all the way to resolution, and ensuring the customer is satisfied with the resolution. Ability to relate technical information into non-technical concepts. Experience with Linux OS including command line and Bash scripts. Experience using data analytics tools including Python, R, etc. Experience working with version control systems, e.g., GitLab. Experience with network authentication protocols and services highly desirable, e.g., Kerberos authentication. Experience creating dashboards and visualizations desirable, e.g., in Splunk, R, Python, etc. Experience with SQL and/or querying databases desirable. Experience with Jira, TFS or similar issue tracking software preferred. Experience working in an Agile or Scrum-based environment preferred. Strong oral and written communication skills Strong interpersonal skills to work with others at all levels of the organization, and to assist end users requesting technical assistance. Self-motivated to understand existing platform capabilities and work with minimal supervision. High degree of collaboration and ability to communicate with Linux system administrators for troubleshooting, enhancements, and product integration. 3+ years of relevant work experience. Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience, Scientific or Computer Science degree preferred.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: PLEASE NOTE: Ability to work remotely with minimal travel to our New Jersey office. US Applicants only!! We are seeking an experienced digital marketing manager to help us manage the day-to-day for a fast-growing CPG brand and ecommerce channel. Manage digital creative, assets, and catalog. Campaign management across multiple channels, including email, mobile and social platforms. Organize and evaluate data into actionable recommendations. Requirements Prior experience with promotions, social media marketing, email marketing, loyalty/retention, affiliate marketing, digital advertising, and/or public relations Understanding of branding positioning and messaging Experience developing content for various marketing and social channels Understanding of digital marketing and social media best practices Ability to juggle and coordinate multiple projects across several key marketing channels simultaneously Ability to analyze a range of key performance metrics and synthesize findings into clear trends and actionable recommendations Outstanding communication skills with a focus on teamwork and follow-up Excellent project management, program management, and organizational skills Familiar with website optimization, landing pages, user funnels, and A/B testing Familiar with web analytics tools and reporting, including Google Analytics Demonstrated success with customer acquisition and retention Experience working with agencies, creative teams, and developers, understands creative briefs and approval processes Qualifications and Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science/Information Technology, MIS, Engineering, or a related field from an accredited college/university A professional with 5-10 years’ experience in multi-channel e-commerce marketing, email, and promotional experience Experience managing influencer, brand ambassador, and affiliate marketing programs Display and programmatic advertising experience Liaison with customer service to improve the customer experience Creative development and graphic design experience a plus Videography, photography, and/or video and photo editing experience CPG and subscription box experience are a plus Responsibilities include: Run the day-to-day management of projects and ensure that they are completed successfully Manage promotions, social media campaigns, content calendars, maintain content and calendars Develop branded and targeted content for various social and marketing channels Execute campaigns and measure the effectiveness of them, and provide recommendations for future improvements Collaborate with cross-functional teams, vendors, and stakeholders, including developers, agencies, freelancers, and other departments to ensure consistency of marketing messages and user experience Liaison with customer service to manage and continually improve the customer experience Recommend, implement, and test new digital platforms, channels, and tools Identify partnership and promotional opportunities Manage and optimize marketing campaigns, including email marketing, social media, and digital advertising Develop clear product marketing messaging both in-product and across external retention channels Grow engagement across the email, mobile, and social media marketing channels and identify segment trends and opportunities Benefits include: Ability to work remotely with minimal travel to
