title: Marketing Manager
description: Overview: Bethesda Softworks is seeking a Marketing Campaign Manager to join our growing team. Responsibilities: Own CRM marketing roadmap – including segmentation of players and personalized, targeted communications (via appropriate channels) – across our games. Develop blueprint for CRM success, including game data inputs, outputs and analysis required during the game development stage; Memorialize blueprint across key organizational functions and customize it by game. Create and manage content for targeted, multi-channel digital marketing communications for all live services games. Build player segmentation at brand and publisher levels using marketing automation tools and predictive analytics, continue to test and optimize segmentation. Develop A/B testing plans for multi-channel campaigns with clear KPIs; regularly work across marketing to report and present findings, up to the senior-management level. Manage digital communications calendar across brands, at the global level. Manage communications for publisher-level campaigns, including large-scale events, cross-brand sales, cross-sell initiatives. Qualifications: 5-10 years of experience in marketing, with a focus on digital marketing Experience with marketing automation platforms, including IBM, Adobe or Salesforce Experience Leading cross-functional teams, specifically product, business intelligence and sales Experience developing and managing digital marketing content and campaigns Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with experience writing both long-form and short-form digital marketing content Interest in gaming required; experience working in the gaming industry a plus Data driven marketer with strong analytical skillset, with experience driving key business KPIs and presenting results at the senior management level Strong project management skills with the ability to push projects forward Applicant Privacy Notice: CCPA Applicant Privacy Notice

title: Software Engineer
description: Job Summary: Working as part of an integrated Agile development team, the Software Engineer collaborates closely with other software engineers, systems engineers, database administrators, designers and product managers to deliver software capabilities end-to-end across the development life cycle. The engineer actively participates in Agile development practices such as Scrum, Kanban, TDD, paired and mob work, automated and manual testing, and/or leading design sessions, and clarifying value and acceptance criteria for work. Software Engineers enrich JAX capabilities and toolsets, providing innovative solutions to research and business demands. The Software Engineer works on complex functional, technical, or architectural efforts, while executing them in an incremental and value-driven way. Requires broad technical knowledge and experience across a variety of IT areas, including domain knowledge, infrastructure, development, testing, design, analysis, DevOps technologies, and operations. An Experienced Professional that applies practical knowledge of the Software Engineering disciplines typically obtained through advanced education and work experience. Works independently with general supervision, problems faced are difficult but typically not complex. May influence others within the job area through explanation of facts, policies and practices. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with Agile team members to understand research and business issues and opportunities, develop/configure solutions to meet the need, test software. Collaborate with Agile team members to understand research and business issues and opportunities, develop/configure solutions to meet the need, test software utilizing automation and manual practices, implement proper security and governance controls, and proactively advise leadership on impediments/blocks uncovered throughout the software development life cycle. Provide leadership and input into direction of our software practices and direction for each software platform Minimum Qualifications: Requires 3 – 5 years of experience with Software Development and/or Application Configuration, preferably in an Agile environment. Experience with ITIL service management framework, including Release and Change Management Familiar with 3 or more of the following techniques utilized in Agile software development: data analytics, business and system analysis, technical design, paired and mob programming, automated unit and functional testing, test strategy, manual testing, user-centered design and design ops, test and/or behavior driven development, and continuous integration/deployment. Familiar with 3 or more of the following leadership skills such as collaboration, product management, domain knowledge in a relevant stakeholder area, facilitation, influence, conflict resolution, and mentorship. About JAX: The Jackson Laboratory (JAX) is an independent, nonprofit biomedical research institution with more than 2,400 employees. Headquartered in Bar Harbor, Maine, it has a National Cancer Institute-designated Cancer Center in Augusta, Maine, a genomic medicine institute in Farmington, Connecticut, and facilities in Ellsworth, Maine, Sacramento, California, and Shanghai, China. Its mission is to discover precise genomic solutions for disease and empower the global biomedical community in the shared quest to improve human health. JAX employees work in a collaborative, value-driven, and team-based environment where the focus is on advancing science and improving patients’ lives. Researchers apply genetics to increase the understanding of human disease and advance treatments and cures for cancer, neurological and immune disorders, diabetes, aging, and heart disease. JAX was voted among the top 15 “Best Places to Work in Academia” in the United States in a poll conducted by The Scientist magazine! EEO Statement: The Jackson Laboratory provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, age, mental disability, physical disability, medical condition, gender, sexual orientation, genetic information, ancestry, marital status, national origin, veteran status, and other classifications protected by applicable state and local non-discrimination laws.

title: Data Scientist
description: A bachelor’s degree in statistics, data science, applied mathematics, computer science, or engineering is required. An advanced degree from a highly respected academic institution is strongly preferred. 5+ years’ experience working as a Data Scientist. 3+ years’ of hands-on experience using tools such as R, Python, SQL, Stata, Spark and/or Matlab. AWS Hardware Engineering is looking for an experienced, self-driven Data Scientist to join their Data Science and Analytics team. You will be part of a group of talented engineers and scientists who builds data products and services to turn hardware monitoring data into insights using advanced analytics and machine learning. As a Data Scientist, you are able to use a range of data science methodologies to conduct analysis for cases when the solution approach that relates to a portion of a business or business process is unclear. You have a breadth of experience in the practical application of data science techniques and tools to solve difficult business problems. Your work is focused on team-level goals, medium size projects, and small subsets of larger goals. You are able to ramp up quickly on new areas where colleagues identify established solutions. The ideal candidate will be able to solve complex problems using data science principles that are highly accurate, stable, secure, scalable, and cost-effective. You will have hands-on experience leading and/or working on multiple simultaneous data science initiatives as well as be able to balance technical with business judgment to make the right decisions about technology, models and methodologies. You will strive for simplicity, and demonstrate significant creativity and high judgment backed by statistical proof. You will be responsible for developing KPIs, programs, reporting, visualizations, tests and research in order to drive business solutions using computational techniques, and statistics to support strategic and tactical decision-making. You will have significant experience performing large-scale data analysis and reporting. This position requires a solution-oriented candidate with a combination of deep business acumen, broad knowledge of statistics and algorithm development, and an analytical mindset. The candidate must have the ability to work with diverse customer groups to solve business problems and provide data solutions that are organized and simple to understand. You will have the opportunity to leverage extensive datasets and provide meaningful insights to improve the customer experience as well as optimize business decisions for Amazon. An MBA is preferred. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services is a plus. Strong knowledge in application development using JAVA, JavaScript, PYTHON, R, etc. Prior experience using reporting tool such as D3.js, Tableau, Kibana, Qlik or equivalent. Strong business acumen with an understanding of the marketing, accounting, decision support models, operations, leadership, and financial levers that drive profit, loss and customer experience. Deep experience with data mining, data analytics, predictive modeling, and advanced modeling techniques. Extensive hands-on experience working across multiple disciplines presenting findings to an executive audience. Experience with mentoring junior data scientists on the team. Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Title Business Analyst - People Process, Data & Reporting Excellence Job Description Summary The Business Analyst - People Process, Data & Reporting Excellence supports the Employee Experience & Services teams in making high-impact, data-driven decisions. The Business Analyst - People Process, Data & Reporting Excellence are responsible for the development of process and procedural documentation, ensuring global alignment of process and data architectures, develops and ensures quality assurance strategies, and partners with cross functional teams (TDS, HR, Finance, etc..) to enable process, data, and reporting quality and consumption. Job Description Responsibilities: Understand the various operations across Cushman and Wakefield geographically and functionally Work with cross-functional teams to design, build, and deploy reporting mechanisms with a focus on workforce management and data quality Utilize metrics to monitor success and determine improvement opportunities Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple (often disparate) sources and compiling it into a consumable and actionable outcomes Work in partnership with the Employee Experience & Services country leads/function leads to build reporting and other process/ data driven solutions that support automation and streamlining Support the development efficient and value added processes by questioning and partnering to achieve desired outcomes Partners with TDS and functional groups to develop process, data, and functional requirements, develops and maintains documentation and ensures transparency and record keeping for all changes Ensures quality assurance by developing strategies including testing, auditing, data usage, and data ownership models. Partners with Data Analytics teams to enable data leveraged decision-making. Performs other related duties as required or requested. Competencies: Experience in an analytical role with experience in interpreting data, analyzing results to identify trends Experience in HR Operations, Background Checks, Recruitment, Staffing, Payroll, etc. Analytical mind set and ability to see the big picture and influence others. Strong oral, written and presentation skills combined with the ability to lead group discussions Lean Six Sigma (preferred) Ability to manage through ambiguity where lines of ownership aren't always clear. Able to communicate complex messages and outputs from their analysis in a confident and ‘simple way. Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information. Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

title: Business Analyst
description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at http://www.jpmorganchase.com/ . The CIB Chief Data Office (CDO) is a business-centric organization whose purpose is to unlock value for our stakeholders through timely delivery of high-quality, compliant data. The CIB CDO oversees the overall strategy and execution of the CIB data agenda. Contributing to the broader CIB CDO agenda, the Reference Data Product (RDP) organization is entrusted to provide reference data products which support and enhance the needs of our business consumers. RDP's core functions are Business Relationship Management, Product Solutions, and Portfolio Management. Partnering closely with Technology, this diverse global team is dedicated to delivering high quality reference data solutions in line with the needs of our line-of-business and their respective clients. Above all, we value our data and each other. The Reference Data Product Solutions function drives the overall product vision and strategy, aligning to business priorities. The product suite includes Party Central, Reference Data Taxonomy (Business Taxonomy, Common Static Data, and Enterprise Product & Services Taxonomy), Reference Data Analytics, and Reference Data as a Service (RDaaS) architecture, components, and integration. The team works closely with both business stakeholders and technology partners to define new product features and drive business value. If you're interested in working in an environment where leadership, excellence, integrity, and diversity are among our core principles, then explore the opportunities at J.P. Morgan Chase. Description of Role, Functions and Activities The Reference Data Mart program of work provides real-time analytics and visualizations for Reference Data MIS and Data Quality. This program delivers a fully automated end to end solution for Operations Management and staff to analyze and visualize aggregated data and trends for reference data population, work load, data quality exception queues and volume metrics for Reference Data SoRs via customizable dashboards. The ideal candidate should possess knowledge of Banking Reference Data, engaging with stakeholders and technology teams to analyze & document requirements & gaps in areas of data sourcing, data aggregation, reporting & data visualization/dashboards. Familiar with scrum style of project execution, managing & prioritization of backlog and ownership of end to end delivery is expected. KEY OBJECTIVES OF THE ROLE Performing detailed business analysis in support of product features from opportunity identification, business case development through product performance Defining meaningful metrics to track, how to interpret them, and how to offer course corrections at the program or feature team level when necessary towards building dashboards and managing KPI data Defining and ensuring adherence to Agile best practices Defining and managing program work intake processes Defining and coordinating program level releases Facilitate solution demos to stakeholders TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES OF THE ROLE Knowledge of one or more Reporting Tool e.g. Tableau, SAP BO, Qliksense, Alteryx others Knowledge of SQL (Oracle, etc.) Knowledge of Agile tools, like Jira, Version one, etc. Writing technical specs, user stories and acceptance criteria. Knowledge of Data Test strategy & data testing is a PLUS. BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES OF THE ROLE: Strong written & verbal communication skills - Comfortable presenting in front of teams and leadership; possesses tools and techniques to keep participants engaged Ability to think outside the box and able to negotiate with parties to achieve a desired outcome Assumes ownership of problems and sees them through to resolution, making appropriate decisions where necessary. Proactive in identifying issues & making recommendations Adapts positively to change and acts as a change agent Qualifications Bachelor's degree 8+ years relevant experience in Business & Data Analysis space Experience in working in Data Management - Master Data, Data Quality Reporting, Data Analytics, etc. Agile Expertise - able to drive adoption across team MBA in Financial/Banking Domain is a Plus JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment. As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. These requirements may include sharing information in the firm's vaccine record tool, vaccination or regular testing, mask wearing, social distancing and daily health checks. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests. Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

title: Senior Product Manager
description: 2+ years of experience owning product definition, roadmap prioritization and end to end delivery for big-data and data science based products. 5+ years of overall technical product management experience Complete understanding of data science principles, quantitative concepts like statistical models and more. Bachelor’s degree in either data science, data analytics, computer science or any related field. Experience contributing to science and engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product. We are looking for an experienced analytics professional who is curious, driven, and passionate about marketing insights and analytics. If you are looking for a role where you can make a major impact by developing and launching new products to drive insights development and business strategies, we want to meet you. The Customer Behavior Analytics (CBA) organization owns Amazon’s insights pipeline from data collection to deep analytics. We aspire to be the place where Amazon teams come for answers, a trusted source for data and insights that empower our systems and business leaders to make better decisions. Our outputs shape Amazons marketing teams’ decisions and thus how Amazon customers see, use, and value their experience. CBA-XO’s mission is to make Amazon’s marketing the most measurably effective in the world. Our long-term objective is to measure the incremental impact of all Amazon’s marketing investments on consumer perceptions, actions, and sales. This requires measuring Amazon’s marketing comparably and consistently across channels, business teams and countries using a comprehensive approach that integrates all Paid, Owned and Earned marketing activity. As the experts on marketing performance, we will lead the Amazon worldwide marketing community by providing critical global insights that can power marketing best practices and tenets globally. As Senior Product Technical, you will be responsible for identifying customer needs and strategic business problems, define and drive development of big-data and data science based products from concept TO minimal viable product TO launch and drive full product lifecycle. Work cross-functionally with program mangers, legal, business development, engineering and data science team to perform technical, business and science feasibility analysis to drive product development and lifecycle management. Contribute to help shape product portfolio strategy, align your product roadmap and deliver features to achieve on the product portfolio vision. We are looking for someone who is customer focused, relishes ambiguity and has a passion for innovating to create a first-class customer experience. Responsibilities Include: Work closely with leadership and cross-functional teams to develop and deliver innovative software and services that enable marketing measurement at scale. · Discover, evaluate, and track global marketing and marketing measurement industry trends. · Partner with Engineering, Science and Business Intelligence teams to create best-in-class solutions for customers. · Contribute to a team culture of experimentation and innovation · Work with technical and non-technical stakeholders to understand and improve product capabilities. · Create & track success metrics to dig deeper on customer feedback to identify key pain points. · Manage bottlenecks, provide escalation, anticipate, and make trade-offs, balance the business needs versus technical constraints, and maximize business benefit while building great customer experiences. · Present confidently to senior, external partners, and stakeholders. · Roll up sleeves as necessary to ensure projects stay on schedule and meet our high standards of quality. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Skills in various big-data infrastructure (Apache Hadoop, Spark), programming, and database languages like Python and SQL. Experience working with machine learning, deep learning, causal inference models and other data science concepts. Excellent written communication skills with demonstrated experience engaging and influencing senior executives Strong analytic and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions A proven record of accomplishment of building new, innovative, and engaging customer experiences informed by customer data from various sources (market research, internal data bases, A/B testing, user research)

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Your Purpose: If you prefer a consultative approach to producing valuable data visualization reports to improve the lives and decisions of clients, we want to speak to you! We have an immediate need for a client-facing BI Consultant that will design, develop, and validate end-to-end BI Products for our customers. We are seeking a Mid or Sr level resource that takes pride in bringing value to external partners. In addition, you will be working with our cutting-edge technologies, including Google's Looker for visualizations that will report our AWS data using Snowflake! As a Business Intelligence Consultant, you will be part of the Service Delivery team that is responsible for activating and supporting clients on the hc1 platform. You will work with hc1's healthcare clients to solicit business and technical requirements and to design, develop, validate, and support custom business intelligence solutions that support our clients' business and clinical operations. hc1's BI Consultants serve as trusted advisors to business, clinical and technical client stakeholders, helping them develop strategies for harnessing the power of analytics to support data-driven decision making within their organizations. The BI Consultant is a member of the Service Delivery team and reports to the VP, Business Intelligence. How we will make an impact: hc1 is focused on improving lives with high-value care. Our unique machine learning algorithms transform laboratory data into personalized healthcare insights. As an AWS Partner Network organization, our cloud-based software organizes live data (including lab results, genomics, and medications) to deliver solutions that ensure the right patient gets the right test and the right prescription. Your Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, validate and support custom reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights that enable end users to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their business and clinical operations. Develop efficient, cost-effective data models to support custom analytics. Train hc1's client end-users to develop reports using hc1's reporting platform and consult with users on report design, development, and administration. Drive data democratization throughout the hc1 organization. Advise hc1 colleagues on best practices for data-driven decision making. Develop internal analytics to improve hc1 operations. Design Customer Solutions. Work with existing and potential customers to deeply understand their business and technical needs. Develop solutions that make the best use of hc1 products. Collaborate with hc1 field sales, training, and support teams to ensure customer success.. Engineer ETL processes to move and transform data from disparate sources to facilitate development of BI reports Develop stored procedures to process and maintain data for BI reporting Your Skills & Experiences: Bachelor's degree in an analytical, quantitative or technology-related field such as computer science, mathematics, physics, philosophy, public health or IT, or >1 year of direct experience developing business intelligence solutions 3+ years of experience reporting upon data stored in relational databases using standard reporting methodologies (e.g., SQL queries, data modeling, and drag-and-drop data visualization tools) An understanding of basic statistical concepts Experience working with healthcare data (LIS, EMR, Pharmacy, Billing) is a plus An interest in healthcare informatics Ability to communicate complex technical and business concepts to client users and IT staff Must be comfortable working in a client-facing role serving end users Applications for a "Senior" role will have 5+ years of the experience above, and also possess: A strong understanding of how analytics support quality programs, process improvement and business decision making. Ability to transform data into business intelligence and insights. Ability to create dashboards and reports in an actionable way to drive business change Ability to identify and resolve issues independently in a rapidly changing environment; taking initiative in ambiguous circumstances Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs. Our Technical Environment (NOT all required, prior experience with any similar tools will do!): hc1 platform MySQL Amazon Web Services (AWS) Snowflake Looker Python AWS Glue XML and web services Jira Github What's in it for you: Unlimited PTO, remote friendly and flexible hours 401k Matching Career planning, mentorships and professional development Stock Options Volunteer Opportunities Wellness Programs Compliance Training All of our employees are responsible for adhering to federal and state privacy regulations. You will be required to Complete annual regulatory training and certification as required for the Healthcare Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and other applicable regulations and policies as determined by hc1. Join our Talent Community: Get a glimpse into our culture and perks by visiting hc1.com/careers and follow us on Instagram (@hc1dotcom) to get a day in the life at hc1. Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment: hc1 is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Data Engineer
description: Travel Required: Less than 10% Public Trust: NACI (T1) Requisition Type: Regular The Data Engineer provides system and data engineering support to data analysis operations throughout the reporting and analysis lifecycle. The Engineer will build and maintain systems to extract, clean and transform data, using advanced automation and scripting tools. Duties include: Work with business owners and data analysts to develop technical solutions for reporting products Develop and maintain cron jobs and algorithms to extract and transform data into actionable information Build, test and maintain database pipeline architectures Use ETL tools to extract and load data for various reports Create data validation tools Automate data analysis and collection products Create documentation and presentations Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture Develop and conduct tests to ensure data solutions meet documented user requirements. Analyze IT environments to identify and assess critical capabilities and recommend solutions to problems of moderate scope and complexity. Collaborate with data science team to transform data and integrate algorithms and models into automated processes. Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. May coach and review the work of less-experienced professionals. Provide ongoing training for data analysts and staff on data tools and products Assist data analysts with data preparation to create sources for data products Help create governance processes and procedures. Support data collection, analysis and visualization projects as needed, including data modeling, database creation, and technical support Recommend and implement technical and automated solutions for manual processes Provide recommendations to streamline and improve current business processes Participate in special projects as needed Education Requires BS/BA degree with 5 years of experience or 3 years with a Master’s Degree Qualifications Expert coding knowledge including SQL and Python (required), and R (preferred) Knowledge of Linux and setting up cron jobs Understanding of relational and non-relational databases Experience working with large datasets, performing tasks such as data cleaning and processing (ETL) Experience with automation/scripting Experience with machine learning Knowledge of cloud storage and cloud computing/analytics Understanding of data security Ability to build prototypes of new data products and to automate workflows Willingness to learn and explore new data tools Ability to conduct feasibility studies to determine suitability to program requirements Experience with Tableau, Power BI, MS Office 365 suite Experience with data science tools such as STATA Excellent analytical and writing skills Strong verbal communication skills Highly motivated and collaborative This position requires being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by January 18, 2022 or the start date, if after January 18. Individuals who work in or reside in Florida, Montana, Tennessee, Texas, or work outside of the United States may be excluded from this requirement. We are GDIT. The people supporting some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We deliver. Bringing the expertise needed to understand and advance critical missions. We transform. Shifting the ways clients invest in, integrate, and innovate technology solutions. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. We are there. On the ground, beside our clients, in the lab, and everywhere in between. Offering the technology transformations, strategy, and mission services needed to get the job done. GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Job Summary The Senior Business Analyst, Information Systems plays a critical role in the partnership between eMoney business stakeholders and the Internal Systems team. This strategic and hands-on role combines deep understanding and analysis of cross-functional operations with systems knowledge to drive delivery of prioritized initiatives. The Senior Business Analyst develops and maintains productive working relationships with stakeholders, key business owners and peers to drive enterprise goals. The ideal candidate will seamlessly balance progress across Strategic Initiatives, partnering with stakeholders and development team members on requirements and architectural direction for large-scale solutions, features, enhancements and issues related to various business systems, such as CRM, Billing, and Learning Management, as they arise. To ensure success, the Senior Business Analyst will create working groups that bring together diverse skill sets and business perspectives, lead the aggregation, analysis, and documentation of technical and business requirements, and continually confirm alignment with business vision. By creating and providing clear, well-refined requirements to Product Owners and development teams, they impact the design, timing, and implementation of solutions. The Senior Business Analyst will act as a servant-leader to initiative working groups, providing perspective, guidance, and project management that represents shared priorities, identifying opportunities for collaboration and efficiencies of scale. In addition, they are the point of communication back to stakeholders, business owners, and end users, effecting organizational readiness, evangelizing solutions, and promoting the effective use of data, information, and technology to inform decisions. Job Responsibilities Apply technical and operational subject matter expertise, best practices, and thought leadership around the internal tech stack to lead and influence solution design related to various business systems Develop and feed the development team backlogs; partner with Product Owners on ongoing prioritization, refinement, communications, and expectations (development team and business owners across business units) Collaborate with end users, business owners and leadership in the design and development of business requirements, reporting and data needs, workflows, use cases, test scripts, and training materials Drive development teams to delivery by exploring and documenting solutions, which may include tool implementations, workflow/process engineering, and/or system modifications Represent specific business areas in cross-functional teams to build economies of scale, tighter integrations, improved handoffs, timely data sharing, and greater overall cohesion within each functional area of the organization and the enterprise Team with the Data and Analytics program in representing business area priorities and client experiences to discern patterns, areas for improvement, data gaps, and opportunities Collaborate with leadership and wider cross-functional teams to refine and build processes that optimize client experiences and enhance client experience data capture Understand complex and/or competing business needs and translate them into functional requirements Act as the bi-directional point of contact between Sales, Marketing, and Client Services Operations, business owners, end users and the Information Systems team – building and managing the backlog and communicating priorities, risks, and timelines Write functional test cases and work with Quality Assurance in the areas of auditing and testing Manage and run User Acceptance testing, following feature launch through to production and ensure successful long-term delivery through customer feedback and KPIs Requirements Bachelor’s degree or related field or equivalent experience required 5-7 years of Business Analysis or Solutions Architect experience, preferably in a SaaS environment priorities and goals Capable of articulating needs and opportunities, translating findings for technical and nontechnical audiences Displays intellectual curiosity and business acumen Proven ability to achieve results and effect change Strong analytical, problem solving and diagnostic skills Top notch organizational skills and ability to work within processes Detail oriented The salary range for this position is $93,000 - $127,000; commensurate salary to be determined based on skills, professional background and expertise. title: Product Manager
description: Careers that Change Lives You will join a world class team of mechanical, electrical and software engineers responsible for further development and enhancement of the globally launched Robotic Assisted Surgery platform: https://www.medtronic.com/covidien/en-us/robotic-assisted-surgery/hugo-ras-system.html Impact patient outcomes. Come for a job, stay for a career. In the Surgical Robotics (SR) business, part of Medtronic’s Medical Surgical Portfolio, we believe patients around the world deserve access to quality care and improved outcomes. We strive to expand global access to care and reduce variability through robotic and analytics solutions. SURGICAL INNOVATIONS set the standard for Minimally Invasive Surgery (MIS) by creating innovative surgical products and services. A Day in the Life This position will be based out of Medtronic’s campus in North Haven CT and reports to the Capital Product Lead - R&D Sustaining Engineering. The Sustaining Product Engineer will work closely with the project management office, Medtronic engineers, and our contract manufacturing sites. You will be able to dive in deep technically, and lead design change initiatives on the capital equipment products used in Robotic Surgery. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills are critical to success in this role, as is the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You will Have high aptitude for mechanical systems Be the key central communications point for sustaining related project activity. Track deliverables from internal and external teams against product design change requirements. Anticipate, identify, and provide technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Mitigate production and manufacturing risks by identifying areas of opportunity and executing improvement projects. Assess timeline impacts against project schedule. Work with engineers to develop a deep understanding of the technological underpinnings of the system. Conducts project management tasks & documentation with design controls and risk analysis in accordance with established SOPs. Incorporate required regulatory standards (FDA, ISO) in developmental and/or sustaining engineering projects including written protocols, test methods, assembly processes and the Design History File. Contribute inventions, new designs and techniques regarded as advances in the medical and technical/scientific community. Prepare reports, presentations and spreadsheets of an analytical and interpretative nature using statistical data analysis methods. Must Haves Bachelor’s degree required and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with 0 years of experience. Nice to Have Outstanding verbal and written communication skills Strong leadership skills Comfortable working in a fast paced, cross disciplinary environment Ability to discuss technical details with engineering staff, the ideal candidate will have a strong engineering and product development background. Ability to create and track a project budget and timeline Able to work with minimal direction towards completing project tasks Takes initiative in keeping current with technology developments in specialized area. Effectively communicates and works cooperatively with others as part of a team. Working knowledge of applicable FDA and ISO standards. Thorough understanding of engineering practices, product safety and root cause analysis. Knowledge of rapid prototyping, assembly tooling, injection molding, metal stamping / machining, design, and process methods. Working knowledge of Design for Six Sigma, Failure Mode Effects Analysis, Statistical Analysis methods, and Design of Experiments. Effective in written and oral communication; experienced in report writing and development of presentations. Knowledge and experience with reusable medical device materials and biocompatibility testing. Knowledge of medical product R&D and clinical/regulatory process Good understanding of structured product development (requirements-driven engineering, documentation, rigorous verification, etc.) Engineering verification test development and execution Understanding and experience with system reliability testing and service. About Medtronic Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Physical Job Requirements The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position. The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EEO It is the policy of Medtronic to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Medtronic will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. This employer participates in the federal E-Verify program to confirm the identity and employment authorization of all newly hired employees. For further information about the E-Verify program, please click here: http://www.uscis.gov/e-verify/employees .

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Description Job Description: Leidos Corporate is seeking a Business Intelligence Engineer to join our CIO Services group. In this role, you will be part of our Business Intelligence and Systems Integration team responsible for business analytics, data visualization / dashboard, data development, reporting and management of data warehouse systems. You will collaborate with technical team members, analysts, and process owners and contribute throughout the data management lifecycle process in areas such as data acquisition, management, manipulation, and data / reports analysis in Enterprise Data Warehouse environment. Primary Responsibilities: Work directly with business teams, stakeholders and other cross functional teams to gather, document functional and technical requirements in epics and user stories with clear acceptance criteria. Create new and maintain existing Cognos artifacts using best practice standards to minimize performance impact and ensure that all reports follow an approved path to production and are designed to meet SOX, audit and security requirements. Monitor and perform troubleshoot Cognos helpdesk tickets and provide superior customer support. Create, enhance, and maintain Framework Manager models to support business requirements. Research, analyze, identify, and resolve issues within current systems and determine the best course of action to correct the issues. Participate in all phases of development, testing and implementation of various projects. Coordinate with data architecture and modeling team to analyze and design solutions to meet the business requirements. Work collaboratively in a team environment and interact effectively with other departments in the organization. Perform other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other technically relevant degree and minimum of 4 years of relevant experience in business intelligence / data warehouse analysis. Prior experience must include experience with Cognos Analytics 11.X BI Suite and Cognos Financial reporting. Experience working with relational databases such as Oracle and SQL Server with strong knowledge in SQL. Strong analytical, problem solving and debugging skills, sufficient to provide accurate problem analysis to the business unit and follow up with documentation. Ability to build relationships and communicate effectively with senior officials across the organization. Ability to work under tight deadlines and prioritize workload. US citizenship is required and able to obtain security clearance. Desired Qualifications: IBM Cognos Analytics 11.X certification. Experience with Cognos SDK Experience with other reporting tools such as Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC), PowerBI, data science toolsets and Toad Data Point. Experience with ETL/ELT tools such as Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Informatica. Reporting and analytics experience with Deltek Costpoint and T&E. Understanding of PL/SQL scripts. Experience with writing JavaScript / JQuery code. External Referral Bonus: Ineligible External Referral Bonus $: Potential for Telework: Yes, 100% Clearance Level Required: None Travel: Yes, 10% of the time Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 Shift: Day Requisition Category: Professional Job Family: Business Systems Analysis Pay Range: Pay Range $65,000.00 - $100,000.00 - $135,000.00 #Remote

title: Director Business Analyst
description: The Director of Human Resources (‘DHR’) will help to develop and execute the general and strategic people-related initiatives for GBFB while managing the day-to-day HR Operations. The DHR administers or oversees the administration of Human Resource programs including, but not limited to recruitment, benefits and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance management; productivity, recognition, and morale; occupational health and safety; and learning and development. Responsibilities: Manage the talent management process to attract, hire, retain, compensate, and performance manage talent for our team. Manage vendor relationships including but not limited to benefit brokers, insurance benefit providers, retirement plan service providers, etc. Manage and execute the mid-year and year-end performance management process. Maintains knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law; applies this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management. Ensure compliance with Federal, State and local recruiting and employment, unemployment, workers compensation, wage and hour, and benefit requirements. Oversee the administration of all HR records including team member files, immigration, background checks, drug testing, etc. Develop and execute a strategy for Team Member learning and development both in person and online. Collaborate with external HR advisors, and attorneys as required. Deliver timely data and reports for HR metrics including analytics including executing an annual Team Member survey. Draft and update HR policies, Stand Operating Procedures (SOPs) and guidelines with a review of all relevant SOPS periodically. Lead in fostering a unified and balanced culture that inspires excellent performance and strong Team Member engagement in support of GBFB’s values. Oversee and execute investigations, reporting and compliance relating to all team member complaints and accidents. Develop and maintain a highly effective Human Resources Team; Directly supervising the Human Resources Manager and the Office Manager. Perform other duties as assigned. Skills: Ability to adapt to the needs of the organization and team members. Ability to recognize and prioritize issues and opportunities; manage multiple tasks, and independently develop and execute sound solutions. Excellent verbal, written, spreadsheet and presentation skills and proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite. Experience with project management. Excellent use of judgment and discretion required relative to sensitive and restricted organization and team member information. Capable of highly independent work, as well as being a team player and role model. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organizations HRIS and learning management systems. Strong negotiation skills; using diplomacy and understanding as pillars to achieve successful outcomes. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Management, Human Resources or related field; M.S. degree preferred. PHR/SPHR certification or equivalent certification, preferred. A minimum of 10 years HR generalist/management experience. Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations. Demonstrated experience in successfully managing a progressive and high-performing HR Team. Competence in team member relations and conflict resolution. Ability to work in a fast paced environment. Work Environment/Physical Demands: Ability to sit a minimum of 3 hours. Lift up to 25lbs.

title: Marketing Manager
description: Why TrueAccord?&TrueAccord is a category-defining company. We combine machine learning with a human-based approach to transform debt resolution and to get people on the path towards financial health. Every year, more than 70 million Americans have negative experiences dealing with debt. We are changing this by providing personalized digital experiences that guide lenders and consumers through this challenging financial process.&With a world-class leadership team, passionate team members, and proprietary predictive models trained on years worth of transactional data, TrueAccord is well-positioned to deliver on a huge opportunity: helping millions of consumers to regain and keep their financial footing while lowering the cost of doing business for creditors across many industries.What You ll Do: Assist in the development and implementation of the company s brand strategy.Support marketing initiatives and activities.Ensure all marketing efforts serve to achieve immediate and long-term business goals, identifying and executing improvements for processes, content, and lead generation.Prepare marketing activity reports and metrics for measuring program success.Provide market research, forecasts, competitive analyses, campaign results, and consumer trends.Support the maintenance and development of internal tools.What We re Looking For: 1-3 years of relevant experience.Knowledge of traditional and digital marketing, content marketing, and social media marketing.Experience with research using data analytics software.Excellent writing, communication, and presentation skills.A creative approach with experience in identifying target audiences.Learn more about our values, mission, and our hiring process here!Benefits, Perks, and Culture- Everything you need to work remotely- Work with talented and motivated people in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment- Medical/dental/vision insurance, 401k (with match), flex spending plan, and life insurance- Family-friendly policies - parental leave, flexible work from home- Unlimited PTO- Transportation benefitsTrueAccord is a distributed company with a major presence in the San Francisco Bay Area and Lenexa, KS. We offer a healthy work environment that continuously builds an inclusive and diverse culture where everyone is able to develop the best version of themselves. We are a dynamic group of people who are subject matter experts with a passion for change. Our teams are crafting solutions to big problems every day. If you re looking for an opportunity to do impactful work, join TrueAccord and make a difference.Our Dedication to Diversity & InclusionTrueAccord is an equal opportunity employer. We promote, value, and thrive with a diverse & inclusive team. Different perspectives contribute to better solutions and this makes us stronger every day. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.&

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: ***WORK FROM HOME OPPORTUNITY (FL, LA, TX, NC, SC)*** Interested in joining a dynamic and growing company? At Lighthouse, we are committed to providing a safe, stable environment for insurance professionals to work productively, and provide knowledgeable service. Lighthouse is seeking talented candidates who are passionate about growth, helping others and delivering the best possible service to our customers and employees. We offer a competitive salary and a robust benefits package, including 401(k) match, FSA, medical, dental, and vision health plans, long-term disability, paid time off, and career development opportunities. Job Summary The Digital Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for building, creating, and managing online marketing campaigns and programs, with significant emphasis on email. The Digital Marketer will assist in the development of digital campaign strategy and tactics to deliver persuasive messages that drive brand campaigns and boost traffic. Measures results to evaluate and optimize campaigns. Must be intensely data-driven and know what it takes to drive success across digital marketing programs. title: Marketing Manager
description: InfuSystem is a growing healthcare company that provides infusion pumps and related products and services for patients in hospitals, clinics, ambulatory surgery centers, and other sites of care from five locations serving all 50 states and Canada. We deliver improved patient outcomes and high patient satisfaction. As a leader in our field, our mission is to provide quality infusion services to patients and medical practices, including a 24‐hour clinical support hotline. Our team effort provides product management and clinical support to enhance the lives of our patients and the communities we serve. Service is always our highest priority. SUMMARY: The Marketing Technology & Data Analytics Manager will be responsible for ongoing management and execution associated with the Marketing Cloud, Customer Data Platform (CDP), and Analytics Platforms. This is a hands-on role, and the candidate will possess the necessary technical and architectural skills to serve as the owner of these platforms for marketing. IN THIS ROLE, THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL: Assist the Sr. VP of Marketing in the development of a multi-year strategic roadmap & project prioritization for all digital technologies Manage campaign execution and optimization of content across paid and earned channels ensuring it is cohesive while being tailored to each target and digital media buy Execute lead generation and lead scoring programs Manage Marketing Cloud technologies and campaign execution Data management via use of the CDP Develop business cases to quantify new digital technologies Manage campaign reporting and analytics delivering insights, campaign metrics, and optimization to ensure actionable insights Serve as the point of contact for Digital Technology vendors Responsible for the digital technology platforms including Marketing Cloud, CDP, and Analytics Any additional duties assigned by management SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: None THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. REASONING ABILITY: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. COMPUTER SKILLS: To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Database software, Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software. title: Marketing Manager
description: About us Share Local Media, or SLM, is a rapidly growing startup reimagining the world of offline marketing for tech and e-commerce companies. We started as e-commerce marketers ourselves, and launched SLM with a goal of turning direct mail into a high performing, scalable channel for a digitally native client set. To do so, we’ve taken an inputs based-approach to the space, and re-engineered the channel from the ground up to make it easier to test, faster to execute, more measurable, and ultimately, more effective for e-commerce and tech clients of all types. So what does SLM actually do? We’re a full-service direct mail agency, media program operator, and technology platform, serving some of your favorite e-commerce and tech brands (think Casper, Lyft, Grubhub, etc.). We live and breathe direct response marketing, and strive to delight clients with high performing campaigns built around fast, data-driven client service, and premium, unique branding. What are we like at SLM? We’re passionate, humble, and kind. We value data-driven thinking, speed, persistence, creativity, and teamwork. We love helping clients grow and scale through a tactile medium that has long term brand value. And finally, we get excited about transforming an old-school channel into something new through data, product, technology, and a service-driven mentality. Share our excitement? Great - we’d love to hear from you! The Role We’re looking for an enthusiastic Marketing Associate to join our rapidly growing team. You’ll be responsible for leading planning and execution of DM campaigns for well-known consumer brands, interacting with clients on a daily basis, providing post-campaign analytics and reporting, and thinking strategically about how to optimize future campaigns. We’re a startup, so we’re looking for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit, passion for marketing, and enthusiasm for working with clients. Key responsibilities will include: Account Management Lead tactical and strategic planning on end-to-end direct mail programs for a portfolio of brand partners Oversee day to day communications for brand partners & internal vendors Provide regular performance updates to business owners and serve as the channel owner in making recommendations, and sharing best practices Evaluate and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to test and grow campaigns Conduct new client outreach and onboarding Analytics Develop and execute direct mail marketing strategies to efficiently drive new customer acquisition for our partners Evaluate campaign performance to optimize for cost per customer acquired and other ROI metrics Track program performance (quantitative & qualitative tracking) and provide strategic recommendations for testing and optimizing campaigns Suggest tactics and strategies to improve performance and enhance overall campaign and reporting effectiveness No day at Share Local Media will be the same but a typical day could include the following activities Developing a mail plan strategy for a new or existing client Managing the timeline & follow ups for any mailings currently in progress Status calls/meetings with clients & vendors Analyzing and leveraging results to optimize future campaigns Troubleshooting campaign issues and addressing client issues Qualifications 1-3+ years of relevant experience in marketing, sales, or finance Passion for marketing, customer acquisition, and account management Strong sense of urgency and great time management skills Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills (oral and written) Very comfortable with analytics and taking a data-driven approach to marketing The ability to work independently and manage relationships Experience interfacing directly with clients, customers or agencies Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States What we offer Full-time role based in our NYC office / Remote flexibility during COVID-19 outbreak Ownership and growth opportunities Flexible vacation policy Robust benefits package A fun culture including: team events, happy hours, and trips (Currently Virtual) The opportunity to work with a group of passionate, humble, and kind team members If you’re looking to be part of something new that is transforming an industry, this is the role for you. You will be empowered to think like an entrepreneur by coming up with new ideas, testing them, implementing them, and then scaling them quickly. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Referral program Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Application Question(s): Will you now or in the future require SLM to commence (“sponsor”) an immigration case in order to employ you (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration case)? This is sometimes called “sponsorship” for an employment-based visa status. Experience: marketing, sales, or finance: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

title: Software Engineer
description: Full Job Description Job Title: Software Engineer Company: ViSOAR LLC Location: Salt Lake City, UT (fully remote option available) Reports to: Chief Operations Officer Contact to apply with a letter of intent and a CV. A list of contacts for references will be required if interviewed. Company Vision: ViSOAR LLC is devoted to furthering modern data-driven science and technological innovation by making massive scientific data easy to use without requiring expensive hardware. By providing user-friendly tools that manage imaging data of all scales, ViSOAR aims at empowering scientists and engineers in academia and industry to benefit society at large with innovations that traditionally have been confined to few elite investigators. Company Summary: Founded in 2011, ViSOAR LLC (formerly known as ViSUS LLC) is a start-up company with four full-time employees, several consultants and interns for temporary activities. The company was created as a spin-off of the University of Utah to develop and commercialize research software originally created for training geologists in the field with massive imagery for oil and gas companies. Since its inception, ViSOAR has identified a much broader and approachable market that is an ideal fit for our image reading and writing pipeline for massive data including industries such as healthcare, neuroscience, ecology, agriculture, and materials science. ViSOAR LLC provides a software framework designed with the primary philosophy that the visualization of massive data need not be tied to specialized hardware or infrastructures. In other words, a visualization environment for large data can be designed to be lightweight, highly scalable, and run on a variety of platforms. Due to the large size of datasets, the data samples cannot all be loaded into main memory and ViSOAR streaming solutions are not limited by local hardware resources. Additionally, ViSOAR software can access and visualize data while it is being produced, enabling real-time monitoring of remote experiments, something that is difficult with existing file formats. The analysis and visualization of large-scale data is a major challenge of modern science. As new data acquisition devices are built to generate more accurate, high-resolution information, data users struggle with the difficulty of gaining access and making practical use of the information generated. The large data analysis and visualization tools being developed by ViSOAR are becoming a critical component in many areas of data manipulation and analysis. ViSOAR management and processing of big data allows the translation of the raw data into discovery faster and leads to actionable information faster, such as finding out early that someone opened the door and flooded the room with light thereby ruining the scan during the first hour of a four-hour electron microscopy scan. Over the next 5 years, ViSOAR will see the completion of our pipeline and its adoption in software that comes installed on HPC machines as well as products with storage as a service. ViSOAR is well-positioned to be the de facto standard for reading and writing of massive data for HPC simulation, analytics and visualization, and the development of VisStore™ and our ViSOAR Data Portal positions us to become the de facto standard for storage as well. The Position: We are looking for a candidate with a strong software engineering background to develop and maintain software tools and to participate in the full SDLC (software development lifecycle), from concept and design to testing. Candidate should have CS fundamentals, problem-solving skills, coding and debugging skills, in particular with multi-threaded code; should be a strong, capable C/C++ and Python; should have solid experience driving algorithmic solutions from prototype to implementation; should have an understanding of or experience with modern devops tooling. The candidate should be able to learn and adapt quickly and should have excellent written and verbal communication skills and be a pro-active problem solver. These include: Competitive salaries 37.5-hour work week Flexible hours/schedule In office, fully remote, or hybrid work options 13 paid holidays Generous paid time off policy Additional paid office closure days (typically the office closes the week between Christmas and New Year’s) Casual dress code Mission over profit prioritization This role is a mix of 80% programming and 20% other responsibilities. In addition to technical skills, applicants must have clear communication skills, a solid work ethic, and be able to thrive in a team environment. Must be a self-starter, capable of working with minimal direction. ViSOAR LLC currently utilizes a hybrid office/work-from-home model for all staff, but a fully remote option is available for highly qualified candidates. Position Summary: Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Works with the Chief Operations Officer, other staff, and directly with domain and university collaborators to build software and tools as part of our VisStore and ViSOAR Data Portal products. Creates plugins or API to read and write data to our proprietary data format. Attends weekly virtual meetings with our team and additional meetings as needed. Performs other duties and responsibilities as needed. Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities Required: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. ViSOAR LLC welcomes all competitive applications and encourages interested candidates who lack one or more of the requirements to apply. title: Director Business Analyst
description: Excited by the prospect of working for a mission-driven organization that helps companies simplify their global expansion strategy while supporting sustainable communities around the world? Then we just might have the job for you. At Elements, we’ve pioneered a 100% direct Employer of Record (EOR) model to help accelerate how companies expand their business, onboard employees, manage compliance and pay globally – and we’re excited about our next phase of hyper-growth. Through our award-winning HR tech and solutions, we are helping clients of all types, from established leaders to stealthy changemakers like us, and advising our customers on the complexities that go along with expanding into new global markets. Position Overview We are currently looking for an outstanding demand generation talent to join our growing team. This position will report to the VP of Marketing based in Chicago, IL. Marketing is a significant driver of revenue growth at Elements and it’s time we brought on someone to own our demand generation and demand capture initiatives. We’ve generated great awareness in the market and launched products and solutions that our customers need and love. You will be responsible for leading all efforts to drive innovative and cost-effective new customer acquisition and customer growth at the core of all efforts. As a key leader of our revenue-focused marketing team, you must be a player-coach who has built a framework for experimentation but also revels in the opportunity to roll your sleeves up and execute experiments yourself. This role is focused on building our demand generation strategy from the ground up and rapidly expanding our user base. You should be an SEO expert and be laser-focused on data-driven results. You should also be comfortable writing high conversion copy on and creating landing pages, as well as digging deep into analytics. We need a legit demand generation leader, who’s hungry, curious, and won’t shy away from taking on a revenue goal. If this is you, keep reading. Key Responsibilities Own marketing campaigns focused on driving net-new pipeline, including inbound demo requests and opportunity goals Own and manage a process for experimentation to find new channels, tactics, audiences and offers Build automated organic social outbound campaigns from Elements leaders, focused on driving inbound demand Develop and optimize pipeline acceleration campaigns to help improve deal velocity and conversion Manage day-to-day worldwide marketing operations and support for BDR/Inside Sales teams: provide visibility and management on all inbound and outbound leads by maintaining regular lead scoring, dashboard updates, trending and analytics. Own our targeted outbound account-based marketing strategy and execution. Partner with our design team, BD team, content leaders and others to deliver best-in-class campaign experiences About You +6 years experience in SEO, growth marketing, A/B testing, conversion rate optimization Must have B2B, enterprise software and SaaS/cloud experience in a high-growth environment Proof that you've had double-digit % impacts to revenue in current/past roles and ability to explain how you did it Successful track record in conducting integrated campaigns across a variety of channels, including social media, email and online Power-user knowledge of HubSpot, Google Analytics, LinkedIn, Facebook, Adwords Experimentation and optimization mindset - get things out and test them vs. work on them until they're perfect Above average communication skills and ability to distill complex concepts into “explain like I'm 5” language You aren’t expecting for there to be a “how to do your job” playbook waiting for you You know how to work with teams like Product, Sales and Customer Success You don’t take yourself too seriously and enjoy a good meme What We Value NEVER SETTLE - You are a bar-raiser who is never content with the status quo nor second place. You seek opportunities to go above and beyond to deliver the extraordinary. You enjoy endlessly optimizing. THIRST FOR KNOWLEDGE - What you don’t know yet thrills you. You are a naturally curious, life-long learner with an appetite to be more and do more. LOVE WHAT YOU DO - We’re in the business of making global expansion easier using revolutionary HR tech. Do you love to have fun? Do you love to work on things you're passionate about? Us too. BOLD MOVES - You’re pumped to be part of building something from the ground up for a high-growth tech company. You want to work somewhere where you’ll make a massively positive impact on the business and the people you work with. What We Offer Unlimited PTO We offer health, dental, vision plans. Elements covers 100% for STD, LTD, and $50K Life. Technical and business skills' advancement through Coursera. Ability to work in an organization with over 40 nationalities all over the world, which embraces diversity, inclusion, and belonging at its core. Opportunity to work for a company that is revolutionizing the market and is experiencing exponential growth. Allow your inspirational ideas to come to life in a highly creative and executional environment. The opportunity to challenge in a high-performing organization and leave each day knowing you have made an impact. This position description may not describe all duties, responsibilities, and skills associated with this position. It is intended to portray the major aspects of the job. Other duties or skills may be required. Elements Global Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Elements is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Elements is based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Elements will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Elements encourages applicants of all ages. This role may be subject to a background check after an employment offer has been made and final employment will be subjective to a positive result, in addition, reference may be requested at the final stage of the process. Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Analyst
description: Responsibilities: Principal is seeking a Data Analyst within our Life Data & Analytics Team! In this role you’ll partner with leadership in our US Insurance Solutions to provide data, insights, and recommendations to support their strategic goals. Additional responsibilities will include: Develop, execute on, and measure meaningful data-driven metrics that align with strategy Effectively mine data sources and provide relevant information in an easily consumable manner. This includes acquiring, storing, managing and sharing structured and unstructured data Independently develop accurate and timely reporting to support and measure business initiatives Effectively utilize sophisticated tools/technologies to mine data sources providing relevant information in a consumable manner Qualifications: We’re looking for someone with: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required Related internship or work experience in analytics or similar fields required Experience with Python, R, SQL, or related programs Proven attention to detail Outstanding verbal and written communication, including presenting and training to groups Excellent problem solving, analytical, technical, and statistical skills and identify and resolve complex problems Additional preferred technical experience: Experience working with life or insurance industry Experience working with statistical models Experience working with AWS cloud tools and solutions Additional Information: Work Environments This role offers the ability for in-office, hybrid (blending both office and remote work in a typical workweek), and remote work arrangements. You’ll work with your leader to determine which option may align best based on several factors. Job level We are open to hiring at the Data Analyst or Sr Data Analyst level depending on qualifications and experience Work Authorization/Sponsorship At this time, we're not considering candidates that need any type of immigration sponsorship (additional work authorization or permanent work authorization) now or in the future to work in the United States?
