This includes, but IS NOT LIMITED TO: F1-OPT, F1-CPT, H-1B, TN, L-1, J-1, etc. For additional information around work authorization needs please use the following links. https://www.uscis.gov/working-in-the-united-states/temporary-nonimmigrant-workers and https://www.uscis.gov/green-card/green-card-eligibility/green-card-for-employment-based-immigrants Investment Code of Ethics For Principal Global Investors positions, you’ll need to follow an Investment Code of Ethics related to personal and business conduct as well as personal trading activities for you and members of your household. These same requirements may also apply to other positions across the organization. Experience Principal While our expertise spans the globe, we're bound by one common purpose: to foster a world where financial security is accessible to all. And our success depends on the unique experiences, backgrounds, and talents of our employees – individually and all of us together. Explore our core values, benefits and why we’re an exceptional place to grow your career. Principal is an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. #LI-Remote

title: Product Manager
description: Who We Are. Founded in 2001, Smart Warehousing is a warehousing and fulfillment company that operates as a direct extension of its clients’ teams and is committed to empowering brands to meet consumer demands. With a 38 warehouse national footprint in over 12 regions, Smart satisfies 1-2 day fulfillment needs of e-commerce and retail companies. Smart Warehousing’s inventory management system, SWIMS, provides a system of record for inventory, putting control and visibility in the hands of its clients. Smart Warehousing was recently ranked within the top three on The Business Journal’s ‘Kansas City’s Top Logistics Companies’ in 2019 and 2020. POSITION SUMMARY: As a Product Marketing Manager, you are responsible for usage and adoption of our product. You will be the product evangelist and will play an integral role in organizing product launches. The person in this role will be responsible for knowing our competitors like the back of your hand: what they do today and what they plan to do in the future. You also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make their buying decisions. You will develop innovative programs that drive demand. This role is the glue that binds our product strategy to the tactics we need to drive success in sales and marketing and to achieve results. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for owning market intelligence. Must be the expert on our buyers, who are they, how they buy and their key buying criteria. Understand the competitive landscape—be an expert on our competition and how they are positioned. Collaborate with product management and rest of marketing team to develop product positioning and messaging that resonate with our target buyer personas. Understand and document our buyer’s process, including where they get information, and the who, what, when and why behind the decisions they make. Then drive changes to our sales and marketing processes based on what you learn. Develop a marketing plan for the products you support in conjunction with our marketing team, including key activities and budgets to support the retention of existing customers and the acquisition of new customers. Assess the effectiveness of the marketing programs that support your products on an ongoing basis, and report back to the business on required changes. Plan the launches of net-new features and releases of existing product features and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan. Act as the primary thought leader for the products you support externally, including speaking engagements and written works. Develop product messaging that differentiates new products and services from others in the market Communicate the value of new products and services to the sales and marketing team Develop and implement promotional activities such as promotions and product launches Create product content such as case studies, videos, website copy and blog posts Gain insight into customer use of current products, untapped opportunities and buyer personas Measure and optimize the buyer journey as it relates to product feature adoption and usage “THE PERSON” | MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in business or marketing 2 or more years of product marketing experience 1 or more years of experience in a market-facing role (e.g. delivering presentations to customers and prospects, conducting competitor analysis and market research) Comfortable using collaboration and CRM tools such as Slack. Familiar with marketing automation tools such as Hubspot and Google Analytics. Exceptional ROI-tracking skills, able to prove what is –or isn’t—working Must be a strong public speaker, comfortable in front of large, senior groups, and a solid writer. Excellent people and management skills Familiarity with in-app marketing tools (ie. pendo, etc.) Experience working for a SaaS organization Pragmatic Institute Certified (PMC) preferred KEY ATTRIBUTES: Exceptional ROI-tracking skills, able to prove what is –or isn’t—working Must be a strong public speaker, comfortable in front of large, senior groups, and a solid writer. Excellent people and management skills Incredible attention to detail and eye for quality WHY WORK FOR SMART: At Smart we offer a wide range of employee benefits including, but not limited to: Competitive compensation packages A wide range of benefits including 401K with company match Medical, Dental, and Vision healthcare plans Parental leave Professional growth and internal promotion opportunities due to continuous organizational growth Holiday pay Flexible work schedules for headquarter positions and multiple shift options for warehouse roles

title: Data Engineer
description: WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all. We're looking for experienced Cloud Data Warehouse Developers who can work across the organization from product, engineering org to analytics to data scientists to business heads delivering accurate, timely, actionable information. The ideal candidate will have experience with cloud data warehouses, a high level programming language such as python, fundamental understanding of data modeling and software development process, experience monitoring and maintenance of business critical production pipelines using tools such as Airflow, Grafana as well as experience with bringing data to life using tools such as Looker Responsibilities Collaborate with cross functional teams to make data actionable Work closely with business users , product managers, analysts and data scientists to build out both analytics schema as well as star schema layer for fast and accurate data analysis Design high performance, resilient, efficient data pipelines using ELT Become a subject matter expert in the data layer with deep understanding of entire pipeline Responsible for end to end project ownership Designing analytics friendly data sets that abstract complex business and transformation logic Developing reusable, testable code Responsible for accuracy and recency of data and meeting data team SLAs Communicating with stakeholders to achieve project objectives Responsible for building out dashboards as well as be willing to train end users on self serve methods for exploring data Keeping up to date with with best practice What we are looking for 3+ years of experience in data of all types with at least 1 years in leveraging distributed cloud based data warehouse technologies for large-scale complex problems Expertise in building and scaling modularized ELT pipelines Expert knowledge in SQL and data warehousing techniques Past experience with bringing data to life, using visualization Production experience with high level languages, ideally Python Experience with Airflow or other workflow tools Proven track record for keeping SLAs on production data pipelines Experience with cloud services and serverless is a plus BS or MS in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent At WW, it is our priority to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are committed as individuals, as an organization, and as fellow humans, to advocate for and support our employees, our members, and our communities. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Objectstream is an award-winning small business supporting the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) for last 15 years. We offer a competitive benefits package to our employees which includes: M/D/V, matching 401k, and other benefits. The passion and dedication of Objectstream employees is what has supported the growth and success of our company. We develop strong, dedicated, unified teams committed to our core value. Job Description The Senior Business Analyst job provides information technology services in facilities planning, operations and support. This position supports the Air Traffic Organization (ATO)'s Technical Operations Services under the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). This position is on the NAS Modernization Group. and involves analytical and writing skills. Specific Required Experience and Skill Sets: Experience in designing and implementing a data platform for analytics and reporting Understand relational database design including data normalization, data types, and data integrity. Understand AWS Cloud Technologies to include core AWS services including compute, network, databases and storage. Understand the AWS shared responsibility model and security best practices. Identify AWS services for common business use cases. Experience with coding in business class languages such as Python, SQL and/or Visual Basic or Applications (VBA). Experience with converting manual procedures to automation. Experience with programming/scripting automated tests steps. Knowledge of database architecture and programming Develop user graphical interface to display data/functions Design dashboards for easy understandable views of operational status. Qualifications A 4-year course of study leading to a bachelor's degree with a major in any field that included or was supplemented by; at least 24 semester hours in any combination of the following fields: accounting, business, finance, law, contracts, purchasing, economics, industrial management, marketing, quantitative methods, or organization and management is required. Required 8+ Years of relevant experience Experience with database architecture and programming, Tableau platform/development, Data Analysis/Management Preferred experience in Full Life Cycle Project Management, Agile/Scrum Frameworks, Troubleshooting/Critical Thinking 360° Information Services Management Power Apps Cloud Infrastructure, Amazon AWS Willing to consider remote work arrangement for right candidate.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Full Job Description Your Job Join a team of highly-skilled Business Intelligence professionals dedicated to ensuring success. Our team works directly with senior leadership to drive optimal strategy and decision making. We are experts on data and the go-to people for generating actionable insights through advanced analytics. Additionally, our team develops sustainable and automated solutions that empower analysis throughout the organization. Our position within the company requires that we interact with technical and business leaders across the Company. This position offers a hands-on understanding of how we run our business. Responsibilities: Become a subject matter expert and trusted partner supporting analytical needs Develop insights which can be used to optimize strategy by building reports, dashboards, decision-optimization tools, and visualizations (using Python, SQL, Tableau) Lead and direct other team member’s projects to ensure a high quality work product, and partner with team members across the broader org Deploy advanced applications of descriptive and predictive analytics to business processes, and stay current on best practices in the field Understand your business stakeholders’ objectives, the metrics that are the most important to them, and how they measure their performance Turn business requirements into technical requirements Build relationships across teams to leverage and extend existing analytical research Who You Are 3+ Years of SQL. Must have the ability to write complex, highly-optimized queries across large volumes of data 3+ years of solid Python programming skills to cleanse, manipulate, and present data, particularly using Pandas and Numpy 3+ years of Industry experience in a report development, data science, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technology Team leadership experience is required Excellent oral and written communication skills, and comfort presenting to everyone from entry-level employees to senior vice presidents Knowledge of ETL and data warehouse concepts and processes Ability to explain complicated or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiences Sensitivity to clients' needs and able to develop warm client relationships Experience with reporting, descriptive statistics, probability, and cleaning big datasets M.S. degree in math, statistics, computer science, engineering or equivalent technical field Job Type: Full-time Pay: $91,000.00 - $131,000.00 per year Benefits: Paid time off Schedule: 8 hour shift COVID-19 considerations: Please wear masks to stop Covid 19 spread. Experience: SQL: 4 years (Preferred) Python: 4 years (Preferred) Work Location: Remote

title: Software Engineer
description: Company Description Guardant Health is a leading precision oncology company focused on helping conquer cancer globally through use of its proprietary blood tests, vast data sets and advanced analytics. The Guardant Health Oncology Platform leverages capabilities to drive commercial adoption, improve patient clinical outcomes and lower healthcare costs across all stages of the cancer care continuum. Guardant Health has launched liquid biopsy-based Guardant360®, Guardant360 CDx and GuardantOMNI® tests for advanced stage cancer patients. These tests fuel development of its LUNAR program, which aims to address the needs of early stage cancer patients with neoadjuvant and adjuvant treatment selection, cancer survivors with surveillance, asymptomatic individuals eligible for cancer screening and individuals at a higher risk for developing cancer with early detection. Job Description Guardant Health is looking for an energetic and passionate Software Engineer to join its growing Software Quality Engineering team. This team is responsible for delivering the product functionality needed to support the customer experience workflow for several of its market leading cancer diagnostic tests as well as integration with various oncology EMR systems. An Ideal candidate would have experience working in a regulated environment with thorough knowledge of Quality Engineering best practices and technical expertise to deliver software products meeting the business needs in an efficient and fast paced environment. This role requires someone who is adept at understanding system architecture, design, implementation to succinctly develop tailored test strategy and deliver quality software products meeting regulatory standards. The candidate should have the aptitude to work on parallel projects with overlapping schedules, quickly learn new technologies, demonstrate teamwork and technical leadership. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Participate in the Agile scrum team and work on Software Quality Engineering tasks. Design and execute test coverage for various functional and integration aspects of the Guardant Health Portal Solutions. Apply appropriate test methodologies including but not limited to writing test plans, test cases, and execution of test scripts within the sprint schedule. Create test cases in Jama and execute them to support scheduled releases. Troubleshoot issues identified during testing and report defects; able to distinguish between user error and application anomalies. Perform System Integration testing at the end of functional sprints prior to product release. Provide clear and concise feedback on defects, usability, and other test findings/results. Identify and advocate testing standards and processes as needed within the team. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely and robust execution of testing as part of a regular release schedule. Primary role as a functional tester with potential for some aspects of automation. Execute complex testing scenarios, perform in-depth statistical analysis, and interpret results independently. Establish cross-functional relationships across business and technical leads, architects, and product owners to ensure alignment with business goals and enterprise-level architectural standards. Apply QE standards, best practices, and principles to develop quality plans that deliver optimal outcomes across multiple products. Deliver test documentation to support software development for medical devices in compliance with FDA, CE mark, IEC 62304, PMDA and ISO 13485 standards. Qualifications B.S or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Bioinformatics, or a related study or equivalent project experience. 5+ years of hands-on testing experience in Service Oriented Architecture environment using COTS/SaaS solutions with API led integrations. 3+ years of experience in testing Portal based applications in a hybrid environment leveraging HL7/XML/JSON message formats. 2+ years of performing verification and validation activities in medical device, pharma or healthcare regulated environments. 3+ years of experience in test preparation activities within an Agile Development Process – Test Design, Test scripting, Test Data creation. 2+ years of experience using test tools like Postman, Fiddler, SOAPUI, JMeter required. Proven ability to adapt to new technologies and design test strategies. Extensive experience in good testing practices, methodologies, and automated tools. Excellent communication and analytical skills, including strong ability to identify and solve ambiguous cross-functional software quality related problems. Experience in identifying, analyzing, and narrowing down system integration issues and performing root cause analysis. Expertise in developing and maintaining SDLC documentation such as Verification Plan, Report, Risk Assessment and Traceability Matrix, etc. Effective communication and presentation skills. Ability to deliver software releases in frequent cycles using agile methodology. Experience working in a regulated environment (CLIA, CAP, HIPAA, SOX, 21 CFR Part 11, ISO 13485, IEC 62304, and other FDA regulations) is desired. Working experience in EMR Integration is a plus. Additional Information Covid Vaccination Policy: Starting January 7, 2022, Guardant Health will require all employees to be fully vaccinated to either (a) establish that they have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19; or (b) request and obtain an approved exemption from Guardant’s COVID-19 U.S. Vaccination Policy as a reasonable accommodation, as consistent with applicable laws. An employee is considered fully vaccinated against COVID-19 two weeks after receiving the second dose of a two-dose vaccine or one dose of a single-dose vaccination. Acceptable vaccines are approved or under emergency use authorization by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and/or the World Health Organization (WHO). In addition, fully-vaccinated employees will be required to maintain their fully-vaccinated status under this policy by obtaining, if applicable, any FDA-approved boosters. Employee may be required to lift routine office supplies and use office equipment. Majority of the work is performed in a desk/office environment; however, there may be exposure to high noise levels, fumes, and biohazard material in the laboratory environment. Ability to sit for extended periods of time. Guardant Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. To learn more about the information collected when you apply for a position at Guardant Health, Inc. and how it is used, please review our Privacy Notice for Job Applicants. Please visit our career page at: http://www.guardanthealth.com/jobs/ #LI-KH1

title: Director Business Analyst
description: Yellowbrick Data is a rapidly growing Enterprise Data Warehouse start-up headquartered in Silicon Valley – the only credible EDW start-up alongside Snowflake. We are selling into a hot market right at the convergence of Big Data, Enterprise Data Warehousing, IoT and the Edge. Our technology is used by the world's largest insurers, credit card companies, telcos, healthcare firms and marketers. Our customers love our product: Most are repeat buyers, and in many cases we've become the new standard for analytics and data warehousing in their respective enterprises. Yellowbrick is well- funded, having raised $173m from top-tier venture firms. Job Overview We are looking for a hands-on and driven Sales / Revenue Operations Director to run the day-to-day operations and support our Revenue Teams in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity. The ideal candidate has deep experience supporting B2B Sales, a strong desire to execute, a passion for data analytics, and loves turning insights into actions. This person excels at balancing strategic thinking with pragmatic execution and is very comfortable getting their hands dirty. This role will manage functions essential to sales force productivity. These include planning, quota setting, sales process optimization, sales role design, sales training, sales program implementation, sales compensation design and administration. This role will serve as the trusted advisor to the Sales team, and will be responsible for building strong relationships across Marketing, Product, and Customer Success leadership to influence decision making, drive process optimization and overall GTM effectiveness. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker who is comfortable interacting with department leaders as well as various analysts and sales reps throughout the organization. Responsibilities Own enhancements and maintenance of sales system tech stack in order to guide and scale sales processes. (SFDC, Clari, Gong, Outreach.io, etc) Drive efficiency and compliance of lead distribution rules and guidelines to promote proper Marketing to Sales handoff within the lead funnel Provide ad-hoc reporting, analytics and operational support to sales teams Manage to a scrum methodology with periodic sprints on deliverables, clear communication updates, and prioritization of incoming requests from sales teams Serve as a key subject matter expert on complex and/or critical business issues and processes with particular emphasis on CRM systems and Sales processes Continuous identification of opportunities for process improvement to drive efficiency and eliminate manual tasks Qualifications 8+ years of Business/Sales Operations, IT/Strategy Consulting and/or Business/Systems roles in high-growth technology with 2+ years experience in managing and mentoring teams Strong working knowledge of Salesforce.com and other sales productivity tools, including best practices for use, integrations and reporting. Strong experience and passion for scoping, defining, documenting, and continuously improving business processes Ability to build trusted advisor relationships with sales Ability to work well with variety of people and departments Ability to work in fast paced environment with tight deadlines and shifting priorities, and be willing to "roll-up your sleeves" to drive organizational change Experience driving cross-functional projects end-to-end. Ability to negotiate priorities across organizations at all levels Effective, clear, and concise communication skills, verbal and written. Ability to communicate the right level of information to executives and cross-functional teams at the right cadence Strategic, structured problem solver. Strong analytical skills and eye for business. Aptitude for framing business questions with data, translating business needs into strategies, and executing tactics and process improvements Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment while dealing with ambiguity with strong sense of urgency, craftsmanship and attention to detail with a knack for organization Must have experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud, experience with other sales productivity tools such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Outreach, Gong.io etc. is strongly desired #LI-Remote Yellowbrick Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, gender identity or any other category protected by applicable law. We hire and promote individuals solely on the basis of qualifications for the job to be filled. To all recruitment agencies: Yellowbrick Data does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Yellowbrick Data employees or any other organization location. Yellowbrick Data is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Product Manager
description: Upwork ($UPWK) is the world's work marketplace. We help connect companies large and small with top independent talent from around the world. Simply put, our mission is to create economic opportunities so people have better lives. Every year, more than $2 billion of work is done through Upwork by skilled independent professionals who want the freedom of working anytime, anywhere. We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our Project Catalog Team. Launched in January 2021, Project Catalog is a new way for businesses and independent talent to work together instantly on the Upwork marketplace. As a Senior Product Manager of Catalog, you will drive significant impact to drive Catalog's rapid growth. You will work with an established team of developers, designers and marketers on scaling our marketplace through product experiences that delight our users. You will use customer insights and data to build a results-oriented roadmap and work hands-on with design and engineering to execute, test and learn quickly. Your responsibilities: Lead the strategy and roadmap to build fabulous user experiences for Freelancers and Clients to start a relationship on Upwork Champion your ideas and product vision to internal stakeholders, creating alignment that drives cross-functional prioritization decisions Partner closely with our talent and internal research, analytics and customer success teams to deeply understand and evangelize our customer problems Take an analytical approach to understand drivers of our supply / demand dynamics Establish success metrics, be outcome driven, Test and measure everything, take ownership of the results, track critical metrics and use them to drive decision-making about what's next Seek long-standing and difficult user problems by breaking down fundamental assumptions and going back to the basics What it takes to catch our eye: Three (3)+ years of consistent track record as a product manager in a fast-paced, data-driven environment Experience working with two-sided marketplaces, especially marketplaces with wildly diverse participants or offerings Experience with building a roadmap, breaking it into experiments for testing hypotheses and working to execute with cross-functional teams - Marketing, Customer Success, Sales, and Operations Passion for building high quality product experiences and design sense to solve complex UI/UX design challenges Analytical chops for breaking down complex problems and solving them with data. Flexibility to adapt to high growth, early-stage environments Deep emotional intelligence for customer needs, frustrations, and aspirations. Familiarity with crafting user experiences and their impact on conversion funnels Ability to build a sense of belonging for distributed teams. Come change how the world works. At Upwork, you'll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also support hiring of corporate full-time employees in 15 states in the United States. Please speak with a member of our recruitment team to determine whether you are located in a state in which we are hiring corporate full-time employees. Our vibrant culture is built on shared values and our mission to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster amazing teams, put our community first, and have a bias toward action. We encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work and grow together through development opportunities, mentorship, and employee resource groups. Oh yeah, we've also got amazing benefits. Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about the employee experience. Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. #LI-Remote

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: As the world's leading provider of cloud-based software and technology solutions delivered by managed service providers (MSPs), Datto believes there is no limit to what small and medium businesses can achieve with the right technology. Datto offers Unified Continuity, Networking, and Business Management solutions and has created a one-of-a-kind ecosystem of MSP partners. These partners provide Datto solutions to over one million businesses across the globe. Since its founding in 2007, Datto continues to win awards each year for its rapid growth, product excellence, superior technical support, and for fostering an outstanding workplace. With headquarters in Norwalk, Connecticut, Datto has global offices in the United Kingdom, Netherlands, Denmark, Germany, Canada, Australia, China, and Singapore. Learn more at datto.com. As a member of the Product Business Analytics Team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will use technical and business knowledge to aid in the analysis, reporting and presentation of key performance indicators to support various business operations across the department. This role requires candidates to have an understanding of relational database structures and KPI reporting. This position will also partner with various stakeholders to best support self-service analytics and business decisions for the departments within the Product organization. The BI Analyst will use data to solve business problems and analyze metrics around specific reporting structures for various projects and teams within Product. They will work with the Sr. Manager of Business Analytics to create and maintain the business intelligence data sources, as well as various dashboards and ad hoc analysis and reporting. Primary Responsibilities Leverage Datto technology and process knowledge to define and lead projects that improve our performance: requirements, problem solving, analytics, share actionable insights, build solutions, and drive change Partner with Product leaders to fulfill analytic and reporting requests as domain data leader and be available to support follow up projects, including projects aligned to our Unified Continuity product lines Assist in creating and supporting a self-service style analytics platform among stakeholders Translate business needs into research designs that generate actionable insights through professional reporting formats (presentation or written) Enhance our capability to analyze and "make sense" of large sets of data and translate findings in a visually appealing manner that tell a story and help us make better data driven decisions Define and track KPIs, benchmarks and aid in identifying and measuring successful and failing strategies. Identify opportunities for process improvement Continue education into emerging BI tools and processes Education & Experience Bachelor's degree required, concentration in computer science, information technology, mathematics, statistics, analytics, or economics preferred. Minimum of 1 year of experience in a business environment responsible for analysis and reporting. Advanced SQL, Tableau and Excel knowledge. High level of attention to detail, thoroughness and commitment to data quality and analytic rigor. Effective analytics problem solving skills; ability to turn a business problems into hypothesis driven analysis Excellent time management skills and an ability to manage multiple tasks and projects. Benefits: At Datto, we're committed to cultivating a healthy, positive and growth enabling environment. We are proud of our wide ranging benefits package which is available to all full-time employees, including: Comprehensive health-care benefits Flexible paid time off policy Generous paid paternal leave "Datto University" virtual on-boarding program Access to more than 5,000 courses via LinkedIn Learning Education reimbursement Employee Assistance Program Headspace App Charity match program A dynamic and socially active work culture, including Employee Resource Groups Networking and career development opportunities And more! Note: We are looking only for candidates willing to join us directly as W2 employees (No 3rd party candidates) By submitting an application, you acknowledge we will process your data in order to consider you for the position you apply for and for other open positions within our company for which you may be suited. We collect and store your data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Practices. Datto is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Business Analyst
description: At John Deere, we run so life can leap forward. This powerful purpose is our promise to humankind that we will dream, design and deliver breakthrough products that sustain our world for generations to come. The world is counting on us to feed billions of people and build vital infrastructures in villages, towns, and megacities. We live up to the legacy our founder forged in a one-room blacksmith's shop nearly two centuries ago by creating a culture that brings out the best in all of us. A culture where great ideas thrive because every voice is heard. Primary Location: Estados Unidos (US) - Iowa - Waterloo Function: Data Science & Analytics Title: Business Analyst - 79455 Onsite/Remote: Onsite Position Your Responsibilities As a Business Analyst for John Deere Waterloo Works located in Waterloo, IA, you will…. Establish and monitor metrics & tools relative to materials management issues and ensure close loop corrective action process is in place with designated champions, to drive continuous improvement. Maintain and process select applications to support data management of key materials management processes. SAP and process SME for the Materials Management organization at Waterloo Works. Smart Connected Factory (SCF) lead representing Materials Management What Skills You Need 1+ years experience in Moderate to Advanced skills & knowledge with analytics tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, or Power BI 1+ years experience in supporting existing applications by diagnosing and troubleshooting issues with end user applications Experience developing tools or applications for multiple users or database management Experience configuring or maintaining items within SAP, or other similar business software Moderate to Advanced Excel Skills What Makes You Stand Out Experience with coding languages such as VBA or SQL Experience within John Deere Materials Management or Operations Working knowledge of database management tools Education Ideally you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following: Bachelor's degree in Business or Engineering/Technology discipline or equivalent What You'll Get At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package. The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines. An Equal Opportunity Employer, John Deere requires a diversity of people, perspectives and ideas to address the complex challenges of its global business. John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Marketing Manager
description: We are looking for a creative and highly qualified Marketing Coordinator to work closely with the executive team to develop and implement marketing initiatives for a wide range of clients. Your main responsibilities include conducting market research, producing promotional materials and analyzing sales data. Our ideal candidate is able to interpret customers’ behavior and suggest creative ways to increase brand awareness. If you have excellent communication skills and a passion for marketing strategies, we want to meet you. Ultimately, you will ensure our company’s marketing efforts help us achieve our immediate and long-term business goals. Responsibilities Conduct research to analyze customers’ behavior (e.g. purchasing habits, trends and preferences) Design and implement successful marketing campaigns Set up tracking systems for online marketing activities Track progress with Marketing Managers and/or Marketing Specialists Identify and analyze competitors Prepare reports by collecting and analyzing data Collaborate with the design department to produce promotional materials Craft clear product marketing copy Create social media content and manage social media profiles for client accounts Organize promotional activities for new products/services Prepare (monthly, quarterly and annual) forecasts Skills Proven work experience as a Marketing Coordinator, Marketing Officer or similar role Knowledge of traditional and digital marketing tools Experience with research methods using data analytics software Expertise with Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterest, TikTok, and LinkedIn Solid computer skills, including MS Office, web analytics and Google Adwords Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management and Content Management System software Excellent communication and presentation skills BSc degree in Marketing or relevant field Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract Pay: Up to $2,500.00 per month Benefits: Flexible schedule Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: Marketing: 2 years (Preferred) Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description: Welcome to Centura Health: Welcome to the largest health ecosystem in Colorado and western Kansas. Welcome to living your mission among thousands of people on fire to live theirs too. Welcome to options, possibilities and values that guide exceptional care. Welcome to extremely important industry challenges and opportunities to solve complex problems. Welcome to highly intelligent teams, overflowing community and the wholeness of mind, body and spirit that is Centura Health. Pay Range: $29.81 - $38.57/hr Flourishing Begins Here: You have a purpose, unique talents and NOW is the time to embrace it, live it and put it to work. At Centura Health, we value incredible people with incredible skills – but your commitment to a greater cause is something we value even more. Job Summary The Digital Marketing Advisor will be responsible for creating email campaigns, paid social media campaigns, and maintaining and monitoring both Centura Health’s paid social media presence and reputation management. This role will collaborate with other members across the Digital, Enterprise Marketing and Communications teams to develop an ongoing strategy for each digital channel. The Digital Marketing Advisor will execute content on all digital channels, as well as monitor engagement and performance daily. The candidate will also interface regularly with operational leaders to develop and execute Centura’s digital marketing strategies, as directed by other leaders within the broader Centura Marketing function. This position will also play a key role in driving online engagement. The candidate selected must demonstrate a strong skillset for customer engagement and digital marketing. The selected candidate will be the voice for Centura Health on all online review sites such as Google, Yelp, Healthgrades, etc. You enjoy a challenge and keeping up with the fast-paced nature of online review sites while always representing our brand, core values and Mission. The selected candidate must have a strong understanding of online reputation management and are work as an exceptional team player and communicator. What You Bring/Job Requirements: In addition to bringing your whole self to the workplace each day, qualified candidates will need the following: Education Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications or a related degree required Minimum Experience Requirements 5+ years of experience in hands-on digital marketing role Outstanding written and oral communication skills Excellent project management skills Experience calculating KPIs and generating reports Solid experience with paid social media channels; expert knowledge of social media strategy and implementation on all major platforms Experience with email marketing and A/B testing required Experience with Marketo, Pardot or similar platforms Familiarity with CRM tools and Google Analytics Have a solid understanding of ratings / reviews / business citation management and reputation management on third-party websites. Demonstrate experience with social media platforms including but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest Experience with reputation management platforms such as Social Clime, Odeza or similar; and responding to negative and positive reviews on sites like Google, Facebook, Yelp. Comfortable working in fun, fast-paced environment across Marketing, Creative & Brand, Digital and IT teams. Your Connected Community: When people and places align, incredible things happen. Just like the 21,000+ amazing associates who work here, every community within Centura Health’s connected ecosystem has its own unique history, story and personality. Caring for Your Whole Well Being: We’re committed to delivering whole person care and understand that a comprehensive benefits package enriches the lives of our associates at work and at home. At Centura Health, we offer incredible benefits that impact mind, body, and spirit to eligible associates. Our total rewards are designed with your well-being in mind and may include: 401K, which includes matching when eligible Three Health Insurance Plan Options including covering eligible dependents Two Dental Insurance Plan Options including covering eligible dependents Vision Insurance including covering eligible dependents Daycare & Medical Flexible Spending Account Options Leaves of Absence, Short Term Disability, and Long-Term Disability Life Insurance and Spouse & Child/Dependent Life Insurance Coverage Options Voluntary Benefits including Hospital Indemnity Coverage, Critical Illness, Accident, Permanent Life insurance, and Norton LifeLock Paid Time Off & Sick Pay Shift Differentials Employee Wellness Resources Employee Assistance Programs Tuition Reimbursement Relocation assistance based on location Associate Discounts for Phone, Cell Phone Plans, Auto Insurance, Home Insurance, Auto Buying, Pet Insurance, and much more... The pay rate for this position is listed above and varies based on experience, skills, and comparison to others who are already in this role. *If you do not see the pay range for this position listed, you are on a third-party job board. All our pay ranges are posted on our careers site www.centura.org/careers. Please visit our careers’ page and apply today!

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Job ID: 2118198-US-United_States Location: , , US Date Posted: 2021-11-18 Category: Information Technology Subcategory: Bus Proc Analyst Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time Minimum Clearance Required: None Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None Potential for Remote Work: Yes Description SAIC is searching for an experienced Senior Business Analyst who can gather important information needed to generate requirements, use cases, business process models, and other artifacts necessary to document the changing business IT landscape of our client. Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs. Our ideal candidate provides expertise on continuous process improvement strategies, organizational redesign, change management projects, and performance measures for basic business process engagements. Defines and develops business processes, policies, roles and responsibilities, and performance metrics; Conducts analysis of business processes: current state analysis, gap analysis, benchmarking, best practices identification, organizational assessment, and other related tasks. Plans and implements process improvements, including: future state design, change management, and transition planning. Participates in risk management analysis and assists with the creation of business continuity, contingency, and disaster recovery plans. Develops and executes the testing processes utilized to validate the disaster recovery plans. Responsibilities and Duties Develop comprehensive use cases at the application and multi-application levels Oversee all aspects of project, leading a team on medium to large projects or significant segment of large complex projects Assists in developing, implementing, and maintaining policies, procedures, and programs for the security and integrity of data, databases, information systems, and technology Participates in risk management analysis and assists with the creation of business continuity, contingency, and disaster recovery plans Develops and executes the testing processes utilized to validate the disaster recovery plans Ensures recovery infrastructure is fully documented, vital records protected, with a comprehension of the declaration of authority, order of succession, recovery, and dependencies necessary to recover business-protected infrastructure Determine and document user requirements for business processes and abide by those requirements for future projects Monitor existing IT service delivery business processes to determine current states, define desired future states, and perform gap analysis Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications Provide expertise on continuous process improvement strategies and performance measures; writing improved procedures Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Analyze new and complex project-related problems and create innovative solutions that normally involves schedule, technology, methodology, tools, solution components, and financial management of the project Qualifications Bachelor’s or master’s degree. May accept an additional 4 years of experience in lieu of a degree. 5+ years of associated work experience It is preferred for someone to have at least 1+ years of Business Analyst experience Practical application ability with Microsoft Office and Visio Detailed analytical abilities Organized with strong time-management skills Strong experience in user testing and requirements management DRII ABCP (Disaster Recovery Institute International Associate Business Continuity Professional) certification - preferable COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees will be required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Customer site vaccination requirements, if more strict, will take precedence over SAIC's vaccination policy. Target salary range: $75,001 - $85,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors. SAIC is a premier technology integrator solving our nation's most complex modernization and readiness challenges. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes high-end solutions in engineering, IT, and mission solutions. Using our expertise in existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions. We are 25,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has pro forma annual revenues of nearly $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. For ongoing news, please visit our newsroom. For SAIC benefits information, see Working at SAIC. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

title: Data Scientist
description: The Challenge: Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data. We have an opportunity for you to use your analytical skills to improve data-driving decision-making across the Navy and DoD. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll develop analyses, test hypotheses, apply statistical methods, visualize data, and support a broader team of data engineers and data scientists to use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into objective answers to help senior leadership make informed decisions. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good and empower clients to make data-driven decisions. Empower change with us. You Have: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, database design, and data management Experience in the United States Navy in an Engineering or Combat Systems department related billet at sea Experience with analyzing specific metrics embedded within the Personnel, Equipment, Supply, Training, Ordnance, Infrastructure/Networks (PESTONI) pillars of analysis Experience with using Java, Python, R, or Matlab to perform rapid prototyping of data analysis, statistical analysis, and data visualization Experience with the application of advanced data science and data analytics, including structured, unstructured, or relational, data mining, and machine learning techniques Ability to develop a comprehensive understanding of the Surface Force's business practices, primary (organic) data sources, secondary (non-organic) data needs, data gaps, and organic analytic capabilities to inform the development of a meaningful data visualization tool suite and predictive modeling needs for decision-makers at all levels Ability to exhibit flexibility, initiative, and innovation to succeed in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment to compose client deliverable quality documentation, analysis, and reports Ability to obtain a security clearance Associate's degree Nice If You Have: Experience with using Databricks and Apache Spark Knowledge of advanced analytical techniques in a production environment Secret clearance Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Engineering Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Build Your Career: At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have the chance to: access online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition participate in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government You’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success. We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

title: Director Business Analyst
description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference. The Director of BIA Strategy and Operations is responsible for managing the BIA initiative portfolio and partnering with the BIA leadership team to prioritize, organize, and govern new initiatives. This position supervises a team of project/program managers and works with enabling functions to ensure all BIA requirements are being met. Role & Responsibilities: Provides strategic guidance and consultative capacity on initiatives to Head of BIA and the BIA leadership team Identifies innovative practices and industry trends in the management and operating model of analytics organizations Identifies and implements opportunities to further “One BIA” (sharing across team, mobility across teams, integration opportunities) Collaborates with the BIA LT to identify, prioritize, and select new initiatives Partners with the BIA LT and executive stakeholders to rapidly organize, launch, and govern major initiatives Leads the BIA LT Team meetings (setting of agenda with LT, managing time, topics, ensuring proper follow-up with action items) Provides program management for the BIA initiative portfolio Leads the BIA Strategy and Operations team meetings (includes S&O team members) Oversees aggregate BIA finances in partnership with Finance to ensure budget attainment and strategic planning (budget, April and September projection, tax, financial reporting, etc.) Works with other enabling functions (HR, Legal, Procurement, IT, etc.) to ensure integration between teams, and BIA requirements are being met Develops a BIA communication strategy and leads BIA communication initiatives and activities (BIA Annual Summit, Townhalls, etc.) Manages Project Coordination team who is responsible for all BIA purchasing (SOWs, POs, Market Research Project Brief Processing) Represent BIA on a range of Corporate-wide initiatives (e.g., return to office planning) Leads the BIA Career Development Team focusing on key drivers for talent recruiting, development and retention Leads the program management for BIA’s Rotational Development Program, leading recruiting, development and management of this talent incubator for future leaders Partners closely with TA, university Recruiting, Finance, HR, other Ops and communications leads across the enterprise, L&D, and builds relationships to best leverage BMS resources. Education preferred: Bachelor’s Degree required; MBA preferred. Experience preferred 7+ years of experience within management consulting, business strategy, business operations or related fields 3+ Years of Pharmaceutical, Medical Device or healthcare industry experience, strongly desired Proven experience working with, influencing, provoking and driving senior level leadership (SVP, VP, ED levels) Proven experience managing and developing matrix teams Proven ability to work in ambiguity to drive and achieve business results Proven track record of coordinating across multiple teams to drive action and accountability towards a shared goal Demonstrated understanding of the business areas BIA operates in and the work BIA does Excellent project management skills with demonstrated ability meet project timelines and produce value-added results Experience in driving adoption of cultural and process changes Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with diverse teams Understanding of Finance, HR, Procurement a plus Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Our company is committed to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request an approval of accommodation prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, or any part of the recruitment process direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com. Visit careers.bms.com/eeo-accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.

title: Software Engineer
description: Job Description This is a Hybrid position within our IT Organization. The role will allow employees to work offsite but will also require onsite work based on business needs. The selected candidate will be expected to commute to the innovation center to which they are assigned as their primary GM facility. Relocation may be provided. For all external applicants, we are targeting a start date on or after January 10th 2022 for this position. In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM's global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed and business value. Job Summary: The software engineer will be a member of the development team supporting GM's $8B/year Global Logistics business. We craft and deliver secure, event-driven, cloud native application functionality which enables business strategy for a Fortune 10 company completing a vision of a world with zero crashes, zero emissions and zero congestion. Core Responsibilities: Deliver innovative solutions to support the inbound logistics and container business, using IoT and telematics integrating with Microservices running on GM's private cloud Produce solutions enabling real-time shipment tracking on both web and mobile platforms Work on an Agile development team using CI/CD and DevOps practices Deliver enterprise code utilizing web analytics, resiliency patterns and fault tolerant design Participate in code reviews, software design and refactoring, in collaboration with junior and senior developers Additional Job Description Qualifications: Hands-on experience using JAVA, REST, microservices, and containers (Pivotal Cloud Foundry or Docker and Kubernetes) Must have at least 3+ years' experience building enterprise applications using JAVA (Spring-Boot) and/ or Angular Shown experience as a Software Engineer understanding of (e.g. SAFe/Agile, TDD, BDD, etc.) Development methodologies (Reusable Code, Code Review, Unit Testing) Source control software (Git or Azure DevOps) CI/CD Technologies and build pipelines Experience in developing automated unit and integration tests Experience with applying software development tools and standard methodologies, i.e. Spring, Eclipse, IntelliJ, Jenkins, unit testing, code coverage, secure code analysis, performance tuning, refactoring/code smells, source code management, etc. A bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent experience in IT industry Preferred Qualifications: PostgreSQL experience AngularJS Ability to learn new cloud patterns, technologies, and domains quickly Experience with NoSQL databases, big data and message brokers like Kafka, Hadoop, Redis and Cassandra is a plus Experience with messaging architecture (MQ, Kafka) Experience in crafting and implementing applications using frameworks like Axon that implements Domain Driven Design, Event sourcing and CQRS patterns Data modeling and database/query tuning expertise About GM Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all. Why Join Us We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team. Benefits Overview The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others: Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents; Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family; Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement; Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values; Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing; Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends. Diversity Information General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities. Equal Employment Opportunity Statements The policy of General Motors is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, General Motors is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us atCareers.Accommodations@GM.com. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

title: Director Business Analyst
description: About the Role: With 720+ employees and growing, we are searching for a hands-on human resource expert that will partner with the People Team, the CEOs, and their teams across 20 Operating Companies of varied size and scale to design, develop and deliver the full suite of HR programs and services in support of the respective business goals. This is a build opportunity; an opportunity to take very foundational and limited HR infrastructure to a more sophisticated and comprehensive level. All People Programs from policy to leadership succession, are in the process of being built. This is an opportunity to help expand the HR team and infrastructure. This role will report to the Chief People Officer and be responsible for strategic human resources functions, including process development, policy implementation, risk mitigation while also getting involved with day-to-day human resources issues by providing insight, counseling and problem resolution to business leaders, managers and employees. Responsibilities: All in partnership with the broader People Team; this role reports to the EVP, Chief People Officer, Hilco Global: Design, develop and implement all people policies and practices. Ensure compliance with all federal and state employment laws. Educate the workforce accordingly. Design, build and implement full scale compensation strategy, process, programs, and tools. This will include defining the job architecture, pay bands, and incentive compensation strategies and plans across 20 Operating Companies. Partner on development and utilization of qualitative (surveys) and quantitative (demographics, workforce analytics, turnover, etc.) data and enable the business on how to use this information for more effective workforce planning and optimization of their workforce. Design, develop and deliver exit interview process, programs and tools and ensure insights are shared and actions put in place. Provide full advisory support to leaders, managers, and employees on various HR-related topics such as leaves, compensation, and employee relations matters. Partner with business to help deliver performance management, manager effectiveness, job architecture, learning programs, and other priorities as defined by the People Team. Partner with People and Finance teams on design, development, and implementation of Workday (launch date is July, 2022). This includes communication, training and change management. Partner with People team and Hilco leadership on M&A transactions and sale of companies, as arises; support people issues throughout due diligence and integration. Work with leaders and managers to effectively diagnose organizational issues and partner with People Team and business teams to resolve. Collaborate with Op Co CEOs on the implementation of all HR initiatives to optimize talent, structure, process, and culture. Co-lead the annual performance management, bonus, and merit processes. Coach and build capability of leaders and managers. Characteristics/KSFs: Rolling up your sleeves: Be able to go from strategy to execution; this is a very hands-on role in every aspect of the talent life cycle. Navigate complexity: Hilco has 20 Operating Companies making this a complex organization to navigate. Must be able to start with the business and bring solutions that are simple, meet all needs, and are in alignment with an entrepreneurial deal-oriented culture. Business Advocate: Deeply understand business priorities, helping the business leaders and their teams articulate how people levers help drive business outcomes; collaborate with leaders so our workforce is high performing and highly engaged. Trusted Advisor: Build mutual trust and respect with business leaders, acting as advisor, coach and thought partner; have the courage to ask tough questions. Problem Solver: Collaborate across the full cycle of HR (cyclical programs, organizational change, employee relations, conflict resolution, etc.); identify and address root cause and solve issues with grace and tact. Job Qualifications & Requirements: 12+ years of experience as Human Resources Business Partner or senior people partnership roles, preferably in professional services, supporting an entrepreneurial, diverse, fast-paced organization. Qualified candidates will possess a bachelor’s degree in HR, Business or related course of study and other certifications are preferred (e.g., a Professional in Human Resources (PHR) certification). Experience partnering with and influencing senior leaders to help drive their people strategies and increase business outcomes. Demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills. Experience applying agility to every aspect of a role, adapting approaches and processes based on new information or a changing landscape. Expertise in developing deep, trusting relationships at all levels- from entry to c-suite. Strong empathy and change management skills to work through rapid growth and change. Demonstrated ability to manage human resources at both the strategic and tactical levels. Intellectual acumen, sound judgment, professional and personal integrity, initiative, and flexibility, combined with solid analytical and problem-solving skills. Have a passion for building people processes and live in the data to explain the what, why and how. Excellent ability to communicate at all organizational levels. Assertive, high energy, independent, results-oriented demeanor, and a strong drive to succeed. Ability to work at a high-level of independence and autonomy, while always collaborating with the People Team. Project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and lead and gather information from cross-functional teams both within HR and across the business. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Hilco requires all employees to be vaccinated in order to visit any of our offices and to participate in any company driven in-person events.

title: Data Analyst
description: Who You Are As a Data Analyst at Friday Health Plans, you will be responsible for assimilating large volumes of medical and financial data into meaningful and useful reports that are universally understandable and enable users to easily interpret and identify patterns, trends, and correlations. You will also generate data extracts for a wide variety of internal and external partners. You will primarily work within the Microsoft SQL Server and PowerBI application suites. Our business is growing, and this is an excellent opportunity to join a team where your effort is appreciated, your ideas are valued, and you can make a difference on a daily basis! Who We Are Friday Health Plans isn’t your average health insurance company. We’re not about unnecessary extras and confusing terminology. We cover the basic health services you’ll likely use the most at a price that just might make your wallet happy. Our simple health plans and friendly service keep you covered so you’re free to live every day like it’s Friday. As a Denver-based startup company, we’re looking for smart, talented people like you to join us. We value collaboration, innovation, passion, and calculated risk-taking. Now in year four and growing rapidly, we’re looking for people who lead by example, and that example is one of flexibility, reliability, and positivity. If this sounds like you, then we want you on our team. What You’ll Do The primary responsibilities of this role include: Support the needs of your assigned market(s), users and leaders. Create dashboards and automated reporting and present to peers and company leadership in meaningful and engaging ways Collaborate with the rest of the analytics team on data management Ensure all reports and visualizations are accurate and complete and collaborate with teammates as necessary to ensure consistency and quality across markets, lines of business, etc. Proactively identify new opportunities to add value through data and advanced analytics Identify new predictive models, analytics tools, and automation strategies that would improve the team’s ability to meet the needs of business users Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: The following skills/experience are considered essential for this position. Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline (such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems) or equivalent experience At least 3 years’ experience developing business intelligence solutions, of which at least 1 years should be in healthcare working with medical and/or financial data At least 3 years’ experience with relational databases and SQL queries At least 1 year experience with output and visualization tools Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) Ability to work to meet milestones and deliverables Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail Ability to work with large data sets Excellent problem solving, time management, and organizational skills Excellent communications skills, written, oral, and visual Must be fully authorized to work in the US. No Visa Transfers, Visa Sponsorships or Green Card Sponsorships Additional Desired Attributes: In addition to the required skills listed above, these attributes are highly desirable in potential candidates: Experience using HealthRules Payor and/or HealthRules Data Warehouse highly preferred Prior Data quality and QA responsibilities Python or R experience Prior PowerBI (or equivalent product) experience How You'll Be Valued: Medical, Vision, and Dental premiums for you and your family covered at 100% Company funded health savings account (HSA) 401(k) and 401(k) matching Company paid life insurance Company paid short- and long-term disability insurance Employee assistance program Paid time off and 10 paid holidays A company culture that is regularly recognized as a Top Workplace by organizations such as CoBiz and the The Denver Post Pay: $66,772 - $83,465 annually ZqceL0ZJiu

title: Director Business Analyst
description: It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. Specific Responsibilities Serve as an objective financial steward, with an enterprise perspective, and a trusted business partner who enables effective decision making that creates value. Lead monthly financial and operational reviews for the Operations organization supporting $1B in revenue. Clearly communicate a cohesive and concise story around business drivers and potential implications on future results. Align financial forecasts and long-range planning processes with Operations business partners and regional finance teams. Drive value by providing financial and analytical counsel to facilitate decision-making around strategic business initiatives. Works effectively across matrixed organization, including commercial, supply chain, BU/Regional finance team, enterprise Finance, Accounting and Tax on major initiatives including but not limited to business model evaluation, cost saving opportunities, cost of quality analyses, vendor selection & negotiation, and operational efficiency. Identifies opportunities to drive revenue growth, margin improvement and cost savings. Provide financial modeling, financial analysis, and valuation support for acquisitions, new product development, and other ad-hoc financial projects. Drive process improvements by identifying need for change, proactively gathering requirements, designing, developing, and implementing change. Lead and develop a team of two senior financial analysts. Skills and Competencies 10+ years of relevant financial experience and 5+ years of managing a team. Experience in a global manufacturing and supply chain environment. Strong results orientation with a track record of meeting or exceeding business objectives. Detailed understanding of financial budgeting and forecasting concepts and modeling. A team player who is collaborative and receptive to ideas from others and works effectively across functions to identify and resolve critical issues. Excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to interact successfully with all levels of management. Professional executive presence and poise; drives business results through clear communication and collaboration. A creative, yet pragmatic, problem solver who is hands-on as well as detail oriented. Excellent planning, execution, and project-management skills. Experience working with a SaaS CPM Solution such as Adaptive Planning, Planful (Host Analytics), Anaplan, Hyperion, etc. Excellent skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency. Education The Director FP&A, Operations for Creation Technology will have a minimum B.S degree in Finance or Accounting or related field with a CPA and/or MBA preferred. #LI-LC1 #HP If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
